I am a big Google user it's nice that I can see our household Google calendar through echo show. However that is it there's no way to use any other Google functions or Netflix Hulu kind of works but is not that reliable and once again the browsing capability is not there. In general probably should have gone with a Google home unit. It would have sucked that my Amazon music wouldn't stream but I end up using my phone and going through Bluetooth anyways because I can't browse for my music on my show. Also with Amazon show I don't like having the drop-in feature so anybody can drop in on us so I just don't use it instead. Where with Google home I could use their video calling and that would have worked awesome.

reviews.reviewTitle: Hasn't worked right since we opened it (Christmas Gift)
reviews.reviewText: We ordered 2 of these., as Christmas Gifts. Expensive ones. One for my wife and one for our best friends in Fl. The one in Fl appears to be ok (Have not had a video call yet) but the one for my wife has issues. When she attempted to contact me it would dial our daughter (even though it has MY number listed) This has been partially fixed by customer service. Our contact lists do not fully show on the device. C/S currently trying to resolve. When making a call from the Echo Show it is supposed to default to making a video call. It did when it accidentally called our daughter but once they fixed that it no longer calls in video. Yet if the Show is called from our cell phones it answers in video. It's been almost 3 weeks and we're still dealing with technical assistance. I think they should either give us another unit or get this one properly operational. By the way, on 2 of the tech calls, the tech was unable to correct any of the issues and just disconnected the call! The current tech adviser is polite and trying to resolve the issues but we are losing patience. We also purchased a Ring Doorbell from Amazon to use in conjunction with the Echo Show but we won't attach it until the issues have been resolved. As far as using the other functions (like a Dot) they work fine. We've always had a great experience with the Amazon service and I'd rather not have to have our credit card company cancel payment but this has gone on too long! I would like someone to intervene and get this issue resolved. PLEASE.

reviews.reviewTitle: Better sound, screen but video calling worse than earlier generation Show.
reviews.reviewText:
This is a much nicer looking design than the original and show and sounds significantly better when playing music but its major flow is sub par video calling performance. In calls to another person using the original show, feedback (squealing) is always an issue at the beginning and there are frequent problems with freezing and pixelation which I never saw when using the earlier generation model. Sometimes it quits altogether and must be rebooted. It may be an incompatibility issue with the old and new versions. I figured this would be fixed eventually with updates but it remains as bad today as when I bought it.
Otherwise, the bigger screen is a big improvement. The sound is mostly better but can be a mixed bag, depending on the environment. Speakers fire backwards and up instead of forward so sound quality is affecting by closeness of walls and ceilings at the location where being used. This model does produce a wider sound field using some sort of surround sound technology.

reviews.reviewTitle: Upgrade only if you need the Hub
reviews.reviewText:
I have several echo devices. I actually purchased this device brand new from ebay. The sell had just went off on amazon. The Gen 2 Show is better than Gen 1 in about every way except for the audio in my opinion. The speakers are placed on the side instead of the front to accommodate the larger screen for Gen 2. This seems like a good idea but not having a front facing speaker does not sound good in a large room. If you have the unit close to you on a desk the audio probably sounds descent. I ordered the echo sub for this device which will greatly improve the sound for this echo show Gen 2.

The main purpose I purchased this Gen 2 Show was for the hub to control smart devices. I have iris by lowes which was my alarm and home automation. Iris by lowes is going out of business March 31st so I got this hub for home automation and I got simpli safe for my alarm.

Gen 2 has a bigger screen, better graphics and probably a better device. In my opinion the upgrade is not needed unless you need a hub. The Gen 1 plays just as good and has better sound quality in my opinion because of the front firing speakers. Gen 2 has better quality speakers but because of the side speaker placement the audio seems distant.

I still am a fan of the Amazon ecosystem and they are constantly improving their products. Amazon needs an echo watch. I am not sure what they are waiting on.

I received the 2nd generation Show along with two 3rd generation Dots (which I paired for stereo) and immediately set up the Show. It was easy, and in a matter of minutes I was up and running.

I began familiarizing myself with its nuances. It wasn't much of a learning curve, as I own the Spot, so... I must say I was impressed with the screen resolution and size. Bright, easily readable from across the room. I love the color details when viewing Youtube videos, as it was faithfully reproduced.

Music was loud, and some good bass was present. It was easily navigable via the touch screen, or voice commands. And the browsers, Firefox and Silk, launch on command. Cool. Say, 'launch Youtube', and you're there. Sign in to you YT account, and play all videos in your History; or simply tap the address bar, and when the keyboard appears, type in what you want to see. It isn't a seamless way to go about it, but at least it works.

All-in-all, the Show really delivers on Amazon's stated features and capabilities. I am happy with the Show, and if you aren't very picky, you may be too. Let's begin...

Should you consider purchasing the 2nd gen. Echo Show? If you like your music sounding great; if you like watching videos on an immersive 10" screen; if you want to browse the internet as you would on a large tablet; watch Vevo or Youtube--yes, you should consider the Echo Show over its competitors. The 2nd generation Echo Show is vastly improved over the 1st generation Echo Show, which looked boxy, and had only seven inches of real screen real estate. Sound on that one was, at best, acceptable. Nothing to dance about, though.

But on the newer incarnation the sound quality is quite good--no, damn good! You'll get powerful stereo sound. Bass punches solidly, so that you can actually feel it. Highs and mids takes care of rounding out the music quite well, and in stereo. Amazon improved the speaker system so, that you'll wonder how it could sound so good from a smallish footprint. But it does! And this thing can get quite loud. It filled our rather large bedroom without distortion, even nearly way up. Put it in a large living and your next party will be complete with D.J. Alexa on hand.

Getting around on the internet with either the Silk browser or Firefox was as easy as saying, "Alexa, open...", and you're taken to the browser where you key-in what site you wish to visit. Sure, the on-screen keyboard is a bit clunky, but you get used to it.

I've not tested the video-calling feature, or the drop-in feature, but from the rave reviews on Amazon about this, it's a winner. Skype will soon be coming to the Show.

I was impressed by the screen quality and accurate color reproduction, even from across the room. Most aren't going to want to sit through an entire two-hour movie, though, but you could if you wanted to. A greater majority relegate the Show to kitchen duty, where it shines. Still, any room (not the bathroom!) is a good place for the Show.

So, in my opinion, yes you should consider bringing home the Show instead of the competition's products, as Amazon got it right the second time around. And at $230, I'd say it is priced just right to go.

Well, I'll play with this gadget a few days more. In the meantime, The Echo Show must go on!

reviews.reviewTitle: So far I like the little echo spot better
reviews.reviewText:
So far disappointed with the show the little echo spot is better the show goes into sleep mode and the clock is almost impossible to see and it doesnt auto wake up when you are in front of it you have to talk to it for the screen to light up!
you get constant alexa tips non stop usually about things we would never be interested in i have all alexa devices types and this one i like the least, it doesnt understand much and you cant shop for stuff on it it cant even find my recent music purchases or tell you whats being delivered that day just your last 4 orders the notifications are always things you already know or an hour after things have already happened. I dont like tablet like screen in fact i just got a 10" fire tablet that they now want you to use as a show and it would be better at half the cost! its over priced too twice what it should be, the only decent things about it are good sound with strong base when you can get it to play what you want (usually takes 4 or more fails first) and decent quality and nice screen for videos BUT we have many big tv's for that, dont get it you might consider getting fire tablet 10" instead and use that in alexa mode with the show dock its sound is tinny compared to the show but you could get bluetooth speakers to solve that and it will still be cheaper then the show and can be a tablet with full functions.

Two main things I don't like is how the plug goes into the back of the unit. It sticks straight out so you can't have it up against the wall on the kitchen counter without bending the wire, and I am afraid it will eventually damage it. So it sits out a few inches taking up more counter space. The second, bigger issue, is the one with the sound cutting off and having to be unplugged to reboot to get the sound back. This is a KNOWN issue and I really wish they would come up with an update to fix it. I don't know what sets it off so it's not like I can just "not" do whatever it is. It would be really nice if this had an easier to access web browser so I could get to recipes easily. I still end up using my tablet propped against the wall for that. The sound is great but it would be nice if it were a little more customizable as the bass is a little too heavy. The screen is a nice size, it integrated well with my other home automation such as lights and outlets. I haven't done any video calling on it so cannot speak as to how well that works out.

reviews.reviewTitle: BUYER BEWARE - IT HAS AUDIO ISSUES. I'VE HAD TWO THE AUDIO DIDN'T WORK
reviews.reviewText: Buyer Beware! There is an issue with the audio on this model, my first one had no audio at all, I got a replacement and the second one the audio lasted about a week,then pooped out. Getting it replaced again has been a nightmare. I spent over an hour on the phone with the reps trouble shooting, etc.. then come to find out it is a software issue that they've been unable to resolve which would have been nice to know the first go around. Then the second rep takes my information and when I asked when it would be coming she was very evasive - seems they are now out of them which I'm sure was caused by having to replace a lot of them. What a mess - and them not being upfront about it is really disappointing. When it worked it was a great product.

I don't know how I let my self get suckered into buying this with my phone..... It has very good rich audio quality which I do use to listen to music sometimes, but I feel like have very little control regarding what sources of music it plays from and I don't like that.... Alexa will only play from designated sources and using the web browser to load stuff from other places removes the futuristic talking aspect of the device so..... I would not recommend unless you need a smart home hub or whatever.... Plus Alexa does some weird creepy stuff from time to time... She thinks you are talking to her when you aren't or when the room is silent. I don't like it...
Has no sound! I tried everything; Rebooting, restart, and factory reset and still has no sound!

This was my first Echo device with a screen (next to my Amazon Tablet), so I can't comment on any improvements screen-wise from previous Show's, but I can talk about improvements over my first generation Echo devices. The speaker has a richer sound than my 1st generation Echo. I've placed the show in my kitchen, but the far field microphone array seems to be able to hear me from across the room and even into the room next door. I've found the screen helpful for displaying flash briefing video content as well as my Amazon Prime Video content. I love that the next events on my calendar also show up as well as reminders. This is a great start if you've never owned an Echo device, but also makes a great addition to your existing setup (I've got two dots, an Echo, a Fire tablet, and now the Show).

reviews.reviewTitle: I enjoy using it as an enhanced photo frame
reviews.reviewText: I got a good deal on this Echo show and thought i would try it out. I like every part of it! I like that in the dark it still scrolls my pictures but dims the screen. I like that its very good at understanding me and that it responds fast (no delay). I haven't figured out how to stop playing videos when i ask it to do something else... There must be a way. overall i am happy with the Echo show.

I've got nearly 20 of these Alexa devices spread out over two houses, and this one is my favorite. Has a large, vibrant display, and arguably the best sound of any of my Echo devices. I cannot compare it to either "Plus" - don't have either one of those, but can compare it to every other one and this Show produces a rather decent thump with the bass and the treble carries well. The passive sub adds more to the depth of sound than one might expect.

One complaint, and this is common to both this new Show and the original. When you get a notification or a message on most other Alexa devices, you get a yellow ring on top that pulses to let you know at a glance that you've got one or more of them waiting for you. Nope, nothing on this screen unless you happen to touch it and see the banner that says "new message for..." or whatever. Would be really nice to be able to see at just a glance from across the room if you've got a message or notification. I'm sure they could fix this with a software update, but I guess not enough people have complained about this for them to address the issue. That's really my only gripe so far, and the reason I docked this review one star. If they fix this, I'll be glad to put up a full five star review.

Got the Amazon Echo Show. It took 2 hours to set up just with passwords and accounts and all the other nonsense. Got the device for my mother to make calls. Then found out it can make calls out fine when it's paired with a smart phone BUT it doesn't allow calls IN unless it's from another echo device. Can't receive calls from other phones or mobile devices. WHAT A JOKE. PATHETIC. ALSO, when you're not using it, it shows ads. Really, really, really annoying. To buy a constant billboard of ads. Another pathetic amazon fraud.

I love the idea of Alexa and the devices associated with the app, but integrating them all together is not as simple as made out. Sure, you might be able to "connect" the devices on the app screen, but whether they will integrate correctly to function the way you wish often runs hit or miss, and attempting to find answers to questions leads nowhere more than not. Operating the devices separately usually presents no problem, especially with simple requests. But put two devices in proximity, and you're liable to find some confusion on Alexa's part. When I ask Alexa to play music on my music group, I get a completely different response, though that is the phrase suggested for playing music on all of my Alexa connected devices. So, what really is the problem: is the app not in a state of complete functionality yet? Does Alexa not "hear" my voice correctly? I don't know, and I can't find answers to my questions on the help sites. For now, I can listen to music, if I carefully make a simple request, and receive answers to basic questions, "What's the weather forecast?", but beyond that the functionality of the devices is limited . . .

I received brand new Echo Show 2nd generation. Out of the box it worked fine for about an hour. I unplugged it, took it to a different location, and the audio would no longer work. The device was responding to voice commands and playing music and movies as I instructed but no audio. I tried plugging out and back in and then did a factory reset. Still no sound. I called technical support and they were unable to solve the problem. I was told to return the product and was told to not return the power adaptor that came with it because they would not send a new power adapter. That seemed odd and has me worried that they may be sending refurbished rather than a new device as a replacement. I noticed other purchasers of product had complaints with sound not working as well. It seems there is a glitch in this product that Amazon should fix before selling more of them.

Echo show seemed to be the answer to my search for a device I could play music on and watch shows while I clean the kitchen/ house. The idea of having a Smart Screen with voice recognition is great. But here is the thing it is super limited. Though Echo has a touch screen you can't actually touch and scroll through everything. I have many videos on Prime but I can only access my last 25 purchases or so. Hulu is available, but it won't allow you to switch accounts if there are multiple users. Also you can't pick which episode you want to watch on it, it automatically starts with the first or last viewed episode. For the cost of it I was expecting to have more features and to be able to do more. I can't pull up recipes I have on Pinterest or other sites only the ones Alexa suggests. All in all unless you have the ring doorbell and a family member with another you want to "face time" with this isn't the best bang for your buck. I wish I had just held out and saved more for an iPad which would have done everything this does and more just with a lesser speaker.

What's good:
Speaker quality is great.
Pleasing to the eye

Not Good:
Limited use on apps
When you ask Alexa todo anything her voice is way louder than what you are actually listening to
Doesn't always work and I have to repeat myself a lot.

After reading many reviews we purchased the show and are very happy with it. We already had a couple Dots and a Spot in our home. The sound quality is great for what it is. We uploaded photos to our Prime account and created an album that rotates for our background. While some may find the different pop ups annoying, we enjoy them. I can see where some would like a way to turn them off, but our house enjoys seeing and frequently clicks on the snippets. The pip ups also help us to learn new skills a available with Alexa. We frequently use this with our Premium Prime music and the family enjoys seeing the lyrics. It’s nice to also view particular items on Prime we are interested in buying. Prime videos are not what you might expect, but we didn’t buy this solely to watch movies, though we do at times, while cooking. Overall we’re very happy with this purchase.

I have been using the Echo Show in my kitchen for the last 6 months. Frankly, it's not very useful. It shows topics you can learn more about (which to my knowledge cannot be customized to be what I’m actually interested in knowing), but you have to enunciate very clearly for it to pick up on what you are saying, even though it’s a suggestion from the Echo. Then the information is frequently inane and not worth the effort. I’ve also searched recipes on it, and it does give multiple suggestions and allows you to add ingredients to a shopping list. But when cooking from the recipe, the ingredients are on one page, and the instructions are on another, so you have to toggle between screens to see how much is to be added at each step. I does play music well, and listens to commands such as to operate the connected Wi-Fi plugs I have throughout the house. But for general information questions, it’s poor at best.

Frankly, I wonder if I’d like Google for the home better for information. I frequently ask Alexa something, get a wrong, off topic answer (or hmm, I don’t know that), and go to my phone and ask Google and get what I’m looking for. For the money, not worth it.

I originally got this because it could play Bloomberg TV. Now they have taken that away.
I used to be able to ask it to spell words for me and it would actually show the word on the screen which was nice. No it now longer shows the word on the screen. Why the heck would the developers remove that feature.
Browsing for movies on Prime is clunky and slow.
You can not play U-tube or Netflix on this.

I have spent a lot of money on Alexa devices, now I am worried that maybe I picked the wrong infrastructure. Shall I see what google devices can do for me?
The weather has very little detail. You would think that a radar on the video screen might be a nice touch even, but you can hardly get a basic forecast that is more than a few icons and a temperature.
I was hoping things would get better over time....Instead it is getting worse!!

Also note how they rig the review with just the 3 features that it can do. Sure it can do Voice Recognition as well as the $30 dot, sure it has Alexa integration as that is a basic feature, sure the sound is pretty good and better than $30 dot. But that is not what is most important in a video enabled Alexa.

reviews.reviewTitle: screen larger and more easily seen from a distance and sound bolder
reviews.reviewText: The larger the better in my book. Sound seems better than 1st iteration. Much easier to use bue to size and videos are more easily distinguishable. It will auto reconnect to wifi in case of internet or power outage which happens here frequently as with Echo Spot but the screen size and sound quality is so much more impressive, I just wish Alexa knew more historically significant info, geographic areas of the world and you could select multiple languages for responses. It would be handy to have someone else who understood French, German, Spanish, Russian and Italian on whom to practice. No one else remembers any of their language training and it makes it tough to keep current. Just a thought for improvement for future updates. Please. Size of screen also makes it easier to see my son and his large family in another state and Alexa often helps me locate my iPhones by dialing until I can locate them by vibration if necessary. Alexa has and reinforces good manners which seems to be a dying art in communication.

Just have been using for a week but while trying to set it up I could not adjust the size of the clock fonts and could not get rid of the Alexa tips. discovered these are common complaints. Because it is an item that is always on it is very annoying. While researching the show it sounded like a wonderful household companion that would fulfill my every need. After receiving it all I hear is I don't do that or I don't know that you are saying while all the time scrolling things to try. (my attempt at humor) Seriously I have set it up with the smart plug and the security camera and enjoy listening to classical music. I do hope they find a way to get rid of the Alexa tips and ways to adjust the clock size as not everyone has young eyes. After Christmas will set up a calendar etc..

reviews.reviewTitle: Lacks good support for video streaming
reviews.reviewText:
I was really looking forward to getting the Echo Show so I could stream videos hands free in the kitchen while cooking.
Unfortunately, the show falls short in this category, so I have returned my device. For a device that has such a great video screen it seriously lacks support for video streaming. There is no native support for YouTube, Netflix or any of the major streaming services, except Hulu. You can access them through the Show's internet browser, but you can't use voice commands to do this, which completely defeats the point of having the Show. Because of the limited streaming options that are available with voice activation I am giving the Echo Show only 2 stars.

If you want a device for your kitchen that will let you stream videos from your favorite services a better option would be to get a Kindle Fire HD 10 put it in Show mode and hook up some decent speakers or to get a small TV and attach a Fire TV Stick.

The sound quality is really good, but not as good as the Echo Plus.

its ok, plays my audible books while im cooking, the “ things to try” feature, which it seems cant be turned off is so annoying. also unable to look at kindle recipe books, no alexa i dont want you to read it to me, show me the book ...... i got it mainly for drop in and calls while im cooking, ut i think its going back and ill just use my ipad instead. id have kept it and just made it work for me if wasn’t for the stupid things to try. and yes ive been all through the app and supposedly shut it off and yet they’re still there . disappointed, would not recommend

reviews.reviewTitle: Can I give this a 6 star rating?
reviews.reviewText: The Echo Show 2nd generation is wonderful. It is my favorite Echo product (and I have most of them). The sound is killer! I keep mine in the kitchen. I love being able to use multiple cooking timers and see each of them. I can watch Hulu as I am cooking. Being able to pull up a recipe video is very helpful. I had the first Echo Show and I didn't care much for it (poor sound, small screen). I have the Echo Show 5, too. I like it a lot. I like it better than the Echo Spot (which I still like a lot). It is a matter of budget, needs and space. I don't like watching shows, youtube and recipes on the Show 5 but the Show 5 is way better than a dot and more useful than an Echo. I prefer to the use the Show (and Show 5) with a stand because it is more functional. I just don't like products with a large base sitting on my counter. The video drop-in feature is great if you have an elderly parent you need to keep an eye on. It can be fun for grandchildren or any loved one.

The biggest selling feature for me was the fact that I would be able to watch Prime and Hulu on it and it's the one feature that doesn't seem to work very well. I have tried using it with Hulu three times. It was fine the first time, lagging and freezing the second time, and would not open Hulu at all the 3rd time. It also wouldn't open Prime video on command, but I at least know how to manually get to what I want to watch. I don't know if there is a way to do that with Hulu. I spend a lot of time in the kitchen and I like to watch TV shows and movies while I'm cooking because it's the only time during my day that I really have to myself. Pretty bummed that doesn't seem to be working.

It does work very well with our Ring doorbell, kasa cameras and lights, and I did like that I was able to import my Google calendar.

BUT that wasn't even the main reason for buying the Echo Show and I could have continued using the apps on my phone for those functions.

reviews.reviewTitle: It is an improvement over the original Show.
reviews.reviewText:
I now have both the original 5" Echo Show and the 10.1" Echo Show.

The larger screen, for my old eyes, is good especially for viewing WYZE camera Alexa Skill views while in bed.

I'm also very pleased with the enhanced speakers and resultant sound.

I could not find a review of the power consumption by the 10.1" Echo Show so I just used my Kill-A-Watt device to determine it pulls .09 amps, 5 watts at idle and 7 watts streaming WWOZ, a local community radio station.

A most excellent improvement!

And Alexa seems a bit more attentive with the new microphones, Good Girl!

reviews.reviewTitle: Love the screen size and sound!
reviews.reviewText: Absolutely love my 2nd gen Echo Show. Used the Amazon trade-in program (with my 1st gen Echo Show), which worked exceptionally well. As for the new one, I have it in my kitchen on the breakfast bar. And yes, with speakers in the back, it does need an open area so sound isn't muffled - no big deal IMHO. The screen size, sound, and color are superb. It certainly dims well at night, so believe it would work fine in a bedroom. Although some folks have entered negative comments about the various banners that come across the screen, I love them - they give me ideas about how to better use my Echo Show, as well as catching headlines and trending topics that I'd never think to ask about. As a Prime member, I can easily stream music from Amazon. Also, yes, the Echo Show can stream SiriusXM, which I have. All you need is to pay for Internet streaming from SiriusXM and enable the skill for Alexa. Works great (although you won't see any info about the song or artist, which does show up on regular SiriusXM device screens). I use my Echo Show not only for music but to search for recipes, get the news and weather, change channels on DirectTV, call friends and family that also have Alexa devices, etc. Very versatile! Glad I upgraded!

reviews.reviewTitle: Minimal instructions! Figure it out for yourself by trial and error.
reviews.reviewText: There are NO INSTRUCTIONS other than a brief: plug it in and swipe the screen to go to settings and download the app. Really?! The app settings are minimal. When trying to set up the Echo Show to have the camera show my living room to view my pet in action, there wasn't anything even remotely close to showing me where I might find how to do that. Fortunately, a friend has an Echo Show and told me to go to CONTACTS, then go to my own name, then look at the icons. Find the one that shows a house and tap it. Geez. Who would ever have thought to do that? The positive remarks are the sound quality is excellent when playing music. Also, AFTER it was set up and I was totally frustrated, I received two helpful emails from Amazon that gave a little more information about the features available. That info definitely should have arrived in the box with the device. Alexa and I are gradually getting to know each other. I am hopeful that this device will become more useful to me. Otherwise, it is a very expensive radio. I am sure if I subscribe and pay for other features it will be even better, but I don't appreciate having to invest more money to enjoy those features.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does not do what it says!
reviews.reviewText: Wish I had saved my money! I wanted this to replace a kindle fire I use to stream videos and live TV in my kitchen. Needless to say the kindle works better. This Echo Show does not do what it says it is doing. For example I ask for a Prime Video by name and episode (yes I am that specific) and Alexa says here’s blah blah blah (exactly what I asked for) and NOTHING plays or it says it is playing something completely different. Also cannot add apps or really do anything. Big waste of money! Use a Kindle Fire attached to an Echo.

I like Amazon. I buy a lot of stuff, including most of the Alexa items over the last few years.

However, the Show 2nd generation apparently has some problems. I've had two of them fail within a month of purchase, more or less, and both had no audio. I reset them, no fix. The manual volume buttons would show the volume bar on the screen moving, but no sound. Two separate devices, same exact problem.

But my bitch is that if more than 30 days have expired, I can't just click and get a return label. I have to "chat" with someone who tells me to reset. (And the chat person has several people on at the same time, and I have to wait a long time between every reply. I don't have extra time to wait for replies from whose tech support is based upon reading menus.)

I've been buying electronics for three decades at least, and i don't need to be told to reset. Further, if the device needs periodic resetting, well, it is broken. I don't reset my toaster, my microwave, my car, or my airplane. Why should I have to continually reset a $300 device on my kitchen counter?

Amazon should send me a new one, instantly, and let me use the new box to the ship one back. I don't save boxes: I buy way too much stuff to build a warehouse to hold Amazon boxes. So sending it back first (in the wrong packaging, but all that I have, and a hassle at that), then waiting a week or two, just to "fix" a device that shouldn't have failed in the first place, especially when I suspect strongly that audio failure is a "known issue", just pisses me off.

When it fails in the first six months, not thirty days, send me a new one. Instantly. I'll send the broken piece of crap in your box, with your label.

Sorry to vent. I've been a customer since Amazon only sold books, which is a very long time. I deserve better treatment.
Robert

I purchased this product for my grandfather who loves his echo dot. This is a surprise gift for his Christmas. The show was packaged great, it felt like I was opening a new iPhone. The setup couldn't have been simpler, as I don't really like the Alexa app. Everything was done on the screen and there was no need for the app. I did mess up the setup by mistyping my phone number and that led me to call Amazon but they were able to fix that quickly. I was quite impressed with the overall build quality, the speakers were loud and it has decent bass. Also, the screen brightness automatically adjusts to fit surroundings, so when I wake up I am not blinded. I purchased this with the Wyze Cam $5 addon, and I will leave a review there for that. But the ability to pull up cameras (this is my first show) and see them it fantastic. I couldn't be happier with this Show.

reviews.reviewTitle: Overall I am very satisfied with my purchase
reviews.reviewText:
In all honesty I really did not need to purchase the Echo Show 2nd gen. But couldn't pass it up during Amazon Prime Day!! Anyhow it took me a week or so to install do to work schedule but after setting up I could have done it in less than 10 mins.

Pros:
1. I really love the on screen display. It alternates with weather info, news articles and makes suggestions on current events you can watch.
2. If you are not into that you can setup for it to show you photos from your amazon account.
3. If you own a Ring door bell, another cool feature is that you can ask it to show you camera "xyz." This feature comes in handy if you need to see an alert you got at your front door. Yes guys if you set it up as a routine you can have your Alexa say " someone is at the front door. "
4. Each time you trigger her name "Alexa, Computer, Echo" you hear a nice tone that lets you know she is listening. This comes in handy if you are not facing the unit. Other wise if you are able to see the unit you see the typical blue lights as a bar across the bottom of the screen.
5. When playing music from Amazon Music, the echo show, displays you lyrics which for the kids is a lot of fun. For adults who thought the lyrics were something else you are in for a learning treat as you sing along to the correct lyrics.
6. You can integrate multi room speaker setup so that you can play music simultaneously throughout all your alexa devices.
7. The sound quality on my echo gen 1 was pretty nice. The sound quality on the echo show 2nd gen is AMAZING!
8. I went with this model because it has a lovely 10.1 screen, big enough that you can see pretty well across the kitchen as you prep your ingredients from a recipe.
9. I don't watch movies yet on the device but I do watch videos
10. I don't make video calls yet but I do send messages to friends and when they respond back you can see an icon letting you know you have a message.
11. The echo show 2nd gen is terrific about showing you your events. For some reason echo gen 1 when I would ask for my events for the day it would tell me I didn't have any. Perhaps operator error. This unit shows me everyday what my events will be!!!
12. When you ask it to do something you get to see that it is turning on lights and at what percent those lights are on. You can either manually change the percentage or you can ask her to change the percentage. Just really cool that you can see it being done in front of your eyes.

Cons:
1. Not a big deal but the echo show 2nd gen seems to take a few seconds longer when I ask it to do something.

Overall I am very satisfied with my purchase, the family loves using the unit more than before, and I would highly recommend this product to friends and family. I can’t wait to see how they continue to improve on this device.

I bought this one for my mother during mother's day promotion. Since she only speaks French, I wanted to be sure it has French language capability, otherwise no point to get it.

After some research on line I found out that there is a way to enable French (from France or Canada) on it, when creating a new Amazon account then select French at setup. Then I set up everything in French on it, and gave it to my mother. The power plug that comes with it supports 10v to 240v, so it's totally compatible with the French power as well.

Otherwise, the unit works flawlessly so far, without any troubles with the camera or sound. The only minor issue we have with it, is that no matter the language spoken, the Echo seems to have troubles to get the voice command said to it right away, and we will end up having to repeat ourselves from time to time.

I will update this review later after to see how this device does after few month of use. But so far so good !

reviews.reviewTitle: Frequency of signal hurts dogs ears - please provide a remedy Amazon
reviews.reviewText: Hey Amazon - can you please look into thee frequency issue with the Echo and Echo Show? There are forums lamenting how dogs are adversely affected, they cower, tremble and hide in fear. Someone on an amazon forum put an ultrasonic frequency detector on their devices (Echos, Dots, and Spots) and found they all show a significant amount of energy just above the 20KHz range when Alexa responds. They believe this is probably what dogs are hearing. I have an Amazon Echo and an Amazon Echo Show. I would really like to use them and say good things about them, but my golden retriever shakes profusely and hides any time I turn either of them on. Please please Amazon...please find a remedy for this. TY

Two main problems: Alexa often behaves like Hal 9000. Getting it to play Tune In Live, the Cardinals was an exercise in frustration. The second is, if you have DSL which is all that is available to me, any video is slow and jerky. Apparently Amazon didn't support Net Neutrality. Downloading the update for the new device took all night. Alexa is no longer available on my Chromebook, so I still haven't been able to hook up my sub woofer. (It is available on my phone, but one of the required steps isn't available even when I carefully follow the instructions.) And, I refuse to deal with Amazon's techs. I've been through that scam where you spend all day on the phone doing all the work and then some change in programming brings you back to square one. Good luck, Amazon, you keep stealing function. When the last one I still enjoy (read, put up with) disappears, you and I are done.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does not support a Netflix app, they say they are working on it, but i doubt it.
reviews.reviewText: I bought the 2nd edition of the Amazon Show because it now has a much bigger screen, making video possible at a decent distance. The only bad thing is that you can't load a Netfl;ix app, they do not have one that works with the Show. So while Amazon advertises watching video on the Show, what they really mean is that you can watch Amazon video, and only Amazon Video. You can't watch NetFlix because they did not make an NetFlix app for the show, and Google owns Youtube, and since Amazon won't sell Google devices, Google won't let Amazon have access to youtube. This needs to be taken to the FTC to force them to work together. Amazon does not have the faith in their own products to keep selling. I have no intention to get any Google Device. I did have one, but I quickly got rid of it. My house is full of Amazon devices. Now I have to consider sending the Show 2nd gen back, as it won't do what I bought it for, which is watch Netflix. Yee, it has a beautiful screen, and great sound, but that is only if you get to watch what you want.

I bought Alexa Show as a Christmas gift for my dad who is ill. I was very excited that he can play his music by voice command since he is not technology savvy. The hope was that the voice command will allow him to listen to music when he wants. Unfortunately Alexa pays two to three songs and stops. He has become so frustrated with the process of constantly asking to play songs that can't be found, and going to Youtube and getting bumped off so frequently that in a few days he said he does not want to use it anymore because it is too stressful.
My internet search shows this is an inherent problem with the system and many have sited this short coming with Alexa. I think the company is obligated to address this issue and should assist persons who bought this faulty system.
I hope someone can assist.

reviews.reviewTitle: This device should be called "Things to try".
reviews.reviewText: Before you buy, make sure you don't mind rotating "Things to try" messages at the bottom of the screen. You can see them now in some of the product images. Just know you can't turn them off on the main screen. They just keep rotating and rotating and rotating. After reading the Alexa SDK docs, it is clear Amazon really likes this feature. It is core to their UX. See 8.2.2 at https://developer.amazon.com/docs/alexa-voice-service/functional-requirements.html After spending two days with the echo show, all I see now is "Try ... Google Home"

This could be a decent device for watching cameras and other screen related tasks but unfortunately Amazon does not give you full control of this expensive device. They control it. You can not turn off the try this from the home screen and it is extremely annoying.
I bought it, I want to decide what is on the home screen. I will not buy another echo device with a screen nor recommend one. If this was on a television and I could not turn it off I would quit watching television. There are thousands of complaints about this but of course they could care less. Find a different device if you need a screen.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's ok, It's good mostly, but it should do more, and it drives me crazy
reviews.reviewText:
When you have a screen, it makes sense to do what is most intuitive - touch it. While there are a few major skills that are built in and seem to make use of the bare minimum (pause/back/forward with spotify is one example), why not extend the Echo ecosystem so that 3rd parties can put some basic apps into here if we add their skills?

Spotify should allow us to select playlists, radio, or artists from the echo touchscreen.

We should be able to use a basic web browser to find recipe's online instead of the terrible "all-recipes" app and search functionality.

We should be able to cast from our phone, or at least do something like "pushbullet" does, where we send a link to the show, and it loads it in the Show (I'm thinking for random web recipes, or youtube links, etc...

Without these basics, I don't see the appeal to the show right now - these are really bare minimum to me to make it useful. The Google Home Hub does a lot of this already as well from my experience with it.

The sound is quite decent, the form factor is good, the screen is nice, it's still an echo and has alexa. It's just not quite there yet, and I hope it improves.

reviews.reviewTitle: I don't get it - it's a beautiful brick.
reviews.reviewText:
I've had the show a few days and wanted to use it like a second/portable tv for streaming tv and movies. I thought a screen could "screen" almost anything - nope. Even though others have reviewed the limitations of the show, it was difficult for me to picture how a device so beautiful could be so useless for streaming video.

I can't get flash and netflix to work on it through chrome. This means I can't get my cable tv and online dvr to play from the xfinity website on this device. I just don't see how I can use this unless I fork over hundreds of dollars to purchase prime videos and tv. Even though I have prime and the first season of a show is listed as free - the show told me I needed to go to the webiste and pay for the tv show in order to watch it.

So, if you are happy watching whatever show manges to scrounge up for you or you really want this for video conferencing/camera monitoring, I would give this a hard pass. Yes, the sound is decent but I tried placing mine against a wall (normal) and the sounds is awful and bounces of the wall. This really needs to be placed a couple of feet away from a wall. Incidentally, the stand you can buy for this fits perfectly and works well.

Disappointing and confusing device.

reviews.reviewTitle: We love the easy instant access to weather, music, recipes, and abundance of skills
reviews.reviewText: Mu husband does not know how to power up a computer. He is not interested in technology tools. However, he loves the Amazon Show because it us always on and the voice recognition works. I created music playlists for each of us and he can now play his favorite music without my assistance. I love the ability to add items to my shopping list and add appointments to my calendar while washing dishes. My husbands To Do list is easily updated. When we play games like Jeopardy, you cssn read the questions and see the answers all at the same time. I'm hooked and love the convience of the Alexa products. We now have an Echo Show for the kitchen, an Echo Spot for the bedroom, an Echo 2nd gen for one of the bvathrooms and the garage. My kids are each getting an Echo Show for Christmas for their homes. Thanks Amazon for making these products affordable.

3rd UPDATE:

I am now updating my rating to five out of five stars.
Seems this latest update not only fixed follow up mode, it also fixed the annoying auto-wake function.
Voice recognition has improved as well. Very satisfied now.

UPDATE:

Amazon released an update for the echo show that just loaded on mine, and now the follow up mode works perfectly.

No more redundant commands just to perform one operation, excellent!

Now if they just put a function to disable the auto-wake on the echo show, so that a shock sensor doesn’t wake it up every time you bump or even loud sounds wake it up and start flashing, stuff I don’t want to see.

Overall great device, I change my review to four stars.

There are a lot of good things about this product but bad things too.

Right now it’s laying face down on my table, because I refused to have it bother me constantly by waking itself up in any movement, or even some sounds wake it up.

For about the last week the follow up mode has refused to work, and this is a hindrance because the echo show will keep flashing mindless garbage on the screen until you tell it to turn the screen off. I didn’t want another voice command just to enter each operation.

The intelligent thing to do would be to ask Alexa to perform an operation and then she does and after about 5 to 10 seconds the screen goes dark again.

Sound is very good, real bass and treble. Nice display, useful to have video information added.

So, please fix the follow-up function, and maybe even change the programming to make the screen go black after the intended operation has been completed. Subtle irritants in an otherwise excellent product. But then again irritating enough that I’m considering throwing the echo show right in the garbage.

reviews.reviewTitle: Too Slow To Play Some Streaming Movies
reviews.reviewText: I received the echo show as a gift. It works well listening streaming music, radio, and some movies. Streaming movies that work well on my phone and laptop DON'T work well on the echo show. I suspect the echo is simply too slow to handle the job. I have a 5-year-old tablet that is somewhat slow such that some movies stutter and time out. The echo show behaves the same way such that it stutters and breaks up the movie. If I simultaneously watch the same movie on my laptop, phone and echo show; only the echo show messes up. However, if I watch an old YouTube black-and- white western on echo show, I don't notice any problem. I suspect the echo show is simply too slow for HD movies. Echo show will read kindle books to me as audio, but surprisingly kindle on echo doesn't show the text. Echo show doesn't respond to seemingly obvious commands for kindle. Echo show seems to have been released to the market before it was ready. The screen is good, but I'm glad I didn't waste money on it.

Received 2nd generation Echo Show as Christmas gift. Was very excited about placing device in kitchen to watch YouTube. Unfortunately, YouTube videos stop playing after 5 minutes and return to home page screen making it useless for this purpose. Other web videos have trouble playing as well. Video starts and after about 5 seconds starts over in endless loop. I wouldn't recommend this product until they fix the video play problems.

Update #1 (1/4/19): Was contacted by Customer Service and was advised to unplug Echo Show for approximately 1 minute and then plug in again. This action seemed to have fixed the problem as videos on YouTube and other Websites now play properly. Therefore, I am revising my Overall Rating from a 1 to a 5.

Update #2 (1/5/19): All problems came back when tried to play videos again. In addition, screen became locked on video page with no way to exit. Alexa commands didn't work. Contacted customer service and Echo Show was factory reset. Videos still didn't play properly. Will probably try to return device. Too bad. Great idea for product, if it worked. Revising review back to 1 star again.

reviews.reviewTitle: Makes a nice TV for the kitchen
reviews.reviewText:
I can tune live channels with Hulu, and thanks to the new browsers you can get to YouTube etc, all on a quite usable 10" screen.

One negative is that the processor they chose for this model can barely get the job done. There is considerable lag to video operations, like clicking the screen to get the pause/back menu, asking Alexa to back up a few minutes etc. Sometimes it seems like it isn't going to do anything but it usually works after some pondering.
I can't imagine that it would have cost much to make the thing slightly faster - look at the Raspberry Pi 4 for $38.

The second negative is the sound. It is loud enough to hear over kitchen noise (just), but it is all base with very little highs. There are settings you can use to balance it out.

Overall I'm pleased, and if there was a good sale I might by another for the study.

reviews.reviewTitle: We love the 2nd Generatiion Echo Show.
reviews.reviewText: The quality of the video and the sound is great. We can view our lists, weather info, recipes, videos, our photos, etc. We haven't had our Echo Show very long so we are still discovering new uses. We will be adding a Ring doorbell to our system in the next few weeks. And my wife loves the Sandstone color. I would have preferred it in Charcoal but I don't always get what I want. HaHa

reviews.reviewTitle: Great device, until it falls off its rocker
reviews.reviewText:
This device does a lot of things well. Hardware aesthetics are elegant, sound is great (Not as good as my true studio monitors, but this is for casual listening), and the screen is crisp. The automatic screen brightness and far-field microphones work flawlessly so far. Other reviews cover its qualities very well.

I have two gripes with the device, one software and one hardware. My software gripe is that there are few options to change the time, weather, and suggested phrases on the home screen. I expect this will be added functionality in a future update. (Amazon, I hope your SDE's are reading these!)

I'd like to have an invocation button on the device as the Echo/Dot/Plus do, but that's minor, and something I knew before purchasing the Show. My hardware gripe is with the rubber base. I was playing music with notable bass at 80% volume. The device continued to shake backwards, sliding away from me, until it almost FELL OFF my painted ledge. The rubber needs to be thicker to absorb the lower frequencies to mitigate this. I hope Amazon will offer a fix for this to keep devices from falling to the ground below.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Show and Ring - Home Automation at it's best. Perfect for elderly parents.
reviews.reviewText:
I bought the Echo Show two-pack at a great price because I had recently purchased Ring doorbells for our house and our parents home. We wanted to be able to see who was at the door in either location before having to go answer the door because stairs in a split-level home are becoming more of a problem as they age.

I also wanted our parents to be able to see who was at the door without having to worry about constantly carrying a phone or finding it every time the doorbell rang. The Echo Show just sits on the table near where they sit most of the time and a simple voice command can let them see and talk to whoever is there.

Although it kinda seems like 'spying,' it also gives us peace of mind to know that when our daughter is supposed to pick up Grandpa at 1:00p for his doctor appointment, she actually shows up on time. We have video evidence of the comings and goings at our parent's home. And if she doesn't show, guess who is getting an emergency 'get your butt over there now' call!

I work from home, so I placed the second unit in my upstairs office so I can do the same thing... see who it is and determine whether I have to drop everything to answer the door. If a signature is required on a package, the carrier at least knows someone is on the way down, and I don't have to go to the post office to pick up 'missed deliveries.' This alone made it worth the cost of the Show in time saved going to the post office 2-3 times a month.

As an added benefit, my father-in-law likes to follow the markets, and Alexa can intermittently and automatically show him any stocks or market conditions he's interested in.

Echo Show makes caring for elderly parents so much easier and relieves a lot of worry about 'not knowing'. We use the DROP IN feature to check in with them occasionally. They do the same with us if they need anything. Any of the Echo/Alexa setups can do the same thing, but sometimes there is no substitute for being able to see the other person.

And finally, as one of many other added benefits, with Alexa no question goes unanswered, and with Amazon Music there isn't a song they can remember that they can't hear again on a moment's notice. They often wonder who an actress is on an old movie and as long as you know the name of the movie you can get a list of cast members for pretty much anything. And last Christmas we were over there and heard coming from the other room, "Alexa, play Burl Ives Christmas music." (Now there's something you don't hear every day....) But by golly, Burl Ives Christmas music came up with lyrics, and the room was filled with "Holly Jolly Christmas" and a lot of other great old songs I'd never heard. It made them very happy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great extension to the Echo ecosystem
reviews.reviewText: The second generation Echo Show has been a great addition to our Echo ecosystem. It integrates nicely with my Nest indoor cameras, my Ring exterior cameras, my extensive Philips Hue lighting system, and my Logitech Harmony hub. Faster at bringing up camera images than my iPhone. I also love the way I can instantly get recipes, see a video on preparation, send the ingredients to my shopping list and a link to the recipe. Communication features are also excellent. I can use the Shows as an intercom throughout our home (we have an Echo Show in the Kitchen and in the Master Bedroom, Echo Show 5 smaller units in two other rooms we use as home offices, and 1st gen Echo unts in several other rooms. I can broadcast messages ("Dinner is ready") across the whole system or use them walkie-talkie style from the app on my iPhone. List of uses keeps growing!

I love the Show. The sound is great and does not require connecting additional speakers (unless you are really picky about sound settings). We have 3 Alexa devices in our home and use all of them. I especially like being able to see the display of the words to the songs while playing music on the Show. I listen to music on all my devices but connect additional speakers to the Dot in order to use it on the deck during warmer weather. I have no complaints about any of the devices but like the Show the best. It (as well as the Echo and Dot) was very easy to setup and use. I purchased the sandstone color simply because I like the lighter shade but I'm sure the black looks just as good. It's merely an aesthetic choice.

reviews.reviewTitle: Why on earth would you buy this? I wish I could return it.
reviews.reviewText:
Take the cheapest Smart Television you can find on Amazon. Remove the ability to use Netflix and most other relevant streaming content. Make navigation very awkward and really really slow. Make the Alexa digital assistant just slightly less smart than she is on any of the other Echo devices. Reduce the quality of the image and the sound. And cut the screen size about 50% from the smallest Smart TV you can buy these days. If you're still happy, buy another Echo Show.
I have no idea why people are buying this thing. I purchased a 49 inch Samsung Smart TV for only slightly more than the cost of this expensive paperweight. Not saying a 49 inch TV is comparable, by the way, so please don't try to online shame me for my opinion. I have 5 echo devices which I love. This is simply not worth the money for what it does. A moderately good Android tablet would be better.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's my daily bedtime YouTube Sanctuary!
reviews.reviewText:
Aside from everything Alexa does which is great, Mostly I use the built-in firefox to browse to YouTube.com/TV to have the best YouTube experience on such a device, And this experience will not Be complete without a wireless 2.4Ghz USB remote control, I bought a micro USB OTG adapter So that I can connect The wireless USB dongle to the echo show 2, Not a lot of people know of this feature which can also allow you to connect keyboard and mouse to the Echo Show 2, and with this combination You get a true YouTube mini television set experience.

It can also play Hulu and Amazon prime videos by voice command which is awesome, for example Alexa play Seinfeld, And it will catch up from you where are you've left off.

And with twitch skill enabled you can watch your favorite twitch streams, What more do you want?

Netflix, HBO, & YouTube TV isn't supported yet though, but you never know, maybe one day it comes to the Echo Show!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great tech support when you finally get a technical person
reviews.reviewText:
I am going to write a long review here because Amazon does not seem to have an easily accessible technical support channel for customers who purchase and use Alexa devices. One way or another my laptop got a virus that was sending out massive amounts of spam so my ISP IP address was blacklisted. I re-imaged my laptop deleting everything and everything on my home network was reset to factory defaults along with reinstalling firmware where possible. Once everything was online I noticed my Alexa dot was connecting in a manner I found suspicious. It was a challenge getting a technical person but Amazon customer service lined one up and then tracked me down after I abandoned a call to customer service.

My household depends on the Alexa devices for lighting and device control so having them offline for a while had a big impact. I'm relieved now that I know the level of security that is baked in.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is true love! It’s not urban legend it really does exist and I found it!
reviews.reviewText: The new LARGER screen is fantastic and I think her sound is even better...I’m rocking out right now while typing my review ;) the only thing I don’t like is I purchased the 1st echo show version so I kinda duped myself- which don’t get me wrong she’s great too but not FANTASTIC. I would compare this to going from Miranda Kerr to Gisele- they’re both beautiful but only 1 of them has the IT factor. Of course beauty is within the eye of the beholder. **FULL DISCLOSURE- I am a complete and utter Alexa/Echo Junkie AND I have no intentions of seeking help.** ......I’ve gotta go Swagger Lee just came on and I have no choice but to bust a move....Alexa you vixen.
This is my second echo show. It was DOA. Returned. Scared to even use Amazon products after this....

The connection and video from show to show isn't very good. The picture of the caller, you, at your location shown as a smaller picture in the corner is very sharp.
The app isn't user friendly. Doesn't lend itself to much help when issues arise.
I've purchased 4 units and have trouble connecting all of them so we can video call. The newest of them calls only one way, when I call it tells me that the party I called didn't pick up when they are actually waiting by the show for a call.

Hope this gets better, after buying four of them , kinda of expensive, it seems I will be using the phone. Has not been a good experience. My next move will be calling Amazon help.

I will update again if my feelings about the show changes.

Update...... The day after my review with two star review and listed issues I had a call from Amazon asking what my issue was and how they could help. Honestly, this is why I consistently use Amazon. Took a few calls but bottom line is that we rectified the issues. Went
to 5g to help the picture clarity , had to set up a separate account for one of the shows to get it to connect. Much happier....again.....best customer support out there. Still needs to be tweeked to make a 5star concerning features.

It’s a decent product. We also have the Google Home. The Alexa has an amazing sound speaker, but be aware that you cannot play multiple songs on multiple devices without a $15 a month charge. This is very frustrating. I have a family of six, each person owning a dot and we have the show. The kids all want to set their own alarms and reminders and it is quite frustrating. This technology Seems like it is in its infancy, unfortunately. Alexa get stumped very easily on questions, and you have to have just the right wording. However she does search for recipes and you can scroll through them and pick the one you want. That is helpful in the kitchen. It does have a large selection of music on Amazon music, however to get an unlimited amount, again, you have to pay for it. This is why we got the Google home as well, So we can get what we need without the hassle of trying to re-word every question we ask Alexa. That being said, the Google Home and the minis do not have good sound systems. They are decent, but Alexa blows them out of the water with her sound system.

The device is a huge disappointment overall. The biggest problem is that sound died after 30 minutes, and won't come back even after powering off and on and resetting the device. It's pretty useless at this point without sound.

The software is also rather awful:
- Ring integration is sluggish. Half the time, the camera stream won't appear. The rest of the time, it takes about 30 seconds for the stream to come up, and even then it's very pixelated.
- The device is very slow. Every menu takes several second to load, including the back button.
- The developers don't understand hit targets. A lot of the buttons, such as the back button, are difficult to hit with your finger because they're so small.

You're better off buying an iPad and keeping it always on.

reviews.reviewTitle: Prime Day Echo Show Fail - No Sound
reviews.reviewText: I received an Echo Show 2nd Gen that has non-functioning sound. When checking the internets, this seems to be an issue that a large number of people who ordered these on Prime Day are having. After several fix attempts with customer service I gave up and will just return. What a huge waste of time, and a Prime Day fail.

reviews.reviewTitle: Dont get this unless you want an Alexa with pictures..
reviews.reviewText: got this for my wife, wanted something to cook with in the kitchen, sounded like you just say a recipe and alexa pulls it up for you to use... blah way more trouble than its worth.. lots of inbetween stuff needs to be done to just get a simple recipe to show.. she winds up using her phone to get the recipe she needs.

reviews.reviewTitle: I LOVE THIS DEVICE!!!! HAPPY BIRTHDAY TO ME. Woohoo!
reviews.reviewText: I had wanted a good sounding device to integrate with my other Alexa/Ring devices. Stopped by Best Buy a few months back and the salesman talked me into a $200 Sonos speaker. Thank God I got the 2 year warranty. Took it back after dealing with the disappointments and shortcomings for over 2 months. Got my money back and used it on the Echo Home Second Generation. OMG! I'm sooooo glad I did. This device is the bomb. Set up is the easiest thing I've ever done. It walks you through everything without lifting a finger. Registration was a snap. And within minutes all my Ring devices were hooked up and showing everything I asked to see. Highly Recommend. Gonna get one for my son for Christmas if he doesn't get one before then once he sees mine. I could go on and on but I'd be wasting your time. Quit reading this and order one NOW!

Nice idea, but not fully there. It feels half baked, mostly because the screen in not very functional or useful.
I think this will be great for my mom to be able to make video calls and I've decided to give one of mine to her. I'll keep the other one to talk back and keep it it in the bedroom or office to replace the alarm clock.

To make this better Amazon needs to make the screen more functional. Just give us a control panel with different screens. Let us put the home automation controls in there so that I can view (and change) the settings of all of the items in my smart home setup. THAT is what this should be. Actually I've been using one of my Echo Shows in the same room as my Fire TV Cube and that setup is almost impossible. I just wish this was functional with the voice control turned OFF and that this and the Cube could work together rather than against each other as this would be a perfect control/info panel. It already has all of the hardware necessary to be that--but the software isn't there. Not even close to there in fact.

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazon fixed the photo rotation problem
reviews.reviewText:
There used to be a problem that if you have 5000+ photos uploaded to your amazon photos account and want the echo show 2nd gen to rotate through them on your home-screen it just would stop at 50-1000 pictures but amazon fixed that issue and now it works flawlessly and perfectly for what I want it to do. I originally had it this review at 3 stars for that issue but now that it's fixed I am updating the review to 5 stars. The sound quality and microphone are way better than the first gen echo show. And the 2nd gen echo show works perfectly with other smart devices that are alexa ready. I have a harmony hub that controls my oscillating fan and my whole home theater system, 8 philips hue light bulbs that have a bridge, a leviton smart light switch, and a ecobee 3 smart thermostat all that the echo show 2nd gen works perfectly with. For my philips hue lights I have different groups for each room they are in set up in my alexa app and I can have alexa turn on/off each group of philips hue lights one group at any time I want and she will do it perfectly. I have the leviton smart light switch set up to control my florescent lights in my kitchen and connected to my echo show 2nd and alexa turns them on/off perfectly.

I would now definitely recommend people buy this product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Audio failed in a week then a customer support fail
reviews.reviewText: Normally, I would not grade so harshly - especially with the limited evaluation time I had. I have a Gen 1 that I have had for quite some time and it has worked well. Gen 2 seemed like it would be a step up in nearly every way and I was very interested to try it out. However, the Audio failed within a week. Alexa would get the commands but then was not able to output sound. I called and asked and hoped there might be an easy fix or a new device might be sent fairly quickly as a replacement . Instead, they had me ship the unit back for evaluation and repair if possible, or replacement if not. I finally heard back with an email that wanted a clarification of address so they could send the unit. I responded immediately to the email with the chat option. Here I spent 40 minutes before they could even determine the device I was trying to get help on and then they finally reported that they couldn't proceed with the promised repair or replacements. Instead, they had the audacity to suggest I buy another device and they would refund this later. So... Now they have my money and my device and their solution was to ask me to purchase ANOTHER device. I asked for a refund. I'm still waiting to see if that goes through. The rest of these devices may be good. Maybe I just got a lemon but this situation has made me very wary of purchasing another Amazon product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Mad I paid for this - don’t care for Amazon’s support
reviews.reviewText:
Very disappointed in this device. Have the first generation Echo Show and I hate to say it works so much better. I can stand 6 feet away from the new Echo Show and speak to it, and the Echo in the living room 30 ft away (https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00X4WHP5E/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_search_asin_title?ie=UTF8&psc=1) hears me while the brand new flag ship sits idol. Wish I had saved my money. This thing is not ready for prime time.

Update: Called in for support. Still under warranty.....and have to send it back so a tech can decide if it is broken and fixable. With the amount of $$$ I spend a year at Amazon, the least they could do is just replace it. Not happy Amazon makes a customer go through the hassle of sending it back and wait for a possible repair. So far this thing is a dud and not happy with the response from Amazon.

The echo show doesn't work. We have 2 replacements in 1 week because out of the box the audio never worked. Not a single sound, effect, or anything.
Tech support have been nice and is sending yet again another replacement, but how can I trust a device that can't work out of the box 3 times in a row!!
Love echo devices but until this bug is fixed it's a complete fail.

As always, Amazon has delivered an excellent product in the Echo line! I love the new screen size and sound quality! Making video calls with family members on the second generation Echo Show allows us to be closer with a larger viewing area, crystal clear video and quality sound. Watching videos on the 10.1" HD screen or listening to music with the premium sound speakers while completing daily tasks has made these daily tasks so much more pleasant. In addition, using the recipes to make new dishes is so much easier to read and follow. Answering the Ring Video doorbell or watching a live view of your outdoor areas through the second generation Echo Show provides you the ability to view who is at your door or view your surroundings while standing across the room from the Echo Show. Of course there are many other features, apps and skills that enhance the second generation Echo Show as well. I definitely recommend getting the new version Echo Show!

reviews.reviewTitle: Definitely buying a 2nd Echo Show 2 in the near future!
reviews.reviewText:
Absolutely LOVE my Echo show!!!! I’ve wanted to get one for over a year, the clunky look of gen 1 stopped me from buying it at the time, and I had 2 of the tallest 2nd gen Alexa speakers already. I didn’t think I could get a better sound than I already had.
I have my show on one side of the kitchen and my speaker on the other side and the sound in my kitchen is AMMMMMAAAAAAZZZIIIINNNNGGGGGGGGGGG!!!! It’s juat a tic or two below the sound of a Bose stereo at a wayyy more reasonable price!
I have a lot to learn about all the things the echo and the echo show can do, but I’m going to have a great time learning about it. Music is at the top of my reasons for having them. Without music this world would be a very dreary type of hell. I have music playing almost constantly 👍😁
Right now I have a screensaver of a crackling fire going. White noise can be very relaxing.

Right out of the box the Echo Show (2nd gen) had no sound output. Tech support worked with me to troubleshoot but the device appeared to be malfunctioning from the factory. Of course, Amazon is replacing the unit. I tried to log on to use it as a clock until the replacement arrived but it would not recognize my account. Did Amazon disable the device or is there another malfunction? Overall, no earth-shaking issues but frustrating. I'm a typical impatient American!

I am really glad I purchased this. The audio is amazing. The bass is deep, the trebles are strong. It can get really really loud. I have actually turned down the bass and keep the audio at about 5. The visual features are really nice. We keep ours in the kitchen and I love being able to use Firefox to look up recipes and watch Youtube while cooking. Having Hulu and Netflix capabilities are also really nice, but I haven't gotten around to setting them up yet (shame on me!). The Alexa features are really nice, although I find myself using mostly skills that dont truly benefit from the Show's screen. I need to look into some more. Either way, for what I use this for, I love it. Its sleek and a wonderful addition to any smart house array. Now I just need to buy some cameras for home security and also use the video call more often!

reviews.reviewTitle: Not as good as Regular Echo
reviews.reviewText: Echo Show 2nd. Gen is not good as the Echo period. The biggest problem is and I think it is the most important one and that is... Voice Reconition. If there is any little noise around while you are talking to Alexa, Alexa will not understand. You will wait and nothing will happen. Will not give you any indication that is not understanding either. Plus, the receiver (mic.) volume is super low so in general you have to scream for Alexa to get it. I wish it had a microphone volume adjustment it is this unit not there yet. By the way this is my second 2nd. Gen version too, I returned one for the same reason already.. This 2nd. one it started OK. but now is back to not understanding again. The Regular Echo must have voice cancelling in it because it would understand with no issues whatsoever.

I was interested in the first generation of the Show, but since I have a functioning Echo (1st gen) and Dot (1st gen), I thought I would wait for this 2nd Generation Show. I think it is absolutely wonderful. My original plan was to put it in the kitchen but in the end I swapped out the Echo in my bedroom and put the Show in there. I find that the dimming function makes the display on the Show so soothing that sleeping in the same room is no problem. The sound is great. I replaced the background with a picture of my own choosing and I find at least some of the rolling screen suggestions worth taking. If I need it in the kitchen, I can always pick it up and move it there. I bought it in the Amazon store in my local mall.

I took advantage of the super sale and bought the new Echo Show 2nd gen. So far I am not happy with it. First the screen always looks dark even though I set the brightness to high and turned off the adjust with ambient light. On my original Show the screen would automatically go to sleep after several minutes. If the 2nd gen has that setting I cannot find it. The best I can find is to tell it to turn the screen off. Why not a setting for sleep with several time options. Last, my original show came with a very nice screen saver set of beautiful pictures from around the world. The 2nd gen comes with a slide show of pastel water color type drawings or a blank gray screen. There is an option to upload and create your own slideshow. Why not at least give us the same as the 1st gen with additional options.

I'm pretty under impressed. I bought this to watch instructional youtube videos and watch shows/movies in my kitchen while I'm cooking. Thought it would be easy especially with Alexa. However you have to go to Firefox and type in the youtube website then the video. Usually that wouldn't be a big deal to me but when I'm in the kitchen my hands are usually dirty or wet. When I saw it didn't allow Netflix, I wasn't sure but talked myself into it for the voice control and being able to stream HBO. However, I can't watch HBO because I didn't purchase it through Amazon. I have cable and can access the app. If everything you have is Amazon, you will like this product but if you purchase entertainment from other companies like Netflix, Google, or HBO, you need to know this product does not support them.

I'm satisfied with my purchase. It does what it's claimed to do. I bought it as an upgrade to the Aamazon Dot I got a year ago. The crystal clear sceen is excellent - very sharp colors for any picture or video you might play. I'm not that into music, although I do you it occasionally for that. I mostly enjoy watching YouTube Videos on it.

In regards to YouTube access, you just ask Alexa "Open Silk" to open its browser, and use the touch screen to open YouTube. I found it easy to use. It's cumbersome typing in the specific video you want, so it's best to touch the microphone icon and simply speak the name of the video. Once videos appear, you can use the screen to scroll to the one you want.

I only have a couple minor complaints: The screen is always on unless you tell Alexa "Screen Off". But if you happen to bump the screen with your hand or arm, it comes back on. There is no "off" button. You can use the Do Not Disturb feature to have the screen be off at specific times, but again, if you accidently touch the screen again, it comes on.

Secondly, the reviews rave about the sound quality. But I've found that the bass seems to be pretty strong, resulting in a sort of a muffled sound when Alexa responds to a question. You have to adjust the volume in those cases where the voice isn't super clear. The voice on the Echo Dot is clearer at times in comparison. At least that's my opinion. Others may disagree.

Overall, I really like this product. It's screen is big, but the unit isn't much bigger than the screeen so it doesn't take up a lot of space on a counter or table. I don't use the Echo Show every day, but I'm still glad I spent the money on it.

I bought this for my 85 y/o mother for Christmas. She is terrified of tech, so she was not pleased, but after showing her how easy it is to use, she loves it. After a day or two she is using it to make shopping and to-do lists, reminders, alarms, cooking timers, checking her calendar, reading recipes. Sorry if this turned into a review of my mother.

The screen looks great and the audio is amazing. Very easy to set up once you connect to your Wi-Fi.
