reviews.reviewTitle: Waste of money, good reviews must be fake.
reviews.reviewText:
It doesn’t really do anything.
Doesn’t reply to my voice unless it has no other sound in the room even birds chirping.
It doesn’t shut down at night lights will flash all night long unless I unplug it. Doesn’t play music. Will not play back my pictures on my phone. I down loaded every app associated to the show. It a good thing I won this product on a drawing because I would had sent it back what a waste of money if I had of paid for it. I guess I will give it to goodwill maybe some kid may like it. I know I wasted hours on it reading, watching video, asking people about it, can’t not find anyone who would buy it!!!

Owning a Echo show 1, Echo Spot, Echo plus , dot etc etc , I was on the waiting list for the all new Echo Show. Having now got it, i must admit that its a must have at every home. Compared to the Show 1, the screen size is a big improvement while HD quality display makes watching the Show 2 a pleasing experience.
The sound quality is far improved with an in-depth Base sound on the new Echo show. The touch panel is also more sensitive and responds to even a slight nudge.
I received the Echo Show 2 with a one months Hulu Subscription. Now that's what i call music! This Echo Show plays all our favourite Live TV channels (CNN, Fox, Cozy, Boomerang for kids .......) available on Hulu. This is indeed a new chapter in Television entertainment. In addition, Echo Show now has apps that can also play back some free to air Live News and entertainment channels.
I have so far no negative feedback on the product. I did however noticed that once connected to a Bluetooth speaker (in my case to a Yamaha bluetooth), there was a little lagging in the sound track. This is not the case with Echo Show 1. Maybe at the next software update, Amazon can fix this minor concern.
As always, A great product from Amazon. Try it Guys - it's sure worth the price!

reviews.reviewTitle: Love the 2nd Gen Amazon Show! First time amazon echo buyer here!
reviews.reviewText: Love this glad I bought it! GET THE STAND FOR IT !!! (Sold separately). It will protect your echo show and raise it up off the counter. Allow you to tilt up and down as well as all around 360. Its worth the extra money for the stand! I also bought 4 plugs that works with alexa too. Not amazon brand, (gosund brand)... Now I can say "alexa turn on living room light", without having to walk all the way over to the lamp! Also if you have an old school coffee pot without a timer, get one of those plugs! You can prepare the coffee the night before and when you get up in the morning you just tell alexa to turn coffee pot on! Those plugs are a must have with any echo device! Watch you tube videos for more reviews and Helpful tips. Also the alexa app has been easy to learn and navigate! Amazon music is my best friend! Also bought an extra echo dot for the bathroom so I can rock out in the shower! Overall I love these products!

reviews.reviewTitle: A great start but not perfect
reviews.reviewText: I have had this for about a month now. Sound is very good and overall a great product. I had been using an echo which I liked but was going to purchase an echo plus but decided to get a Show, Spot, and fire tab 8 with Alexa. My biggest complaint is you truly cant get the display to show what you want. With some effort you can get close but ultimately you get messages that say Try"Alexa …. Playing movies and such is also not convenient. I have several fire sticks and they work great and way easier then the Show. Another issue is if you start adding hi Res cameras you better have a very good internet connection. I run dual band DSL and upload speed seems to get in the way with a few devices running. With a few software changes it could be a great product, the hardware is overall very good. My spot and show went back. I kept the tab but still fighting with show mode when I put it on the wireless dock (show dock). I may end up abandoning the dock and simply use it without show mode. Going back to echo, a very nice product

reviews.reviewTitle: Media Player, Security center, and Timer/Alarm in 1 small package
reviews.reviewText: I bought this to replace my original 1st generation Echo in my kitchen. Honestly I had no idea it was touchscreen until I turned it on the first time, as i couldnt find any info in the description. I was very happy that it is. The main reason I wanted this was to use with the Wyze Cubes for a cheap security camera system and this works perfectly for that. The sound quality is also amazing for its size and we love the easy accessibility to youtube and prime videos as well. My only complaints is that the youtube app is quite clunky and a but difficult to use, and theres no netflix on it yet. If they add netflix and fix the youtube app this would be 6 stars

reviews.reviewTitle: DON’T BUY: Nice Body, Bad Personality
reviews.reviewText:
UPDATE: just don’t buy this garbage. It has become terribly slow even after resetting, and is nothing more than a good speaker. You could just buy a really good speaker for less money than this paper weight.

When I first saw this product announced I was super excited. After spending far too much money on it, I'm left sad. As the title alludes to, the hardware is there. The hardware of this thing is amazing, the sound quality is great, the screen is great. But the software is terrible. Alexa herself certainly needs some upgrades, but the actual OS of this machine is terrible. It is not intuitive to get to anything, including the browser. It also has about no app support so no Netflix like I was hoping, and youtube is usable at least through the browser, but definitely not great. I have hope for the echo show 2 though after maybe another year of software improvements.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love the new Echo Show!
reviews.reviewText:
After reading the reviews of the first gen Echo Show, I opted to wait. I now have gen 2 and I love it! I haven't had a chance to try video calls yet, but I've used lots of other stuff, including the basic Alexa stuff like shopping list, reminders and alarms, playing music, playing audio books and even music videos and Hulu! So far, I love it! I'm really glad I opted for the adjustable stand (at an additional cost). The only thing I wish I had so far is a physical volume up/down button. Sometimes you just want to tap the volume up or down quickly, but I don't think it has that. Otherwise, I super love it and I plan to get one for my Mom, too!

Ps: there are volume buttons on top!

Love my Show. Vibrant screen, nice sound quality and I have gone a little crazy adding switches and plugs to automate EVERYTHING. My only complaint with the Echo devices is Alexa integration. I have the Show in the kitchen and a DOT in the living room. When playing music it’s cool that I can create a group and play on both devices at the same time but that’s where the integration seeems to end. For example, we are in the kitchen and set a time. Then we go sit down in the living room. The timer goes off and we say, “Alexa, stop timer” however Alexa in the living room responds,”There are no timers set” which means we have to get up, get closer to kitchen Alexa and repeat the command. Kind of defeats the purpose of automation. I would like to have Alexa all over the house whereas no matter what command I give they can all respond.

reviews.reviewTitle: 2nd Gen has more issues than 1st Gen
reviews.reviewText: I really enjoy using the echo. We have it set up to control our lights, for listening to music, and overall general information. Very helpful. We got the 1st gen Shows when they first came out and were impressed. We recently gave one show to a family member so we could use it to communicate with them, and honestly, a reason for me to get the newest gen Echo Show. However, I have run into more issues with the 2nd Gen Show than I ever have with the 1st Gen. I've had issues with this Show not displaying anything, then no audio, delays in response, and now it won't perform what it's asked to do. For example, I'll ask it to give me my flash briefing and it won't respond with anything. No action! I have restarted this Echo so many times thinking it just needed a reboot. If it keeps doing what it's doing, I'm going to request an exchange. And if the exchanged 2nd Gen Echo Show does the same thing, I'll go back to the 1st Gen.

Well I think when you're reviewing this item it's really a matter of taste. You either like Alexa or you don't. For me, the sound is good (i'm not an expert on sound, so it wouldn't surprise me if you disagreed), the picture is good, and it just straight up works. I personally think the device is great. I like how it does food recipes and music. I don't really use it for smart home use, so I can't comment on that. It's a great device for what it is, and if you like Alexa, then you'll like this device.

I got this as a gift about a month ago & I haven't found much use for it yet other than to use it like an echo or echo dot. It will do everything that an echo (I have 1) or echo dot (I have 2) will do with voice commands. The sound is better for music as it has a better bass response. I can have it show me the camera from my ring doorbell but I have to tell it to show me. I haven't been able to figure out how to get it to come on automatically when motion is detected or the doorbell rings which is what I hoped to use it for.There is a lag time of a second or two in the video & sound from the doorbell. I don't think that the lag time is from router speed. Could be from the ring. I have an Orbi mesh router system with 2 satellites. The test speed of my router is 84mbps which should be fast enough.

My first Echo Show 2nd generation!! I love it! I bought the deal of buy 2 and get $100.00 off. I gave the second one as a gift to a family who has helped me out a lot this past year. They were thrilled and loved it. Still playing and learning the system. What I am going to like a lot is skype! I have it connected to my smart plugs so on command it turns the lights on or off. The sound is “wow” sound. I even found a screen saver called my aquarium which is quite impressive! I’ve read other reviews that were rating this item low and their gripes but so far I don’t see it and love the all new echo show!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Love, love, love my Echo Show
reviews.reviewText: I use my Echo Show everyday. I can't say enough good things about this device. I can play my music on it, when I am cooking it can look up information for me, it walks you through a recipe so you don't have to pull up your recipe while your hands are gooey, it hooked up to my Ring Doorbell so I can see who is at the door much quicker than I did using my cell phone. There are so many more things the Echo Show can do and I don't want to bore you with listing them all. Just buy one, you won't be sorry.

You likely won't be able to do what you want as everything pushes you to paid subscriptions that you likely dont already have. Like to use Spotify? Good luck getting to what you want and where you want...but pay for Amazon Music and options open. Use Netflix? Not on this device. Hulu will work better (which nobody uses btw).

Most frustrating is that everything is done by voice. This big beautiful screen has no way to touch your way to your music or videos.

For me, Google's device or a simple tablet would do so much more. Especially since I already have Smartthings hub.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love it, with only minor complaints
reviews.reviewText: I love the Show, it replaced an 2nd generation IPad 2 that all I could do was look up recipes and watch Sling. Just prior to the purchase of the Show, Sling informed me it wouldn’t support older iOS systems so my days of enjoying it on my iPad was numbered. I did a bit of research and decided on the Show and traded Sling for Hulu +. I am enjoying it immensely with only a few complaints. I have a HBO subscription on my Prime Video but unable to access it on the Show which is disappointing. Also, I will be watching something and when I ask the Show to turn on or off the lights or drop in to another room it doesn’t return to the program. Lastly, Alexa is so much louder than the programming so am always physically turning up or down the volume. I know, 1st world problems right? Small annoyances, that is all, but important to point out. The Echo Show has been, for the most part, a wonderful kitchen companion.

You have no way of getting the pictures off the Echo once they are on. I downloaded my pictures and there are ones I forgot about and do not like. I cannot delete them! They are there forever. Also, Alexa wil show the same picture reel over and over again. You ask her for new photos and you get another short reel of other pictures over and over again. I have to turn Echo OFF to stop seeing the same thing every day!

reviews.reviewTitle: You NEED the Echo Show. The sound is superb and visual display is amazing.
reviews.reviewText: The Echo Show is an awesome product. It's like having another person in the room, only waaaaay smarter. Great for keeping current on news and weather. Also nice for sports highlights, movies and television shows. Lots of amazing games and music / trivia attributes. Excellent device for streaming Sirius XM or any other on-line service. Alexa will play any song you ask her to. She is great. The perfect companion. There are so many more things I could say but will stop here.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice large screen, too much base
reviews.reviewText: My first Echo Show was the first generation, so when I bought the 2nd generation, I figured it was an improvement. Screen wise it is, speakers, there's too much base (there is an EQ, even with the base turned all the way down, still too much base). The other issue is the speakers facing away from you, behind the device. The first gen unit I could hear throughout my apartment at lower volumes, the second gen unit, I can't unless I really turn it up loud. As I said my apartment, I use my Echo Show as an alarm clock, and listen to music while I wake up. Getting back to the base issues, the last thing I figure my neighbors want to hear is the base coming from my Echo Show as base travels very well through walls. So if you live in an apartment, and you wish to use this device as an alarm clock, I would advise finding a gen 1 Echo Show instead, as it's a much better choice, even with the smaller screen size.

reviews.reviewTitle: Lag time to respond to touch and voice - disappointed!
reviews.reviewText: I own a slew of Amazon/Alexa devices: 3 fire sticks, a fire tv an echo and three dots in addition to the ring alarm and multiple ring cameras. I’ve loved all of their products up to this point but the Echo Show 2nd Gen is underwhelming to say the least. The key issue I have is with lack of responsiveness to touch or voice. Touch is a 50/50 to work and I often have to tap things multiple times. If it does work there’s major lag. For example: I swipe left from the right side of the screen to pull up my smart home controls, it take two or three seconds for it to actually do it on the screen. It’s like an old computer that lags. Voice is much the same. For a $229 product it’s unacceptable. Unfortunately I’ll be selling mine and hoping for a better product in future generations. Sadness. The display is also not the greatest in terms of quality and for smart home controls it’s just clunky.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great but can’t use multiple devices with spotify
reviews.reviewText: Love it !!! Came 7 days early the sound is amazing only frustrating thing is I have Spotify not amazon music and if I use one Alexa device to play Spotify and can not then play on another device

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Show 2nd Generation, 50 year old womans perspective
reviews.reviewText:
We received this Echo Show (2nd Gen) as a gift and I have to be honest I never wanted this product in my house. I thought it was creepy knowing it can listen in and take pictures/video. I have to change my opinion now, I love having it around. I love being able to listen to music or watch videos, check the weather or ask Alexa anything and everything. I just turned 50 and I love my 80's hairband groups. I can just say. "Alexa play 80's rock music or one hit wonders" and in a blink of an eye there it is and the screen shows the lyrics. If I don't like the choice I then say "Alexa stop, next" things like that and the songs change. I can also make calls while busy walking around. I can watch recipe videos to show each step. I can connect my pictures to see them on the screen.
I forgot to mention the sound quality is amazing and you can change the sounds to your own preferences.
I'm really new to this device and still learning but it can do SO much. I want to get a door bell that connects to this device and I can say "Alexa show me the front door" I then can see the front of the house. Or when someone rings the bell it shows me who it is, some even have two way microphones. You can buy special plug adapters to plug household items in and then you can control using "Alexa" to operate it, like TV's, lights, routers to control your kids time allowed on the internet. I know there are many more things it can do but I'm still learning. I didn't think I'd like or want anything like this in my home, boy was I wrong. I would recommend this product to everybody especially to us not so young individuals that think this product was stupid in the first place. I'll admit I was wrong.....LOL

Take this with a grain of salt since I didn't spend any time to train . But appliance was not user friendly. It does manage turning lights, fans on/off IF speak the connected utility ID clear enough for it to do it, otherwise get which one? And you have to repeat until it passes your pronunciation. You can't casually direct requests. In games it will only except the EXACT answer'vemg. If answer is New York City it may not accept it (wrong-answer is New York CITY), etc. Interface is not as smooth as I thought it would be. But again, I did not delve into perfecting my procedure, and just yell at it. Cats are more perceptive, intelligent and adaptive.

This was really an impulse buy but I'm actually not sorry that I bought this thing-a-ma-bob. Yeah, you can tell how techy I am, but still, this is a nice addition to the kitchen. I am still waiting for it to inspire me to follow a complete recipe from start to finish, but it is promising. I would buy it again for the entertainment aspect it offers. It sounds rich and full, and screen display colors are clear and vibrant. Surprisingly, though, my Echo Spot gave me a more detailed response and display on an anatomy question than the Show, but still, I am good with it all in all.

Theirs people that can't never be happy no matter what! I was really reluctant to buying amazon products like the alexa smart speaker, and echo show because I didn't like the idea of some one or something listening to what I say at all times but I can honestly say I was wrong. I just got my echo show and smart speaker yesterday and I'm already in shock of how awesome these products are simple to set up and use and the quality of the sound amazes me my echo show is as loud as my 55'in LG 4K TV its an amazing smart little screen that does the job I can now clean ,cook and have dinner while watching my favorite shows without having to touch or press anything. Just with my voice I'm able to jump directly to whatever interest me. I personally hate when people read the description of a product then go online after buying it just to complain about something they knew the product didn't have or couldn't do like Oh I purchase my echo show and I thought it was bigger then my 32"in tv but its not so I'm gonna give it 3 stars ...........

I managed to pick up the Echo Show on a recent sale. It has a very nice quality of base and overall sound quality to it. I was somewhat surprised when compared to a lack luster speaker in the Echo. Music from my Amazon collection as well as station such as Pandora have a rich sound to them. The visual display is crisp and certainly suitable for displaying images, through I prefer a larger screen to watch video at home. Voice recognition, even across from a small room while playing music is dependable. It is configurable so that the screen only displays time when not in use so not to be distracting. The bluetooth pair is not quite as reliable as it should be, as it did not connect to a device sitting directly next to it. Overall, a good purchase at a discounted price.

reviews.reviewTitle: Significant Improvement Compared to First Generation Product
reviews.reviewText: The new Echo Show is a significant improvement over my first generation Show, which I have kept. Voice recognition and sound output is considerably better and it remains easy to setup. I soon as I plugged it in an connected to my wifi, it connected, downloaded a lengthy update and then downloaded necessary personal information from the Alexa app. It works with all of my enabled products of several different brands with no difficulties and I did not have to setup anything just for this new product. The app took care of that for me. A quick run through of the settings and I was all set. My only disappointment is not new, its the fact that Siri does a better job of understanding what I want that Alexa does. Amazon, it is time to improve this, please do some more work on the software that controls this. 4 Starts until this improvement takes place.

reviews.reviewTitle: Can't adjust display sleep time. Makes using recipes from web difficult
reviews.reviewText: First, the Echo Show has a very nice display and the sound is fantastic! But the display sleeps too fast and there is no way to change it yet. I bought this device after seeing the ads and the pictures in the product description that show people using it in the kitchen. My wife and I have a lot of recipes in Pinterest. The display will go to the home screen if it not touched every few minutes. This is not ideal for cooking or baking. There is no way to adjust the screen sleep time apparently. I contacted customer service and tech support and was informed that it's not possible to do at this time. The Echo Show will probably be returned and we will go back to using our laptop in the kitchen.

I do much of the cooking and cleaning in our house which means I spend a majority of that time in the kitchen. We started with a Echo Spot in our kitchen with the idea that some music or an audio book might be nice to help pass the time while stuck in the kitchen. Once we got used to the Spot the Show started to sound like more of an good idea.

I've had the Show for a month now and am really pleased with it. The sound is great and the video is nice to have for YouTube or other videos. It even connects to my Ring doorbell although I haven't used this feature much yet.

A couple of nitpicks...
The shape of it does not allow for the Echo Show to be easily mounted to a wall or under cabinet. Important for those of use with limited counter space.
YouTube has to be set to 'desktop' in order to watch it without the screen timing out. This was frustrating to have to work out.
The touchscreen could be easier to use. At least for my old and inflexible fingers. I might purchase a pen for it.

I so wanted to like this unit because I heard so many great things about the 1st gen and how great it is. When I saw a 2nd gen had come out with a largers screen I was in. ***Buyer Beware*** voice recognition sucks. It’s slow to respond. It often has issues and I have to turn it off and back on at least twice a week. For the money spent I could have gotten two echo spots instead. WAY overpriced for what you get. The only decent thing about the unit is the sound quality.

I thought I would be able to use this device to show me recipes and listen to music or movies while I cooked. Alexa doesn't understand my requests and 75% of the time I'm using my laptop for recipes instead. You have to be very specific when asking for things. Now that I've owned it for six months or so, it has stopped working almost completely. It won't turn back on. I'm so frustrated.

Update: I should have tried the first thing with all electronic devices....Reboot. My Amazon Show is back up and running! Still, it's only good for music so hopefully there will be an upgrade in the future. Amazon contacted me trying to help but I haven't called them back yet. If they are able to troubleshoot the communication problems, I'll be back with another update!

reviews.reviewTitle: Very disappointed, huge waste of money...
reviews.reviewText: I got this thinking that the screen would be useful only to find out that you can not watch Netflix or Xfinity on this device. Also, it falls asleep after 5-10 minutes and the screen goes black and there is no way to turn off the sleep function. What is the point of having a screen to see lyrics or watch videos if you have to touch the screen every 5-10 minutes to keep waking it up? And why even set up a home wallpaper if the screen just goes to black constantly, I never get to enjoy my wallpaper? Finally, only two weeks after I purchased this it went on sale and I got screwed out of $50. I'm very disappointed with Amazon's price guarantee/match policy. Most stores will refund you the difference if a product goes on sale within 30 days of purchase, but not Amazon. This has turned into being a very expensive paperweight on my desk, and half the questions I ask Alexa she has no answer to. I just don't see the point of the Echo Show when you can't do anything useful with it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Please make it a better clock
reviews.reviewText:
I primarily use echo show to replace my bedside clock.
I like the large display but hate the fact that I can't change the clock face. Despite the large screen, it shows time in top left corner only. I want to be able to see the clock without putting on my glasses. I don't want to disturb others by asking Alexa what time it is. It is really silly that Amazon does not give me the ability to use the entire screen as a giant clock that may also display date, and possibly current weather. It has the ability to display it by I can't customize it to make it occupy the entire screen

I now understand that this product is more for people that want to have a touch screen.... but you should be able to touch it to have it do things then! I have had nothing but problems with this. Hulu does not steam correctly.... half the time when I ask Alexa to find a movie she does something else. The voice recognition is crap. I have several other Echo devices and do not have the same problems that I do with this one.

I purchased two.... one for home and one for work. I seriously can't get either one to work correctly. I really wanted to get one for my grandma so that we could video chat, but I don't think she would be able to get it to work.

Also.... if you want it to be touch screen you should be able to pull up the skills to use them. I like to use Spotify but forget it on this thing.... it has no idea what Spotify is let alone telling it to play a certain play list.

I was trying to give it the old college try and now I'm outside of the return window. I really wish I would have just gotten a new Fire that had Alexa.... it would have been a lot cheaper and so much easier to work with.

Last but not least..... LET US HAVE NETFLIX!!!!!!

I'm currently using both Echo Show and Google Home Hub/Lenovo Display. This one is very closed to perfect, but I'm ignoring youtube in this review since that have nothing to do with the actual product itself. It would be great if the home screen can rotate some photo/image of the day like the Google Home Hub can, it actually nicer to look at and not repetitive since it cycle differently every day. The Echo show just have some simple repeated artworks and cycle trending news, it gets old very quick. Unless you create your own album to let it cycle. Controlling lights is a bit unorganized when you have a large amount of smart lights in the house. The Google Home Hub have much better organization when it comes to linked smart home products. Though the 10.1" screen amazing, really great for kitchen use. Sound is MUCH better than other smart display, bass and sound are just really good for what it is. Amazon could really use some features from the Google home hub to improve the Echo, it's REALLY close to being the best in the market.

reviews.reviewTitle: Quality build lacking responsiveness and some obvious skills
reviews.reviewText: First impression is it a quality device but still getting to know it. One observation is it takes a very long time to open camera views in the Blink skill and there is a serious lack of live video skills...hope there’s more coming. Seems like it should be easy enough have access to Playstation Vue or other.

reviews.reviewTitle: Ring and Show are out in space
reviews.reviewText: Cannot get ring spot lite camera to show on screen! Picks up signal and says there was a detection. iPad does all and the video is there. I am versed in works and cannot figure out the problem. All units operate on same net and pass. Amazon techs are also baffled. They say reset the Ring but it is up 25 ft. and how come phone and IPad works?

-Why can't the Alexa app be preinstalled on this device rocking a 10.1" HD Screen? Why??? I have to use a phone, tablet or a PC/Mac to access the Alexa app this device is supposed to portray.
-Alexa dim all lights 50%!!! "Sorry all hue lights are not responding!" (Lights are offline on the Alexa App but perfectly fine on the Philips Hue app)
-It is supposed to "sync" with my Philips Hue account and mirrors my HUB setup from the Philips Hue app but no! Instead of just 4 fully assigned lights, this thing discovered 4 extra factory-named lights duplicating the ones that were fully assigned. Delete the duplicates then all of a sudden "Sorry Hue Lights are not responding".
-Why is there no option to raise or lower Alexa voice directly like changing volumes for media, ringtone and notification like on any regular mobile device?
-Why is there no real settings to customize the Home Screen especially the CLOCK?
- Why under "Lights and More" you can only toggle on/off your lights. How about dimming and stuff?
- Most annoying if you're watching a video and say "turn on/off lights...!" You have to wait for it to execute the command then wait 15-20 secs before it resumes the video.
Hopefully they address those issues soon otherwise I am returning it

I really like this device it resides in my Kitchen The Alexa functionality is good and getting better all the time. Sound and screen size is pleasing but like the rest of the device, it could use improvements. My two main complaints are #1 the is lack of multiple users control and #2 tablet type functionality. If you want to make a call you can only pull from one address book which is cumbersome for a device meant to serve a home as a centralized device. The device is limited to the echo show mode and Aleza only and has no tablet-style functionality like adding your favorite apps which is limiting at best and a gross omission at the very least. I do hope the platform improves overall. Look at it this way if I want to add a new Hue or smart thing device I have to pick up my Fire HD 10 or phone or laptop to add it so Alexa can control it because the Echo Show is useless in this regard. Not what I expected and I'm sure very frustrating for many less tech-savvy DIYers.

reviews.reviewTitle: Poor picture quality , not a full HD
reviews.reviewText: Now days , people are not even satisfied with 1080P and looking for 2k , 4k or 8k . This device is not even 1080P and the pictures are kind of dark most of the time even on the brightest mode. the touch screen is also very weak , most of the time won't work, very difficult to get You Tube, no app store, and ..... You cant even change the picture on your albums with the touch and most of the time stock in one picture . Amazon need to reprogram this device and for sure the new one should should have at least a full HD 1080P. I give it two star because of the sound quality only.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nest video doorbell and Echo Show lack compatibility features.
reviews.reviewText:
I currently have an Echo Tower and Dot. In addition, I have the Nest thermostat and Nest doorbell. I purchased the Echo Show to display recipes, streaming videos, playing/displaying music, and displaying and letting me know when someone is at my door or ringing the doorbell.
I love everything about the Echo Show, except for how it works with my Nest Doorbell. Echo show will not tell you or display, if someone is at your door or ringing your doorbell. I have to ask Alexa to show me the front door. I am very disappointed with the way Echo Show works with the Nest doorbell.

reviews.reviewTitle: I Got It, Amazon: Echo Has a Ton of Skills to Try
reviews.reviewText:
The Echo Show is a great device nearly ruined by a poor software decision by Amazon.

The device sounds great, is easy to set up, and is dead simple for home automation purposes. However, the bottom of the screen is interrupted by a constant advertisement from Amazon to try various Echo skills. This cannot be shut off. It's always there ruining the screen. It nearly caused me to dump the Echo ecosystem entirely and switch to Google (I still may...).

If the constant advertisement doesn't bother you, consider this a 4/4.5 star review. I, however, believe I should be able to control all of the screen real estate and should be able to shut off things I don't like.

reviews.reviewTitle: Handy & Easy to Use...BUT No Battery
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this specifically for the video capabilities. I bought 3 so my kids and parents have them and we can video with granddaughter.

It is easy to use for things like turning on movies, music, video conferencing, viewing security cameras, and video conferencing.

HOWEVER, I cannot even fathom the reasoning behind not having even a short term battery. It comes with a six foot cord which won't even get you out of the room you're in. My plan was to be able to keep it in my office and take to kitchen when needed. I cannot do that without unplugging, replugging and waiting for it to set up. The only reason I can come up with for no battery is Amazon doesn't want you to be able to take it room to room but wants you to purchase additional shows for each room you would need it in. I find that frustrating...and a little infuriating. I am currently looking into whether a longer power cord can be purchased and will update when I find out.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great sound, but that’s about it
reviews.reviewText:
I was very surprised by the sound quality. I have a pair of Sonos play 5 mounted on top of my kitchen cabinets my wife was playing some music and I had to ask if the sound was spraying out of the Sonos or the echo show.
As for the echo show itself . I’m not super impressed with its functionality. It kind of crashes when trying to watch Hulu. We have a large open kitchen / dining / living room we used to have a echo dot on top of the fridge, it could hear us at normal conversation level in any of the rooms .
The echo show is on the counter directly across from the fridge , and now we have to shout commands when we are in the living room .
One of the features I do enjoy is having it show my camera roll . Most of the Alexa apps are designed to be used with out a screen . We have rings and the integration seems week. I would like the camera view to come up on its own, with out my having to say the command .

Great improvement over gen 1 echo show. Larger screen makes it easier to see things like time and temperature. Sound is amazingly clear with improved bass response. Don’t really like “booming” bass sound while listening to rock music so I had to turn bass down using equalizer. Besides music, we use it for timers, reminders, weather reports, phone calls, recipes, jokes and various skills. What a great “toy” as well as useful device! Only wish Amazon would update software to allow us to adjust font size of time/temperature & include day/date on home display along with the time/temperature.

This is actually quite larger compared to the pictures and it can take up some real estate depending on where you will put it. It also has some weight on it. Other than that though, I think this is the best echo yet. Screen quality is very good, alexa responds quick and the sound is absolutely amazing. It also has a mic mute button but it does not have a camera shutter so you would probably want to put a shutter on it if you are paranoid like me.

As far as integration with smart home devices, its even better. It supports all the other stuff I have previously and If you have blink, you can now view your bllink cameras on the screen. You can even make calls and camera quality is actually quite good.

Overall, echo show 2 is a very cool and impressive device!

This totally exceeded my expectations.
Easy set-up from opening the box to syncing and beginning of use.
It even arrived earlier than expected!
The box has been opened for about an hour and we're loving the lyrics with songs playing, video from our security cameras, story time with pictures and words, and the photo slideshow.
I can't wait to use this for more!

Only complaint I have is when music is playing you have to scream at it to stop . May be a nature of the beast since its producing sound next to the mike but can get annoying .
Should also point out voice recognition seems to be better than other alexa products and it does not go off by accident as much . Dont bother with Amazon music . Same price you get anywhere else has more selection and not as many weird or live versions you cant get around .

I was super excited to receive my Echo Show but quickly realized that it wasn't exactly what i was expecting. The screen quality is excellent and the sound is fantastic. While i love how the image quality looks and how the sound performs, it does have a few flaws.

There is no main screen where all of your apps will live, You will need to ask the Echo to open things up. For some reason when ever i ask to open spotify it asks me to set up a video provider on the alexa app.

The Hulu app is limited in what you can search or watch and its the same thing for prime video. It is almost impossible to get the echo show to open up the correct show when you ask her to. I have found i have to ask the echo to open something and then look for it manually.

It is pretty bulky and takes up a bit of space .

The alexa app itself is a little hard to figure out and has made me use a google home to control my home devices.

All in all its a good speaker and great for video chatting ( Once you can figure it out), but there are still a lot of things that are lacking that Amazon could improve.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not worth the money, iPhone does the same things...
reviews.reviewText: It was a waste of money, but I can't return since the window closed while we took our severely disabled son to Walt Disney World (they failed to accommodate him under the ADA), and now we are stuck with an expensive and useless product. The Fire Stick is excellent though. I plan to report to AG's office and my congressman so he knows that when we asked, "do you listen all the time," the thing replied that it only listens when you say the trigger word, BUT, we asked the question without saying "Alexa" first! So it does invade your privacy. We unplugged it. We do recommend the Fire Stick though!!

The Show is my favorite Echo device in the house. I have a Echo and an Echo Dot, but having the screen and other added features make it well worth the price. I am able to connect my Ring video doorbell up to the Show to see who's at the front door. Also, I can see the words to songs that are playing on Prime Music. Speaking of sound, It sounds much better than all the other Echo devices... Clear sound with nice bass (Has an equalizer that you can tweak). There is also a lot of Bluetooth tech capabilities like using it as an external speaker for your TV or Stereo. The wallpaper is customizable as well. You can have the Show display your photo library or a specific picture for the main wallpaper background. The touch screen is also a nice touch. Hopefully they will update the Echo Show to include more touch screen options like a tablet. All around good and solid product.

Buyer beware - there is a known issue where no sound will come out. Some users will have to plug and unplug device frequently to resolve. That worked for me once and doesn’t any longer. Now sending to Amazon to repair/replace. This will be the last echo product I purchase due to lack of response on issue from amazon and poor customer service on remedying the problem.

As for the unit itself, when it worked... sound is nice. My wife wanted it for pictures of the kids in the background. it’s okay for that, but there’s always an annoying overlay of ‘try this’ notes. It tries too hard to push use of device through this feature and it’s annoying. reminds me of when i first bought the the first kindle fire... just not as good as I hoped.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice Product... Except for Annoying Alexa Hints
reviews.reviewText:
I own three 1st Gen Echo Shows... and just purchased my first 2nd Gen Show. Very nice product, a definite upgrade. Screen looks great. Overall I am pleased with it, except for the "Alexa hints" at the bottom of the home screen.

Let the user decide if we want hints displayed on the bottom of the screen. I don't. Give us a software option to turn hints off. Provide a simple on/off toggle button in the settings.

I would give this product a 5-star rating if this one major annoyance was remedied. The home screen should allow some customization by the end user. Please fix this issue, which is long overdue...

reviews.reviewTitle: Please read this review and it may help you too.
reviews.reviewText: We bought 2 echo shows one for us and one that was set up 1800 miles away from ours in a nursing home. This product allowed me to drop in on my chronically ill sister whenever i wanted. She was no longer able to reach and answer her phone. I got to see her everyday which made her feel that I was sitting with her. Sadley she passed away last night and I was able to be with her until the end. God Bless the people who developed " my friend Alexa" who did her job and let me be with my sister, it was comforting for both of us.

reviews.reviewTitle: Audible and echo are not integrated
reviews.reviewText:
Audiobook fan? Love audible? See photo for the activity feed .. "not supported" this is what this device is in a nutshell. The echo show is clearly not ready to be in anyone's home. Support for prime video is poor, shopping poor, music is decent but not great, at this price point.. it's a doorstop. Don't buy.
The echo show doesn't support bookmarks!?(WTH) The echo show does not sync to the android mobile app!

Syncing audiobooks

Echo > Android mobile app = fails 100%

Andoid Mobile app > echo show = functional 80% (8 out of 10 syncs of playback position are successful)

I regret my purchase, the echo team and audible team need to have a meeting and get this done, yesterday. Disgraceful oversight.

Alexa tries to make me watch Psych no matter what show I ask for. Clearly not ready for the market. Sending it back

I will be sending mine back. The sound is pretty good and picture is clear but my 3 year old fire is every bit as good and far more intuitive. I really can't figure out what is supposed to be better about Echo Show. It puts videos in my queue that I will never watch and it can't find the things I ask for. Hate it so far.

reviews.reviewTitle: Will not pair with Echo plus in stereo configuration
reviews.reviewText: I previously had two echo plus (2nd gen) paired with the subwoofer downstairs in my house. I Moved one of the echo plus upstairs and then tried to pair the echo show with the sub and the other echo plus. Found out that only similar devices will pair with the sub. So you need two echo plus or two echo plus shows to pair with the sub, you can not mix and match which to me seems a bit ridiculous. If the alexa "plus" devices can communicate with each other and broadcast to each other why would they not be able to mix and "sync" with the sub. Updating my review to add the fact that so far the echo show (2nd gen) will not detect the temperature in a room as does the echo plus. Amazon seems to have dropped the ball on the echo show overall.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very disappointing, poor voice recognition and glitches
reviews.reviewText: I have been so disappointed in the echo show. My unit has had so much issue responding to me calling Alexa, so bad that another echo device in another room responds with the echo show picking up the commands. It’s super bad when volume is over halfway that you have to walk directly within 2 feet of unit to shut it off by voice commands. I tried replacing my unit and all amazon wants to do is spend time on the phone to trouble shoot. My unit is also suffering from the sound glitch. What happens is no sound will come out of the unit. The only fix is to unplug the power from the unit for at least five seconds and FYI unplugging from the wall does not work only from the unit (see forums for discussion on this glitch)

reviews.reviewTitle: I would give the Echo Show 10 STARS if I could
reviews.reviewText:
I would give the Echo Show 10 STARS if I could. It works great with all my Ring products. And the things I can do with the Show are great. The picture quality is great for a older person like me, for I can see everything real easy.

Cons:
Alot of us been telling and calling Amazon about this. We need more then 4 names for the units, I alone have 7 Amazon Dots, 1 Echo Show, and 1 Echo Show 5. I have a unit in every room of my house, I control the lights thermostat, and a ton more things. So when one of your commercials comes on about how many miles form the Earth to the moon. I don't need the units telling me because they hear the question from one of my TV's. So please give us more name are better yet let us set the names we want.

So frustrating--this device fails to hear us in the same room. We will repeat ourselves louder and one of the Alexa enabled devices in other rooms will end up responding before this one does. I thought this had more and better microphones. This is one of the most important features for this device-response and it is lacking. Knowing what we know now we would have bought a second original Echo Show or waited for improvements. I expected much better.

reviews.reviewTitle: Pretty good with smart home integration
reviews.reviewText: Overall a great device to own if you like cooking it will display recipes. Really easy to set up and use and the voice recognition is nice for smart home integration and control. It is a little extra with Vivint systems since it will say “ok completed Vivint.smarthome, ok turning off these lights” it’s a little annoying but it still does the job. There are a lot of additional skills that help integrate other services as well which is nice. If you’re familiar with drop in, you say forget the other things like the FB camera thing. Alexa allows someone with the app on their phone to drop in and video chat with contacts and displays the video for both which is cool especially for family. You can do it between echo devices or other contacts.

Music sounds really great. Have a few things connected to Alexa such as, lights in different rooms, home thermostat and a ring doorbell. Everything works great with Alexa with one personal drawback with the ring door bell and that is you have to tell Alexa Show to "show front door" in order to view the video, otherwise it only announces there is motion or your door bell is pushed. I wish it would automatically show video in order to give you a faster response. I have a bulb in a tall floor lamp beside my chair that works with Alexa. The light is a little out of reach for me and all I have to do is tell Alexa to turn the light on and can be dimmed too, works great. My Alexa is several feet away from where I sit and I have to raise my voice in order for her to hear me if I have the TV on. With a few minor drawbacks Alexa is a great convenience.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great device, but background pictures continue to loop and not cycle correctly
reviews.reviewText:
These devices are great. I own two of them. The display is sharp looking and the sound quality is fantastic. As a digital picture frame they are terrible. The problem even occurs on the gen 1 Echo show. I am talking about the background picture display and NOT the slideshow mode that is also possible on these devices.
For the background, I choose a folder of pictures from Prime Photos. It cycles the photos every 90 seconds or so while showing the overlays I have selected (weather, drops ins, sports scores) and also transitions between the Amazon trending topics. At least once a week, it will get stuck on a picture and never change it unless I power cycle. Also, when it gets to the last photo in the album, it will usually just go back and show the last 10 pictures again, rather than start back over at the beginning.
I have contacted Amazon product support about this and they ignored me. I am not a software engineer, so perhaps programming for pictures is a very difficult thing. It is possible though, as I've seen other devices do it. I would also like to see some options for the background pictures, such as picture duration/speed and a shuffle option. This request to Amazon has fallen on deaf ears too. Maybe they just don't care.
I have tried about everything I can to fix this/trick it to work and have not had luck. Others I know have the same issues with background pictures. I would use the slideshow mode, but it doesn't display any overlays or additional information. If Amazon would fix this I would give it a higher score.

UPDATE: The show devices keep getting worse for using as picture displays. I have an album I use as the background (not the slideshow feature). It changes between a photo in the album and the Amazon trending content. Every 3 cycles the picture changes to the next one in the album. It has got progressively worse. It used to get stuck on a picture forever, unless I reset it. Then it would get to the end of the album and instead of starting over, jump back about 10 pictures or so and loop them. Now, it skips pictures in the album randomly and gets stuck in a loop randomly in the album. This keeps getting worse. This should not be that hard to program.

First off, sound is fantastic for such a little device. I didn't realize we could get music/video of this quality from such a small device. However, with that said the software has me concerned. I'm staring at my Echo Show right now and it has powered off on it's own. I've had to reboot this unit several times since receiving because it either locked up or for some reason powered off by itself. If this wasn't so expensive, I would probably be more forgiving, but at $200 I expect more.

Screen quality is good, video playback is good as well. Touchscreen responsiveness is also good. My biggest gripe is when the unit has stalled. Perhaps when future updates are pushed out, this Echo Show will be more stable and less inclined to locking up or powering off on it's own.

reviews.reviewTitle: El equipo en mi país no funciona que puedo hacer ayúdeme
reviews.reviewText: Saludos. El artículos es estupendo y fácil de, desembalar pero tengo problemas en mi país no funciona soy de República Dominicana y es imposible usarlo, el tiempo la hora por que solo funciona para USA Y PUEDE VER ES IMPOSIBLE POR QUE LO COMPRE PENSANDO QUE TRAIA ESPANOL Y NO HABLO INGLES

reviews.reviewTitle: Slow and doesn’t understand you well
reviews.reviewText: This product has become more of a disappointment when comparing to the google nest hub products. More specifically, in terms of accurate voice recognition and understanding of commands, this device falls short. Its loading times are also very slow, including respond to touch. After selecting a video on the screen, it takes several seconds for the video to load in any capacity. The limited music selection has also become apparent. Inconsistencies in playing music after issuing the same commands is frustrating. This product is better than nothing, but I eagerly await to replace it with the google nest hub max.

Very poor as compared to the original. I thought that I would be patient and see if maybe it improves after I interacted with it a bit but it has gone from bad to worse. I have several Alexa enabled devices that function just fine including an Original Echo Show, (2) Echo show 5s, an Echo Dot, and 2 Fire Sticks but the 2nd Generation Echo Show does not live up to the hype. It often does not recognize my wake word “Alexa” or has an incredible lag of 30+ seconds before it recognizes it. If I’m streaming a video and I give an auditory command such as “Alexa Pause”, the blue light often comes on acknowledging that the device heard the wake word but refuses to comply to the directive. I most often have to interact with it using the touch screen which is not its primary design. Very disappointed.

reviews.reviewTitle: I have one Alexa in every room of my home!
reviews.reviewText: We have so many Alexa models in my home I have lost count and always upgrade when a new model arrives. These two as you can see are placed in our Bedroom and kitchen. We have tried the “Competition” and have one also next to our Alexa in the Kitchen (not shown in the picture) but do not like it! Amazon wins on our home hands down... one in every room!!! Our lights, stereo, health, everything connected. Do I care that they are listening.. no as I have nothing to hide. I am a true believer in the Amazon Alexa products and highly recommend them! Still though waiting since day one for my Amazon Alexa Echo Auto.... long wait and with having so many devices surprised not to get an invite yet! Does not matter love Alexa!

Having two of these products, I really would have liked to be able to communicate from one Echo Show to another or another Alexa device. Example if I have one upstairs and another one somewhere in the house having the ability to talk, send notifications, see the other person to whom I am trying to communicate with would be wonderful. An alert that some one is trying to contact you, with the ability to reject or accept the contact would be beneficial. If not excepted within 30 seconds the call is dropped and a message could be left on the screens of the other devices. But overall I have enjoyed the devices. I also have google devices to compare to and have found the Alexa devices much more "intelligent in nature" giving great responses.

Updating my review from 4 stars to 2. Less than a month in and it's malfunctioning. Way way over priced for what you get. Should have stuck with my echo....which by the way...is also malfunctioning.

A little pricey considering it doesn't do much. The touch screen doesn't have many options at all. Most programming needs to be done with your phone. Great sound. Nice, heavy and sturdy so that it can't get knocked over easily. Works good with my security system...however wish that the live camera feed would automatically show when it detects movements. A split screen on my security cameras would be nice too. I don't like amazon music as much as my other music app. Some of the music titles they play in their stations aren't the #1 hits I want to listen to....some aren't desirable at all. Still giving 4 stars because having my home controlled by Alexa is pretty cool.

I contacted Amazon Technical support. They stated the "Network port on the back of Echo Show is meant for specialized Enterprise experiences. We currently do not offer support for consumer use of the Network port."

I asked for documentation on the "specialized Enterprise experiences" and was informed "that information is not available on Amazon website. It is internal information. We do not have access to further details regarding this port."

This is sad considering many media sources and reviews touted the port as a feature.

I primarily use this device for video conferencing. Every 10 minutes or so, there is a slow down on the connection. The device doesn't have any troubleshoot options to see where the issue is location.

Other than that, it works great.

My husband bought this for me as a gift. The sound is wonderful and I'm impressed by the quality of the screen. I like being able to play music, check the weather, hear the news without touching the device. However, some of the limitations have surprised/disappointed me. I was bummed to discover that there isn't a skill for Netflix and that video streaming services like Hulu and Prime don't have their full capacity. It's difficult to navigate Hulu to find all of the movies and TV shows I like.

More importantly, I am shocked it's not easier to use the Show for storing and accessing recipes. It seems obvious that this device be used to view recipes while cooking without touching it and getting it dirty. AllRecipes appears to be the only skill for recipes, but I get very few if any of my recipes there. As an experienced cook, I have a ton of favorite recipes I'd like to pull up on this device, but instead, all I can get are a bunch of "suggestions" that are not my tried-and-true choices. Even if I request a very specific recipes by title or publisher, my requests don't pull up. I've seen that customers have commented about this issue for a very long time now with no response from the company, which suggests that perhaps Amazon isn't doing a great job of improving their product to suite their customer's needs.

All in all, I'm excited to have this product, but I hope Amazon makes some improvements soon!

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa - Stop showing me suggestions on what to try.
reviews.reviewText:
I wish they sold a ADD FREE version like they do tablets.

Good device for all us Amazonian s, but the product manager needs fired or a kick in the bottom for the TRY SPAM.

I bought this for a handy cam display. However there is too much delay for it goes to Amcrest then Amazon then to my echo show... my phone did a much better job of viewing it.

Dont get me wrong I really like this gizmo. Watching YouTube video's with a voice command is kinda cool.

I bought my echo show used on eBay. My comment is just that I have no way of changing when the screen times out. I went to settings under display options using the echo show itself and using the alexa app on my phone. I went to settings on device options using the device and the app and there were no options to change how long before the screen times out. What I loved most about the first echo show- which I bought from perpay for more than it sells on Amazon- were/are the daily routine abilities and the constant flow of news updates going across the screen. I also put my favorite artists as the background image. I wouldn't have even gotten the second echo show except the first one kept making a popping noise. Why are they letting these things happen?

I got the Echo Show specifically to be able to see my Ring Camera feeds. For this it works great. I did have some challenge since I have a number of Amazon Echos about, so sometimes one of the other Echos would intercept the command rather than the Echo Show. My biggest challenge was the Alexa App on my PC intercepting. I unistalled the app on my Windows PC, and now the Echo Show picks up the commands fine.

So far I am liking the Echo Show. It was a good addition to my Smart Home experience.

No matter which duration I select, the photos display for one minute. There is no randomization for displaying photos. It might be random where it starts from but then it stays in that folder showing each photo before going to next folder. In between photos it shows promotional messages which is annoying. Plus it shows messages over your photos. I purchased this primarily to provide a slideshow of photos when not using Alexa and am very disappointed.

This new Echo Show was so easy to setup. I wasnt sure about the split keyboard layout at first, but it is actually really comfortable to use when needed. I do wish the browser would load a bit faster, both Firefox & Silk a bit slow to open and load a web page.

Ive used the 1st gen Show as a background media device for about a year and my only real complaint was the screen size for watching shows. In that time we have lost then gained youtube access, and gained Tidal and Hulu support, This device is wonderful as it s basically a tablet in a speaker enclosure so you get a full screen experience at the expense of front directed audio. Since I still feel they are targeting the this for a corner of your kitchen all of the sound is now reflected from the back and while it is much more "spacious" and "immersive", its not nearly as clear as front fired speakers, this is true with TVs, phones, tablets, laptops etc so its not a device specific behavior. This gen also has a built in Zigbee hub so you can use things like Hue bulbs without having to buy the additional hub. If you can grab one at a discount, its definitely worth a try.

reviews.reviewTitle: "Try" suggestions at bottom of screen still too small
reviews.reviewText: Love the product except for this: The "Try" suggestions at the bottom of the screen, in italics, are the same size they were on the first generation product with a much smaller screen. I purchased the second generation version, mostly because the screen is larger (the main reason ANYONE purchases the upgrade). One would naturally assume that the text for the "Try" suggestions at the bottom would be a little larger also. We have this Show not more than 7 feet from our couches in our family room, on our entertainment console, under our flatscreen. It's ridiculous too think that we cannot read the "Try" suggestions because they are so small. BTW, my (and my wife's) vision is 20-20. At the very least, Amazon, allow us too change the font size for the "Try" suggestions. This is an EASY FIX. Come on, Amazon, THINK!

This Echo Show has terrific sound and picture quality. The speaker is great! With the clarity of the picture one may easily watch videos. We are also looking forward to using this to "drop in on" family who we do not get to see as often as we would like. The first Echo Show that arrived with my order was defective and had absolutely NO sound. Tech support was very helpful and tried everything to help fix my device. When it was determined that it would not work, they ordered a replacement which arrived within a few days and it was just perfect. The technician even called me at a prearranged time to make sure that my Echo Show replacement was working properly. That is how a company keeps customers happy and coming back.

reviews.reviewTitle: Lack of setup help is a hinderance
reviews.reviewText:
Free light bulb, doesn't work. Oh well, it was free after all. Logitech Hub & Harmony Elite remove have worked perfectly since we set them up 2 years ago. The instructions on the Alexa app say to down load the Harmony app, sync it to the hub, then add to Alexa app. That's it. I download the Harmony app, it works with all the devices we have attached perfectly, I sync it to the Alexa app, no errors, Alexa doesn't recognize any of the Activities that are in the Harmony App, not a single one. I don't know where to begin to trouble shoot this mess and I can't find anyone to call to help.
So far the only things connected to Alexa are 1 plug and 1 light bulb.
Also, if I had know I'd have to download an app for everything and connect the apps I would have re-thought the whole thing. What happens if I leave the house with my phone and mu husband wants to turn a light off? Is Alexa taking his command, using my phone data plan to send it to the Alexa app on my phone, have Alexa on my phone connect to the app that actually controls the light and sending the proper response back to Alexa in my house to turn off the light?? do I have to load all the apps I loaded on my phone on his phone too??
And again, where do I go to get answers to my questions? The help is helpless, the search engine doesn't understand complicated questions and there's no on to call.

My son had one and then I decided I wanted one too. You do have to be clear in your speech to Alexa, I have it in my bedroom and what I really really like most about this product is all of the music, the sleep sounds that I use every single night and tell Alexa to turn off in one hour, I like it when I wake up in the middle of the night and ask Alexa what time it is I don't have to fumble around with a clock turning it on to figure out what time it is, I like that the display turns off for a darkness when you go to sleep, I just really really like this product, I have a "dot" downstairs in my work area where I will ask questions ALMOST FORGOT I love how you can tell it to turn on and off lights, this helps me a lot. I am elderly and this product in my opinion makes my life easier and safer.

What a great thing for visually impaired users! I can ask "Alexa, what am I holding?" and in a few seconds Alexa will give me an answer. Some answers are better than others but almost always the answer helps me figure out what can/box/package/bottle I am holding. This is fantastic in the kitchen. A year ago no amount of money would buy this functionality. Now it comes with a main stream product at no extra charge. It also has a VoiceView screen reader to make stepping through recipes easy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Beautiful display and sound with this second gen model.
reviews.reviewText: I own 2 first generation Echo Show devices and wanted to rely the newer second generation models initially because of the bigger screen size, but what is amazing besides having a larger screen, is the HUGE improvement in sound over the first generation model. It is such a amazing device I bought a second one. I use the first gen models in several bedrooms and the second gen models in my livingroom and family room. I have used it for music, watching Amazon Prime videos and now with the new 'Alexa Guard' update, it is now part of my home security system. Awesome product that is well worth the money! The large screen on the show allows you to monitor your 'Ring Cameras' with simply commands should you get motion notifications while at home.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not worth the money if ur purchasing it for video calls
reviews.reviewText: I’m very disappointed with this product since I first purchased the show gen1 this summer .. my bf n I purchased each one so we cud video chat ... my first one after the abt 3 weeks the speakers started to make popping sound... returned it and they sent me a 2nd gen... after a few weeks of that one the screen started to flicker ... returned that one too.. in the meantime my bf’s started doing the same thing ... for the price I wud expected better now I have kept 1 gen 1 and 1 gen 2 and I live with the intermitant flickering.. and also because i live in Canada some of the feature like the web are not available (big hype they use to sell them) so I created a US account and had them change it at amazon... that seems to work

I think the Echo Show was inaccurately described on Amazon's page. It does everything that the page says. What the page doesn't say is that the ES doesn't run a web browser (Chrome, Edge, etc.). You can't run common programs like Thunderbird or Gmail email programs. It doesn't stream from Netflix.
What this really reminds me of is a smartphone in a larger box plus wireless bluetooth speakers. If you want to control everything in your house with Zigbee devices do Skype-like video phone calls it will do that. It has many links to content providers, many of which will charge you extra for their service.
If this is what you want, the ES will probably satisfy you. If you want more as mentioned above, you need a laptop or all-in-one computer, which, granted, is quite a bit more expensive.
Not recommended except for its specific functions.

Where do I begin

Pros:
- My thermostat, door bell, light bulbs and outlets are compatible with the Amazon show
- Good size screen
- Great for recipes
- News articles are an okay bonus

Cons
- You can't search the internet
- video quality for video chats are not good
- you can only watch tv on PRIME and all the good shows COST ADDITIONAL MONEY - this is the big reason I am only giving this a 2 star review and consider that lucky
-Netflix and Hulu are NOT compatible
- You cannot search the internet
- you can play music from Pandora but you CANNOT click on the channel you want

Summary,
Spend a bit more and Buy an old IPad or anything similar. you'll have access to a LOT more things!

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa Escho Show, I am super happy with this product.
reviews.reviewText: I recently traded my Alexa Echo (first version) and purchased an new Alexa Echo Show. I am very happy with this upgrade. Not only the hardware is very well done, but the software is very intelligent. I noticed that while first installation the system was smart enough to find all information provided during previous installations of Echo devices that the system was able complete the installation of the Echo Show without requiring any additional info from me. The system auto completed the Wi-Fi connection and to other components, including the Ring Door Camera and integrated all functions needed to complete installation, in less than 5 minutes. The Music sounds great and the picture quality is outstanding. Alexa seems smarted than before.

reviews.reviewTitle: Overall summary, everything is a little better and more interesting with video.
reviews.reviewText:
If I could it would probably get a 4-½. Bought it primarily for displaying Ring video, because the Ring app, takes more time than it should to load and display. The eShow Ring skill takes somewhere between 7 to 8 seconds from when the Ring Doorbell is pressed. But everyday I seem to find something new. Works just like an eDot, but more interesting with video.. Love the recipe photos, step by step instructions voice controlled, also downloaded 2 recipe Skills one being the Food Network & All Recipes, so quite extensive. Spelling, now you also see the word. Shows any calculation, if you don’t get all the numbers after the decimal point. Weather shows current statistics, followed by forecast. News in some cases you see the person reading the news. Music playing shows the lyrics. Trending topics — some are interesting. Down graded ratings because speakers face backward. Bass level better than an eDot, but not that much better, because of the direction. Works well with Hulu. Overall summary, everything is a little better and more interesting with video.
Oops I should have worded that differently. The Echo Show doesn’t automatically show Ring video when the doorbell is pressed. You must say, Alexa who’s at the front door — then it takes 7 to 8 seconds. I guess brevity doesn’t always work for me.

This product is one of the most awesome devices that one can own. The Echo Show has so many features that make them fun to use. Everyone should have many Echo devices in their home. They have so many skills and are extremely easy to use. We have had many Echo products since they were introduced in 2015 and use them everyday. Whether it be for Notifications, Important dates to remember, Communicating with friends and family members, News, Weather, Sports or just listening to your favorite music, nothing beats the Echo products. You can also use them to control all types of smart devices throughout your home. I would strongly recommend everyone to consider purchasing many Echo Products as soon as they can.

Don't buy it! Returned the first one because of issues with uploading contacts. Same thing with the second one. My daughter and a friend of her's has the same problem. We're all pretty tech savvy, It can't be all of us! On the plus side we now have a $225 radio in our kitchen ☹️

reviews.reviewTitle: I am just starting to get to know all the things my Echo Show (and Alexa) can do
reviews.reviewText: I bought the 2-unit set so I could send the second unit to my son and daughter-in-law so they and their children could video chat with me. My unit was easy to set up, using the Alexa app on my smartphone. We haven't been able to video chat yet (because the other party is unavailable) but the system is ready and Alexa always asks if I want to send a message and when I have recorded the message asks if I want to send it. The messages have gone through flawlessly. I use my unit at this point mainly for playing music and the sound is great. I also use Alexa for making shopping lists and my Show (and Alexa) pick up all my additions (even when I sort of mumble). The unit looks very well made. This was a great purchase.

I purchased this for the bigger screen and better sound. The screen is great but the sound is what is really outstanding, as I use it primarily for music. Crisp, good clarity and a decent amount of bass. I have a few bluetooth speakers from Bose to Klipsch and I actually prefer this Echo Show to any of them.

I've had an Echo Spot for a long while but wanted a larger screen. While the spot is PERFECT for a desk, or a nightstand, the Echo Show is great for entertainment (however my Echo Show is right next to my bed ass well...lol). I LOVE this. Bright screen, lots of color, and easy to use. You can completely turn off the screen by voice if it's next to your bed, or set it to dim really really low. On the lowest auto brightness setting this gets dark enough for me to sleep without disturbing me.

The sound is the best of any device I have so far. It also comes with Silk and Firefox for browsing, enabling you to do just about everything from it!

Paired great with my bluetooth mouse & keyboard. Convenient for twitter, FB, and other sites. Also paired quickly to my phone, earbuds and external speakers.
Not at all what I expected. Not as user Friendly as I thought. So disappointed. 😟😟😟

We had a digital photo frame that died. I thought that the Echo Show would be a good replacement as we would also have Alexa skills available. Little did I know how hard it would be use this as a photo frame. I set a Prime Photos album as the background, but it doesn't rotate as an actual slideshow. I can ask Alexa to show an album, but it only displays all albums and I have to select the album I want. Then if we use Alexa, I have to go back to the photo album manually again. Using one of these to default to a digital photo frame seems like an obvious feature of something like this, but it fails completely at that. What use is an always on screen sitting in my house without being able to easily display photos?

reviews.reviewTitle: Good product, but the technology is not quite there yet
reviews.reviewText: The Echo show works like any other Alexa product except it has a small monitor screen that can display information. The display is nice in many applications. HOWEVER, the technology is not quite there yet. Specifically; I have a Ring Doorbell with video. I can ask Alexa to show me the front door bell and it will show the view from the doorbell camera, and it will. I can also (using alexa routines) when the doorbell detects movement, it announces "there is movement at the front door" and it does. What I wanted to have happen is Alexa would announce that there is movement at the front door AND then show me the view of the front doorbell camera, which it can't do. The system is getting close, but there is a ways to go.

reviews.reviewTitle: Is an improvement over the original "Show"
reviews.reviewText: It has excellent sound. Set-up takes a few minutes for it to download, configure, install etc. It found all my "Ring" devices and Honeywell thermostat. I have 4 WIFI channels and it chose the strongest one and connected without input from me. It also recognized all of my "Echo" devices. The alarm feature is set really low. You can adjust the volume in the "Equalizer" section under "Sounds". The video screen seems more vibrant than the original "Show". The screen dimming feature seems more intuitive than the original "Show". It has learned my speech pattern and it very rarely doesn't understand what I say even if I am talking in a very low voice and not directly in front of the "Show".

Love it! Really easy setup. I have one in my kitchen and the other in the dressing room for my handicapped daughter. I like the ease of being able to ask questions or get music if I am assisting my daughter.
Installed a light with smart plug in my daughter’s bedroom. Pretty easy.
Plan to install camera to monitor my daughter at night. I ordered a Moon City Brand and send it back. Do not recommend that particular brand. No support. Just bought a D-Link-DCS Pan and Tilt. Hoping for better results.
There are some questions that Alexa can’t answer so you have to make sure you are wording your requests carefully. But you get the hang of it. I am still experimenting and figuring it out. Lots of fun.
I don’t think I would like one without a screen. So glad I spend the extra money to get the Show.

I'm overly disappointed in general from the Echo Show 2, we bought it since we were very happy with the original Echo, and the promise for a Skype integration (which we use a lot), pushed us over the edge.

I'll start with the one thing I think it's outstanding, sound quality. The original Echo had excellent sound quality, but the Echo Show 2 surpasses that easily.

Now for the bad:
Skype Integration:
1. I wish I would be able to see my Skype contact on the screen, Alexa has a hard time understanding names that are not common - I need to confirm the chosen contact every time I ask her to initiate a call.
2. My video feed keeps getting stuck, and I need to stop/start the camera in order to release it.
3. Call will disconnect, and Alexa will claim there's no internet connection, while it's connected to my home network, and all the others devices connected to the home network are operating without an issue. I have to stop/start the WiFi to get things working again.
4. When you're on a Skype call, or calling someone, or someone calling you - Alexa is essentially absent, she will not respond to any commands.
Spotify Integration is clunky at best. The device will only show up in the main Amazon account holder Spotify.
It will lose synchronization with the device that "cast" the music over, and will sometimes disappear altogether from the list of available devices (old Echos in my home don't have that issue). Only a full restart will fix the problem - why the hell isn't there an on/off button on this thing ???
Video streaming - no NETFLIX integration, really???? I can leave without YouTube, but I think most people have Netflix and not HULU, this doesn't seem to much of a big deal to fix... but it's been almost a year since this was launched, so I'm not keeping my hopes up.
Prime Video - works only for the main Amazon account holder - why can't other accounts connected to my account, and also authorized to use Alexa can't watch Prime Video? Also, the UI is horrible, really hard to get to where you want, and if I try to use Alexa to do this: "Alexa, Play Bosch" it plays the first episode of the first season, while I'm actually watching the fourth season now.
