Smart home - same issue with the accounts. Smart home devices only show up on my account, what's the point of having a household in Amazon, if nothing works for the other members.

This is more a vent than a review, but it's a lot of small things that make a device that has great potential to something really mediocre.

Very nice, this is my third one, love them, grandson approved also for his bedroom, he can play his own music and watch different programs on it, great sound too, family loves them, great for security also just ask Alexa show me the front door, and there it is. You can even check on your house when gone, on your phone, ask her to show you your echo and you can talk or look to see what is going on in house...Cool!

The Echo is handy to have around. Allows you to multitask by being able to look things up, listen to and change music, get the weather, etc., while you're busy doing something else. She is able to hear quite well from a reasonable distance, even when playing music and is hooked up to our Ring doorbell, letting us (and the kids) check who is at the door - with audio and video - without getting up. You must be aware that when asking Alexa questions, you have to phrase it just right or she may not understand, although I am impressed with the amount of commands/questions she can respond to. One thing I have not figured out is how to eliminate her bias for the Seattle Seahawks, which is her answer to, "What is the greatest Football Team of all time?".

Update 08/22/2019 - I would like to subtract another star if I could. This thing is laggy and slow. I have three Alexa devices near by, both of the other devices would execute my command before this one even registers the command even though I'm standing right next to it.

I wanted to use this mainly as a clock, but I'm near sighted and can't see the tiny clock. There are no options to make the clock full screen. I am aware that I can "zoom in" on the clock to make it bigger, but that's just ridiculous.

reviews.reviewTitle: Interesting hardware that doesn't really have a point
reviews.reviewText: I have mutliple dots, and echos in the house. I replaced the Echo in my kitchen with the Show. The Echo has an omnidirectional speaker and can be clearly heard from anywhere in the large room. The Show is a directional speaker and feels much more muddy and quiet. Muddy appears to be due to an over engineered sub woofer piping (trying to increase resonance in a small space) which causes a muddy less accurate sound. The screen is fine the touch is fine. However the vast majority of uses I am used to via voice with Dots and Echo seem silly when you have a screen. Perhaps I just don't know how to use the show appropriately. Also the intergration with my nest cameras and door bell are very minimal.

I've had this for a few months now and I'm really satisfied with the performance. It took a while to figure out what Alexa understands, but eventually, we started to understand each other. I've got Ring cameras, and home security that communicate flawlessly. To be able to say "Alexa, show me the garage" (or front door) are nice features. Other smart home items I have integrated include a Honeywell thermostat, TP-Link light switches, and Meross outlet switches. All of them are working flawlessly. I occasionally "drop in" on my daughter and it's really nice to be able to have a video call with her. The video and audio are clear and easy to view and communicate. I also highly recommend the Echo Show (2nd generation) Adjustable Stand. It gets your Echo Show off of the table a little and allows for adjustment.

I ordered the Echo Show so that I could have face time with my grandkids, who already had an Echo Show. So far, the only thing I am upset about is that this went on sale right after I purchased mine at full price, wish I could get the sale price and the light bulb.

While I am no stranger to a computer, I will admit new technology isn't always easy for me to do by myself and when I had to go and select the newest Amazon Alexa app - well that's where I got stumped, have you seen all those apps. I simply asked my son, he sent me the link and wa-la all done.

I'm still learning all there is to use with this Echo and my husband and I are looking forward to enjoying talking face time to our kids and grandkids.

reviews.reviewTitle: Hearing and response to voice is worse than 1st gen, what happened Amazon???
reviews.reviewText: Very unhappy. I currently own (3) 1st gen echo shows, (2) echo show spots and several other Alexa - responsive devices. This 2nd gen show has the worst field of sound in terms of hearing my family’s commands. We almost have to yell to get this device to appropriately respond. This device replaced a 1st gen show, same location in our kitchen. It’s 10x worse in terms of response. About to unplug and return and go back to first gen.

reviews.reviewTitle: Video screen times out! Other issues.
reviews.reviewText:
Perhaps you would like to watch videos on this device. Amazon Prime, YouTube, Hulu?
After a few minutes the screen times out and returns to the home screen.
The device cannot resume where you left off. You must go through the entire video location procedure and start over.
Quite disappointing. No way to change time out.
Also times out for Amazon Prime Music screen and returns to home screen. If you touch the screen, it will return to the music screen, but will time out again.
As others have pointed out, the home screen always has "Alexa try..." or "Alexa show me the best selling...( fill in random Amazon product here). No way to shut this off.
Over all it is merely ok. Lots and lots of room for improvement.
Mostly underdeveloped technological possibilities and therefore
annoying.

I like Echos. I have a few of them around the house. This is a device that I thought would be a home run, but ultimately is pointless. The obvious use case is watching short clips on Youtube, but Amazon and Google are in some kind of spat so you can't. There's also no Netflix app.

The reason I got the Show, though, was to use as a baby monitor. I tried out a Wyze internet camera, and I liked it so much through my cell phone that I thought the Show would be even better. However, it seems that Amazon has blocked the Show from displaying a video stream more than 10 minutes long.

Sound quality is quite good, but considering the video is pointless, you'd be smarter just to get an Echo Plus.

The Echo Show can hear me but produces no sound when it responds. I have to restart the device several times to get it to work. It seems to lose sound on its own every few weeks. It's irritating.
I also wish I could do two tasks things at the same time. For instance listen to music while browsing a recipe.
Also, I want to be able to browse the regular internet on the Echo show. Finally, the slideshow function does not work well. It shows the same picture repeatedly and moves very slowly. I need it to be faster and more configurable. Overall, the Echo Show is okay, but nothing I would recommend at this time.

The biggest disappointment is Echo Show has issues with Smart Connect which allows the router to select the best WiFi band which has the same SSID, it keeps disconnecting and the only way to reconnect is to turn off / on Echo Show. There is no option to select the band. I have 19 devices on my network some connect at 2.4 GHz and some connect at 5 GHz and none have any issues, only Echo Show does. That's why 2 stars for Alexa integration - after all if you can't connect to the internet you can't integrate with anything.
The speakers have too much base to a point that vibrate the device, far from premium sound. The stand is an extra $30.00, it's plastic but it's needed.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect Smart Device for your home!
reviews.reviewText: Love this! I couldn't be happier! I purchased to replace our first edition. Easy to set up took less than 10minutes since there was a update. Literally was ready everything was there from the older one an this came with new features i love the multiroom music streaming with all your echo speaker devices. Haven't set up my voice recognition yet having fun with all the skills. I love that it works with everything, our security cameras through arlo skill, watch tv, movies everything. The sounds is awesome, clear loud bass everything. I purchased during prime day so I got this, 3rd gen dot an Philips smart bulb for $159 you can't go wrong with that. Video calling family is the best.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cannot connect to VOIP phone calls.
reviews.reviewText: We got this to connect to our children's Echo Show so we could talk and see them and the granddaughter at the same time. Integrating a VOIP connection like Ooma, Skype, or What'sApp is practically impossible. I have been on the forums to see how to do this and immediately saw that others have the exact same problem. Asking Alexa how to do it is a joke. Alexa doesn't know 'jack' about how she works or can be configured. Going to the Alexa app is a total waste of time, there is no information there about the best way to integrate your Skype contacts into a Skype connection. I can't even really tell which phonebook Alexa is using (I have three contact lists) or how to switch from one to the other. One even wonders why on earth there is a screen on this device. It seems useless unless you need another clock or want to watch liberal-bent fake news stories continually scrolling past. Maybe if I were to use it to watch Amazon Prime it would be OK but I have an entertainment system in my family room and don't need another small tablet screen for anything. It really is just a bigger, more expensive version of Alexa with a screen. Nice speaker, I listen to IHeartRadio on it, but that's about it. Oddly, I would like to listen to Amazon Prime Music on it (I am a member) but it can't seem to make the connection. Very curious indeed. The purpose of this device was to make video calls and it can't do that, even though it is marketed to be able to do that.

Simply do not understand how there are so many amazing reviews. Truly at a loss as literally nothing works with our device. Not the commands, not the lights, not Arlo baby, drop in to other devices. It's basically and overpriced speaker now. If we lived in the US would have returned this. Simply the biggest waste of money ever.

This version has a Bigger screen and for me that's really a plus because since I hit that 40 year old age limit my eyesight has just not been the same. The new Speaker system sounds great at any volume especially when its being played loud, and I like it loud. This unit also has a lot of new tweeks and hidden features that the older smaller version did not have.

Just bought the new 2nd Gen Echo Show. I bought the bundle that included Hue light bulbs as it’s advertised as being able to directly control the bulbs without need for the Hue Bridge/Hub. But to do this you must enable the Hue skill by linking accounts. So you go to setup a Hue account but that requires the Hue Bridge. So you just try to link using the Alexa app....and are told it can’t find the Hue Bridge. So a big fat waste of $50 for bulbs you can’t use as promised. Rest of Show works as advertised but this is really misleading.

reviews.reviewTitle: Needs more integrations, cant pair it to another bluetooth device (i.e. speakers)
reviews.reviewText: Great screen, awesome sound, easy to set up, nice touch screen, etc... great over all, but needs to be able to do more than just amazon video. Just about any device you get now a days, even the other amazon devices can do netflix, why not this? Also, you cant pair other speakers to this, you can just pair your phone or another echo to it. I have external speakers with a bluetooth amp that run my outside speakers, I cant pair it to another set of speakers. The bluetooth is only one way, to this... fix these few things, and it is great!

reviews.reviewTitle: My elatation turned to deflation with the Echo Show (2nd Generation)!
reviews.reviewText:
Could hardly wait to get my Echo Show (2nd generation)! I was like a little kid on Christmas! It's been a week, and I'm a little disappointed so far! Most of the complaints I read on here, I do not have with mine. My complaint is that when I tell her to play music such as "Smooth Jazz", she'll play it for a little while maybe 30 minutes then shuts off! Even when I tell her to play music for eight hours= she doesn't! Also, I thought she would be like Seri where you could ask her anything and she would answer, but 4 out of 5 questions I ask her, she answers with "I don't know that"! Yes, her sound and picture is awesome, but that's about it! I can't find any information as to where to read instructions or how to's on this!
I thought about returning it for a Google one, but I see they use Alexa too!

reviews.reviewTitle: Calls Constantly Dropped; poor camera angle
reviews.reviewText: The main reason I bought this device was to communicate Face to face with my elderly mother. Unfortunately, the calls were constantly dropped (up to 10 times in a row), and the camera quality is poor. I upgraded my mom to FIOS, and we have high speed internet, so I know the dropped calls were not due to wifi quality. Also, the camera points upward, so if the device is on a table or counter, and someone is sitting on the opposite side of the room, all you can see is the top of their head and the ceiling, instead of seeing a panorama of the room. I purchased the Facebook portal, and the camera and speakers are of much better quality. The Echo Shows are being returned.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's great as long as it's working properly
reviews.reviewText: I've been using this echo for a few weeks now, and I love the screen and sound. However, it's buggy. It would start making scratchy noises for no reason, and all of a sudden it doesn't play any sound. I have to unplug, wait a few minutes, and then plug it back in to get it working again. It happens from time to time, and it IS annoying. Also, I often have a problem controlling music using the touchscreen.

Only reason I give it a 3 is because of Amazon's stupid feud with Google that prevents it from having more Google integration like a YouTube app, calendar, etc. And there's no Netflix integration which sucks.

Sound quality is excellent, Alexa works as advertised and it works great as a zigbee hub.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect for keeping in touch or security
reviews.reviewText: Bought this for my wife and a second one for her sister so they could video chat. The echo show has so much more to offer than that. When in the kitchen cooking she can pull up music, a favorite show from Hulu and other providers as well as recipes or videos for cooking tips. The sound quality is awesome, it pretty much booms in our kitchen. My favorite quality is the integration it has with all my security devices. I can set up alerts with my brinks doorbell camera, my blink xt outdoor camera or my inside wyze cam. If someone is at the door all I have to say is Alexa show me the front door and Bam camera is on live view. The echo show is wortg the cost and pays itself off with all the conveniences it offers.

You have to mostly figure it all out on your own. The is no user manual that comes with it and none that you can download for free. It sounds nice and looks good and can do some neat things. You can turn your light on and off, but the scenes don't work very well. To dim or brighten you may have to tell it a percent amount, and just forget about any color scenes for your lights, it doesn't know that. But it can do math and act as an egg timer. I'm sure it does other stuff too, but like I said there is no manual for the thing.

reviews.reviewTitle: Need to have YouTube and few others things
reviews.reviewText: Cons no youtube on Alexa control no google as you have to find other ways around it. A bit annoyed that I can’t tell Alexa to pull up a YouTube video. Seems Alexa answered question when I first plugged in now seems she doesn’t know anything. Have asked her things I asked Her the first day and now says she doesn’t know. I think amazon screwed themself when they blocked google from using their things now we suffer more. I would have recommended but now I don’t, to many cons this was just a few cons I’ve listed and not enough pros. The pros good video chat, good to pull recipes up will keep it on a good amount of time. Like how you can put her to sleep so tv doesn’t command her. Like the few workouts they have, wish they would add more apps though. The Smart device hookup is good and does have a lot to offer. The first day I had it was allowed to YouTube which was great then googled stop them and now super annoying how I have to open up browser and type no voice control to watch YouTube instead of asking Alexa to pull up

Love this addition to my tech abilities in my home. I do wish it had the ability to access other apps like Netflix and such. Additionally, it's a bit off when I attempt to pull up programs from Amazon Video. Doesn't get it right most the time when I use voice. I usually have to find my program by using the touch screen. Which the latter makes it more like I could set my tablet up and use it more conveniently. But as time has gone by I'm getting better at speaking the language the Echo Show understands in order to voice my selections better but it still is frustrating more often than not. The speaker/mic quality of this device is very good in my opinion. Another feature that I find pretty good is the screen brightness ability where it senses the environment and adjusts accordingly. Pretty nice feature and it works well.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa can you hear me? Well, I can't hear you!!!
reviews.reviewText: I am upset because I bought this on Amazon Prime Day and it has absolutely no sound. If I have to troubleshoot on the first day, that's a problem. I looked at YouTube and read other reviews from people who had this same problem and I can't get it to work! Very disappointed but will be sending this product back!

I bought this so that I could “facetime” with my home while away from the house. It worked fine until Aug. 17 and then decided to be offline when ever I try to use it. The window to return closed on the 16th. Very disappointing. Not it won’t keep timer or do anything. Waste of money. I tried to speak to Amazon about it and was told it was outside of the return window. They told me to de-register it and it would be fine. Not working still
The sound did not work right out of the box. All other features work but there is no sound. Spent over an hour with support, talked to 4 people and still could not get it resolved.

The only noticeable Improvement what's the largest screen. I've noticed no improvement in voice recognition compared to the Echo gen 1, Echo spot and Echo Show. The different LED lights that indicate whether you have an alert , message, delivery or any of the other statuses have been removed. There is no visual indication that triggers you to check the device if you're not next to it anymore. If you happen to be next to the device and the notification appears it disappears within four seconds so you barely have any time to read it. When a reminder appears on the screen it's always shows the current time at that moment that you are looking at the screen. it's very confusing if you look at the screen after the time that a reminder first appears because the screen always shows the current time next to the reminder instead of the time reminder was due. You can't tell how many minutes have passed just a reminder became due. I definitely prefer the Generation 1. This product seems rushed and it's lacking many of the features of his predecessor and no real Improvement besides a larger screen

The Echo Show (2nd generation) is extremely useful and full of features. Besides all the things the other Echo devices are capable of doing the Show can process a verbal command and display on its large screen the video my Ring Floodlight Camera (and Ring Doorbell camera) is capturing. Pretty cool. My wife loves the visual displays of recipes and timers. I am somewhat ambivalent about the incessant news and information prompts...some like them and some do not. The sound is much better than the Echo but I have a whole house audio system so I don't listen to the Show for music very often. Podcasts work great. I am still learning about all the tasks the Show is capable of performing but so far it has been a huge plus.

reviews.reviewTitle: Entertaining and Useful Addition to the Family
reviews.reviewText: I'll have to admit that I got my Echo because I was feeling left behind by the future (yes, this can happen to techies as they age). I wanted to have the opportunity to play with the nexus of AI, home automation, home security, entertainment, communication, and voice-based information retrieval. I'm surprised by how easy it is with Alexa and the Echo Show. I believe that the visual experience is critical to appreciating the full range of capabilities (e.g., videos, amazon prime, amazon music lyrics, data presentation). I can't compare the Echo Show with other devices from other manufactures but I can tell you that I am so-far happy with this one. The sound is very good for the size of the device, but I could use a little more base.

I love this product in theory. I bought one for me and one for my mom so we can stay connected. When I first booted up the Alexa everything seemed great. The sound worked the picture was clear and it could stream videos from Amazon video and Hulu without any problems. Then when I relocated the echo show to the kitchen I got errors. First the sound just stopped working, the echo looked like it heard me and even did what I asked it but not a single sound came out. I was able to fix this problem by unplugging and plugging back in the power cord 6 times. That brought back the sound. Then the videos stopped playing on Amazon video and hulu. It would work sometimes without any issues and full network connectivity. But other times the video will play then just stop and close out. So far no fix to that. I would like to love this product but it isn't showing it's worth.

Haven’t explored everything about the Show yet but loving it already. The sound quality is just amazing compared to our old 1st gen echo. I’m loving the feature that allows “dropping in” on other rooms of the house by using multiple echo devices. We will be getting a dot or spot for every room to create a cool whole house intercom system(though that’s less a review of the Show as it is of Echo devices in general.) Our Show is on the kitchen island so it will be handy for recipes as well!

reviews.reviewTitle: Big Problem with Sound not working - Dont buy until they fix this!
reviews.reviewText: The initial setup went well. I moved it to a different location and the sound stopped working. After fiddling around with it and googling known problems for an hour, I found out this is a known problem and Amazon sent it anyway without fixing it or at least letting me know so I wouldn't waste my time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa finally works, don’t put it on an extended network
reviews.reviewText:
This is the 2nd one I purchased of the 2nd generation echo show. I purchased this one because the first one I bought stopped responding after 5 hrs. This one did the same thing. So, then I wanted to try and resolve the issue. The support team didn’t have any answers since I had called them the first time. So, I looked online for help. One person said to turn on the Do Not Disturb under settings and this didn’t work. Another person said to check the network. So, the echo show was on an extended network (we have a repeater to get a better signal). I took it off the extended network and put it on the main network and it works fine. So, I still had the first one and did the same for that one and now it works fine. Three days in and they are both responding every time. Awesome!

Also, I had purchased a google home hub and it doesn’t work well with an iPhone. It’s more difficult to set up and sync then Alexa. I do like the fact that the google home hun read recipes step by step and pauses until you’re ready to continue. But, ALEXA my favorite.

I don't want to write much review for this product. Because last time, I wrote a review for other product, Amazon didn't post it and they refused to publish it after a few days. My honest review had never got a chance to be posted. Thus, why bother to write a lengthy review.

Compared to the first one, this one has more bass sound and the screen is viewable. 7 inch screen size is considered small now. The microphone picks up fast. I have no problem calling Alexa. The large screen makes it more pleasure to see the lyrics when playing song from Amazon music.

The YouTube app is working with Amazon again. Great.

Amazon really got it right with this second gen Echo Show. It does so many useful things for me. I use it to ask questions, activate Alexa compatible devices, play Spotify, etc. However, it also makes a great speaker phone since you can link a mobile phone number and have it make calls. Very useful since I work from home sometimes. It also has a browser (2 actually), so you can get to things like YouTube with a couple steps. It gets plenty loud if you want it to. Alexa is getting better at answering questions asked with natural language, but there are still times when I feel like I have to memorize a specific way to ask for certain functions. Bottom line, though, is that Alexa with a screen is a nice plus. I traded in a regular Echo to upgrade to this and I use it a lot more.

I am really enjoying slowly adding smart devices to my home. I love the versatility of this device. I purchased 2, and sent one to one of our children who is grown and moved out. It definitely makes for better communication with them. The only 2 design flaws I have are: first, it doesn’t have an internal battery. So if I want to move it from the living room to the kitchen, to follow a recipe, I have to unplug and set the whole device up there. 2nd, it dosent come with an integrated stand that you can control the tilt or swivel with. I had to order a separate stand, I. Order to adjust the angle so the camera could see everyone in the living room. Other than that, I love it

We have a Echo Show 1st generation in our AZ home and we ordered a Echo Show 2nd generation for our Chicago area home with high expectations as we have been very pleased with our AZ Echo Show product. The Amazon tech was very helpful but after a gallant long effort told me to return the defective unit. This is our first Amazon disappointment after countless weekly various product deliveries but we will not reorder the Echo Show product. Not too bad - Nobody bats a 1000...

reviews.reviewTitle: Still not working! Bought on Prime Day.
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this an upgrade for my first generation. And like a darn fool, I traded in my first gen. That was one of the WORST mistakes I have ever made. This 2nd gen Show does not have any sound! It hasn’t since a few minutes after I plugged it in. Customer support was no help. They finally agreed to send me another one, and that didn’t work! There is apparently a glitch in the software, and I have to patiently wait for an update. I am really disappointed and disgusted with Amazon. I really regret this upgrade. If you have the first gen Echo Show, keep it, this second gen is an expensive disappointment.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very nice sound and the addition of a screen is a plus
reviews.reviewText: Wow, what an improvement in sound quality! The addition of a screen has brought so many more features. I love the way it works with audio/video door bells. It is a great safety feature to be able to see or talk to the person before opening the door to them. I am a blind person, and the security it gives me to be able to speak with somebody at my door is immeasurable. I also like that I can turn on speech output and navigate through all the screens with no problem. The only reason I gave voice recognition a 4 rating is that there are times my Echo Show doesn't appear to hear me. It isn't bad enough that I wouldn't purchase again, but there is room for improvement.

the show is not for prime time yet problems watching Amazon video with my prime account didn't work right, camera fails terrible too just black and white with lines only, then received the replacement, Bluetooth failed speakers stop working, call customer support hard to understand Indians over the phone, Amazon don't want to replaced the second unit they told me point black get your refund and buy somewhere else OK is a lot of products in the market better than this piece of junk i got my research and lenovo google assistant is a lot better and cheaper, selling all the echo crap i purchased over the years and go with google home thank you amazon for open my eyes

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Video Option for a Senior Who is Not Tech Savvy
reviews.reviewText:
Purchased Echo Show for Mom, in her late 80's, virtually deaf & not tech savvy, specifically to pair with Ring doorbell and solar cams to view the perimeter of her property from inside her home. While not electronics savvy, she has quickly learned how to use the simple commands, "Alexa, show me..." She would not be able to operate a computer or mobile device for other types of security systems, so Echo Show turned out to be a fantastic option without breaking the bank.

The video image is decent for our purposes, and of course relies on the signal strength of your wifi (Spectrum in this case). Have not tried with Prime video, nor any other feature available. The suggestions at the bottom of the screen are confusing to Mom, but she's learned to ignore them.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love the screen size, but not so much the voice recognition or question capabilities so far...
reviews.reviewText: Love the larger screen compared to the 1st generation, but voice recognition is horrible. I find my self yelling at the device at times in frustration, while none of my other multiple devices have these issues. Also when alexa does pick up there is a delay (same with the 3rd gen dot) the blue light is delayed to pick up compared to earlier generations. Speakers are good, wish there were some in the front as well as the back for more of surround sound. Also when asking simple questions i would think the device could look up online for me, it either had no answer or would come back with something completely off topic! Disappointing i had to use my "ok google" feature on my phone while cooking one night bc my hands were dirty and i needed some information, or asking what kind of birds have black and yellow feathers (my 2 year old saw one in the yard) and it kept responding to me with what the yellow notification light meant... so frustrating that you cant ask random questions...

reviews.reviewTitle: Extremely buggy; no channel for reporting bugs/feedback
reviews.reviewText:
I have 5 echo dots and this is my 2nd echo show (the first being the 1st gen). This new one is extremely buggy! If I ask for sports update, I'm lucky for one of the team's logo to actually show up. There are numerous others, which I would express directly to Amazon, which leads me to my next major concern: There is zero option to provide feedback on what works and what doesn't. Unlike other products, there is seriously no effort on behalf of Amazon to report bugs in order to improve their product. It seems as all the focus is on selling as many as possible, with no focus on actually improving the product or taking feedback from customers/bug reports.
This is the last 'Echo/Alexa' device I will ever purchase.

My son and his family have had an Echo Dot for over a year. I wasn't too impressed with it and never bothered doing research into buying one. But my brother gifted an Echo Show to me for Christmas and I love it. I think the visual makes me interact with the system more often than I would normally. I like the news feed of the articles/videos that oftentimes are not found on the usual media sites that I visit and at my age, having reminders come-up a few days in advance is handy too. I was so impressed that I purchased one with a stand and gifted it to my son and his family one month after Christmas. They were delighted to receive this "non-holiday" gift. :)

reviews.reviewTitle: Surprised by how much we like this
reviews.reviewText: We replaced our old Echo with this Show. We have been surprised by how much we like it. We received it as a package deal at Christmas when there was a good offer on a new Samsung Galaxy phone. We have been surprised how much functionality it adds to the Echo experience. It is great to see your shopping list on the screen, it is helpful to see your audio books, nice to see the lyrics for music that is playing. Also, it works as a photo frame showing us the family pictures we uploaded. All in all, we are thrilled with it. I would recommend it to everyone who already has the Echo (and I guess anyone who doesn't! at well.) It's a nice upgrade! It can do so many things.

reviews.reviewTitle: A lot of potential but not there yet...
reviews.reviewText:
I purchased the Echo Show to replace an aging PC that we used as our family organizer along with integrating some home automation. While Alexa handles the home automation just fine, the Show's home screen lacks the "at a glance" features my earlier PC setup did.

For instance, the home screen doesn't show the month/date/day - only the current time and temperature. There is no built in calendar display to look at although I can verbally schedule appointments to a linked calendar. If I want to peruse the calendar, on the Show I'm out of luck. Upcoming events for the next day do show up but it would be nice to be able to configure it to show me (n) days in advance.

Contacts are also a problem. Although I have my contacts linked and they do show up in my Android Alexa app on my phone, only 5 of those contacts show up in the Echo Show. After doing some research, it appears that the reason those 5 show up is because Amazon detects that they also have some sort of Echo device registered. Not very useful to me because I want to be able to see ALL of my contacts.

I love this Echo device!! We have it in our kitchen. While a lot of the features I use most are available on the Echos without screens by using the app, it’s so convenient to just have the ability to have it pull up your shopping list right there. I love being able to see all my individual timers while cooking. Seeing what’s next on my to-do list as I’m finishing something up or adding things as I go, makes my multi-tasking much more efficient. The sound quality is great, we use it when entertaining in the kitchen often. I’m a music video fiend so I enjoy being able to watch those on a whim and sing along to the lyrics as they pop up when just listening to music. It’s great for quick cooking instructional videos from time to time too.
Sometimes Alexa has no idea what I’m asking for but this device’s does a much better job of it than our Echo Dot does so there’s that.

So much to say, but I’m really ecstatic we received this from our wedding registry!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice but thought it would be more visual
reviews.reviewText: It works like an echo dot but has video for some things. I was expecting there to be more video related apps. You would think it would be easy to pull up a weather forecast and see a radar image. No not really. Hopefully YouTube will be an app soon now that Google and Amazon are working out their issues. Amazon video works well. No Netflix either. Music sounds nice. If you are on the taller side a tilting stand is pretty much a must have to be able to view the screen and touch it easily. The on screen keyboard is meant for you to use it while you are holding it which is odd.

Have owned the echo show since they first came out. Decided to trade in and upgrade to the 2nd gen model. Glad I did. Bigger screen, improved functions. Worth the money. Nothing to the set up for me as I already owned the orginal. Turned on, verified it was me and the echo did the rest. There are side by side and function differences listing on the web, too long to put here but you can easily find them with a search in you want to see the differences.

reviews.reviewTitle: Voice recognition not as good as 1st gen but speakers and design are much better
reviews.reviewText:
Decided to buy the 2nd gen when it went on sale and also traded in my first gen. Price was right (25% off from trade in plus $15 credit for old one) and I'm definitely overall happy. The voice recognition, or more specifically it hearing the wake word, isn't as good as the first gen unit. But everything else is better - image quality, sound quality, overall look and design. Putting the first gen and second gen next to each other makes them look like they are 10 years apart and not the actual 2 they are.

Definitely happy I upgraded even if I have to yell the wake word a little louder for it to catch it.

First of all, it's a gorgeous device! I received it as a present from my husband. Easily a 5 star device. So, why am I deducting 2 stars? There is a ridiculous, ugly, horrible nag line at the bottom of the screen that says "Try. 'Alexa, (whatever)'."For example, it may be displaying a beautiful pic of a 15th century Puerto Rican fortress and splashed along the bottom is "Try, 'Alexa wake me up to 80s music'." YOU CAN NOT TURN IT OFF on the 2nd gen. It was possible on earlier model or version but not now. Trust me, if you want to use the Show as a photo display, you will be disappointed. The ability to turn this off is one of the most requested features, yet Amazon is not listening! I am beyond disappointed... Google Home Hub is going in the bedroom not a Show.

I've had the Echo Show now for a week and have to say its not a 5-star product. The build quality and screen are very nice, but the software is lacking. A simple example is the slide show of background photos. It doesn't shuffle very well; It consistently shows the same picture many times in a row and stays within the same folder. Maybe that's a minor issue to most, but I use it as an example of what should be an important part of its capability. I looked for how to fix this and found out its been an ongoing issue for many years and i couldn't even find a response from Amazon on how to fix the issue.

The other frustration is with many of the skills not being very useful. This may not be Amazon's fault directly, but if they would do some quality control of who is writing to their ecosystem, they would be much better off.

We enjoy having the show in the kitchen. As a mothers day gift, my mother just loves it. The video chat is great, seeing our ring video so quickly and easily is certainly an added bonus. One of the features she loves is the amount of games and news available. When shes cooking she loves to play "guess the song" where she competes against others naming song titles and artists, shes a proud champion of over 100 straight wins... LOL What a great buy. It makes me happy seeing her so happy. Highly recommend this for all ages. Prime video is available to play, the speaker beats all other Alexa devices HANDS DOWN.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good purchase for the price but has room for improvement
reviews.reviewText: This is good for what it is. It’s not an apple product, so user friendliness is not quite as seamless as it would be in an Apple product. It’s perfect for a kitchen counter. I play music, watch news and shows, check weather and recipes, etc. It’s great for the kids to sit and watch something, however they have trouble operating the voice commands. I find myself saying the same commands over and over sometimes without an action from the device. The touch screen is finicky. Sometimes it does not respond to touch for 3 or 4 tries. While I do think it’s a good product to have in my home, and I would purchase it again, it leaves room for improvement.

reviews.reviewTitle: Glitchy and over promises and under delivers
reviews.reviewText:
If I could give zero stars I would, buyer beware. I bought this for our kitchen and it worked well for about 3 months, then it started lagging. Becoming unresponsive and certain functions just wouldn't work. I now have to hard restart every day. Regardless of it saying it has the latest software running, it barely does anything except take up space now. I have been happy with most of my other Amazon products but this one is a big fail. Stay Away!
As for features, it is supposed to play content on Hulu and play Apple Music, but those interfaces are decidedly limited. So just know that going into purchasing.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very intuitive device. A must have for techies.
reviews.reviewText: I'm very satisfied with this device. The second generation is much nicer versus the first generation. The 10" screen is a nice size with a very clear and high resolution display. With the Alexa app, it works seamlessly with my Ring doorbell and shows me who's at the door. Since it has the built in hub, I'm able to remotely control my lights, and thermostat and I'm also able to connect to my other Amazon devices in other rooms as an intercom. The sound is very good when I want to listen to music apps such as Pandora or Amazon music. Another cool feature is that I'm able to see my shopping lists on the screen and take it with me on my phone with the Alexa app.

I am happier with the new 2nd Gen Echo Show. Bigger screen, better sound, but the screen has very limited use. No YouTube, StreamPlayer is losing content with much less live channels than a few months ago. If you are happy with Amazon Video for your watching pleasure, I guess it is OK. A friend of mine has a Google Display and that thing has lot's to watch. Better watch out Amazon, Google has already caught up. You will be playing catch up if you don't start getting more video choices here soon. If you don't, I may have to abandon Amazon for Google. By the way, I had two 1st Gen Show and opne broke, The second one is starting to act up. Hope it is not going bad too. If so, this will be a reason for me to make th jump. They don't last more than a year.

I bought this one from Amazon sale was a great price I received it yesterday I went to set it up and the volume won’t work I called your office they said they’re working on a situation I gave them my number they said they call me today which they haven’t and still not working this is a bad sign of a product that you just bought and it’s not working

The all new look and feel of the newest Echo Show (2nd/generation) along with its awesome speakers and screen clarity is amazing! I can’t wait to purchase several more for my guest bedrooms. Thank you, Amazon for an AWESOME product!

These are great, have two 2nd Gen and one 1st gen in the house, as well as several other Echo devices. The screen is quite nice, the extra size of the 2nd Gen is definitely worth it, but the small size of the new 5" would be a nice device to try as well. The sound from this is good, gets plenty loud if you are playing music and definitely nice to group the devices for music throughout the house.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good upgrade from the Show 1st Gen
reviews.reviewText:
Amazon did a good job in seeing what improvements should be made with the Show 1st gen. Bigger screen is a huge plus. Speaker sound quality is much better than the 1st gen. I paired mine with the Alexa Sub woofer and have good all around sound, but not quite bose quality.

I tried bluetooth pairing with an AIWA speaker and the functionality was awkward. It would play music through the AIWA at one point and no other sounds would play, such as Alexa responding. When it finally connected with Alexa responding and music then I would get a thump out of the AIWA speaker every several seconds. If you are looking for the sound quality as I was, I highly recommend considering the Alexa sub woofer.

For a speaker all around the sound could be better, with it behind the device, you can’t have it against a wall or anything it needs to be centered somewhere, I don’t want a big screen in the middle of a counter, I want it pushed back. It lags as well, all my other devices are great. I wish when looking for a recipe it showed them from all over google, instead if I want a specific one i find on my laptop or cellphone it won’t show me it, only ones Alexa suggests unless I go to internet and do it myself, but then it times out and won’t scroll or answer “what’s next?” for you.

reviews.reviewTitle: A few things share the name......
reviews.reviewText: This device just doesn't live up to the hype. Microphones are not good at all. Have to yell at it at times to recognize me. Also, when I try to turn off a device, say my bedroom light, alexa will say "a few things share the name bedroom light, which one do you want" when I only have one device named bedroom light. I can pick up my phone, use my tp link kasa app and turn it off no problem. This device needs some work before 5 stars can be given. EDIT: Changed to one star because of the microphones. I can be less than 1ft away and speak to it and it doesn't recognize me. This device needs a lot of work to compete with google.

We like having echo show on the kitchen but it's performance is terrible. Half of the time we have to repeat what we requested several times, occasionally the device decides to mid program, there is a significant delay between receiving the command and actually executing it (sometimes up to 20 seconds), in some instances the device receives the command but does not execute it, yesterday it started crashing for no apparent reason mid show. After third crash in span of 5 minutes we switch to TV. Very nice idea but horrible execution.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is a amazing hub it’s a excellent addition to our home
reviews.reviewText: This echo show Hub will blow your mind it takes everything you have that can work with Alex work so much better than before. The video screen is picture is amazing. Once we learn everything it can do it’s is becoming a tool to make our lives better Just the list app you just ask Alex to add butter to the shoping list when one of us go to the grocery store we open the list and see what everyone has add that we need it really is excellent. We have the ring doorbell just ask Alex to show me the door and it’s so fast because of it being a hub we have noticed That the seed or your internet don’t slowdown. We are very impressed. Thanks Amazon for making great product for families to use in their home and make our lives easier

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product with a few limitations
reviews.reviewText: In general like most everything about this product. It's size and clarity of screen, audio and ease of setup. The reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is that it has limited compatibility with my Nest Doorbell and Arlo security systems. While I can view the cameras on these devices I cannot do vocal communication nor will the Echo show create an audio alert when my doorbell is rung. It does not work at all with my Schlage electronic door locks. Least not that I can figure out. I realize this is not the primary functions of the Echo show but the Google hub seems to have better compatibility for more of these type devices.

reviews.reviewTitle: Expensive for a low resolution screen
reviews.reviewText:
The sound is a great improvement over my echo dot. I like having a screen to tell Alexa to show me the front door and have my ring camera connect to it. I like telling Alexa to set the thermostat to 72° and have it done. I don't like that the home screen is not very customizable. I'd prefer to have larger numbers so I could completely eliminate my alarm clock. I'm also not a huge fan of having Alexa suggestions as a background. I mainly purchased this for smart home integration. It works well for that.
The price is a little high for such a low resolution screen. I feel that $130-150 would have been a better price point.

Truly we do. I has brought a lot of good things into my family dynamic. I use drop in occasionally & it always puts a smile on someone's face that I suddenly appear on screen in the kitchen We ask for weather reports almost daily right now (climate change folks!!!) & we have a bulb hooked up to it in a room that has no wall switched lights, so we just tell Alexa to turn the bulb on that in the lamp. Much of what we do with this can indeed be done with Echo _BUT_ the fact that the Show gives a visual display adds an additional and welcome dimension. I haven't even touched the surface of it's capabilities yet, and I look forward to learning more.

I received this as a gift, so it will not show as a verified purchase. The device leaves me wondering why it is designed the way it is. Most in-depth browsing is not as easy as just using the Amazon app on my tablet or phone. For instance, you need to browse movies by voice, which is much slower and more cumbersome than seeing a list of possible episodes, along with a written description of what the movie is about.
Also, Alexa is not good at hearing what I want to play, and often the touch screen just does not respond as expected. A common experience for me is to hover over the device, waiting for a response to voice command or touch command. I hate to say it, but this product would be better with some kind of non-voice input, like a remote or even an on-screen keyboard.
I would not recommend this to a friend, not until it works better.

Update: The first one I got must have been a lemon. Once I unplugged it, packed it up for shipping and removed it from my account everything worked perfectly. I can unplug the one I have now and plug it back in without any of the issues mentioned below. I am very happy with this addition to my collection.

The show2 is a great addition to my collection of amazon devices. I have 2 dots, an echo, and now the show2. I really like the screen resolution and the sound is great. My only complaint is when I set up a music group. The initial setup of the group works great. The buggy part comes in when you unplug the show2 to move it. Once you plug it back in and tell alexa to play music "everywhere"(my group name) the music plays on all the devices but the show2. At this point the show will display the lyrics but no sound comes out of it. If you tell alexa to turn off the music it will. But if you ask alexa on the show2 any question after this occurs you can see her response on the screen but still no sound at all. After trying to figure out what the issue was by messing with the volume and a whole host of other things I figured I just got a defective one. I called support and they had me try several things like rebooting but nothing seemed to fix the no sound issue. They sent me out a replacement. While I was waiting I kept trying to get it to work. I finally gave up in frustration and just unplugged it. Fortunately I am not one to just let things go so I plugged it back in after a couple of hours and low and behold it worked with the "everywhere" group again. As long as did not unplug it everything worked great.

Once the replacement showed up I did a test with it. I set it up in the "everywhere" group and started playing music. I then unplugged it. At that point I went to one of my other devices and told alexa to turn the music off but it would not turn it off. I went and plugged the replacement show2 back in and all of a sudden the music turned off. Crazy right?

So what I have determined is that if a show2 is unplugged and then plugged back in there will be no sound and may have other issues related to the music group.

The solution at that point for me is just unplug it for a while and then plug it back in and the sound magically starts working again. Amazon need to figure out this bug with the show2 and the music group feature. I can unplug any of my dots or echo and plug them back in and they work just fine once they are booted up and online.

So if if you are thinking about getting one just be aware of this issue and hopefully Amazon will read this review and fix the bug.

Update: The first one I got must have been a lemon. Once I unplugged it, packed it up for shipping and removed it from my account everything worked perfectly. I can unplug the one I have now and plug it back in without issue.

I have dots, and the original echo and the first Echo show. I love the larger screen and the sound is awesome also. I highly recommend. I am so impressed with Amazon service. I was actual able to see where the delivery truck was, and a approximate time when my package would arrive. They also took a picture of my porch where they left it. I am impressed.

This product would not allow me to set it up because it would type by itself and would not let me control it. So expensive yet not good at all! Was so looking forward to it and it failed. Contacted product support through chat and was offered a "FREE" replacement, which is insulting. There is nothing free about replacing an expensive defective product. I should have gone with Google Pod Assistant. SHAME ON YOU AMAZON!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Disappointed, really wanted to love it.
reviews.reviewText: No better than the Spot, videos buffer when trying to view movies or TV shows. Video calls are great, providing family and friends own one of these. Sadly I returned, will try the Leveno Smart Assistant next.

I located the Echo Show in several rooms to view security cameras, play music, turn off and on lights, turn on fans, watch pets, kids, etc. The larger screen really makes it nice when watching TV, movies and cameras. The sound quality is excellent for listening to music. Andi it's a lot of fun. I ask Alexa all the time "who's the man" and she replies "you the man". You can ask Alexa to tell you a joke or a story. A lot of fun as well as being practical and useful. Once you have one you will want more. Therefore, look for it to go on sell and buy several. You won't regret it…

reviews.reviewTitle: Display goes dark after a few miniutes. There is no way of stoping this.
reviews.reviewText: There is no setting to change this. Amazon devices does NOT come with an instruction booklet or trouble shooting. However you can Pay for one. Most problems I've had I can find a forum or a complaint with the same issues, but Amazon does not correct or do anything with this information. Just keeps giving the same recorded feedback of " thank you for your feed back we are getting many others with the same problems. We will look into it." Two years later still no resolution... Very disappointed in "Alexa" she does not hardly answer the question I ask or play the music I asked her to play. Often times its something I have no idea where she gets it from. I ask her to play a specific playlist and she has no ides what it is or she can't find it... Soooo Freaking Annoying...

I am a little displeased with the brightness of the video and am hoping this is not a defect. I have the settings cranked up to the highest level to see the image adequately. At the half-way mark (default) it is really hard to see. I can sense that the screen brightness is adjusting to ambient light, but it is really just too dim. I've only had the unit about a week and am still evaluating. If this is the way it is supposed to work, I may need to return the unit.

Sound quality on the other hand is quite improved and rivals that of the Echo Plus 2nd gen. The speakers appear to be in the back so you get a fuller sound (almost too loud).

I took baby steps into the whole smarthome thing. I started with the “dot” expanding to the “plus” before landing on the first generation show. I had purchased 4 shows, 4 dots, and a couple of the “plus” until I had an echo product in each room to control my homes lighting, temp, and security system. I tried out other products before settling down on the Amazon devices. Now for the Show. I have added 2 of the Show 2 to my home. I absolutely love them. I have one beside my bed so at anytime I can check security cams throughout the house and talk to anyone who’s at the door. In add to an alarm, sleep aid with sleep sound skills, home intercom, speaker phone, I now have my own tv to catch up on prime movies or Hulu.

My personal opinion is simply this. Compare all you get in one device for the money. The new upgrades are amazing. The larger screen and speakers kick butt! And the best part is the price remained the same!!! If you haven’t, try it. I don’t see how you couldn’t be more than satisfied.

I really enjoy the new show. It has a nicer design than the original. The only DRAWBACK I have is that I have it in my bedroom on the nightstand right next to my bed, and even on its dimmest setting, the light is annoying. I wish the screen could turn totally dark and I would have given it 5 stars. There was no setup. It came preconfigured for my account and wifi out the box. It also sounds great. I am considering ordering a second to see how the subwoofer only option works.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect addition to my living room as a music streamer and security camera viewer.
reviews.reviewText:
Great unit, fun and easy to use.

Amazon's Blink cameras just need to be able to send motion detection notifications to unit since it can already "arm and disarm" and "live view" them. I haven't seen where you can look at saved clips or set up notifications for them anyway.

Otherwise pretty easy to use I even "drop in" to visit with my sister once in awhile via hers. I like the "guard" function added as well. I previously criticized not having that feature since it has a camera and microphone. I haven't tested it's functionality quite yet though.

I wanted this to replace the first one. I am not sure this is better.

The one thing I have found is better than the first ones, the music is louder.

The screen is larger. You can use Firefox and play youtube.

The bad for me is my one young kitty goes nuts for sound, and the speakers in the back make her want to flip this over. Tv sounds are low, so adjusting the volume from music to tv is a slight pain.

I use mine to drop in on the cats while working. Most of the time they get busted doing naughty things.

Drop in and calling is very handy, when someone can't be with you, they can check on you.

I feel the first generation is better, but this will work.

reviews.reviewTitle: Dynamic sound, modern appearance, fast response times
reviews.reviewText: Had first gen and had to replace due to glitchy, twitching screen flicker. Not impressed with the process to “repair” (found out only after I reached out to amazon it can’t be repaired and at that time, unable to be returned). So I was leery of the second gen but it’s much more refined - bigger and better screen, definite improvement in sound quality. Picks up my voice an easy 25’ away and is good for background music (for our use). Just beginning to “drop in” with other devices at home and with Contacts — easy and beautiful screen with no lag in video conferencing. Would rate 5 stars but need to give it a few months — hopefully it’s more reliable and doesn’t fail!

Alexa is full of information and we like the way her answers are typed in words to display on screen. That helps my Dad who is hard of hearing and can read her answers on screen. She also puts up the lyrics to the song we're playing. The reason we got the show is for our RING Video Doorbell. It works great and my Dad is having a good time with it all. He's 90 years old and stuck in his chair all the time. Alexa is his new best friend :-) We can drop in on all the other echo's we have throughout the house.

We were a earlier adopter of the alexa push. We purchased a large Alexa and then followed suit with numerous echo dots and then a spot. Due to the spots limited use and small screen we did not move to a 1st gen show. but when Amanzon came out with the 2nd gen Show with a larger screen, discount at holiday season, we took the plunge. We ahve also move more in the Ring devises, cams etc. The new Show has a nice large screen, better sound and works well. It now sees our security cams and runs our lights etc. - Con - not much in video content and must use the screen to navigate some apps which makes it difficult to reach across the counter.

The screen is very nice. The sound is horrible. Even when using the EQ and lowering the bass as FAR AS IT WILL GO, it still sounds muffled. I've boosted the mids and treble a bit and made sure not to put the unit anywhere near a wall but Alexa still sounds boomy and music isn't great.

How did they get this so wrong?

Another issues is that the mic doesn't pick up as well as an Echo Dot. I can be 3 feet away from this unit and ask Alexa for something (e.g. play music) and my echo dot in the other room hears me first and plays music there!

Definitely needs improvement.

reviews.reviewTitle: Awesome for staying in touch with Grandpa
reviews.reviewText: The setup was easy and fairly obvious. The integration with Skype required a little research, but some helpful Youtubes took care of it. Grandpa struggled with responding to Skype on his laptop (seems simple to us, but not to him.) The Echo Show just requires an "Alexa, answer" response. I have a placard with that written just below the echo. We get to see each other each morning to check up and plan any doctor appointments, birthdays, holiday events, etc. He just moved into assisted living. This will help immensely. It meant I only had to buy one for him. The rest of the family can use Skype on their Windows 10 computers.

Got this as a gift from my work over a year ago, would've never been inclined to purchase one if not been gifted it...and I love it now. I use it 90% for music (the speaker is amazing), and the remainder for a clock, random Qs, sleep sounds, and weather updates.

Now here's why I'm writing a review (I don't usually write these):

I'm a college student, and so this thing has been put through a lot. This weekend she got puked on, and dropped face down from four feet. After cleaning and scrubbing the speakers (i'm not sure this is recommended), she works and sounds just as good as day one... amazing.

If you're wanting an interactive speaker you can't beat this. I love the screen feature as a clock, seeing artists/songs, and to provide a little lighting at night if I want it to.

reviews.reviewTitle: Audio great, screen is constant irritation!
reviews.reviewText:
I'm an Alexa skill developer and looked forward to incorporating Echo Show into several business apps requiring visual information. My Show sits on my dev computer desk and I'm constantly tell it to "Alexa, blank the screen" This is a serious pain in the ass. I'm on the verge of returning it. In addition, when you're playing music, some songs show a constantly moving lyric display, I hate this. What's next the bouncing ball? Just about every screen shows tips, shown here, "Alexa, what's on my to-do list?" Disabling these tips, lyrics or an absolutely black idle screen are not configurable.

To summarize, I have 8 Echo Dots used for IoT voice integration projects. So I want this Show to be another development tool. The audio is great, however the non-skill screens are a constant irritation. Does Amazon sell Echo Show hoods?

1 Star: No sound out of the box. Not happy. I tried all the troubleshooting steps, no sound.

Update**** 4 Star:I youtubed how to take it apart, and I unplugged the speakers and plugged them back in and it worked.

reviews.reviewTitle: Honey, I blew up the Alexa
reviews.reviewText:
I absolutely love the larger screen size compared to the original Show; however, there are still a few major flaws the Show 2.0. I will say that I use this primarily in my kitchen to watch shows or listen to music while I cook/prepare food. However, I've also used it to do drop in calls with my family and play customized (blueprint) trivia with the Alexa buttons. My initial thoughts summed up below:

PROS
- Larger screen size
- The screen size is much bigger
- Did I mention that the screen is larger?

CONS
- It seems like any hardware enhancements made to account for the larger screen size, weren't enough to make the Show a faster, more viable hub
- Slow to respond to some commands (I.e. stopping while watching a video and returning to the home screen)
- Touchscreen isn't a stellar experience, often times having to use it to adjust brightness settings that have seemingly changed on their own (away from the auto adjust)
- Buttons pair and work inconsistently (to be fair, not sure if that is a Show issue but that has been my experience)

OVERALL
The Show 2nd gen does what I am hoping it will do, but I can't help but wish for a few more improvements.

Would be a five star review except for one major flaw that should be an easy fix.
I have the cloud cam in my nursery and use it as a baby monitor which works GREAT. I can view the camera on my phone, tablet, Fire tv (of which all our TVs primarily use) and now I can ask my new echo show to display the nursery as well which works great as a night stand monitor! Only problem is I also use Alexa to control various lights and switches throughout my house and when I ask my show to perform a smart home command like “turn off bedroom lights” when it’s time to go to sleep, it leaves my nursery cam then displays a control screen for whichever device or group the command was for. Which would be fine for a short while so long as it returned back to the nursery camera... it doesn’t... it displays the smart home control for a bit then goes to the home screen... forcing me to have to ask it to display the nursery again. This is very frustrating. As soon as this problem is fixed I will edit review to 5star.

I was really looking forward to this product. Price wise I got a great deal but the voice recognition was so poor that the unit only recognized a few commands. I tried it for about a week, and decided it wasn't worth the aggravation. It would be a great device if Amazon would work on the recognition problem. The display and the sound are great but the lack of recognition spoils the unit.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Idea - Poor support & Device Issue
reviews.reviewText: Initially loved this device as it showed family photos (digital frame like), our upcoming events and reminders. Plus the added feature of the screen for recipes and shopping lists. Then after two weeks, the screen times out to a blank screen with the clock on it. Many are having this issue, and the only way to return to the screen is to "Alexa". Stays on for a few moments then goes back to timeout screen. Checked settings, but nothing to reset or change, and no change if changes are made. Best part is that I tried the Chat, but the server is not "working", so I called, got a call back but no one there (3 times), placed a request on the help forum under Echo Show and nothing as well... I think this will be going back. If updates are made or fix in place, then we will keep it and update the review. For now, its a clock, unless we ask it something. Not much more of a feature set compared to the standard Echo with no screen.

I have absolutely no complaints at this time. I am still exploring the possibility of this wonder of a box. The sound is simply amazing! As a screen saver I have downloaded a collection of amazing pictures from my brother's photography. They rotate freely. This makes for a beautiful addition to my living room even when not in use for music. I can call my mom and be sitting right in the living room with her during our whole conversation. I am able to view my security cameras quickly and clearly with the request of my voice. Display screen constantly displays time, temperature and weather. I cannot say enough about this piece.

She often doesn't hear your request well; difficult many times to exit out of music; insists on playing a lot of music samples & won't play albums. Bartender app is poor, google better. A lot she doesn't know. Music is fair, really all I use it for. I leave off for days at a time. She frequently responds with "I don't know that". Really expected better. Difficult to get a good news station & can't get one locally. Hate Fox!! Wish she understood "background music", still trying to download my own wallpaper, but found it exhausting & don't understand. THIS IS CLEARLY FOR TECHY PEOPLE AND NOT THE OLDER GENERATION...you'd think it would be helpful for us older folks, but it is not sorry to say.

Pros -
Sound quality is good. I listen to music when I'm in the kitchen. Easily pulls up recipes. Haven't watched a movie on it but the screen is clear and the colors pop. The cons below are more a nuisance but I felt I should add them because I didn't know this before I purchased
Cons -
You CANNOT say Alexa play (insert song and artist) and it will play. You have to subscribe to Amazon music.

The echo show often talks when no one is in the Kitchen. Haven't figured out why. The only Alexa we know is in the
kitchen so we do not have the need to say that name unless talking directly to it.

You cannot put your own picture slide show on it.

We waited till gen 2 before picking up the show and while I do believe it is a marked improvement from gen one there still seems to be some technical hardware/software issues. Amazon seems to be aware of this as well as when we called in they had a whole system to walk through and said it was a common issue (recall?)- one of the issues is that sound will just stop working which then requires you to reset the device multiple times (which means plugging it in and unplugging it over and over) this error/glitch also effects the screen or sometime the start up of the show. - and the whole device is out of warranty coverage in like 30 days or something from purchase. This first happened to us about 15 days after we got it - in hindsight should have probably exchanged it then - but we hoped it was a one time thing - however this is turning into a weekly routine at this point. Besides that the device is great - screen is beautiful sound quality top notch, for what it is, and our kids (4-2) love it. They can ask for pictures of fish and then scroll through images on the touch screen or to play their favorite song or ask for their kids show on Hulu or the time or weather etc. It really enables them to be able to interact and explore without the ability to type and spell - which for them is very empowering.

No significant change compared to the 1st generation, besides size. I frequently have to order Alexa to "stop" several times and with my voice volume progressively louder, before she will hear me and stop.
The technology is still behind times. The screen should be able to show the date and day as it does the time and weather.
I don't want to add my calendar and email.
The screen should offer the option to view a list of music by genre, artist, albums, era, station, etc. Customer should not have to refer to the app on the computer or cell phone to select music options.

No sound out of the box. Will see how Amazon handles it and update my review accordingly.

EDIT: So, after living with this thing for a while, my rating remains a solid ‘1’. Here are some things to think about before buying:

- Customer support. On the plus side, Amazon reached out to me regarding the faulty sound on this device. Unfortunately, though, their “fix” isn’t a fix at all, unplugging the chord from the back of the device is a subpar workaround at best. Worse, there’s apparently no plan for a real fix for these defective devices.

- The faulty sound issues persist, bringing three thoughts to mind for me
— Does Amazon really think unplugging and replugging the product is a satisfactory fix for this $200 device?
— How many times does Amazon think we’ll be able to pull the plug and reinsert before the plug breaks? (the answer is not many)
— How much use will a device that has to be rebooted every time you want to hear something get? (the answer is not much)

- The device is inordinately slow. Even standing directly in front of it and speaking directly to it, my other devices in other rooms answer before the Show can

- Lack of content. I agree with some of the others who have said this is basically an expensive echo dot. Yes, it’s nice to watch Amazon Prime Video or Hulu, but where is YouTube, Netflix, etc. Same with the communication capabilities. They are much too limited

- Too few home screen options. The home screen can’t be customized to do anything useful and can’t be set not to turn off automatically ... or to not turn on every time you pass by

- Limited compatibility with other hardware. If you have already purchased video cameras/doorbells, etc that Amazon doesn’t advertise, you’re likely to be headed back to the store to purchase new equipment

All-in-all, I’d say this is a device whose time has not yet come, in terms of hardware quality, utility, and usability. It’s a shame ... big promise, little result. Amazon should recall these defective units today!

reviews.reviewTitle: No apps no home screen no streaming platform ...
reviews.reviewText:
This device is an echo spot that accidentally snuck into a show 2. It is missing any sort of interface liike a home screen where you select apps. Or internet so that is frustrating. It is also missing even the Amazon fire tv set up of shows. There is no menue to select from, like every other menue on every other device they created ie fore tv fire stick, fire tablet, Web browser.

Im short it is a completly new set up with almost no funtionality for tv watching. It is missing netflix and you tube apps. Despite reviews above saying you can use the web browser you can NOT, per the patch that initiates upon startup. In fact you can not even watch amazon prime video on thier own browser it blocks you out.

In closing it is a great idea that missed ita mark completly as if two different departments are fighting for popularity (tablet, smart home, fire tv) and they dont like to use eachother streaming platforms. This device is more of a cooking assistant if you like bland recipes and not a show watching device..

Buy the hd 10 for less and sleaker design

reviews.reviewTitle: My new computer speaker, Ring video, and Netflix right on my desktop.
reviews.reviewText: I work from home and have this sitting on my desk. I like being able to show my yards from Ring when the dogs are barking at something. I can even tell them to knock it off! - without having to drop my conference call to go look out the doors or windows. I was also able to turn off the computer speakers and use the Show speakers that have a much better sound. Alexa can do simple calculations for me so I don't have to pull up a calculator. And when I need a break, I can watch YouTube or Netflix without leaving my office. Show is my own little personal assistant/multi-tasker.

reviews.reviewTitle: Overpriced gadget, great sound, very limited functionality.
reviews.reviewText: I received this as a gift from my husband. He had read the reviews and thought itcwpuld be a great asset in our kitchen. I believe that the ‘integration’ with things like our dish network and things was strongly misrepresented. Yes it integrates with these other programs, but you can’t actually use the dish app on the Amazon Show, you can only control whats showing on your tv with the Show. We thought we’d be able to stream these other services on our Show. Not the case. And what little user i terface there is is quite cumbersome to use. The lack of a homescreen where you can touch icons to do what you would like is frustrating (instead of using voice commands that Alexa doesnt always understand) This device sounds great. But you can buy a great speaker for much less than the price of his device. It is quite limited in its funtionality. Overall in our house, its basically a digital screen saver that plays music. I can’t say i’d recommend it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cool device, but slow to respond to commands; video underpowered
reviews.reviewText:
The device has a decent screen and quite good sound for a small video oriented device.

The thing to be aware of is that it is slow to start videos, and slow to respond to any commands while streaming video. If you tell Alexa to “go home” while playing a video, the video will continue playing for up to 10 seconds before finally turning off and returning to the home screen. Very annoying. it seems worse with Hulu than with Prime Video.

When using with recordings from the FireTV Recast, it is quite unresponsive when using the touchscreen to play individual videos, you may need to tap on a video 3 or more time to get it to play. The screen clearly registers the tap, it sometimes does nothing.

In fact, tapping on the screen in general seems slow and sometimes unresponsive.

It seems like a faster processor might help with many of the above issues.

I bought the Show 2nd. Gen to replace my old Echo Show. This unit is much better than the first because of its screen. The Bluetooth connectivity is little better than the first. My first Echo Show keep disconnecting my Bluetooth speakers. The sound still needs more help. For better sound, I still need to connect my speakers to it. This 2nd. gen Show do have better voice recognition than the original. I would give the 1st. generation Echo Show a D & the second generation a C or 3 Stars.

reviews.reviewTitle: WOW. so much bigger and brighter!!
reviews.reviewText: I love the new Echo Show (2nd Generation). the screen is so much bigger and brighter. The sound quality is amazing. I watch movies on it, Stream the news, and have a fantastic photo slideshow on the background. It was so nice to stream Christmas songs and sing along to the lyrics on the screen. I am giving my 1st generation Echo Show to a friend out of state. It will be great to video chat with them. I also am able to view all of my security cameras on it. I can't say enough about it. Great job Amazon!! p.s. I did NOT receive one free from amazon to review. but would have loved it if they had. I not only bought myself one. I also bought 2 more to give to my parents and to my brother.

Like several other reviewers, I received a defective unit without sound. It initially had sound but after the software updates there is no sound regardless of what settings, reboot, or factory reset I do. I will be sending it back for a replacement but I am concerned about the quality control.

I bought 2 of these so I can see my aging mother as she does not have an iPhone. I got the larger screen so myMom can see but it is quite heavy vs. say an iPad or Kindle fire.
Overall it works well, video is clear and sound is great. The reason I gave 3 stars is because it is quite heavy and difficult to hold on to due to its shape. The angle it is tilted at is ok unless you want to change it so it is pointing at you vs you and ceiling. It would have been better to have an adjustable stand and smaller speakers to make it easier to handle. Needs an overall slimmer profile.

After a few months of use it remains to be good hardware with incomplete software.

Almost all of our content comes from Amazon and I would expect it to work easily. Trying to get a movie to play can sometimes take forever.
"Alexa, play Rouge One"
"Sorry, I cannot find any services that can play Rouge One, A Star Wars Story. Try managing you video apps on the Alexa app"

Constantly it will understand what you say but fail to get any content, whether movies or audio playlists. For a device that had a touchscreen it suggests you use the Alexa app on your phone almost half the time.
