The home screen is annoying and there are a few volume issues where you might get really surprised when Alexa speaks with much greater volume than the content playing.

Bought two so we could let the kids video call my in-laws. Needing a smartphone besides mine too set that up was frustrating.

This makes the first "family" device that only makes sense to have on the kitchen counter. Profiles and multiple users are terrible and it can only learn one voice per user account.

Everything works great 20-30% of the time and it feels like a great purchase, but it's often frustrating. When we filled the house with the original echo we showed them off but this one is too buggy.

I normally dont write reviews, but I feel compelled to write it for the Echo Show. This device, as sleek as it is, is an absolute failure. The simple fact that you NEED to have a smartphone to set it up, is horrendous. All the Videos and text description describe an easy setup. However, if you do not have a smart phone, you cannot actually set it up. We bought it for video calling between older family members, who do not have smart phones in their life. Not being able to add a contact or really, setup anything without a smartphone is a complete oversight. I'd give it negative stars if i could.

I like the device but I rarely use it because it does not have a youtube app due to some dispute. The browser workaround is lame, I might as well access it on my phone. Never even occurred to me this device wouldn't have youtube when I ordered it or that it would still be missing in 2019. I wouldn't hold my breath for it any time soon.

Edit: Just wanted to add the default search for videos is Bing and there appears to be no way to change it for voice commands.

The sound quality and Alexa capability are excellent. I purchased this as well as Sonos speakers and while this isn’t on par with the adobos, which have a large price difference, this product can hold its own in terms of sound quality. An audiophile may be able to tell a distinct difference, but considering the product wasn’t manufactured solely as a speaker with Alexa integration, I am still thoroughly impressed with the quality. If you are looking for a versatile speaker with Alexa integration and a touch screen to boot, this is the product for you.

The Echo is just HORRIBLE. I ask for simple things like a spaghetti recipe by Ina Garten (she only has hundreds of recipes on the net) and Alexa tells me “sure” and then proceeds to bring up every spaghetti recipe on the planet but NONE by Ina Garten. So then I go to my cookbook and get the EXACT NAME OF A RECIPE BY INA GARTEN - maybe I have done something wrong. I give this to Alexa which SHE CAN’T FIND?? She can answer about 1 in every 50 questions I ask her. However she seems to be excellent at suggesting products and services I could buy from AMAZON. (imagine that!!) I got this as a gift for Christmas, I did not buy it. If I had I would be demanding a refund!! But, I’m going to put the device in some unused room in the house and forget her. WHAT A WASTE OF MONEY!!!!!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: May revise my rating to higher as time goes on
reviews.reviewText: Decided to rewrite my review, I adjusted the screen brightness and the EQ for better sound

This was a last minute thought for my wife’s Christmas this year. I had seen one in Best Buy and thought “kinda neat gizmo” wasn’t sure how it would be useful. But when it arrived (right on schedule yay Amazon) it was impressive right out of the box. Not a techie here but I was able to get it up and running in minutes. The screen runs through suggestions that give you ideas for what you can do with it. I added Amazon music unlimited, which allows you to ask it to play any song you want. And I cannot believe the sound quality! I was watching Amazon prime movies right off the bat. Beautiful bright screen no buffering. My wife took to it immediately and seems to love it. We will definitely be adding accessories to start building a “smart home”, light and thermostat control. Nice when you’re getting ready in a hurry for work and ask for weather and calendar events. Impressive quality item, I haven’t compared the capabilities against the Google hub, but as a family that’s moderately connected with Amazon, I have to believe this a better choice for us!

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Show (2nd gen) is being held back by "Alexa" capabilities..
reviews.reviewText:
Display on the 10" Echo Show (2nd Gen) is great, sound is great, real world capabilities = not so great.

Even an experienced user may get frustrated having to reword their questions a few different ways or you will get the "sorry I don't know that one" for a response from Alexa. I asked my google device the same questions and it finds the answer right away (without having to unnaturally rephrase my question a few times).

If anyone tries the Echo Show's or anything else Alexa (yes it does have good capabilities)... you should ask common questions about what store is in your town but not the big stores like Home Depot, Walmart, etc. Try to ask in a natural way but you may have to rephrase it a few times for the answer.

Try to ask about a local business in your city/town and decide for yourself if Alexa will meet your needs and expectations. You may find yourself almost knowing all the information from the way you have to rephrase the question. You will understand when you start using it for real word information. Hopefully, Amazon/Alexa folks are working hard but there is still a long way to go.

Try... "Where is ______" and it might know the answer how far away it is inaccurately... BUT it doesn't know the business hours (Google does). Try... ask directions to a known restaurant in your town that you know has a chain in another city... you might get "sorry, I couldn't find what you're looking for" or the chain that is far away (Google knew the local one I wanted and also sent directions to my phone).

Some pluses... If you ask about restaurants in your town, it will show and tell you the names of a few on the screen (but I question how many it really knows). If it knows a business, you will see the information on the screen such as address, logo, store hours and it will verbally tell you where it is and the store hours.

If you want to like Alexa, do not use Google Home or Google Assistant. Once you do, you will start revealing the real world differences. I'd rate it 3.5 stars overall due to things being unnatural and not as fluent as the "other" device out there. Display is great.... I think if you let Amazon/Alexa KEEP your voice recordings/questions, the "voice recognition" would be 4 stars in a quiet environment but when you add in an A/C or a fan in the room it might not recognize as well unless you look at it and speak clearly and slightly louder.

I hope this helps...but again, the Echo Show (2nd Gen) is great BUT has "Alexa" limitations you should be aware of.

reviews.reviewTitle: Some basic instructions would be nice
reviews.reviewText:
I am sure I'll love it once I figure it out. I have one for my wife she uses in the kitchen and I guess it took her forever to figure it out as well, not sure to what extent she is able to utilize it even now. But it sound great.

UPDATE: Upon further review and use I am NOT loving it. Too buggy. lag between touchscreen commands and execution, voice mode is VERY inconsistent. With the thing in my lap (and after doing the learn my voice skill) is doesn't respond half the time. I end up having to mute and un mute the mic/camera to get it to respond... Oh well, the music sounds great....

For that skill alone any of these Alexa products are worth it to me. Does still need work though - which will come in time. Today, I asked her to tell me about a story that she was showing on the screen and at the bottom the screen it said "try asking about [this story]". I did, and was told about a Mexican basketball player - nothing to do with the story in question. I asked again and was told about something completely different - again, nothing to do with the story I was prompted to ask about. I had to touch the story the next time it came around to actually see it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo products just keep getting better--The Show is the example
reviews.reviewText: I have some type of echo device in "almost" every room in my house. Went up to the spot for my desk and kitchen so I could make video calls to relatives (and they were on sale at the time!!). When the Show went on sale, bought that to upgrade from the spot. The show gives a beautiful picture, even with my video doorbell. The countdown timer in the kitchen unit even shows time remaining. The sound quality is very good as we are playing holiday songs now. My only disappointment is that I want tv on it and Hulu monthly price is out of line since I already have cable. GET the optional STAND. Almost a must for most placements.

reviews.reviewTitle: 2nd Gen Echo Show. We love it!
reviews.reviewText: We wanted this for our kitchen. So far, we have no complaints. It was easy to set up and was a good addition to our Alexa controller house. The screen is very good and clear, and the audio is amazing. The screen goes to a standby mode when no one is around and the Echo Show senses when you walk into the room. The ZigBee hub is built in and allow the use with Philips Hue bulbs. I had a Wyze Camera already hooked up and the Show found it right away. All I have to do is say Alexa, Show me CAM1 and the video comes right up. So far we are pleased with our new addition.

Sound quality is fantastic, great bass. And thats where the good things end.

UI is clunky and laggy, voice recognition is mediocre. Asking it to play a song often leads to it playing a vaguely related playlist, gets extremely infuriating. Ended up only using it as an alarm clock and a bluetooth speaker. Screen is great but useless, not big enough for shows and movies, too big to use for a clunky UI.

Absolutely not worth the money.

I have Alexa’s in most of my rooms at home. This one is by far my favorite. The first thing you will notice, is the screen. It’s huge compared to the 1st gen. Second you will notice is the sound. Has a lot of bass compared to the first gen. Tweaking the equalizer a bit and this thing sounds great. Built in web browser is nice, and overall look of it is a major improvement over last gen. Whole home audio sounds good to. Waiting to get the Echo sub to pair with a couple of these things.

reviews.reviewTitle: Can't turn off the Try Alexa messages
reviews.reviewText: Love the sound quality but the blasted try messages that constantly scroll across the screen really ruins the experience for me. For this much money I should be able to have the display exactly as I want it and not have silly messages flashing across my photo gallery. It's too bad because I really wanted to like this unit. I have no idea who thought this "feature" was a good idea. I'll be returning it tomorrow.

I'm new to "Alexa" and have only had it for a day. There are some things that frustrate me. I can't get Alexa to pronounce my name correctly. Played spelling game and it started getting funky after a while (I'm an exceptional speller). But when I played music on this thing, oh, tears in my eyes it was so beautiful. Beats out my Bose surround speakers in my 17' ceiling room, and my portable Bose speaker. It just shakes me.

Although it does a lot, there are not enough games for kids to interact with the touch screen. I bought this for my son who has developmental disabilities, to help with speech and cognitive abilities. Need more interactive activities, games which are touch screen sensitive. For example, to play connect for you must say the location , such as slot four, no visualization is present. On tic tac toe you must say the location such as right column second space. If you could see it, the game would improve all learning styles. This would then become a great marketing device for those children with developmental delays but have the ability and understanding of how a computer or tablet works..

Hulu hasn’t been working for days. My Hulu account is fine. I receive this message when I try to play anything, yet there is nothing on Hulu help that refers to the error message provided, so I can’t fix the issue.
I often have to unplug and reset the unit because I will say Alexa play Roseanne on prime video.. it says okay and then goes back to the home screen.
This has been the most annoying piece of electronics I have owned next to the fire sticks which buffer every minute or so for several seconds at a time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Convenience in the kitchen!! Or anywhere!
reviews.reviewText: Loving my Echo Show so far. I no longer have to take my tablet or my phone with me to the kitchen when cooking and I need a recipe all the while either eating battery life or having to wake either device up once they time out. My show is right there. I love the visual que and reminders on the display. I have connected my Amazon Photos and created a show file with family pictures and fun quotes to cycle thru the home screen. No complaints so far. I'm looking forward to exploring more and hoping more features/apps are added. Pintrest would be AWESOME!!

I really like being able to get the hourly temperature but the feel like is just a single hit. I would like having both the temperature and the feel-like temperature so I can plan my 30 mile bike ride. I would also like a double line picture of the hourly temperatures.

The barking dog is great since I get to see my 3 dogs trying to find the dog intruders. I have not discovered how to get a string of dog sounds.

Alexa sometimes does not understand me from 6 feet away and I repeat talking slower.

The speaker system is really great ... I love the sound. I've ordered a stand and I'm hoping that will help with angling it for phone calls ... sometimes you have to pick it up to get the right angle, but that's not a huge issue. The reason we purchased the Show was for video calls with our son who lives out of state and that has been awesome! The call quality (video and audio) is great. My main problem is that it gets "stuck" while rotating through my photos in the background so I have to unplug it and then plug it back in. I'm not sure if this issue is the Show or my phone or our WiFi ... but, so far that's my biggest complaint. Overall I love the Show!

We have a small Echo Show and love it. I thought it would be great to by this and move the old one in my daughter's room. Surprise...the screen is so large it competes with her IPad so we decided to put this in here room. Worthy of watching videos. She loves it. We still like our small show in the kitchen. A win-win situation for the family. If you have an old version and are happy with it, I would not upgrade unless you want the video capability. Our older generation does its job perfectly managing our shopping list and other daily uses.

Love my echo show 2 .... needs a few tweaks tho .... like the ability to control the Alexa voice separately from music , news etc , controls my hue lights and links flawlessly with my audible account so I’m not wasting space on my iphone or iPad ....drop in let’s me check up on my pets ....

This should have been the first generation! This has all the bells and whistles that I was hoping for with the first generation. I’m just very happy it’s finally here and I’m able to enjoy it completely.

I like this product a lot. The integration with the Ring doorbell is great and the sound meets my expectations. I like having my appointments show up on the home screen, so I don't miss doctors appointments and things like that.

Works great for cooking and displaying multiple timers. It is also nice to see the lyrics when playing music. I wish there were more video options like Netflix, as opening the browser to load Netflix doesn't seem to work for me

The design is compact enough and doesn't take up too much room. I also like the weather skill big sky as it gives very detailed weather information.

I haven't had any quality problems and the setup was very straight forward and easy.

My mother (92 yrs old) has trouble with even using a phone but the Alexa Show solved that problem. She can now call me anytime and we can face time. This has made her and my life so much simpler. Thanks to who ever created the Alexa Show! Perfect item for family members who are in nursing homes, hospitalized, or just cant handle technology very well.

This was delivered on Christmas eve. It worked great up until the other day when it lost contact with my wifi. I have tried everything to get this thing hooked back up but nothing works. I know the wifi is working because everything else in the house is good to go. I hate that I wasted my money on this. Do yourself a favor and save your money.

Because of my review I got a call from Amazon customer service. A very nice young lady got me straightened out on exactly how the show works. It seems one of the buttons on top of the device is a mute button. I thought it was an on/off button. My bad. All is well now and I'm back to using my show. Thanks Amazon. Two thumbs up!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Sound stops working at least once a week
reviews.reviewText: It's awesome don't get me wrong but it has a major issue that needs to be addressed by Amazon. The sound just stops working completely and needs to be hard reset. Some component inside the Echo Show Gen 2 is either overheating and shutting off or the power is being choked. Whatever it is it stops all sound from producing. I would open it up a reflow the solder or check the internal temps of some capacitors or transistors and see it if above operating temps but I don't want to void the warranty. After research, this seems to be a common issue. Don't get me wrong it's amazing sounds fantastic when its working and it is a great buy. But the only fix is get a new one and they stop working after a while.

reviews.reviewTitle: Welcome to Hell - Try Alexa edition
reviews.reviewText: REMOVE THE STUPID TRY ALEXA LINE! This would be an incredible device if it didn’t have a line about Try Alexa on every screen. Buyer beware! Amazon you should be ashamed of this and send out a patch.

I’m tired of seeing huge ads all over the home screen on my echo devices, looks terrible and the functionally of it is horrible. Amazon should have an update or something that helps with turning these annoying ads off

To me the software is so buggy seems like it was pushed out before testing was finished. Specifically:
1. Do not disturb doesn't work. At first it refused to set the time. Then it would immediately go into that mode even outside the specified time period. The issue was discussed in various forums and couldn't find a solution yet.
2. Photo slideshow doesn't work either. Uploaded my photos to prime photos and specified fast (2 seconds) for slideshow. The picture doesn't change for minutes! After waiting a while for it to finally changed a couple times, it stuck and stopped!

How can functionality so basic failed so miserably?

update 11/7/2018
----------------------
decided to revise my rating from 2 to 4 stars based on the following:
1. received phone calls and email from Amazon customer service after just a few hours leaving the comment with offer to help. surprised by the speed and appreciate the sincere effort.
2. after letting the device sat overnight, the 'do not disturb' feature started to work and the slideshow is behaving better (still slow, but at least work consistently).

i suspected the device came with old software and were updated constantly in the background. so you might want to let it sit for a while before exploring the features seriously.

The sound is great but I don't understand why I would pay for Prime Music, which doesn't have music videos, instead of just using Bluetooth to play YouTube music or anything else.

It is more of a speaker, an awesome speaker, that was given the ability to search the web as an afterthought.

If It could cast audio/video from my phone to the device then I would give it 5 starts, but since it is just another Amazon consumption device I can only give it 3 stars.

reviews.reviewTitle: Slower than a 1st gen echo (original echo). The sound will cut out, good luck getting it back
reviews.reviewText:
I really tried...
I liked being able to play amazon prime and hulu, but quickly learned that asking for a timer would drop me out of the video and not resume it, oh and trying to pick a specific episode is an exercise in frustration. Not too useful in a kitchen.
I liked having a screen that displayed photos in my kitchen that I hadn't seen in years, but then I noticed they would play in order with no sorting options.
I liked seeing my upcoming events, but having an all-day event display all day in the center of the screen seems excessive.
I really liked the improvement in sound quality...

I was willing to work with it, and then, like so many others here, it rebooted suddenly while playing a video and when it came back, there was no sound. I followed the instructions to reboot, no sound, rebooted again and again, no sound. Finally I did a factory reset. And then I realized I had just spent 2 hours of my life messing with a glorified speaker with a screen and I had only had this device for less then 2 weeks...

So I'm done. I hope they actually start fixing this thing. It could be useful, but they've lost me. Not sure I'll continue investing given the advances from google and the overall device usability from apple (side note, a 32 gb ipad is on sale for 250...kinda makes the regular price of this kinda sad).

And as a final kick, did the trade in an old echo thing, hadn't sent it yet. So, to cancel, I'll be charged 5 more dollars until they get this junk back...just kinda bugs me. I realize it will work out in the end (if my return is processed), but it bugs me to be charged any more money for this waste of my time.

Main use for me was to monitor cameras. Device unable to return to previous screen if WiFi blinks. If it buffers it does not recover and the screen returns to home. No battery so if I move it, I must start over. Too much hassle. Wanted a device were the screen would stay were I placed it. Liked the large screen . Picture good. Weight good for stability. Wish there was an app store for all apps so I could see my professional hard wired cameras not on amazon's list. Alexa skills are good but in my opinion apps allow more choices.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice screen, counterintuitive and clunky interface
reviews.reviewText: I can’t believe this gets decent reviews. My $30 Amazon Dot works better. Why, I have no idea. The interface is counterintuitive and clunky. Sound quality is decent but in a “Bose” bass heavy kind of way. I’ll use it as a cookbook, for music in the kitchen, as a timer, and to check the time and weather. Other than that, it gets confused too easily.

reviews.reviewTitle: Disappointing... Why have a video screen when you can't really watch videos?
reviews.reviewText: I really should have just bought a tablet and a stand. Don't buy this expecting to watch videos, really any videos. Music videos and youtube kinda work, by going out to a browser and navigating to a video, but it drops out of full screen each time. Other video services don't work at all. No headphone port either but you can bluetooth pair a set of headphones to it. I was really hoping for a device that could sit on my desk and play movies while I work, but this isn't it.

This echo would be a great product but it is the worst thing ever if you have kids. It will not allow you to put any sort of parental protection on it to block your kids from using it. I've reached out to Amazon multiple times to see if they could do something such as putting a pin on the device, but the only thing they said I could do is remove my account off of the device, which kind of defeats the whole purpose of the device. All in all I am disappointed with this product. If I could return it, I would in a heartbeat.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Show Doesn't Hear Wake Word If Music Volume Is Over 50%
reviews.reviewText:
This is a mixed bag; I want to like the Echo Show so badly, but I'm having some major issues.

To start with the bad points, if the music volume is over 50%, I can put my mouth 3 inches from the microphones and scream the wake word as loud as possible and it doesn't seem to hear a word I say. How can it be so much worse than my regular Echos, which can hear me say the wake word from across the room with my music playing almost as loud as it can go? I've tried different locations to see if that would help, but it hasn't.

After using it for about a week the sound completely went out. It showed that music was playing, or indicated it was speaking, but no sound would come out. I had decided I had received a bad unit and was ready to ship it back when I found other people on the internet who were having the same problem. Turned out that if you pull the plug out from the back of the unit (but not the wall) it resets itself and you get volume back. The problem hasn't shown itself again.

Then about a week later the Echo Show started responding very slowly, or not at all. The display would not power up when detecting someone nearby like it had when I first got it. Unplugging it and plugging back in has seemed to lessen the problem.

The Echo Show is definitely sluggish in responding to many actions. There's a noticeable delay after pushing a button or making a request that the action happens. Seems like a faster processor would solve a lot of that.

I big gripe on not only this Echo Show, but also my regular Echos is the inability to set Alexa's speaking volume separately from media volume. If I have had music playing loudly the next request I make Alexa responds so loudly it can wake the entire household.

On the plus side, the sound quality is very good. Out of the box, the bass sounds somewhat boomy and muddled, but with the sound controls most of that can be eliminated. I'm still adjusting it, and it seems my adjustments for one type of music don't sound so good with other types. Custom presets for the type of music might be helpful.

The screen looks great! I was concerned initially because the specs weren't that great compared to some of the other devices I regularly use, but in practice it's bright and clear.

The unit itself is nicely designed and looks like a quality piece of equipment sitting on my countertop.

To sum up, overall the Echo Show does what you would expect it to do. It looks and sounds nice, but the big issue with it not hearing the wake word when loud media is playing is close to a deal-breaker. I have music playing almost constantly on it, and it not being able to detect me speaking is huge. There's enough I like about it that I'm keeping it in hopes Amazon releases an update that will improve its hearing.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is what the first generation device should have been!
reviews.reviewText: Screen size is perfect, I got the first gen show as a present. Which got the family hooked, we had an echo previously, but the Show opens up so many use cases. My son loves to see the lyrics as he listens to songs he's never heard, like the Beatle's Blackbird. We play games, see the the weather for the week ahead, have our photos scrolling through, see upcoming tasks, see news items we've missed or weird things to know. The list goes on. Home Hubs have been available for over a decade, but the Amazon Show 2nd Gen, makes them a reality. I use the first gen show on my desk, with is the ideal viewing angle.

What is happening with the sound!?! As in, there is no sound at all. Can’t hear the weather, music, nothing.

I can see it is responding with the blue line on the screen, but there is no sound.

We had the issue before and unplugged it and plugged it back in and it restored the sound. Now it’s silent. I found a message board with many people experiencing the same issue. Customer service and resetting the device to factory settings didn’t work for them either.

I am extremely disappointed. Will be returning.

reviews.reviewTitle: Before you rock out adjust the bass settings down a bit.
reviews.reviewText: This generation of Alexa sound great, we did have a problem with it at first, we didn’t know it had an equalizer so when it came it was factory set with the bass and midrange set halfway up the scale which ended up blowing the speakers once we turned it up, Amazon was good about sending us a new one in just a couple days and having us send the one we had back so they could analyze it since it had just came out at that time. But besides that, it works great and sounds great, I would suggest buying it......... just turn down the bass a bit before cranking up the tunes.

Alexa is frustrating. Cannot open apps like Netflix or youtube.

Even prime video is frustrating because there are no touch options to navigate. You ALWAYS have to use Alexa and well let's be honest, Alexa is quite frustrating with foreign movie titles or names.

The sound quality is 10/10 and that's all I use this for

I have the original show and I knew my parents would love one, so I bought a new generation of it for their house. I now have total jealousy over this large and beautiful screen. Works great and a side by side comparison shows no loss of sound power from first to second gen at all. Super easy to set up, very intuitive too. Even my elderly parents are loving all those features. Bonus....since I commute between my house and theirs, I'm never out of touch and can see my house via all my shows, spots, and show 5. Perfect!

reviews.reviewTitle: 30 second timeout and timeout watching cameras
reviews.reviewText:
Very disappointed that the time out of 30 seconds cannot be turned off.

When I use my smart home to view my cameras, it does not pull it from my local LAN, it goes out to ring.com. It should connect through my local Wi-Fi. For people who don’t have the best Internet connection in rural communities, going out to the Webb to view cameras makes them pixelated. When I view the cameras through my Ring app on my iPhone it uses the local lan.

I’m going to return this device. Hopefully the third generation will be better.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice sound, good screen. Worked with Ring for about 24 hours
reviews.reviewText: Nice item for the kitchen. Alexa seems to be improving. This set up and worked with our Ring Door bell for about 24 hours, also worked with our IP camera's via the Monoclecam app for about the same time. Now will not connect to either. I spent a long time on chat with Alexa Support and they couldn't get it to work either. So they claim it is the Echo's fault and are sending me a new one. I will try to update this when I received the new one. We will probably keep it whether it works with Ring and cameras or not.

The sub-woofer on our echo show is blown. We mostly use it to listen baby/nursery music and relaxing music on the weekends with the volume at 7 max, the sub-woofers are poorly made to go out playing baby shark. We have never had issues with the audio quality echo dots, they seem to work great. Also, extremely hard play 2 different Spotify playlist on 2 different devices.

I bought 2 of these on a Black Friday deal for our adult children. They love them! Decided to get one for our home so we can video chat since we have a new grandbaby. I was all set to order, when I decided to do a quick google search. I actually found this at Best Buy for $70.00 less, with a free Echo Dot, and free 2-day shipping. I order A LOT from Amazon and consider myself a loyal customer, but, obviously, chose the much better BB deal. I don’t understand why Amazon sells its own devices for so much more!

Honestly I was very much looking forward to getting this product, unfortunately not so much anymore. The sound from the original Alexa was soo much better. The reaction time on this is very slow. You can’t turn off the automatic time out feature so forget using it for a recipe, or a website that you are reading. After 5 minutes it goes back to the home screen to continue offering suggestions of things to do and so on. I talked with technical support and was informed that this feature cannot be changed at this time. I’m very disappointed!!!

I put one of these in my kitchen and I’m loving it! I’ve come to love the echos scattered around my house and having one that sounds and looks great for recipes and watching prime video while I cook has been great. I highly recommend a stand for it too. I like to adjust it for optimal viewing if I’m right on top of it at the stove or across the room. The speakers sound great for this price range too. The only bad thing I can say is that with the speakers on the back, if I push it too far into the corner under my cabinets the sound bouncing around can get a little weird and the bass goes a little wonky when it gets really loud under there.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great volume and it finds your phone!
reviews.reviewText: I won this at a company event, so the price was definitely right. I have echo dots on my wish list, so this was super sweet! The volume is AWESOME! I've tried a few different wireless speakers and unless you spend a fortune, your music never gets loud. This certainly does! Since I'm not fully integrated into "Amazonland" with all the products, I really haven't explored all the features. It's awesome to listen to my music while cooking, set timers with voice commands and find my phone when I inevitably lay it down somewhere. Looking forward to getting a few of the dots and seeing how this product works with my Fire Stick. So far, a fun product.

I just unboxed and set-up my 2nd Gen Echo Show, this device sounds...AMAZING!!! Set-up was a breeze, took, all of 10 minutes with a new software update download and install. Ordered it via the Amazon mobile app, it was on sale for $179, I was prompted to trade in my 1st Gen Echo Show for $45 and then received an instant $30 gift card making the total investment $113 I originally wanted the Apple HomePod, but at $350 plus AppleCare and taxes, $400 was just too much for me to consider investing in a smart speaker. This device is worth every penny and I’m so glad I was able to snag it at such an attractive price point. Cheers.

Alexa show has been one of the best purchases we have made lately so many functions! Not to mention our little ones are able to ask Alexa to play Disney music all day!! Nothing better than hearing the sounds of “I just can’t wait to be king” blaring through out our kitchen and living room while our littles are dancing and giggling!! Also love that I can access time, temp, reminders, set timers, and have recipes right at the command of my voice in the kitchen and all visible on the screen at the same time!! I highly recommend this product!

The unit will stop playing prime movies or spotify music whenever it wants. That happens if I can even get it started. The echo show It hangs when asked to start a movie or show so I have to reboot it often. This happens through voice recognition or touch screen. Voice recognition is sometimes very picky or sloppy. I don't have a philips hue bridge and that might be why it doesn't connect to my Philips lights often. Sound quality is good though. Hindsight, I should have bought a fire tablet and a bluetooth speaker.

Not a computer savvy kind of person and instructions could have done a better job of walking you through it, rather than having to go to multiple web links. But even I got it working in about an hour. Suggest not doing while kids are watching you waiting for it to work - downloads take some time. Once working, it is really great. Fantastic sound quality and great voice recognition. Already doing things with it I never expected I would bother with

reviews.reviewTitle: Screen seems like a nice addition but very poorly utilized
reviews.reviewText:
I've got Echo's (Gen1, Dots, Tap, all except Show) all over my house and figured I'd add an Echo Show to the Kitchen. Seemingly nice addition, but realized fairly quickly that the screen is really rather useless. I ask it to search for recipe for dinner for instant pot...only searched one site...great (sigh). Got more specific and asked for my favorite vegetarian chili mac recipe for instant pot...couldn't find it because it only searches one site (and nothing else). Tried to watch some videos which wasn't very intuitive...also a fail.

I mean, it's a touch screen, so theoretically it's like a tablet, right? Um...no.

If you just want visual output for Alexa, then this device is it. If you want anything else, including something which can make managing your life or home easier, then you might consider the Google Home Hub or even a inexpensive tablet instead.

There isn't enough granularity in sound volume - there are only 10 levels of volume. There should be at least twice as many. Also, Alexa voice volume is considerably louder than media (music) volume at every level, and it's uncomfortable.
Other than that - the device required getting used to, and getting to know it. It's actually not bad.

So, my youngest decided to pull on my original echo's power cord causing it to fall and break. We decided to upgrade to the show. It was the right choice.
Have the visual feedback for things like news/sports/weather and even music lyrics is pretty awesome. The kids love using it for fun and even help with their homework. A definite upgrade.
The only issue I have with having multiple Echo devices in the house is that sometimes getting music to play on the right device is difficult.

reviews.reviewTitle: If only it could display day/date on Home screen
reviews.reviewText:
First, my only negative comment - I’m surprised and disappointed that there is no option to display the Day and Date on the Home screen in addition to the Time. Since Alexa “knows” the info, it seems that it would be an easy fix for the engineers at Amazon to program an option to display Day and Date on the Home screen.

The Echo Show is a very good personal assistant, entertainment and utility device for our kitchen. Setup and integration with multiple music streaming services (Amazon Music, Spotify, SiriusXM) was straightforward. Sound quality is good for a device of its size and it’s very convenient to play nearly any song or artist if you are an Amazon Prime or Spotify Premium member.

We integrated the Echo Show with our Ring Door Bell (“Alexa, show me the front door”).

We use it often to create our shared Shopping List, which is accessible from the Alexa Mobile App (“Alexa, add Milk to the Shopping List”).

If you have a second Echo device, like a Dot, in another room, you can use the Drop In feature as an intercom to avoid yelling from room to room or from upstairs to downstairs.

It is convenient to have a “hands free” personal assistant in the kitchen to answer basic questions, follow a recipe or set timers.

Alexa can also control many ”smart” light bulbs/switches.

All in all, I’m happy with my purchase, we use it daily and I’d probably miss it if it were gone.

The audio and video quality is excellent. It doesn't seem to respond to inquires or commands quite as easily as my echo dots for some reason. I bought it bundled with a Ring Doorbell 2 and wanted to be able to quickly see who was at my door while in my family room. The problem I've had is with placement. The tables are on the sides of the couches and chairs, so the device is not facing me or others, which is likely part of the problem with the response. There's no convenient place to put it...certainly not like I see people making these things work easily in commercials. I still like it a lot. I just have to figure out how to use it more effectively.

I have been extremely happy with my echo dot and echo spots and was hoping the echo show would be on par. I got this for my bedroom and was excited about the video compatibility with Prime video and Hulu. Almost every time I ask Alexa to play something on Hulu or Prime video, I get a response that my request is not supported or it acts like it is going to bring up the video, then it just goes back to the home screen. The touch screen when trying to play video that way is extremely slow at responding as well, and often does the same thing...returns to the home screen after a few seconds. I thought it might have been a WiFi issue, but I have tried on both the 5gh and 24gh networks and even placed a WiFi booster in the room to ensure I had a strong connection. Still the same issues. Pretty disappointed.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very integrated, gorgeous display, but can't view monthly calendar or watch Netflix
reviews.reviewText: I bought this to try to replace using a "paper calendar" so everyone in the family can see everyone's calendar in one place (kids aged 16, 12, 8) and it makes planning easier. I linked it to my google calendar and am in the process of creating a "family link" family calendar. The Show will display the calendar in line-by-line, but not a monthly view. When I asked "show me my calendar", it works. When I asked "show me this month's calendar", the reply is "Currently, this calendar query is not supported". So take the answers to questions about being able to view your calendar with a grain of salt depending on what you're trying to do. Also, I had hoped I could lock the home screen on a calendar view, but that's not an option either. I REALLY hope the ability to see your calendar in a standard calendar view a month at a time is made available. Outside of that, everything else about it is great - works like a standard Alexa device except with video. Pretty awesome. It just doesn't do what I primarily purchased it for (and was led to believe it could do by reading the answers out there to customer questions), so gotta go with 4 stars.

reviews.reviewTitle: Way to expensive to be so limited.
reviews.reviewText: Sounds amazing. Works good. But don’t wast your money. Buy a kindle and a big as Bluetooth speaker for less money and get allll the same features plus extras. Why are these so expensive?

reviews.reviewTitle: A Welcome Addition to the Family!
reviews.reviewText: Alexa is like another member of the family and the Show takes it a step further with interactive video. We now have multiple Alexa devices in our home and can't fathom how we ever got along without her. Just be careful saying her name in casual conversation...she will butt in.

I have purchased a number of Echo's over the past few years and have the first generation show and love it. This second generation puts everything to shame. It is stunning! The picture and sound quality are incredible. You could actually use the second generation show as a beside television. I do. I will be buying additional Echo Show's as upgrades for the other rooms in my house. It is a wonderful product and if you sit down and learn all it can do, It can actually make your life easier. I use Echo for all my lights, alarms, cameras, intercom, music, shows, news, cooking, etc. It takes times and the purchase of other products to do some functions, but well worth it. I just love the new Echo Show. Thank you Amazon.

reviews.reviewTitle: Needs to be able to add apps and use netflix and you tube and a search engine
reviews.reviewText: I love it! With the exception you can't and apps or use netflix and you tube easily and theres no search engine like google. These features would make it not only perfect but the most useful tool I'd have at home. I have my own recipes I don't put on the internet like all recipes cause they're my recipes and I don't want to share them with the world and since I don't I can not access them with Alexa. But if we could add apps....I could download my app I save my personal recipes to and access them.

reviews.reviewTitle: A cute device which is still work in progress
reviews.reviewText: Alexa is like a helpful assistant which is pre-programmed to do a lot of small inane things like weather, news, give insights, play music, photos, etc. But the biggest disappointment is the lack of seamless integration to videos, existing social media accounts (amazon has none) and most importantly US centricity - all the claims works if you are paid customers of some of Amazon's favourite partners. If you are not too bad for you - you can help Alexa fine tune its AI capability by banging your head trying to get stuff which frankly somebody sitting in a backoffice is trying to help Alexa understand and program for future consumers. Be ready for many "I don't understand" and then keep worrying whether it is picking up private stuff as a trade off for your effort to help amazon become better.

reviews.reviewTitle: New version is a major upgrade
reviews.reviewText: The new version of the Echo Show is a huge improvement. Much larger screen than before, better sound quality, and it also acts as a bridge to control lights and switches around the house. I liked my previous Show, but this new version is a huge upgrade.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy Setup, Excellent Sight and Sound
reviews.reviewText:
It was packaged well and functions great! We enabled Hue Lights by Philips. They are excellent! Routines are easy to build. I get up and say Alexa, good morning and a strategic lights come on. No need to stumble through a dark house. End of day I say, "Alexa, good night." and all the lights are turned off. I've also set a programmable timer (WiOn) to control snow melting mats on the stairs to be controlled by voice.
The information and 'Skills' are amusing and some are actually helpful. We can 'drop-in' on our grandkids 900 miles away. Easier than a Skype call. Just say, "Alexa, drop in on NAME." and we have video call. Love it so far.

reviews.reviewTitle: Terrible! Only has been good for playing music, but then it randomly plays videos late at night
reviews.reviewText: This thing is absolutely terrible and has been so incredibly frustrating! When I bought this, I also bought a smart camera, smart bulbs, and a smart thermostat, but these skills are constantly disconnecting from my Alexa and have not been worth the hassle to reconnect over and over again. When I add up the cost of the Echo Show, the camera, bulbs, thermostat, and Echo Dot that I also got, it makes me nauseous to think of the HUGE waste of money. We do enjoy using our Echo Show for Spotify, but the fact that this is the only use we are able to get out of it is ridiculous. On top of being mostly useless, it randomly plays videos ALL OF THE TIME, so we have to keep turning it on and off. Since we only use it for music, it is usually turned up pretty loud, and then it scares the crap out of us in the middle of the night when a video starts blaring. Maybe I just got a bad model since other reviews are decent, but it has been absolutely terrible for me, and I am bitter about how much money I wasted on this and the other devices to go with it.

Great sound quality. I have six Alexa's and this one delivers the best sound yet. Also, to have a screen is very valuable for many applications. Instead of using just a regular doorbell we installed the ring system with camera which is connected to Echo Show. From now on we can see who is at our front door. Great addition to all the other Alexa's we already have.

This thing is awesome. I love being able to watch Hulu in the kitchen w/o bothering my husband while he naps on the couch in the living room! The apps (like SideChef) are great for cooking... picture by picture instructions so mistakes are a thing of the past. The music sounds AMAZING!!! The bass is outstanding and really fills a small/medium sized room very well. The Echo Show (2nd gen) is seriously worth every penny!!!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Sounds good, looks good, I want another.
reviews.reviewText: So up till now all we had were Echo Dots and Echos in the house. This was our first screened device and we love it! It's bigger on the shelf then I imagined in my head which is a good thing! It has plenty of room in there for the speakers and the screen and the speakers sound GOOD. Alexa and I are still working out my wake up routine but the alarm on, lights dimmed on, and music video starting up is a great way to start my day. It works great with the Wyze cameras we have around the house and for video calls too!

The Show Gen 2 has a very good screen and pretty good sound quality. I have to take off as star because it has one glaring defect and that is that the screen timeout is not adjustable and the screen doesn't stay on when doing a task if it times out. For example I am running three timers. With the screen on all three show up, but then suddenly the screen times out and only one timer shows up. Also while it can be used as a picture frame it is relatively short-lived and it cannot be changed.

Tried wyze and blink cameras with Alexa … always a "BUFFERING" issue. So Amazon's explanation is low bandwidth internet. Hey … don't need it to stream over the internet just need it to stream in the house, on the same wifi router, direct. The camera apps for each camera stream just fine, but Alexa has to do something "special" so it reports buffering with occasional video coming through.

I love the Alexa functions and capabilities but it does not provide a decent streaming display.

reviews.reviewTitle: Better than all the other Echos combined
reviews.reviewText: This device has a really nice screen and excellent sound. The display colors are good. It gives trivia like tidbits at the bottom when you are not interacting with it. It's smarter than the Fire Cube. Music sounds really nice, even when volume is turned up high. I couldn't tell if the music is stereo or not. The bass is surprisingly good. The only negative is the unit is kind of big and bulky. It takes up space on the counter.

I got this for FREE with a cyber Monday purchase I made and I don't even want it. This thing is terrible... I don't even keep it plugged in anymore because it isn't worthy of using electricity. Do not buy this. I love tech and was more than willing to give this a shot, but its just garbage. Save yourself the aggravation and just get a Fire HD 10 tablet instead.

Pros:
- Decent speakers

Cons:
Just about everything.
- It is heavy and oddly shaped
- Touchscreen is useless since you need to ask Alexa to do anything on the device
- Heavily reliant on the Alexa App configuration to do anything.
- On screen keyboard is split to the left and right of the screen. Placed a microphone icon in the middle to force you to talk to Alexa who doesn't understand you half the time. (Try entering a domain name in the web browser using Alexa, what laugh)
- No such thing as multitasking on this device.

I wish it came with directions, because other than costing more money, I haven't been able to get it do do anything more or less than the smaller version. Once I can figure it out, or get someone who knows how to use it, I may appreciate it, but for now, it's just taking up space. I personally enjoy reading it's little pop ups, although I don't participate. I tried to watch the news, but you have to go into your Amazon account and something about apps and downloads, which is beyond my technological ability.

reviews.reviewTitle: Technology without good customer service is only a stress maker
reviews.reviewText: It took much longer to receive the Echo show and dot. When I did receive I did the hook up and did not have any major problems connecting to my internet. It was when I was trying to listen to the show play a tutorial that the sound was like a whisper. I also asked Alexa a question and she was barely audible. Volume was all the way up. Called service and through their phone issues I tried to follow their instructions but audio was worse than my show. I could not get manager. Called back and found out that they were having phone issues. Found that audio on music was ok but terrible on Alexa . This unit was definitely dead out of the box and I should have been offered a new product immediately but that was not the case so I asked for a return and full refund. It is a shame because I do believe that the unit would deliver what I was looking for in my home but spending two hours trying to get service is just not worth it. And you have so little in hard instructions to do your own trouble shooting.

The overall looks are great and the sound is wonderful. The larger screen is worth the money depending on how you use the device. We have two of original Echo Shows, one in my study and one in the bathroom. Both are fine the those rooms. We also have a Echo Show Dot which is used as a bedside clock and controller.
All these devices work very well though sometimes we do have to reboot our modem/router when they lose connectivity.

My echo sits in my kitchen, i use it daily
Great sound system, you can ask "her" to play a song and seconds later, she does

so i often listen to music on my echo while I cook
Sometimes, it's a little Mozart, or Alternative Country
The sound system is much improved over Gen 1 and well worth the money
She'll answer questions, keep timers, turn off lights, close the garage door, set alarms
Nearly perfect personal assistant
And.. I can video chart with my son
So a must own

reviews.reviewTitle: Niche product with more limitations than expected
reviews.reviewText:
The lack of YouTube, Netflix, and Hulu support really makes this a niche device for most people. For music, this is great, but you can do this and most other functions on an basic Echo. Also, searching for Prime Video content is frustrating.

We use this in our kitchen so we were hoping for some (now) universal streaming capability. It shouldn’t try to wall off the garden and embrace other services like Hulu and Sling (assuming it can’t resolve the childish dispute for world control with Google).

In sum, unless you absolutely need this to glimpse a security camera in a different area in your home, this device is relatively useless. Sorry, I love Amazon, but this not worth the cost.

This thing is absolute garbage. I end up yelling at it most the time because it never has the function I need. I mean, I do not want to play a game and I don't need a joke, but I would like you to be able to add multiple items to a grocery list without me have to say "Alexia" every time. I basically have a 200 kitchen timer. Everything that I want to do to customize it take 9 thousand steps and just isnt worth it in the end. BTW I have tried to sell it and no one wants it. I was going to send it back to amazon, but i was a day late on the month return.

I have tried and tried to give it a chance but it just isnt worth the hassle. Buy Google and save yourself the hassle

Update#2: was contacted. And replacement sent. Working again. We will see if it lasts
Update: didn't last long. What a run around Amazon gives you when there product is defective. The wifi adapter in the show is fualty. Very dissatisfied with this product and there customer service is terrible!!!

I like it. Works well so far.

I have thi and I like seeing the clock at night. But the TRY THIS junkmail type stuff keeps me up. And on my Show, there's the BIG notifications changing every 20 seconds, and the little one. Are any of the Google products any better? Had two ordered the same time, sent one back and kept this one. But, to be honest and NOT CUSS on a Sunday evening, between Alexa's IQ in understanding human thoughts, and this noiseless sort of visual junk calls every 20 seconds, I feel this machine won't be here another week.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is 4 out of 5 stars, here is why.
reviews.reviewText: The voice recognition is not as great as the other devices, the wake word sometimes doesn’t get recognized. I have this paired with the smaller devices and integration is good and has been seamless. I have the Ring Alarm and cameras and this does work well but would like to see the Show be able to show the camera during motion or bell press, rather then just tell you there is motion or bell press. Sound quality is better then the smaller devices as it has more bass and better all around sound, especially when paired with the echos.

I thought at first I'd made a mistake. I bought 5 of these 1 for each of our homes and 3 for our children to have in their homes. I wanted to be able to keep up with the grandbabies and I thought this way they could call me on Alexa and not bother with Momma. LOL. Well I couldn't figure out how to hook ours up so they worked on different phone numbers on my acct. If you have one of these and haven't figured out just what they can do, spend a few minutes with one of Amazon's wonderful Show experts! THEY ARE AMAZING! After I got off the phone I taught the young ones a few things. LOVE LOVE LOVE

We really like our Echo Show. It is way more useful than we would have thought. The sound is excellent and it is very handy just to ask Alexa to play your favorite music. The interface to control lights, outlets is handy also just ask and it is on or off as needed. My wife uses it for recipes when cooking dinner etc. Too many pluses to list but we highly recommend the Echo Show.

I've been wanting the Show for my kitchen where I look up recipes. Screen is the same size as my Fire 10HDx, but the sound quality is so much better. I can watch a movie or online videos while cooking.

I'm struggling to add apps to it. On the Fire (which was on a Show dock) I could access FoxSports Go, Curiosity Stream, and many more. Some things I can access through the Silk browser, but others elude me.

However, because I can see my recipes, this unit is a welcome addition to my kitchen.

Update 8/22/19
Amazon support was great. Right after I posted my disappointing 1 star review, I received both an email and phone call on how to resolve this issue. Sound is working now after an unplug/re plug from the echo itself and not the outlet. I’m upping my review to 3 stars pending further use of this device and also because I’m still disappointed I had to experience this nonsense for a brand new system out of the box.

Original review : Right out of the box on first plug in, I would expect a system like Echo Show (2nd gen) to work and this one although somewhat functional, the sound did not work at all. The mic worked fine and Alexa would respond to my commands visually on the screen but zero sound. After reading a few support forums, this one included, I was able to reset and unplug/replug twice before the sound finally worked. After a month of use and having to unplug to the device to move it, the sound stopped working again. No amount of resets and replugging would get this thing to work. A piece of junk if there ever was one. One shouldn't have to reset and fiddle around with a brand new device to have it work the way it should, being brand new and a product from Amazon. Very disappointed. Returning and getting an Echo Plus instead. Fingers crossed!

reviews.reviewTitle: All sound, sometimes just stops...and there is no fix yet!
reviews.reviewText: Basically the unit is fine, but there is a glitch with the software. The sound, after a couple of days, just disappeared. I unplugged it from the wall jack and restarted it. No change. then I went through the process of resetting it to factory defaults and still no change. So I went online and found a blog of a slew of people with the same issue. Apparently the fix from Amazon is to unplug from the back of the show, not the wall, and it fixes the problem. So far I have had to do that twice. Obviously it is something that Amazon knows about and there is no permanent fix for the moment. REALLY?! Other than that it is fine. BTW, this is the first bad review of any Echo device I have.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fun item, needs more interaction still
reviews.reviewText: Well I was extremely excited to add this item to my smart home as the center hub. So far all is easy to connect, and really works great. But quite honestly seems to be missing functionality options. Lke to see google as a main option, like to see netflix and maybe specific apps. I get it Amazon, they are competitors yet also they compliment your item to make the show more important in home. Specific things for "Show" would really make this item more valuable. Otherwise the price even on sale seems high for what it does. Video quality is great as is sound. Just add more it can do.

reviews.reviewTitle: great entertainment in a small package! My Show!
reviews.reviewText: This unit is amazing—I am using this as a replacement for the smaller unit which I gave to my granddaughter. It has a good sized screen and is also good sounding and I have a home theater to compare it to, and it is adequate for my kitchen. I get a morning meditation if I want it, a check on my morning commute, and the NPR news. I am seriously considering getting another Show for my bedroom. I have a Spotify account, and it provides most any request I make for a song, group, or composer. Really a nice addition to my home entertainment—

reviews.reviewTitle: Why? Turning off things to try!! Are not allowed to remove it?
reviews.reviewText: Turning off things to try!!! I hate this annoying line on the bottom of my screen!! I went to rotate once but it is still coming back! AMAZON 2018 why can I not ALLOW TURN OFF THIS ANNOYING FEATURE!! Will change to 5 stars when options given to remove things to try off screen!! Update: 2019. Why?? Does Amazon not allow the customer to turn off the *things to try"? From my echo show screen. Can someone give a real answer.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fantastic Second Attempt: Still needs work
reviews.reviewText: The second iteration of the Echo Show is a marked improvement on the original. The sound is truly impressive and the response times are nice and crisp. However, the lack of an internal battery, and standalone YouTube app severely dampens my love of this item. Furthermore, more thought should have gone into an optional stand for this. (i.e. one that tilts, swivels and can move up and down.) It seems the kitchen counter is where it's designers focused but it works in so many other places that a little more design thought would add multiple user experiences.

Alexa runs my house in just little ways like cameras, locks, lights, TV, etc. The last thing I needed was more Alexa. BUT I caught this on sale and I really love it. In the kitchen I can view the door cameras or play CNBC while prepping a meal. The sound quality is excellent. Now my older gen Echo is on the patio, the spot is in the master bath and the dots are everywhere else.

The next sale I am catching one for the master bath - guest room gets the spot.

I LOVE my Hues bulbs. Snag them if there is a deal.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love Love Love my Echo Show - Replaced older unit just to get newer features
reviews.reviewText: I love my Echo show and replaced it only for the newer version with larger screen and some better features. My other one still works fine. This product lets me talk with my grandkids several times a week- up close and personal without the annoyance of holding a phone or them holding a phone (which makes me dizzy because they can't hold it steady)....I also can talk to them longer because we are not using Mommy or Daddy's phones. One of the best things I ever bought for myself and my grandkids.

Received this as a Christmas gift and if worked perfect, one of the coolest devices I own. However, on 4/4/19 is stopped connecting to 5g wifi and stopped streaming without constantly buffering. It has been in for service, returned with same issue. Amazon sent a refurbished one, same problem. Customer service claims they are working with tech support, but I just keep getting the same emails, telling me to be patient. We have rebooted, reset, reset and reset, nothing. I have consulted with Internet provider, but all is fine and every other device in the home works, so.... gotta wonder if an update on amazons end did something? I will update if it gets resolved.

I've got the echo dot, Echo spot, Echo & Echo Plus. The Echo Plus sounds amazing and best of all but after getting the Echo Show I'm pleasantly impressed!!! It knocks the Echo out of the water easily!!! The bass is phenomenal!! A tad better sounding than the Echo Plus but you can watch movies on it from amazon prime, I love gadgets so I need to see how to put the Echo show to better use with such a big screen. Love the sleek look and I guess the back had to be wide enough to support the acoustics so I'm ok with the size, for this reason.

For previous users of the 1st-gen Echo Show, you will understand. The new model is so much larger and better sounding; so much better for updated 2019 video-watching and video-calling experiences. plus the old one seems so tiny now (something maybe for a closet or other tiny room). Plus my perfect place is the high kitchen counter, and the new tilt-down base makes it useful even when sitting on the lower chairs in the breakfast room. Plus... yesterday I had asked Alexa on my old Echo Show if she wanted to be my Valentine and, the gall: she said "no", because she already had "a strong connection to my WiFi". That was the last straw. Out with the old; in with the new.

I really like my Echo Show. The only thing that puts me off is that there is *SO* much more that it could be useful for. Would be great if it could be uses as a 2nd wireless display for your computer so you could watch TV and surf at the same time. Would also be nice if it didn't time out after three minutes when watching some video content. Would be nice if you could say "home control" and bring up your Zigbee devices, and would be wonderful if it would pair with Sylvania, Philips, and Lutron Zigbee remotes so I could eliminate that "other" hub that I have to use.

This was not something I thought I would want but for Christmas we received the show and two echo dots. They were easy to set up ( We're senior citizens and not super tech savy) and we are having fun with them. We have grandchildren that live out of state so it is great to talk to and see them everyday. Alexa is a lot of fun. We learn new things from her every day. I've figured out how to have music play all over the house. She is great for keeping my shopping list up to date. I tell her what I need and it shows up on my smart phone. I would recommend this to everyone.

After a month and a half the previous five star rating now falls to three with further falls likely. A first the Echo Show worked perfectly and we could chat our granddaughter and great granddaughter live. BUT, for the past week and a half it's either they can't see or hear us or I can see and hear them they can see me but they can't hear us. "Support" (I used that term advisedly) is poor being limited to Google search results. After doing a factory reset, which was supposed to leave the WiFi in place but didn't, we won't know if we can video chat until later today. We are disappointed.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good but stop trying to sell me things every 5 seocinds
reviews.reviewText: We love using Alexa for lots of things, starting the day, tells us the news. I’m still trying to figure out the recipes better. It would be nice if it didn’t try to sell you something when you’re trying to do almost anything. I have prime, music should just be included. Stop telling me I have other categories in a game that I can buy, I understood the first 3 times.
I troubleshoot it the first day I received and spent over an 1 hr with support tech but they couldn't figure out what is wrong with the device. Sending back now on the 2nd day.

reviews.reviewTitle: A great addition to the counter in the Kitchen
reviews.reviewText: This is one fantastic device. My favorites are, Photo Slide show from my Amazon photos, music with lyrics on the screen, any recipe you can think of, weather report from anywhere in the world, I can view any of my security cameras, and so much more. The sound is amazing, the display is outstanding. One thing that really amazes me is, I can ask echo to show me pictures of a certain person from my photo album and every picture will be one with that person in it. A great purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: No Audio Out of the Box
reviews.reviewText:
Buyer beware! Bought on Prime Day. No audio when set up. Tried to reboot several times and did a hard reset. Alexa was mute.

Tried to get an exchange. Passed around the India call center a few times. Manassa said he would process a refund, but no option for an exchange. Not going to pay extra because the unit was defective. This is very bad Amazon service. Beware of yet another nefarious Amazon policy. Not customer friendly. Hear that Bezos?

If I could give it a zero I would. Got it as a gift and like others noted it just constantly scrolls trending things or crap and always has “ask eco...” at the bottom. If I wanted a display like Times Square in my house I’d get a ticker. I hate it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great - but would be awesome with a proximity detector
reviews.reviewText: As an early adopter of the 1st generation Echo, I am a big fan of this device. As I see the evolution and as I prepare to buy my 2nd Echo Show to accompany my other Echo variants - I so wish that there is a proximity locator where multiple Echos are not picking up on each other. Dealing with two Echos responding ( and no - I do not want to change their names) can be maddening. Easy enough to do - Amazon - hope you will consider it as an enhancement for the future.

I have every the old Echo Show and this new one. I def like the new one better as the screen size is awesome. It does sound better as well. The only flaw, which was also in the last generation is when you use the drop in function, or even picture function, the view is not great. It needs to till forward a bit. There are stands out there that will allow you to rotate or tilt, but not do both. I’m waiting for a stand that can do both. All & all i’m Very very happy with the show!

Do NOT waste your money! Alexa can “show” you more useless information than is ever specifically requested. I have had this for about 3 months and the ONLY thing she does reliably every time is set a timer. Honest to goodness, you’d be better off buying a kindle and stand and If sound is a big deal for you get a Bluetooth speaker. She cannot go to Pinterest to search for recipes and unless you like “all recipe” results then again, useless. I haven’t found anything useful about this thing. It would be easier to use if it weren’t hand-free and had a home screen! I’ll update if anything changes ...

Awful speech recognition, compared with other devices. Also, Alexa doesn't seem to understand simple questions, unless phrased exactly as the system is programmed (unlike intuitive systems like Android and Siri). Lastly, installing apps is a pain- you have to do it from another device. 1 star for ease of ordering toilet paper, but such a pain to do everything else.
Constantly disconnects from wifi despite all my other devices having great signal. Have to unplug and replug to recover, every 1-2 days. Super inconvenient.

4 stars because the first day, when I got it straight out of the box, the sound didn't work. I looked up how to get the sound to work & everything I tried didn't get it going. I thought "great, I have to send this back already, I got a dud." I read somewhere that the speakers could come loose during travel & you can plug them back in. Then I realized the device I had is a different generation than the one I was reading about... So I put it back together & figured I'd just send it back. But then I turned it back on & it was working again. After about an hour of messing with it, the sound came back. However, that was a big turn off & hassle, especially since it was brand new. But anyway, I got it working.

Other than that mishap in the beginning, I've had a fun time with it. It's pretty simple to get tasks & commands set up on your phone. I like having Alexa wake me up in the morning & saying goodnight to her & the screen turning off. I like having pictures that I choose scrolls in the background. I just don't like that I can't get rid of the "try this" suggestions at the bottom. But other than that, it's neat & it'll be a great way to Skype with my fiance while he's in the Army.

I’m requesting an exchange. I ordered two. The one i have didn’t have sound. After research, I discovered this was a common problem. Suggestion was to unplug from back. Worked for a few days. When I left for 2 days, Echo would not respond. Unplugged again. Works now but who knows for how long! I hope I get a replacement because I like its functionality, but I don’t want to deal with the issues.

I was hesitant to spend the money on the 2nd Generation Echo Show when I already had two of the 1st Generation. So I waited for a sale to try one out. Now I wish I had bought enough to replace my 1st Generation as well. I know I'll end up buying two more when they go on sale again. If I can wait that long that is... because these are that much nicer looking and the video & sound quality are both a definite improvement.

I also much prefer the Echo Show over the Echo's without a screen. I won't be buying audio only ever again.

And I'll probably just give my 1st Generation away as a gift to my parents and grandparents who would never buy their own. That way it's like buying a gift for them that I get to benefit from!

Full disclosure, this was a gift, so I paid nothing for it.
Pros:
-Good speaker
-Microphone can pick up my voice really well (better than the dots)
-Screen can be nice for video chat

Cons:
-Speaker evoremphasizes the bass (though the bass is adjustable)
-Screen never shuts off (I wish there was a power-save mode for when I am not using it)
-I rarely use the screen, I feel like it is a bit of a niche thing right now

As it stands I like it. I give it 4 stars because I don't really think it would be worth the price, but if you have spare money, it is a nice toy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Do Yourself a Favor and Don’t Waste Your Money
reviews.reviewText: As a stand alone unit ok. Try to get it to work in a smart home with other amazon devices and amazon certified devices such as a Phillips hue bridge, Sensi thermostat, multi room speaker setup (I have all these) and you are in for a headache every day. Every day is what new (or maybe I should say old recurring problem) am I going to have today? Amazon customer service is of little use. If you call repeatedly they have you repeat the same old routine. When you make them aware of it, they get testy. Devices don’t work as advertised. Do yourself a favor and try Google Home. I am stuck with thousands of dollars of these devices that might work better as boat anchors. Every day a new headache. And now they are putting these devices in cars. God help us all. This is a review for the echo show 1st and 2nd generation, as well as the echo devices, and the horrible Amazon customer support.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa needs to take some lessons from google.
reviews.reviewText:
We all know that the only thing Alexa isn't good at is reference. Maybe we need a google skill.

The show is a good device. We have it in the kitchen and it does well. The sound quality is very good. I wish i could tweak the sensitivity. The device in the kitchen often hears me when I'm in a different part of the house trying to speak to the Alexa in that room. But I guess I should just whisper.

Good device, looks sleek and very presentable.

reviews.reviewTitle: Useful, but I wouldn't buy it again
reviews.reviewText: I got this for free as part of the Alexa developer program. It has a really great speaker, and the screen is quality too. On the other hand, Alexa can be a total idiot sometimes, unable to answer basic questions that a simple Google search could. Voice tech still has a long way to go. I imagine most of the price comes from the speaker, in which case I would just recommend getting a nice speaker and an Alexa input or Fire 10. This wouldn't have been worth it if I bought it full price.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love the whole Echo line. GREAT for the VISUALLY IMPAIRED or INVALID
reviews.reviewText: Overall this is a nice improvement over the 1 gen Show. I have multiple Echos and Echo Shows of all types throughout the house. My wife is mostly blind, and as a tool for someone visually or otherwise impaired, it's simply a miracle. I'm quite surprised that Amazon hasn't used that in their marking. My wife calls and receives calls from all her friends and family from any room in the house. Even in the back yard. She plays music and controls all the lights as well with the Kasa devices. The only reason I didn't give the new Show 5 stars is I feel the processor is a bit slow. There seems to be a few seconds delay in responses that I don't experience with my other Echos. But I love it.

I love this device. I thought about getting the Show 5, and decided to go with the one I really wanted and I am not displeased. I can see it across the living room as it sits between the living room and kitchen. I bought a stand, which I recommend, so that I could turn it when I’m in the kitchen and turn it back when I am in the living room. We started with the Echo Spot, loved it and decided to buy the Show and put the spot in the bedroom. I love the skills and finding out how much I enjoy using Alexa.

It seems as though Alexa prefers voice communications, but still hasn’t mastered it. With the 2nd generation Echo Show you would expect the touch screen to have more functionality. Like if you touch the temperature, it would bring up the daily weather without having to ask Alex “what is today’s weather”. More “touch” interaction without the need for voice commands would be preferred. Such as, if i touch the screen while it is playing, I should get quick options like; Pause, Stop, Volume +/-, channel up/down whatever is relevant to the app/skill at the time. Why have the large touch screen and not use it fully?

UPDATE: Performed a software upgrade and so far seems much better. Music consistently plays now, etc.

After owning my Echo Show for 3 months now, I have to say that I'm disappointed from a reliability standpoint. I'm surprised to see how consistently high rated this unit is and can only assume my issue is more on the level of quality control. Almost daily, she will not respond to commands at all, and I have to cycle power to resolve this, which at least a power cycle consistently takes care of this. What's equally frustrating is when I play music, roughly 1 out of 5 times she'll act like she's playing a song (i.e. I can see lyrics moving on the screen) but no sound at all. Again, this is resolved consistently with a power cycle. How is it possible that I am the only one dealing with this problem?

reviews.reviewTitle: A cool device for multi smarthome functions.
reviews.reviewText:
It's larger screen is better and the sound is better and deeper than the 1st generation. I wish it had more options for video apps, but more are probably on the way.
The Hulu function on it is cool, but it doesn't give you the option to choose what episode to view. It auto starts any show at episode 1, which is annoying.
The SirusXM app, Amazon Music app, and Spotify work great on it.
A fun kitchen device!

reviews.reviewTitle: Pretty useful but I never use it for all It's features
reviews.reviewText: Got one of these to replace my echo dot but I don't even use all the features on it and it's pretty much a dot for me still. It's cool that it can do all of this stuff but once you do it a couple times you realize it's way easier to get out your phone and find what you are looking for on there.
