Alexa has a hard time of hearing me too and I find myself repeating things over and over for her to get it right and sometimes she outright doesn't respond. It's pretty cool to say you have one and all but if you are looking to use Alexa to automate your house, try an Echo dot first and then see if you need this.

Over all we really like the Echo show. It works well with our ring doorbell too. We have a number of echo dots and Sonos speaker, one with Alexa so this is an added feature to our system. My husband loves it for looking up recipes as well. Unfortunately Alexa doesn't always do the things she is programed to do the first time. Like turn out lights. She say she is, but it is not 100%

reviews.reviewTitle: Newest update to Ring Doorbell and Echo Show, I can now answer my front door by voice..
reviews.reviewText: I can now answer my front door by voice using the Echo Show. I've been waiting for this feature for 3 years and it's finally here. The problem with my ring doorbell is that I could not pull it up fast enough on my tablet or phone because the person or delivery people would be gone by then. This is instant. I also bought the swivel stand which is pretty pricey in my opinion but it works perfect and it should have been included with this from the very beginning. This swivel stand does tilt in case you were wondering about the older reviews.

this is a unique device, and hence it is imperfect
large iPad like screen with bad audio, is my take. I replaced my first device within a week owing to bad bass sounds. then the second one was also bad.
the first gen Alexa had better sound, so yeah this one was terrible.
moving now to echo plus hopefully will get better sound.
hope in 3rd gen they improve the voice recognition and sound quality
if you want people to listen to their streaming music your decide better sound really good

reviews.reviewTitle: Cant't turn off Things to Try
reviews.reviewText:
Can't turn off "things to try", super annoying feature that is not remotely useful or what I need. It's everywhere, even in the Spotify view. It's too bad, I would have kept it just for the sound quality, the speakers are great.

Another frustration, it looks like a tablet, but you can't use it like one. No apps, crippled mobile browser.

reviews.reviewTitle: Screen size and Sound a definite improvement.
reviews.reviewText: I loved the 1st generation Echo Show and the 2nd generation proved to improve thereon. I like the larger screen when visiting thereon with my grandkids and over all the larger screen help my “older eyes”. The sound is better but, too bad it isn’t focused to the front. I know that can’t be done with out increasing the foot print or finally developing a speaker “behind the screen”. LOL This is not a big deal and actually you get the better sound more directly when you walk around behind the 2nd GEN show, which does not happen with 1st GEN.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don't get to watch stuff with recast
reviews.reviewText: Bought this for wife to be able to watch tv in kitchen.. Remodel done and calling up a channel from recast on this is horrible, and if fire tv is on they send the channel to that device. Channel names are mess and alexa can't recognize them. Would send back but we are now a week outside the return window since I bought this during reconstruction, to keep wife happy. Guess I'll go buy a tablet so she can see the tablo and watch things that way. Amazon.. you really messed this one up.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great as a hub, but have to reset it every single day. Ugh!
reviews.reviewText: I got the Echo Show to use with my alexa devices and it does a great job doing this. The issue with my Show is that the photo playlist stops every day, and the only way to restart it is to unplug it to reset it. I do this every day and sometimes twice a day. The amazon support technician wants me to reset the device back to factory settings hoping this will fix the problem. If I do this, I must reinstall every smart home device. Some of these devices were a challenge to get installed so I don't want to mess with it again.
Do not buy this product, it is very unreliable. Doesn't understand voice commands and can be very frustrating. Returning item and will be looking at Apple.

reviews.reviewTitle: Could be perfect, but it's not
reviews.reviewText: This product could be perfect...but it's not. The "Things to Try" are so annoying! I removed this device from my bedroom nightstand because 1) the things to try is too annoying and cannot use as a simple, full screen digital picture frame, and 2) when I turn off the lights, the screen does not automatically dim out. Oddly enough, I found the Google Home Hub to follow both of these two major points. Now I have a Google Home Hub sitting on my nightstand instead of an Echo Show.

After 2 weeks of having this product, it starting rebooting on ots own every five minutes...then it started displaying an uh-oh error message. Because it was still under warranty....i contacted them to have it replaced and they stated that i had to send it back to them and then they would make the decision whether or not they would fix it. Ummm....ive had it 2 weeks and they have the nerve to say IF WE WILL FIX IT. Its two weeks old and shouldn't be having issues. It should be automatically replaced! It works great......when its working. Im sending it back, but lets see if they deserve me to change my review after their "decision"

reviews.reviewTitle: The Echo Show IS a great Show!
reviews.reviewText: Bought two of 'em and they are a quantum improvement over the previous model. I have a couple of lingering issues with syncing Alexa to some of the smart light bulbs I purchased to "smarten" my home. I don't know if its just an issue with Alexa or with the smart bulbs manufactured by Sengled. I'm still working this issue out, but Alexa seems a bit stubborn. Sound quality is superb as is the picture quality and the price is affordable too.

I can't think of a negative thing to say about the echo show. I use it as an alarm clock and smart home control device and I love it. It can power on my XBox, TV, lights, and wake me up to music with Pandora. I also love that it can connect to my apple music account. I don't use it for watching many videos, but if I had this in the kitchen or living room, the huge screen would be perfect for that. Definitely a worthy addition to a smart home!

reviews.reviewTitle: I would recommend the best one yet
reviews.reviewText: I would recommend this the best one yet the one thing I absolutely hate is the unbelievably stupid annoying text at the bottom of the display with constant messages like try asking Alexa hot to .... there has been numinous complaints on this and nothing has been done to correct this . It kills the effect when you put photos or a screenshot just to constantly have this repeatedly 24 - 7 come on guys give us an option to shut this damn feature off or just remove it completely !

This is my third Alexa device, the others are excellent for asking information and controlling the many other devices I have to help make my home easier to control, lights, thermostat and music speakers. The Echo Show adds even more versatility to my home entertainment. I really enjoy the ability to view recipes on the screen, while I'm cooking. It's nice to be able for view shows on the Echo. The speakers are nice and produce great sound for it's size.

The 2nd Gen show offers some impressive sound quality (including bass). Added AI improvements like only having to say “Alexa” once, then providing multiple directions. Or reviewing results hands free (Alexa: scroll to the right, scroll down, play video 5). These small enhancements really up the practicality of a device like this.

I keep mine in the kitchen, where I can ask for recipes, videos or music. All hands-free so I can continue cooking. It’s great!

I bought the Show thinking it would help more than the Echo. It really doesn't. I am visually impaired and can't read a thing on the screen. The selling point for me was the Show and Tell feature...hoping it could read me the cooking instructions fo frozen food. It doesn't. In fact, whereas it read the Brand name of the food, it goit the particular food wrong. Ahh, well...now I have two Echos.

reviews.reviewTitle: So many options with the show, I’m a tech nerd and I’m still learning.....
reviews.reviewText: Picked this up on Amazon’s Black Friday special. And so far I am loving it . I have WiFi Led bulbs, WiFi power plugs, led strips, and more Alexa enabled devices, and they all work almost seemlessly. Ya just have to be very specific when setting up everything. If anybody has any suggestions on an all in one skill or app that can control most or all Alexa devices please reply and let me know. Because I haven’t found anything that I can integrate all my stuff into. Thanks. I really like this device thanks for a great deal on Black Friday Amazon...

This is another added piece to my house on the way to being a smart home. I placed this in my kitchen and I like the fact that I can get my recipes by touch screen or by my voice when my hands are covered, say in flour or what have you. I am still exploring all that the echo show can do, but for me it's working out. A definite five star.

reviews.reviewTitle: Speakers gave out within one week of having it.
reviews.reviewText:
After owning an Echo Show 2nd gen for about a week the speakers stopped working. I contacted customer support and in the conversation with the Amazon employee I specifically stated that I wanted a new replacement, not just a refurbished one. There is a $50 difference in price between a new Echo Show and a refurbished one and the one I received clearly had issues from the start. They said they would happily send out a new replacement right away.
A few days later I received my package... a refurbished Echo Show. After speaking with another Amazon employee all they could offer was just a return, no option for what I originally wanted or ordered. In most cases a return wouldn't be that bad except I waited to buy this Echo Show on "amazon day" and got a significant discount on my original order. If I were to take my refund to purchase a new one I simply would not have enough to buy a new Show. That being said I will not be purchasing another one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Time Out on Browser is Annoying...
reviews.reviewText: The speaker quality is much better than the Dot. Great for music in my kitchen. My only beef is that the browsers time out way too quickly. I wanted to use it to view my Dinnerly recipes when I cook dinner, but the browser keeps timing out after only a few minutes and I have to reload the browser to get the recipe back up. It's really annoying and I wish they'd fix this. Particularly as they advertise this use for it. Come on Amazon - Fix this!!!

I bought this mainly to see recipes in the kitchen. But I found we use it all the time...to play background music, to set a timer, give me the forecast, etc. And since our photos are backed up to the Amazon Cloud, we use it as a digital photo frame. (I love seeing the "on this date" photos from over the years)

The sound is awesome. And my 5 year old loves reading the lyrics that appear on the screen when playing music. It's really helped him learn how to read (an added bonus!)

reviews.reviewTitle: Poor voice recognition, hub switch is a nightmare.
reviews.reviewText:
Very poor voice recognition, I have to yell at it to acknowledge me and understand requests, speakers in rear of device provide poor hearing ability if you are in front of device. Volume is either too loud or to low with poor to no ability to adjust as needed.
Large screen is very attractive and vivid. Too Much advertising detracts from your screen choices.
First generation Echo Show more user friendly. A nightmare to use 2nd generations Hub if you already have a hub.
Can't set up 2 generations hub without screwing up your whole house....needless to say not using 2nd generations hub.
My whole house was offline for 2 days trying to straighten that mess out and regain use of my original hub. If you are already using a hub (wink etc) stick with it unless you are a very good tech savvy person, there is no place to go for assist for switching hubs. Just plug in the 2nd generation Echo and go about business as usual all will be well.
Not quite what I had hoped it to be.

My brothers purchased this item to stay in contact with our aging mother. Her 2 grandsons on the mainland and my brothers here in Hawaii can drop in on my mother at any time and she loves it. I felt left out so purchased one to jump in on the fun and we love it. I am with my mother a lot but when I'm not with her, this is a fun way to check in on her. Very clear picture and sound. It is as if we are in the same room. Even conversations with those out of state is clear as well. Love this product! Would promote it anytime. Very easy to use and hooks up with all our Amazon products including our echo dots.

Like this much better than 1st Gen Echo show .Much better sound, excellent larger screen , and additional useful features.Adjustable volume for music on screen and visual communication between shows etc. .I was disappointed to find a few expensive stands , but came up with a solution . Search for a 4 inch aluminum lazy susan on amazon.I purchased a few of them and they work great . You will also like the price .

reviews.reviewTitle: NEVER hears you /reminders continuously go off even when dismissed / not a search engine
reviews.reviewText: Extremely disappointed in this product. It never listens to me when I ask it to turn on the lights or to stop the alarm. We have a newborn and not only can it never hear me when I'm talking in a regular tone yelling or even in whisper mode. It only recognizes my husband's voice. I have done the voice recognition multiple times. The newest issue is that the reminders continuously alarm even when dismissing in the app. We got this so we can video chat with the grandparents and every time we do the video freezes or is very grainy is always a bad connection. We have great connection for internet So I'm not sure why this is never a clear view of them during the chats. also another downside when you ask it a question it has limited answers since it is not a search engine. It answers basic questions if you're cooking but nothing further than that. Honestly very disappointed in the product I was hoping for more. Hopefully they can fix these issues. I even tried giving feedback to the echo show and ironically it said it couldn't hear me. This just shows the issues that the echo has.

reviews.reviewTitle: Product Fails to Deliver Basic Functionality - Huge Disappointment
reviews.reviewText: Have had this now for several months and still cannot get it set up right with the Alexa phone app to make video calls. It's basically a glorified clock radio sitting in my master bathroom. Alexa phone app missing key functions to add or edit contacts to support video calls. Instructions and help don't seem to be accurate for all scenarios. Sound is great, but already had a smart speaker. Really wanted to do the video call thing. Oh well, I'll keep trying to solve that problem.

reviews.reviewTitle: Too many bugs and poor technical support.
reviews.reviewText: The Echo Show consistently stops playing videos after on only a few minutes without any prompts or warnings. She sometimes explains things in German even though the settings say English and we don't speak German. It doesn't acknowledge our subscriptions through Prime Video. We reset the device to factory settings and the same problems continued. So bummed because I was really looking forward to the Echo Show and we have enjoyed the multiple Dots and Tap we have. What was more disappointing was the technical support we received. We were constantly referred to the tutorial which did not address our issues and when we finally asked for a replacement unit we were told we would be charged $2## which was more than we paid for our unit since we bought it on Prime Day but we would somehow get it credited back. We said "no thanks" as it sounded fishy. Wished they would have worked out the bugs before launching the product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great screen and sound, love how it will control other devices without a hub!
reviews.reviewText:
Nice screen, great sound - a little heavy on the bass but a built in equalizer helps. The new Show doesn't need hubs to operate Phillips Hue lights and Yale locks or even our Nest cameras! Haven't used the camera in the Show yet...

The ONE thing I wish I could get rid of is the "Try This" suggestions that are constantly popping up on the bottom of the screen. You would think that there would be an "expert mode" or something for seasoned Echo users to get rid of that bothersome scroll. That's my only complaint...

I wish Ring would have an App for my Kindle HD Fire 8 or just have the Fire products work for all the Android apps and not have to have separate "Amazon" apps. Another operating system is cumbersome to say the least. I have a problem connecting to Ring doorbell quickly. From what I've read their booster does not help. Otherwise I love my Echo Show. Maybe should have gone with a different system but I love my "Alexa" products and all that they do.

I purchased this just to have another gadget and was surprised at how great a product it really is. Loaded it with skills that meet my interests, put it in the kitchen and now I find myself using it constantly. The screen images are very good and the sound quality is shocking. The sound quality is nicer than many TV sound bars and really fills the room. I can actually hear it around the house, and use it to listen to Amazon music playlists more than I could have imagined! Movies etc. play crystal clear and the screen size is just right for my environment. Just excellent all around and has become a very good "personal assistant" to access information. You can't go wrong with this product using it as intended.

reviews.reviewTitle: An Incremental Improvement over the last model
reviews.reviewText: I like the fact that it has a larger screen, and the sound is marginally improved. However for some reason it doesn’t seem to be quite as responsive to voice commands as the older one. Plus the “Sand White” cabinet shows dust and fingerprints more than the black one.Maybe they should take a page out of Apples’ playbook and offer it in “Space Grey”

reviews.reviewTitle: DOES NOT WORK WITH SMART DEVICES
reviews.reviewText: I am an avid fan of these Echo devices. I have several Fire TVs, 1st Generation Echo, Echo Dot, several Echo Shows 1st generation, and the Echo Show 5. I purchased the 2nd generation because of the bigger screen. However, this device cannot recognize my smart devices, i.e. Ring Doorbell/Alarm, Smart light switches, etc. It sees the devices but you cannot control it via voice commands. I opened a Support Request back on July 31st and up to now, they still have not provided me a resolution. Support personnel Chris (1st call) and Mauricio (2nd call) were accommodating and followed up on my behalf. However, the 3rd person (Zack) was not helpful at all and gave me the impression that he wanted to hang up on me because he couldn't do anything. This is a shame. This type of company representation, especially in the front lines of support, should not be allowed. I may just end up returning this product. Very very disappointed.

reviews.reviewTitle: You cannot READ your kindle books!
reviews.reviewText: Oh boy, I WON this device from a contest and was so excited. Yes, we love it for music, for YouTube- the kids love this feature... but there are a lot of things I do NOT like... I wish I could have a home screen just like my Fire Tablet! It's hard to figure out right just what the heck is in it......?? AND I wish I could READ my kindle books with it! You can't!!!!!!! It reads them to you instead. Ugh. I just wish I could read my books from it. I hope they add this feature and SOON.

I'm not a gadget person, but what the heck, so I purchased 3, one for each household in my immediate family. I drugged them out of the stone ages too. Poor Alexa is now turning on lamps, checking security cameras and pausing movies... she was easy to set up, which for non geekers is important and she's even easier to talk to. Yes, this was the best gift to self ever

I have several 1St&2nd generations. Hands down 2nd Gen is the best so far until the 3rd come out!
With that being said.
My Echo is my Personal Assistant... Echo set an announcement (Honey I Quit! Make your own dinner! Lol... I Love You) reminders..appointments Literally!
Also my Deejay...who doesn't want to wake up to their favorite artists.. Weather/Traffic Man... Assistant Chef...Video Consultant. Etc.......
I can go on and on. But what I love the most is the efficiency with today's updates on quality gadgets. Gadget maybe cruel to say... My Echo is My Echo. Until it get up and walk out the house on it's own! 😂

reviews.reviewTitle: A generally well designed smart display with a few deficiencies.
reviews.reviewText: My first Echo show. It's a big step up from Echo Spot, in size, sound, and video experience. A 10 inch display makes it easier to enjoy web videos and interact with certain Alexa video skills. However, Alexa listening is not better, particularly when you talk standing from the back of the device. Also, there're some bugs that need to be fixed such as the timer will be cancelled if you click on a web video when there's still time on your set timer.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sound is awesome, picture is ok
reviews.reviewText: It truly has great sound for a 1 "speaker" system. The VR could still use a little improvement as it continually gets the wrong station that I like to listen to in the morning. I wish it functioned a little more like a tablet for the cost. I was looking up something one day and said why not use alexa show as it when I got it would seem to more or less be a tablet in as much as surfing but you got only abbreviated results funny thing is I was shopping for something at amazon which you would think it would bring up the whole website. However this is ok I mainly got it for music and weather/news. If looking for sound and not a top level audiophile this is great. Of course you need amazon music to fully appreciate it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fantastic product, I enjoy the hints, fun
reviews.reviewText: So we use this in the bedroom to control and view our other compatible devices or lis ten to music. The large screen is great looks nice. Blends into our asthetic nicely. Goes dim at night on its own. I personally enjoy the hints/ suggestions. Sometimes I'm not in the mood and ignore them (yep that's an option ) or they are uninteresting. But some are too much fun or informative to pass up. I will probably get a second one for the living room

I was excited to have an Alexa in our home and the family has enjoyed using it. I do find it frustrating sometimes that the search seems limited. If I ask for questions, the results don't seem to pertain to the topic of my question. I tease that maybe I am not asking the right questions, it is not as broad of a searcher like a Google product might be, but I enjoy it being linked to my Amazon account and the notifications and such. It has been a handy tool and great home addition.

Bought this on Prime Day to use with my new Ring Doorbell Pro also purchased on Prime Day. For that purpose it works great. Also love it’s dimming features.

Having had an echo for awhile now, I was expecting some additional perks like being able to actually read recipes from the Kindle app. Having them audibly read to me is not at ALL the same. Also was hoping to be able to see weather radar which seems can not be done.

The biggest reason for the two stars is constantly having to view “things to try” on the screen. Is there some reason Amazon thinks we want this? I think not. Fixing that alone will get you to a 4 star rating.

reviews.reviewTitle: Work with many brands of smart devices
reviews.reviewText:
I have 11 WiFi smart devices of various brands throughout the house controlling bulbs, lamps, light fixtures, plugs, HVAC systems, security cameras and a gas fireplace. I had 4 or 5 different smart phone apps controlling the various smart devices. I purchased two Alexa Echo Show 2nd generation devices to control the devices. One for the bedroom and one for the living room.

The installation was a breeze and all the devices interfaced with the Echo Show with minimal issues. When I did have an issue I called Amazon technical support and they were able to work through the issues even to the extent of getting a Skill or two updated to work properly.

These devices are awesome.

Great sound quality compared to using a fire 10 on a stand but your really need a software update with more of the tablets apps available especially video apps. Also it would be great if people rang your ring doorbell and the Show would automatically bring up video. I bought it thinking this would happen and wanted it in our kitchen where it would give notifications and better video apps. If the Fire HD had better audio I would suggest just getting one of those. We bought this because we thought having a tablet would disappear with one of the kids too often.

reviews.reviewTitle: Less than 3 months and it's dead
reviews.reviewText: Not at all impressed. The unit's sound quality was poor to begin with and the video is difficult to access and then the unit simply quit working after less than 3 months. I tried to contact support and got nothing. The Echo devices are sub par and I would suggest going with Google devices. I don't own any Google devices, but they can't be as bad as the Echo devices.

reviews.reviewTitle: A Fancy Echo Unless You Need Video
reviews.reviewText:
I ordered one of these for the kitchen, primarily to view our Ring doorbell. Our Echo Spot will do the same, but on a smaller screen. We haven't found many practical uses for device beyond how we normally access Alexa through our dots and Spot, so its a bit overkill.

There are several positives that warrant a four-star rating:
- the sound is superb
- it is nice to see the ring doorbell feed quickly when someone comes to the door
- it shows the brightness level of my Hue light when I ask Alexa to activate it.
- being able to see notifications on screen is helpful.

I did buy it on sale, so that swung my decision at the time...

It’s sometimes frustrating that you can’t do things by navigating with your finger. Literally everything is done by voice command. When on Pandora is love to see a list of my stations. When on Apple Music I’d love to see my playlists. Also, it keeps pushing Amazon music on you while playing music from Apple Music. It says at the bottom “Try “Alexa, Follow Future on Amazon Music” The screen is huge and has amazing quality but unless you use prime music it’s pretty bland. The sound is AMAZING coming from this thing. Absolutely amazing. I just really wish it could do more by touch navigation and not only by voice commands.

Wanted to wait a month or two before writing a review. The Echo Show does everything they say it will.
My top features are:
Sound Quality
Ability to hear my voice over audio from Echo Show and background
Built in Zigbee hub
Screen size is perfect for the kitchen/living room
Most of all Skills/Integrations.
My wife was skeptical of our use but after getting 60% of our lights connected she is in love (besides looking up recipes)
My only wish is that some of the skills utilized the display in a more effective manner i.e. provided more info/better displayed
Overall very happy and has exceeded my expectations.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Show -If you got No sound, please read my review
reviews.reviewText: As many reported, mine echo show's volume didnt work out of box. It updated the firmware but didnt have a voice. I called Amazon help to replace the it but they said they can only refund it and advised me to talk to tech support team. After waiting for 15 min on the call, got in touch with reprentative , who told me to unplug the Echo for 30 seconds, and advised me not to start it before she instructs so, after another 30 seconds, she told me switch it on and voila, my echo got her voice back, so please try tech support , it worked atleast in my case, the new Echo show is awesome both in terms of video and sound quality and screen is also bigger than Version 1.

reviews.reviewTitle: They got a ways to go with this product.
reviews.reviewText: I keep trying but the VR algorithms for this product are VERY weak. For example ”Play Amazon video” results in an “ I don’t know how to” response. Ask to play Prime Video and a random video from Prime not a menu. And why does Fire TV have a Netflix app and This device does not?

Love the concept but purchased to use in the kitchen for recipes. The apps just are t up to speed to make it worth using. The commercial for same use look great but maybe in a year the recipe/kitchen use will be user friendly and I’ll try again. Returned item

Bought the Show Gen 2 for both myself and my son. Setup was so easy to do (went youtube to get tips). I love that I can use the show and still be able to use my phone at the same time, as the show uses Wi-Fi connection. I now "drop-in" on my son and grandbaby several times a week. It is like being in the same room. I suggest purchasing the accessory rotating base so you can swivel it around. I also like to play music while cooking, and the sound is great. Recommend this item.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nifty product that you will actually use more than expected.
reviews.reviewText: Great sound from such a small device. Quite intuitive when you’re trying to remember a song as well. Getting the exact order to play certain things can be tricky as it’s a matter of semantics to hear free nighttime stories versus subscribing to a books club. Can not confirm nor deny it uses sorcery. Also has a nice mute feature so it does not wake up any time someone within a 5 mile radius says anything remotely similar to “Alexa”.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easier to talk to than touch
reviews.reviewText:
Was happily surprised by the how good the sound was. I do not however like the rotating home screen of - try this or try that.

Additionally it is easier to tak to it than use the touch screen. That aspect is slow and laggy in regards to the touch input.

This version blows away the first generation. Not only does it sound better and have a bigger screen, but it looks fabulous. Comparing them would be like putting the first Apple Mac against a new one. Not even close.

The incentive program of turning in your old one for credit and then getting a percentage discount, is great, too. But if we're loyal customers of Amazon's technology, they should offer the discount % on multiple items, NOT just one. After all, we bought multiple items to begin with.

I love the sound so much better than the dot! We are in the process of converting our household to work with Alexa...and everything is so convenient! I have it turn off my Christmas lights, scentsys, and lamps. Also looking at the home security system to tie in with it. Alexa calls me Queen Amanda...how can I give her a bad review?? Seriously, the sound on the music is great, and I love everything you can do with it...although, we have barely scratched the surface. Really glad we made this purchase.
Volume stopped working after 2 days. Reset , turned off, unplugged, restart, talk and still no volume. And it's not on do not disturb, you just can't hear Alexa talk. Help.

Useless for basic functions. Want to have the time, temp, day and date displayed at all times? The Show 2 gen can’t do it but the gen 5 with a smaller screen can. WHAT? Want a clock full screen? Can’t do it with a gen 2. These are BASIC things and the boards are full of just this complaint. I have found another product with a bigger screen that does all these things for the same amount of money. Amazon has really dropped the ball on this product (software) and won’t make the software changes to fix it.

We originally bought an Echo Show for our daughter's birthday. She talked about how much she liked it and how the family was using it, my husband and I thought we would get one during Prime. I have been using it for many things such as recipes, weather, answering questions, listening to music and podcasts and discovering many other uses. We have had no problems with the item and would recommend if you like that kind of technology.
Bought on Prime day and I have no sound. Searching for this issue shows that as the units start being delivered more and more people are having the same problem.. Amazon!!!!! Whats the deal????

reviews.reviewTitle: So much slower than the 1st generation Echo Show
reviews.reviewText: Upgraded from 1st generation to the new show for the screen size. Would have been very happy if the performance was like the old one. But for some reason the performance of the new Show is noticeably slower. It takes literally 10-15 seconds sometimes for it to execute the ask. I would say "Alexa drop in kids room" and there would be silence. And then you will hear the ding that it has dropped in. Also the voice recognition is terrible compared to the original. I could say the same command from my sink and the old show would understand it 95% of the time. The new show takes it 50% of the time. Basically I am repeating myself or getting closer to the device 1 in every 2 times. I am not sure if it is the software or the hardware but this is the first Alexa device ( of the 7 I own) that is a disappointment....

We are just getting to know this product, but it is pretty freakin' awesome!!! While doing a video call with my brother (who sent me this for Christmas, we had to be careful not to say "Alexa" because she will try to interrupt the call. To avoid that we started calling her the "one that starts with an A"...I do wish it came with a printed manual. I know there is so much more we can do with it!!! It will be fun to learn. Brother also sent a smart bulb, so she is now turning on/off and dimming bulb too!!

Where to begin. The speakers on the echo show V2 sound fantastic with the bass produced quite literally astounding. I did have to turn the bass down just a tad to stop slight distortion at 100%. Otherwise i have clear, crisp audio on full blast with bass that easily fills a room. The large screen and amazon music are magic with lyrics scrolling across the very nice 720p display. The cooking capabilities are awesome and the ability to control my hue smart bulb lights using the built in zigbee hub is awesome! The screen although beautiful seems to be where amazon may have cheaped out or i may have just been very unlucky. I had my show running for a solid two weeks and sadly the screen couldn't keep up. I came home from work only to find long streaks going across my echo screen. For a device that is meant to be on 24/7 you'd think a better more reliable panel would've been installed. To make matters worse the policy for replacement is a joke. I called and was polity greeted to being told i'd have to send it in for repair rather than what I had expected. What should've happened is i should've had a new show sent out with prime shipping and a return label for the defective one. I understand that people lie to get a second product but that is where the customer would be charged for the second product upon failure to send back the defective one. So for now i am without my show for the next 4-5 business days. The customer should never have to experience down time or feel penalized for having a defective product. In short I love the product but am very frustrated with the support I received.

Worked fine initially now I can’t get any audio. When it did work it didn’t respond correctly to my requests Also it doesn’t respond I’m really bummed I was really looking forward to it. Never even worked a day

reviews.reviewTitle: Device didn’t work out of the box
reviews.reviewText: The product looked great out of the box but no sound. I tried restarting it several times and reset the factory settings and reported it to customer service. After several days it was still not working so I returned it. I am disappointed because otherwise it looked like a cool product. Maybe it was just a lemon.

I admit I thought I was buying a Kindle that also functioned as an Echo speaker. It's my fault, but I'm going to return for a Kindle 10 and Show stand (which I understand has its own limitations). I was shocked to realize you can't install apps like Netflix. It's an Echo Speaker with a screen. Everything works through Alexa and the cloud. I’m sure it’s great for its intended audience but not what I was expecting.

I bought this for my wife because she likes to read and listen to books. It does a good job doing both those things !
It also plays music from amazon which really sounds nice. I like it also because she can turn the light on by just saying Alexa, turn the light on (optional plug you can buy ). Gives visual notifications and voice when you have items coming from amazon.
Can give you the weather forcast and so much more. You can even shop on it and see pictures and full descriptions of items you might want to buy !

reviews.reviewTitle: good sound quality and easy to use
reviews.reviewText:
I like the Show. It's fun being able to see the lyrics of songs being played. The sound is good. The only issue I've seen that is a tiny bit annoying is that when I tell Alexa to turn off the screen, she does. But sometimes when I walk in the room a while later, the screen is magically back on again. There are only two of us living here and I know my spouse isn't reactivating it, so I'm not sure why it's happening.

One improvement I'd like to see with all the Alexa devices is the ability to pick my own WAKE word.

I really like my unit and for the most part it does what I want it to do. There are time where I have to repeat the command but not very often. I would like to see more of the touch screen put to use due to some of the news moves to fast or the words are unfamiliar to me to say correctly to get the report/news. Otherwise, I would have given it a 5 star rating but it is worth having if you like voice commands.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice Quality - But couldn't find the built in Zigbee Smart Home hub.
reviews.reviewText: It's one of those "must have" things. I'd buy it again now that I am spoiled. Built-in Zigbee smart home hub in it can't be found no matter what I do. I purchased bulbs that are supposed to work with the Echo Show because it's supposed to have a Built-in Zigbee smart home hub. I have ordered a separate stand alone Zigbee hub hoping that solves my light bulb lighting problem. I would give it 5 Stars if it actually had a Zigbee Smart Home Hub that I could find and make work.

Started up fine, installed update, but would not recognize any external speakers. Took a couple of factory resets before it would recognize external Bluetooth speakers/devices. No problem streaming to device, but could not stream/pair to external devices... be patient and restore to factory defaults a few times if needed. Otherwise, big improvement over First Gen.

The Echo has decent sound. It is sound sensitive and can pick up its name from about 20 f away. I love that it displays the lyrics on the screen when they are available. While streaming a radio station, like the one I prefer, WMVY from Martha's Vineyard, it inconsistently shows the correct artist playing. Overall, I'm very pleased with it I'm glad I bought it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa is fun. Sound is great. Surprisingly useful.
reviews.reviewText:
Had the original Alexa and it’s a fun toy and can play music anywhere but the sound quality was not so great.

With the show version 2. Sound quality is amazing and fills the room. It will also connect to a better speaker via Bluetooth.

The touchscreen is good and I suppose you could use it to stream shows but we mostly just use the show for music and to answer trivia. Like if you’re watching a movie and suddenly wonder what year Beyoncé was. Oen all you do is ask Alexa and she gives you the answer in seconds.

reviews.reviewTitle: UNFORTUNATELY NOT WORTH THE EFFORT OR PRICE
reviews.reviewText:
This device is very difficult to set up, especially of your trying to link your phone contacts and pictures. You apparently need to install several different apps to use it, which obviously are not accessible through the device.
Most features you think would be enjoyable require monthly subscriptions.
Little to no useful documentation furnished.
Purchased 5, and will unfortunately be returning all of them.

reviews.reviewTitle: Randomly awakens us in middle of night
reviews.reviewText: Privacy invasion. First, my show started randomly playing country western music or recipes randomly while we are asleep at around 3 am then every 15 minutes unless I unpliythe device. I called Amazon today and had to give permission for developers to investigate. They will get back to me in a week. This is wrong on many levels. Further, this show has some voice recognition issues and denies any television connection at times. Do not buy this.

reviews.reviewTitle: Annoying hints can’t be removed so I’m going with Google
reviews.reviewText: We tried the Lenovo device as Google’s search is superior, but the speaker quality is poor and the screen is not real sharp. Sent it back for the 2nd Gen Show. Sound and picture quality are great and there are some terrific “skills”. HOWEVER...There is a banner across the bottom, like the score feed on ESPN, that keeps showing things to try. It is very annoying and can’t be stopped. There is no excuse for Amazon forcing us to see what is basically continued promotion for their product. And we are not warned about this in the product description. It is annoying enough that we are considering returning the product. Update- Sadly it’s too late to return it. Wife got me a Google hone for my birthday, thought about swapping it for a Sho 5 since we have so many Dots, but after reading the reviews about the banner ads and the stupid hints banner, there is no way I am spending that money so Amazon can send me ads all day long!

Held off getting an Echo until we saw the ad on TV. Decided to try it and simply love it! We stayed up til 1:30 am just playing music 🎶, giving A!exa song titles that popped into our heads. Love that the song lyrics show up on the screen. She controls the TV and we are getting security lights and cameras for outside that she can control too. She even tells us good night and to sleep tight. Great companion for homebound elderly!

Really like the Echo show traded up from first generation for this one . Love the big screen love you can rotate wallpapers through really a great product but still have a problem with the fact if you ask it seemingly simple questions it can’t answer unless you have a particular skill for the question your asking and my memory isn’t what it used to be so rembering the name of every skill to open to get an answer is quite a pain in the bottom.

We really enjoy having an Alexa device in every room. This Echo Show is a nice improvement on the previous version which we also have. The picture is great and the sound quality and materials used all make a big difference that make the upgrade worth it. We love this device for video chatting with family and working on math skills with our children. We probably use ours most for music and have really enjoyed having Amazon music along with the device.

There was no sound on my device. The pictures were great. I tried so many things because I really liked the
Echo Show (2nd Gen) but to no avail. When I phoned I spoke with a representative who was quite helpful but still there was no sound. I was disappointed but there was nothing I could do. I got it on the sale day and was supposed to get a couple of bonuses but they were held up. I received the Echo Show on time however.

Right out of the box the speaker was not working. So I looked up the issue online. Turns out it’s a very common issue and you just need to unplug it for 5 minutes and should work after. Now after being plugged in just randomly stops working. Even after leaving unplugged for a duration of time. I purchased to view my Arlo cameras but always has a hard time connecting

reviews.reviewTitle: Sleep functions defeat the purpose of screen
reviews.reviewText:
Works great for smart home functions and other random voice command stuff. Honestly haven't had it long enough to get the full effect.

HOWEVER, if you are thinking of using it for anything that requires the screen to be on for more than 5-10 minutes at a time. DON'T. There is no way to turn off the screen sleep/timeout function. So if you are using to follow a recipe, better get it done before the screen goes to sleep. Watching a video? Better hope it's less than 5 minutes long. Amazon Music displays song lyrics...until the screen falls asleep after 5 minutes. Etc, etc, etc. It seems like, no matter what you are doing, if the screen is active, it will fall asleep after a very short period.

I wish I had just purchased an Echo Dot...would have saved a ton of money and basically had the same level of satisfaction without the frustration.

BTW...the screen timeout complaints have been around since the 1st generation release in 2017. That leads me to believe Amazon as no intention to fix this issue.

I’ve had this product for about a week now, and right from the box it has been nothing but trouble, the screen is very slow, it’s response time has been terrible and it cannot get directions right at all, For example I’ve asked it where the closest Walmart is, it does give me the correct address however it tells me that it’s 10.1 miles away but in reality it’s a little more than a mile away. The sound quality is good, but it’s not enough to justify the terrible performance, all in all I would only give this product a one star rating if that!
PS: Amazon technical support where are you?

I just received my Alexa Show today and love it. It was so easy to set up. So far, I have only listened to the music and it has a nice deep sound. Alexa us a bit loud and if I turn her down, the music is also turned down but that is no biggie. I can always tell her volume up/down. I pulled up the prime videos on it and that is cool. I pulled up appointments and she pulled up my weekly events. Love it. I have a lot more to learn but this is really coo and convenient.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy setup, great sound but still not perfect.
reviews.reviewText:
The first unit I received had no sound at all so had to chat with Amazon to get it replaced. The setup is simple so it is not a huge problem other than the fact I got a defective unit. The sound is very good and video is generally good dependent on your ISP speed. They really could make interfacing with online video services better. I refer to things like Netflix or YouTube, etc..
Adjusting settings can vary from a breeze to a real challenge.

Amazon Echo Show works as advertised. It connects with our ring camera so we can see who's at the front door. Other functionality for the camera is limited so we have to use the ring app on our phones. We also want to install a smart lock that works with the Echo Show preferably without having to buy another device (smart home hub). But it is nearly impossible to get accurate, detailed, concise information about what locks are compatible. Chat with Amazon reps was useless; they didn't even understand the questions. The Echo Show came with a smart bulb from Phillips. Again, you're on your own to figure out how to make this thing work. How stupid are Amazon and Phillips to offer this bundle then leave you hanging with no idea how to get it to work. It took a while for me to figure it out (and I have two engineering degrees and ran a tech department for years), but I still can't get it to show up in the Alexa app on my wife's iPhone.
Depending on what you want to do and your level of tech savy, be careful buying this device.

I’m still learning all the things that can be done with my Echo Show and so far I’m loving it! I like the versatility and especially having a screen to look at! It sits on my kitchen counter and getting recipes, listening to music, watching movies/shows, checking my calendar is great! My grandson loves asking Alexa questions!

The 1st gen worked without issue. Not so with Gen 2. One example is I requested an Instant Pot cooking time for linked sausage, I've used the Gen 1 for recipes quite a bit. My answer on the Gen 2 were recipes for banana pies. Tried a second time speaking clearly. Yep, banana cream pies. Also can't seem to find devices I once had connected to the Gen 1. But... sound is much improved over Gen 1.

We have Echo units throughout the house and just added an Echo Show in the kitchen to replace one of them. The sound is awesome. That was the main reason for getting it. My wife plays music while she's cooking or working in the kitchen and she is very happy with it. We only know one other family member so far with one so we haven't made any Echo to Echo phone calls yet but my daughter is getting one. Very happy with the sound and the functions but we will get a camera cover for it. I'm able to "drop in" the kitchen and see and hear everything that is going on. I can only assume that hackers can also.

I love the new sound on this show, its got much deeper bass and all around sound. Be aware the majority of the speakers are rear facing, as the large screen takes up most of the front, but if you have a good bounce wall that its near, it makes for a full room sound. The screen is a very high resolution, and the additional features on it are great. The voice recognition and "listening" features catch your wake command and questions very easily. I would say its head an shoulders above the old show that I had. I'm glad I upgraded!

I wanted to give it a chance to correct itself before writing a review. After a month of use, the following problems have not been fixed:
1. Volume switches off and doesn't come back on unless I pull the plug and restart.
2. Jeopardy is unplayable. If you answer a clue with "What is America?", Alexa will exit out of the game and do a search for "What is America?". Unforgivable.
3. Playing music via voice recognition works about 60% of the time. Sometimes she will try to convince me someone else is streaming from my account in another location and suggests that I upgrade my prime streaming service (nice try liar).
4. At one point she began reading what I believe was her code aloud to us.

There have been more issues that I can't remember off the top of my head.
I will say that the sound is great (when it works), but all-in-all I prefer my regular old echo.

reviews.reviewTitle: The Best Alexa Product so Far for music
reviews.reviewText:
Great Alexa Product glad I bought it on prime day with the free Dot and Smart have had no problems with it so far
Voice recognition is pretty good but could be a little better but some of it may be due to how loud the speakers are
If they go on sale again will more than likely get another one. They are on back order as of now for about 2 months so maybe a Show 3 is in the works for Xmas ??

I am so glad I waited for the second generation and absolutely love it! However the 4 stars is because I use it in my classroom where I have a student named Alexa. We changed the wake word to “echo” but she doesn’t respond as well to it. It takes multiple repetitions to get her attention. So we ended up just switching her back to Alexa and just deal with it.

Good sound. Since I use it in my bedroom, the only thing I don’t like is that the screen stays on all the time. Even if burn in is not a problem, I have to remind Alexa every time to turn her screen off. It would be ok in the kitchen but there should be a setting for this, like auto-off after 15 minutes of inactivity.

There seems to be a reason Amazon is giving these devices for free.
The device is great looking and sounds pretty good.
HOWEVER, that is where everything stops.
The user interface for Alexa and Echo is absolutely garbage.
I tried to find another word to not be too crude, but, I couldn't.
Amazon, I'm sorry. I'm a huge fan of your great customer service and products.
Why did you design such a useless device from the ground up?
Say you want to play some songs on your pandora, well you will need to use at least 2 devices. You have to configure the station on a computer after going into 10 subselections (really well hidden). Then start pandora with a voice command on your Echo show. That absolutely defeats the purpose of having a smart speaker with a user interface.
Amazon, please allow people to use the screen on the echo show to configure apps, otherwise you sold a very good looking paper weight.

I like that is can be really loud and I can set my alarm by using my voice, but I’ve been having a problem that I can fix which is that Alexa will repeat the time ever so often when I don’t even ask. It will state the name of what is selected on the screen by default which at night I like listening to the radio and every few minutes I either hear the time or the radio station’s name.

It doesn’t even do it all the time, but my brother has the older version and he doesn’t have this problem and he said he noticed it too because he was home alone and was almost sacred to death by Alexa simply saying the time.

Another thing is it seems to have trouble when disconnecting from power Or power gets cut off sometimes after reconnecting it won’t have sound and I have to fidget a bit.

I love my echo show very sturdy, good quality,great sound and make my life easier. My only complaint is that sometimes it get stuck in one response, for instance: sometimes I ask something, like 80 times 9 is...but it keep saying 180 times 9 is....even I repeat the question 5 times.but it happened a couple of times only. Other than that it is a awesome device. Highly recommended. Alarms, clock, calendar, hulu, YouTube, news,music, reminders, and more, everything in one place!!! Love that!! Thank you 😊 amazon.

After watching reviews on the 2nd Gen Echo Show, I decided to purchase it. I’ve had the Echo Dots and I was happy with them but wasn’t sure if I needed a screen. Now that I have the Echo Show, I love the screen. I have it set up in the kitchen and can easily speak to it to search for recipes, control lights, play music and so forth. I shut off the camera for now because we’re not currently using it to do video chats. It sounds great playing music. With the Echo Dot, I would stream music via Bluetooth, but with the Echo Show it fills the room with a nice deep sound. I’m always looking for new things to do with the Echo Show and feel with the continuous skills updating, it will be even more useful in the future.

I’m giving the echo show five stars because I do love all of the news and information that displays on the big screen. However, the primary reason I purchased it was for the ability to have video calls with my friends. While the video clarity is very nice, everybody I know that has an Alexa show, or an Alexa spot, no matter where you place them you’re always staring at people ceilings. I have had two echo show and was hoping the updated version might better resolve this issue, but I still have to place something (book, magazine, etc) underneath the back of it to aim it in an acceptable viewing angle. I do hope they can consider lowering the camera angle or providing an option to some height rotation in future versions of the Show.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good product. Not quite as intuitive as I would imagine.
reviews.reviewText: Our family has really enjoyed the Echo Show so far, but it isn't as intuitive as I would have imagined. I thought that it would be able to do more, especially from a touch stand point. It may be because I am older and want to be able to control it more. I would like to be able to go to YouTube or something like that and then type in what I am looking for. I have trouble getting Alexa to do what I want it to do. My kids do fine with it and love it. I guess maybe it is just me.

So far pretty happy with the show but there is no portable battery for this yet. Requiring this to be plugged in all the time to operate is really a downer when you’re considering the use of video. With the smaller Alexa devices that is fine but for something of this nature being portable is a must. Also when you’re watching the video of the cloud cam and there is motion detected on the Cloud cam it stops the video and doesn’t return.

Useless piece of trash. Cannot get basic stuff working. Called customer service to waste more time. Ask weather and it keeps saying update my address. I see it is right there. Show front door and it says multiple items create group. I couldn't find multiple so I tried creating new group only to be helpless again

I can’t stand this product, the touch screen is very difficult to do what you want and you have to press many times, when you ask for Alexa to play local news she just plays regular news. If you ask to play a reggaeton song she doesn’t understand what your asking not all it’s hyoed up to be not really liking it too much. I have it in the kitchen so i just use her for adding items to shopping list and to lower or put up the AC. Oh and show me front door camera.

I bought this on Cyber Monday and so far I love it. I look forward to having more features in the future, but right now it is great. I also got one for my distant family and we are able to keep in touch so much better. My kids are able to talk with their grandparents and I don't have to worry about compatibility.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent device for smart home integration.
reviews.reviewText: The display and sound quality are really quite good and the integrated hub allows for using smart devices that require a hub to work such as phillips hue lightbulbs. It doesnt seem to pick up my vpice as well as my echo dot down the hall in my officenor the dot down the other hall in my living room but i believe that is due to where I have the show sitting so I will be testing out different places to decide the best location. It does connect perfectly with all the echo dots to have whole floor music streaming from amazon Prime a.d sounds much bettet than just the echo dot speakers alone but if music is your thing then I suggest using the Bluetooth feature or auxiliary cable that the show and dot come with and just use your own choice of speakers. All in all im quite pleased with everything the show can do and have no complaints.

reviews.reviewTitle: Big upgrade from first gen model
reviews.reviewText:
Nice design, big upgrade on video and sound quality. Also, with the second generation model came new software features, like Hulu video.

I purchased the first gen show last year and to be honest It became a music player with a screen. Minus the occasional video call with someone else, that was it's primary use. The screen was pretty small in comparison to the second model and I never would have considered watching anything on it.

The second generation feels like a small TV (requires Hulu w/live TV) in my kitchen on top of being an Alexa / music device.

It also just looks much nicer on my kitchen counter

reviews.reviewTitle: Greatest Kitchen Tool in My House
reviews.reviewText:
I have Echo Dots and Spot and "towers" but the Show literally steals the show when it comes to making work in the kitchen easier and even fun.

Whether it's listening to "Wipeout" while washing dishes or watching a recipe being prepared while I attempt to create the same dish, the Show makes kitchen life easier.

And the 10" screen makes seeing recipes much better than trying to use my tiny cell phone screen.

I literally can't think of a single thing about the Show that I would change or that I don't like.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's fun and easy to use!
reviews.reviewText:
I got this as a Christmas gift from my daughter and have really enjoyed it. It's easy to use and does well to provide a large viewing area of the room - it was easy to set up and is easy to use. The speaker system on it is great as well. I have been.
enjoying this quite a bit - you can watch Hulu and look up recipes among other things. I do wish it would allow three way calling so I can talk to both of my girls at the same time. Maybe something that can be added later

reviews.reviewTitle: I want to love it but . . .
reviews.reviewText: So I love all things Amazon/Echo, however there is a known sound problem with the Echo Show (at least according to Amazon customer service). Every time I want to use this I basically have to unplug it and re-plug it in for it to have sound and then it only last for a little bit, once you change say from music to video you have to do it again. I am currently waiting on warranty information from Amazon.

I am not one to normally submit reviews but I was highly disappointed in this device. I understand that it’s not suppose to replace a tablet but it’s not user friendly. I wanted it for my kitchen to help me with recipes we all know how annoying your phone locking mid cook and having to unlock it to continue the recipe well if the recipe isn’t in Allrecipes and you open it in the browser when you walk away it closes the browser. If that’s not annoying enough when you tell Alexa to open up the browser again it doesn’t open the page you had so you have to search again. I did not realize you cannot do something as simple as Bluetooth to it which is disappointing for a 200$ Device, since I had the original audible I cannot even listen to books on it as my audible will not convert to Amazon. Honestly just not user friemdly for what I was expecting I will keep my dot for things like controlling smart home devices with my voice but am returning the show.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very user unfriendly and way lower tech than the <$50 fire tab.
reviews.reviewText:
....So much less user friendly than it should be. It does not come with a web browser or any platform to download apps from the device itself.
You find yourself basically guessing what to ask it to do, because the home page does not have any icons. The speaker is great, if not way too bass-y (great for music, bad for Alexa).
It’s a much bigger (bulky) wedge shape than you’d expect, and hefty at 5ish pounds.
It should be much better than it is right out of the box.
If we didn’t receive this as a Christmas gift, we wouldn’t keep it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Home screen goes blank after a few minutes
reviews.reviewText: I really don't like this unit as much as the 1st gen unit it replaced. It should be better. And it was for about a week and then the home screen quit showing the images I had uploaded. Now it shows the time like a screen saver until I ask it something. Then the home screen images shows for a couple of minutes and then goes black again. Tried every setting I could fined including a factory reset and noting fixes it. Wish I had kept the 1st gen unit.

reviews.reviewTitle: In this cold weather it's nice to just ask her the temp. here rather than go out side and look.
reviews.reviewText: It was given to me for Christmas and I love having her. She is so good with ant questions ask from spelling to recipes and my 7 year old great grandson spends lots of time asking her just normal questions like math and things he has learned at school and is so proud of her that she gives the correct answer. It's a great way for kids to learn as well of the very many things we adults learn from her and best of all she never gets upset with a silly questionso she will entertain kids for hours.

reviews.reviewTitle: Definitely not my favorite amazon product
reviews.reviewText: I may try and return this product I’ll give it a direct command and it tries to connect to other devices to accomplish it. It doesn’t understand simple commands 10-20% of the time and will do the wrong commands.

Purchasing this along with my other Alexa enabled devices to make my home smart, has been one of the best decisions I have made in years. It is a little bit expensive to buy all of the items however I think it is well worth it for the ease of life they have brought to my home. Been disabled it is very convenient to be able to use voice command for so many functions. I very much hope and look forward to improvements in the Alexa system in the future.

reviews.reviewTitle: Hard pass if you want Audio and Video from the Show.
reviews.reviewText:
We’ve had the Echo Show for ~2 months and in general it’s worked well. I gave it 3 stars because in that 2 months I’ve had to do 2 hard resets to get the audio working again.

Not sure what the issue is but randomly it’ll just stop playing any audio. It still responds to spoken commands but if I ask about the weather forecast the forecast is displayed but there’s no audio output at all.

Since I bought this primarily to monitor 2 Ring cameras a 3 star rating is generous. Not sure if this issue is specific to our Show or if it’s common with the 2nd Gen units but based on our experience I couldn’t recommend one.

I couldn’t be happier with this. It was an early birthday present! The one thing I especially like it for is that in my small in-law apartment, it can hear me call out from any location should I fall and need my son’s help, and will then contact him to come help me. I feel very comforted by this. Then I have all the fun stuff of games to play and information to gather I’m planning on using it to read my audible books to me, as well.

I have 3 Echo Shows (1st generation) and now I have 1 second generation. I use them to make telephone calls, monitor my ring devices, alarm, audiobooks, music, dictionary, thesaurus, exploring new recipes, timer, weather, distances to cities, weather in other cities, calendar events, shopping list and the list goes on and on. The sound is fine for my uses. I am discovering new skills of the Echo Show all the time. I love these devices.

I recently upgraded to the new Echo Show and the one thing I noticed immediately is how great the sound was compared to the last model. The screen size is about right for the area in our bedroom and didn't take up much more room than the old model. I also found the responsiveness of the voice features to be much faster. For me it was a substantial upgrade and definitely worth it. You can also cash in on trade in offers if they're still available which will bring the price down.

Disappointed that the Echo Show goes into sleep mode and no way to disable this. I wanted the unit to constantly show either the home screen or the trends not to go to sleep and just show me the time. If it was not for the unit always going into sleep mode would rate this product 4 stars as it is everything as advertised to be, but the majority of time the unit is in sleep mode with a very small digital time going from corner to corner.

Easy to use, although I wish there were more printed instructions with it.
Our grandkids are far away and this is wonderful, especially since they can do it with a voice command.
Picture and sound are great. Glad I bought generation 2 versions
Amazing how you can call and not use the actual phone of the other person.
Well worth the price.
The quality of the sound it can produce is amazing.
Gr and kids just say "alexa, call grandpa" and away we go.

Replaced the original Echo Show with the Second Gen because it was too good a deal to pass, reduced price, 25% for trading in old Show and a $30 gift card. Like the larger and more vibrant screen. Sound is a little big on bass to suit my taste, but the equalizer allowed me to adjust that very easily. Alexa seems a little faster on the responses on this 2nd Gen Show, although the touch screen maybe not so responsive as the original Echo Show. A worthwhile upgrade.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sound is amazing. Picture is flawless!
reviews.reviewText: This was actually a gift for my 99 year old grandmother. I can drop in on her and video chat with her so easily. She can watch movies on it or any song she can think of. The screensaver can be photos, so she gets to see hundreds of pictures all day long. I can put reminders for all of her appointments and activities on there to remind her. Sooo many wonderful things and its simple enough for a 99 year old to use it!

Can't give this enough stars. First day I paired with my iPhone and can play my iTunes music lists better than any radio, use it in the kitchen for recipes, and make video calls to my granddaughter. The setup was simple once I downloaded the Alexa app on my iPad. The device is a bit larger than the Google equivalent, but it's worth the larger screen and great speakers. Still discovering all the neat things Alexa can do. LOVE IT!

I wanted this for a while now. Started to get it back in the Winter. But I got something else for my home office. But Prime Day came and it was on sell and I couldn't pass it up. So I got it for my bedroom and I am very happy with it. It replaced my Echo which I gave to my mother to replace her Dot. And I'm very happy with it sounds great easy to setup and very useful to get your day started.

I haven't used this product to it's full potential yet. But it's great. I love being able to watch Hulu while in the kitchen cooking. The only thing I can complain about the Hulu app so far is that I don't seem to see a way to choose an episode for a series. It picks up where it's left off. Even asking Alexa for a specific season and episode, it will only play the next one to be watched.
Other than that, it's great. The sound is loud enough where I can hear it over fans and vents while cooking in the kitchen. I did buy the stand for it, because I didn't quite like the angle it provides.

The Show is living up to it's expectations and then some. We have ours in the kitchen which is basically the nucleus of our house and everyone uses it from music, timers, measurements, news, games and more. We currently have two wifi outlets in our house and the set up was easy for Show to control these outlets and have already ordered more outlets and will be getting a camera system in the near future. Also bought two spots, one for my daughter's room and one for our master bedroom. The Show is everything that was expected and more.

reviews.reviewTitle: Same problem as the previous generation Show
reviews.reviewText: It's a nice upgrade from the Gen 1, but still has the same problem of the background photos getting "stuck", when they're supposed to continually shuffle through the album(s) selected. I've gotta unplug it 2 or 3 times every day. Not pleased at all.
Have become very dependent on this device. The voice recognition is good but could be improved. Support when I have had a question is outstanding!!

Great at first then very glitchy. Alexa stopped responding to my voice commands when playing videos after about a week. If you restart her they will work for a little then stop again. I have to touch the screen to stop the video, which contradicts the purpose of talking to Alexa. Also glitches on other basic functions. The idea and design are great, but needs work.

This is my 3rd Echo and I'm generally satisfied with the products. However, I'm having an issue with the Echo Show Gen II. On three separate occasions, Alexa's voice stopped working. The Show seemed to be hearing my questions and responding on the screen. However, there was no verbal response from Alexa. After doing some online research, this seems to be a common issue. Mostly with units purchased on or around Prime Day.

I did find where Amazon tech support has offered a tempory workaround by recommending that you unplug the power cord from the back of the device and reconnect it after a few seconds. The process did restore Alexa's response voice for a few days until it stopped responding again. I hope there will be an eventual software update to correct this issue, or perhaps a replacement unit offered if this issue is a result of a bad batch. Other than this random issue, I am satisfied with the Echo products and Amazons service.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa voice is hard to understand.
reviews.reviewText:
The Echo Show has great sound quality when it comes to music & movies, however I find that the Alexa voice is very hard to hear & understand, even at max volume. The Echo Spot Alexa voice sounds amazing compared to the Show.
The screen quality is great. Prime movies appear flawless as well as Prime Music. It is a good quality accessory. However, as I said, the Alexa voice is not understandable when it answers questions or requests. That is disappointing.

I like the bigger screen, this is for my work desk and I asked lots of questions through the day, especially spelling.
Send quality is not as good as you would think it would be, controls are kind of messy, it’s hard to get it to do what you want, like show contact. I can show one of my cameras, then ask it how to spell and the camera goes away doesn’t go back to it again. Same with showing pictures.

The echo show is a beautiful device! All of my friends that have come over have ended up getting one to. It controls all of my smart devices in our house. Two things that would make it even better is to have a slide show setting. I can tell it to show my pictures and it does beautifly, but it defaults back to the home screen if any messages pop up. I also have an Amazon cloud cam, the echo show will tell you someone was detected at the front door but not give you a video feed to show you without you verbally telling it to do so each time. That should be a setting that we choose to make automatic.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don’t buy it as a gift for someone else.
reviews.reviewText: The product works well, but I bought it for my wife. She is unable to convert it to her information. It has locked in on me and inspite of Amazon’s assistance and multiple attempts they are unable to get it to recognize her account. I would not recommend the item as a gift...unless it is a gift yourself.

reviews.reviewTitle: Tiene que entender español, añadir en settings
reviews.reviewText: Me gusta todo pero no está el idioma español incluido y las personas que vienen a casa no podemos compartir con ellos y dicen que si no entiende español no les gusta

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to set up. It fully meets my expectations.
reviews.reviewText: Originally I just got it for mundane tasks such as weather forecasts and searching the web. After getting it set up I've seen all that it can do. I also started controlling lights and fans around my home. Switches and plugs were very easy to set up with it. I needed no hub with it, only the software that comes with the devices. One thing I held out for was the premium sound of the 2nd generation. The large screen it a must for me too. I reccomend it highly.

reviews.reviewTitle: Could be so much more than what it is...
reviews.reviewText: It does what is supposed to do but almost feels restricted with limited features. It desperately needs some sort of apps and onscreen keyboard to realize its true potential. You Tube and Radio feature work but seem to have a mind of its own on understanding what you ask to hear or watch. It occasionally stops mid way for no apparent reason while streaming radio and videos. It feels like you bought a car but have a donkey pulling it. I do love the audio quality and speakers on this thing.

Great (in call) video quality, the microphone also provides clear (in call) audio even when the person is far away from the unit. Once synced it provides a very easy smart home integration. When listening to music it also provides lyrics. I have only played with it a day but this far a great tech product!

reviews.reviewTitle: Does not support full time photo wallpaper as Echo 5 Does
reviews.reviewText: Disappointed that this echo show doesn’t have the feature of having always on wallpaper photo that the Echo 5 has. I do enjoy the larger screen size and the speaker sounds. Hopefully at some time with an update this feature will be made available. I don’t like and don’t need the revolving suggestions on what to ask Alexa. I purchased a book to use at my leisure for that reason.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great device, needs a little work
reviews.reviewText: Device works great, but i do wish there was more touch functionality. Sometimes i just want to touch, and not speak, and there is frustration by only being able to launch certain utilities by voice, web browser for example i should just be able to get to via touch. If they work on this it will be a 5 star product, until more touch integration is put in via software modification it will remain 4 stars. Still great though.

reviews.reviewTitle: Only lasted less than 5 months and no longer works.
reviews.reviewText: For the cost of this not worth it. I bought this Dec 2018. It is April 2019 and it completely stopped working! Are you kidding me. No real support to remedy this. WTF! Amazon customer service needs to get with me or replace with a new one. I am NOT HAPPY ... Less than 5 months! Unreal

I have the dot (2nd & 3rd gen), and also the Show 5. I like them all but especially the Echo Show 2nd Gen!
I use it daily right next to my computer. The screen looks great and the sound is fantastic. I like giving voice commands but also using the touch display! Nice combination between the two. I watch youtube on the show, all the time as I am working on my computer. Its a great combination! I also like bringing up the recently played music using the touch screen.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Show still needs some work
reviews.reviewText: The Echo Show integrated into our home system (2 other Echo devices) with no problems. However once Echo Show was up and running it was like she thought we were speaking a different language. We'd ask a question or give instructions and get a totally unexpected and unrelated response. Also very disappointed as Amazon Prime Members we have to pay the shipping to return the defective Echo Show.

Overall excellent device, but voice recognition not as good as full size Echo, by design I guess. The microphones are on a flat surface so depending upon the screens direction, device may not respond as well. My Echo in another room often responds before the show in the same room. Otherwise, Show integrates perfectly with August doorbell/camera and all lighting devices and window shades.

reviews.reviewTitle: Didn't know I wanted it until I got it.
reviews.reviewText:
I love starting my day by saying good morning Alexa and she responds with a fact or joke.

She can't always find what I'm looking for but I google it myself. I didnt think I wanted techie stuff but it came with my new build house, I've actually had fun with it. If I'm busy and can't get to my phone I can ask what time is it, what's the weather, convenient and fun

The Echo show second generation is as described, the sound is great, screen big enough to read, although Alexa is still learning she's doing alright so far and I'm sure she'll get better with time. We play some of the skills and find them entertaining and fun. The shopping list feature is great also. I'm sure we'll explore more and look foreward to the improvements that I'm sure will come.

Love this!i can video call my best friend in Wisconsin and not experience any lag in the video or voice. I have tried the apps for video calls they never seemed to work well enough.
