This was easy to set up and start using. We have 3 echo dots and now the echo show. I mostly use it as an intercom system in my house because i am ill and spend days in bed. I can talk to my husband when i need something.

A nice improvement on the original. The larger screen makes it easier for those of us with older eyes to see everything. It also make video content more watchable. Alexa can still hear me from different parts of the house and she connects well with my Ring doorbell and alarm system as well as to smartplugs and lightbulbs. She works with my smart irrigation, my smart Christmas lights and my personal weather station

reviews.reviewTitle: For the Prime Day price, it's great
reviews.reviewText: I really like the Echo Show. There are a few things I haven't figured out yet but I have my photos (a group of them) that play like a digital picture frame. I'm sure I'll learn about the other features but right now, I just received this. It's fairly easy to set up, just follow the on-screen directions and voice commands. I think it's definitely worth what I paid for it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Overall I love it....Just one big quirk.
reviews.reviewText: Great unit overall. Sound is awesome! Screen looks great. My only issue is it is slow. It seems like the processor is underpowered. It does things, but at times.....slow. It can take 5-6 seconds just to execute a request I ask it to do. It almost feels like it is buffering. Again, I really like the unit and am happy with it, but it needs a more powerful engine/processor to run smoothly.

reviews.reviewTitle: How can you use it for recipies when it closes the browser every 5 fricking minutes?
reviews.reviewText: Got this for the kitchen to use it to keep a recipe up while cooking and not have to walk into the room with the computer. Totally useless and irritating for the function it is sold for, applications auto-close after 5 min. The whole point is to have it display it without me having to reopen the stupid thing all the time and re-find my place. A paper book is more useful if they can't program it better than this. The screen is always on and it uses quite a bit of power, I have to pull the plug to get it to "power save" not very green. Great sound for such a small package. I would have skipped this purchase if I was aware of how badly the interface works.

I've got almost all of the o es you make.. have given them to friends and they all love it ....the new Alexa 10 inch screen is great ..keep up the good work ...have family in Tennessee great picture great sound ...I live in California....

reviews.reviewTitle: Does not work with Hulu or Ring like described.
reviews.reviewText: Time will tell but currently it doesn't work smoothly with Hulu or Ring Products. Ring I was able to open 1 out of 5 times. Hulu it just stared back at me doing nothing. Had everything installed and linked. Nothing.

reviews.reviewTitle: Larger screen may be cut of at the bottom, depending on positioning of device
reviews.reviewText: All the improvements are great. But the larger screen gets the bottom portion partially cut off because of where I have the device located. I use it on top of my refrigerator, and to see the bottom of the screen from a sitting position, I had to purchase a stand for it. That doesn't raise it totally , but it is an improvement. The device is excellent, and my problems are probably unique.

I already have the original Echo Show and loved it so I wanted to get the newer model for another room. I love it just as much as I did when I got the first one. They are wonderful for shutting off lights via my voice and setting personal alarms and reading kindle and even playing amazon prime videos on it. The sound is great and the screen is very nice and beautiful color. I haven't had a lot of time to play around with it to see what newer features it has but I would definitely recommend this to anyone!!

reviews.reviewTitle: The Alexa default shopping list stinks and you can't change or delete it
reviews.reviewText: I find the shopping list to be awful and way behind on today's technology. You can't add multiple items at a time without stating the command with each item. It doesn't categorize so you end up with a long list in random order which is a pain when shopping. It seems the designers put no creative effort in product development. If you synch another app with a better list, you can't change the default on Alexa or delete the Alexa shopping list. Essentially, Amazon designs one of the most vanilla apps and then forces you to be stuck with it. Lately, our Alexa has been interrupting us with its own ideas of what it wants to show us which makes me wonder if Amazon is starting a partnership with advertisers. The call video feature is nice and the music ability but overall I'd say Alexa isn't very AI smart in comparison to other products. Hopefully, product development will go back to the drawing board.

Outstanding speaker sound equivalent to $200+ speakers, so easy to setup. Outstanding multi microphone desibn picks up talk from multiple people in room amazingly well, dropin and phone calling features great for keeping in touch with family and friends via video much better and easier than skype. Works well with connecting to anyone who has Alexa app on their Apple or Android phone or tablet. Using it frequently to connect with grandchildrdn eho have Apple phones

I had the first gen version and unfortunately the screen flickered constantly. Sent it back so many times and they would return it to me "fixed". I finally gave up and bought this one. What a huge improvement. It has been 3 months and not a single issue with it. Love the larger screen and improved sound. Very happy! I highly recommend the rotating/tilt stand ... model F068UP by YoFeW

reviews.reviewTitle: The Echo Show 2nd generation is a device you must have
reviews.reviewText: I love my echo show 2nd generation. I like that I can ask Alexsa anything from the weather to scheduling alarm times and reminders. It's also linked to my calendar so I get reminders for appointments I scheduled on my calendar. I ask her to play any type of music and she does. I ask her to give me the definition of words and she does. The volume is excellent. She does so much more.

reviews.reviewTitle: You gotta get one of these!!!
reviews.reviewText: When I first bought the 1st Gen I fell in love.. Then the 2nd Gen came out and it’s even better!! It’s bigger and the sound quality is amazing!!! It’s great for entertaining and every day use! I put my 1st Gen in my room and the 2nd Gen in my kitchen. I love the drop in features as I drop in all the time from floor to floor and also drop in on other relatives that have these... Everything in my home is connected to Alexa . Lights, shows, sound bars, front door.. It just keeps getting better!!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Like it a lot for Amazon Music.
reviews.reviewText:
This is a very cool device. We primarily use it for Amazon Music. I get news and weather in the morning before work.

I thought it would be better for recipes, but it's a bit unfriendly. It's good to get random recipes, but harder to use your own favorite recipes. I'm still trying to figure out how to do that actually.
It's gotten a little glitchy on me a few times too, but seems to fix itself.

Overall, it's a great product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Show is f, but Prime Video App i
reviews.reviewText: I do like the Echo Show. However, the Echo Show Prime Video skill (app) is TERRIBLE. It won't let you view everything in your library. It won't let you browse. It won't let you see everything on your watchlist. I am terribly disappointed, because this is the main reason I purchased it. Also, no Google or Netflix, or movies on YouTube, although you can watch regular YouTube through a browser. The other Alexa Skills vary in usefulness.

reviews.reviewTitle: The sound quality of 1 Echo Show is superior to 2 Sonos Play5's.
reviews.reviewText:
Hands down the sound quality of the new Echo Show is superior to the Sonos Play5 at a fraction of the price. I'm replacing 11 Play5's with Show's and 2 Sonos bridges with Echo Dots plugged into my existing audio amps.

You need to experience it to believe it. I've been missing half the music with Sonos. The Echo Show truly brings the music alive with all the highs and lows in Dolby and voice commands from any room in the house.

The device is fine and does what it is advertised to do. I ordered it and a couple of days later saw they had a sale taking $50 off the price. I called fully expecting a rebate and was told in essence, too bad, so sad you lose. To add insult to injury it was supposed to have come with a free echo mini and light bulb. I was somehow not surprised when it did not. Thanks a lot Amazon.

While I wish there were more video options like Netflix, the sound on this is AMAZING and totally fills the room with full range sound. We bought this to use in the kitchen and the All Recipes skill is great. Just wish there were more options to watch TV or Movies on it since it has a nice large screen.

So far, seems to work well. However, trying to figure out what it can do is somewhat challenging. Still trying to find a book or one place online that covers how the things works. Of the things I have done with it so far, it does a very good job. Update, getting emails that suggest what I can do with the Echo Show is helpful because some of the suggestions I would have never thought to do.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Show Second edition is awesome and then some.
reviews.reviewText: This is my first time using an Echo Show and it is great. I love the way you can see some of your requests on the screen. For example asking for recipes and seeing them on the screen is a great help. Along with some of the skills I have been using have displays that I never was able to view since my only experience with an Echo was an Echo Dot. The sound on this is awesome love listening to music on this. I have not had a chance to try Hulu on it just yet. So far I am very impressed with this echo show and look forward to finding new things I can use it for daily.

Love that this can be programed to start your day, your way; i.e. Good morning Alexa & she'll share the time, temp, calendar &/or news (local or other). All in a program setting. Turning lights off & on; using the Firestick on TV & other Alexa skills. Amazing.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love the larger screen on 2nd Gen Echo Show
reviews.reviewText: I had two of the 1st Gen Echo Shows and wondered why the screen was so small but it was new on the market and it was what it was. I absolutely love the 2nd Gen screen size. The speaker seems louder and it really picks up voices from far away. This one is quite an improvement over the 1st Gen.

I wanted to write an initial review and provide updates later.

I’m happy with the picture quality when I check I’m on my kids. I ordered a stand for it because it doesn’t tilt or move and I was only able to see the top of my kids foreheads.

I haven’t figured out the audio setting but it has too much bass for my liking.

“Dropping in” With the dot was horrible because of the sound quality so I’m much happier with the Echo Show.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does not connect with android version 4.4.4
reviews.reviewText: My kids got the Echo Show for me for Christmas so that I could video chat with them. I successfully downloaded the app. However, it would not connect with my phone version 4.4.4. After an extensive search online to trouble shoot, it appears that Echo Show was not designed to connect to a phone with a version less than 5.0. So disappointed! The Echo Show does do a lot of interesting things. Just too bad I won't be able to connect to other Echo Shows. Won't be able to purchase a new phone for some time.

One of the most frustrating parts of smart devices is when they talk about Hulu but don't include Hulu live. I got this device for my kitchen and since I have Hulu live the mention of Hulu is what made me get this one instead of an older model. Set up today... no Hulu live - very disappointing. Will use for a few days and see if the other functions make it worthwhile but may return.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good Upgrade for you smart home
reviews.reviewText: I purchased the Echo show specifically because of the interactivity and also because of the built in Hub. Being able to see the information you are requesting makes a big difference. I have had no issues with the Hub and have synced lights and a plug no problem. The sound fills a room quit well compared to a dot. It also allows you to drop in with video to the device from the phone app. This feature also works with the guard mode.

Bigger, clearer picture than Generation 1. Also better sound. Only negative is speakers are rearward facing so the improved sound goes in the wrong direction. But as the screen takes up the whole front of the device, you really can't face the speakers forward. Also, if you buy it from Amazon through your Amazon account, it comes out of the box, ready to use. No signing up. The software just updates upon initial use. Very cool. So far very happy with my new device. The upgrade is worth it.

reviews.reviewTitle: No Netflix, No MLBAtBat, Amazon prime video control nearly impossible to use
reviews.reviewText:
No Netflix,
No MLBAtBat,
Amazon prime video control and navigation nearly impossible to use,
Prime video has NO SEARCH FEATURE that will actually work,
Cannot cast to echo show screen from cell phone,
No headphone jack for listening quietly.
Overall ... Excellent hardware,
Sound is very good; picture is good;
but, ...
Echo Show software still needs a LOT of work.

Way better than Echo. Alexa speaks clearly. The screen very bright and huge compared to the 1st generation. I still have not used it’s full functionality as far as watching Hulu and adding home security. Maybe, later. Adding them adds up to the cost. I just added the prime music. I am glad I bought it as I have always been complaining about me and Alexa not understanding each other. It’s better with the screen than talking to a speaker. Glad I purchased it.

I found the following immediately noticeable:
1) Heavy unit, but makes sense as the weight is necessary to prevent the unit from vibrating on the surface it sits on.
2) Sound quality is noticeably richer with more bass than 1st Gen
3) Larger screen is much easier to read and watch videos (or webcam) than 1st Gen
While it is still expensive, IMHO, the improved audio and screen size justifies the spend assuming you have discretionary cash.

reviews.reviewTitle: Bad Amazon customer service. Deceptive advertising
reviews.reviewText: Extremely unhappy. Made this purchase with the understanding it was a bundle and we would be recieving the echo dot free with purchase of the show. We recieved our echo show but no dot. When I called I was told I didnt select the dot when ordering. This is very deceptive as when I went back to look at it you have to select the color tab to then make the selection for the dot which is easily missed . They are now telling me to return the echo show and place new order but the price gas now gone up from 179 to 229. Amazon's customer service was terrible on this...very unhappy

reviews.reviewTitle: "things to try" is so annoying...come on Amazon
reviews.reviewText: I would have given this new Show 4 stars (not 5, because it does freeze/get a little buggy once in awhile), but the longer I have the unit, the more aggravated I am that the "things to try" message at the bottom of the screen cannot be turned off. I use the screen to display my photos, and the blurb at the bottom is extremely distracting. Moreover, it really serves no useful purpose (at least for me), because I never read it anyway. Come on Amazon, provide the ability to turn this off...at this point it is just ridiculous.

reviews.reviewTitle: Much improved over the original Echo Show
reviews.reviewText:
Pros
- Costs less than the original Echo
- much better speakers - more bass
- much larger screen and seems sharper / cleaner
- optional stand to allow tilting
- now comes in two colors

Cons
- I wish it had an optional tilt/swivel stand
- no follow-me camera - always points in one direction

Overall I like the new Echo. Our family is an Echo based automation eco-system and Echo Show II is a great addition.

I love the Echo Show. It was a gamble buying it because I did not know all the ins and outs of using it -- but there's info on line to help. I'm still learning what Alexa can do. The sound is great - the images are nice and sharp and I like the idea that the time and weather appears every day without asking Alexa to turn it on. Good buy for the money, especially when you can buy it at a discount like I did. Great buy for young and old!

I’m having problems with it. When try to use prime movies half the time it doesn’t work. That first sentence I submitted when I first purchased this piece of crap. I was call by support and was told to download the update and I have even had my internet provider come in and install an upgraded modem and this is still worthless as anything other than a glorified music player because try to consistently trying to play video off of prime is a joke. I just now had to ask to play a video five times I also purchased the remote believing that perhaps that would help. Wrong, At this point I would never recommend this product to anyone. The echo show is useless and a waste of money

Original post:

No sound output. Many customers are complaining of the same problem.

Update....

Amazon contacted me with the fix for this issue: remove the power plug from the back of the unit for 2+ minutes. It worked like a champ! The unit has amazing sound quality.

It did not with with unplugging the power supply from the wall.

Kudos to Amazon reaching out for my previous review and resolving the problem, and extra thanks to Kristina at Amazon.

I'm a huge fan of the Alexa products. I have multiple dots in my home. But this one is junk for as expensive as it is. Would not recommend to anyone!!! Needs Alot of improvement before it should have been sold to the public. The two biggest things I bought one with a screen for was to watch a little TV in bed and my cameras. Especially the nursery camera, and it fails miserably at both. Rarely will actually play anything on prime. And it's about 50/50 on pulling up camera feeds and even when it does it will only show a few seconds worth before it goes back to the home screen. With both prime and cameras it usually says "OK" when you tell it to open them and then never actually does anything. DON'T BUY! save your money and stick with the dots and echos.

I should have known better than to buy the first version that came out, the Echo Show 1.0 screen was too small for me because I have very poor eyesight. I didn't know that 2.0 would be out so soon with this bigger screen. I traded up and I am glad I did. I can make out what is on the screen more often. The sound seems better as well and the mic can pick up my voice, despite other noise. That is a nice improvement also.

Finally broke down and bought the Echo Show 2nd Generation on the Prime Day sales. Once I got it installed it was immediately useful. I get all sorts of information from it and the sound quality is excellent when I want to play music. Weather forecasts, reminders and integration with my Google calendar is perfect. Very handy for keeping things like a shopping/grocery list up to date and integrating it with the Alexa application on my phone.

With the new screen size and resolution, it's almost perfect. I use Alexa quite a bit around my home. (I'm not that lazy really!) Next I'll try the telephone calling feature and see how that works. But as far as movies, music....etc, it's quite an improvement from the first gen. Echo Show.

We bought two of these, one for our home and the other for our daughter so that the grandkids could 'drop in' whenever they wanted. Now they call EVERY day! So there is so much functionality in this Show that it would take me all day to tell someone. We use it as an alarm clock, it keeps our shopping lists, plays our news briefings daily and gives us the traffic report for our commute to work. We won't be without a Show ever again!

reviews.reviewTitle: This can be used as a security device as well.
reviews.reviewText: My main reason for buying my Alexa was so I could check on my wife that is handicapped if I had to leave her alone unattended. She can call me by simply saying,"Alexa, call Steve"and it will call my cell phone. I can also use the Alexa app on my smart phone to "drop in" on my side with a real time video and voice to talk to her.

reviews.reviewTitle: Big, big fan of Echo Show!
reviews.reviewText: I’m a huge fan of the Echo Show. Anyone who has an elderly family member should definitely look into getting these devices. It has been a game changer with my 92 year old mother. We can just sit and chat without her having to push a button or figure out a smart phone. Of course I like all the other benefits like movies, music, facts and weather too. This is the fifth one I have purchased for myself and family.

reviews.reviewTitle: Downgrade from gen1 and keeps losing features
reviews.reviewText: I've been a loyal Alexa user for years. Bought gen1 Show at release and was foolish enough to jump into gen2. Compared to gen1 Echo Show, gen2 has a larger screen... but since you still can't customize what is displayed when you're not using it, the added utility is limited. Gen2 is also significantly worse at hearing commands. Don't be surprised to repeat yourself 3...4...5...6 times before gen2 listens or you lose your patience and just give up. On top of that, these devices keep losing functionality -- first we lost Youtube. This week we lost Bloomberg TV, which is now only available on Fire TV and after the Youtube loss was almost the only video I would play on my Show. As it stands, I would not recommend this device; they need to fix the microphone config and figure out better licensing arrangements with content providers.

Love it! Playing music is great! Awesome sound for such a small item! Sits on the counter nicely and I like speaking to it in the morning to get inspirational quotes and in coming home from work she tells me a joke (they’re kinda corny but still I like it!) Connected a few lamps, really simple process and it’s also connected to the Dots upstairs so I can voice message to the Show downstairs. Very nice - I recommend!

Looking around at all the technology, it seems Orwell was right. We will invite Big Brother into our homes voluntarily. He has been lurking in our phones, TVs, game consoles and so many other places already. Now with the Amazon Show 2nd generation) he sits there in all his glory, in high definition and hi gh fidelity sound (relatively speaking). Add Amazon Music unlimited and you are good to go.

This was a birthday present and I couldn’t have asked for anything better. I put a small shelf up in my kitchen for it and can ‘ask Alexa to show’ me any recipe i need. If you ask her for music, she becomes your own karaoke machine showing all the words of your favorite songs (this tends to turn into a one-person dance party), and even better I asked her to show me the Cindy Crawford work out from the early 90s that I loved - and up it came. The best thing ever!

reviews.reviewTitle: It's OK depending on what you need it for (not great for recipes)
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this for the kitchen and it's OK. I wanted to have recipes displayed and play music here's the Pro's / Con's:
Pro - good quality speaker, when you play music the words are shown so you can karaoke.
Con - the recipes don't stay on the screen so you can't keep referring to them and scroll up/down, it's annoying. The screen goes back to music. It's also hard to pull up your recipes, you have to give Alexa a series of specific commands.
If you don't have friends with a show the talk/video feature is useless.

I have the original Show and was really on the fence for updating to the Gen2. I'm so glad I did. I have placed this second Show in my large kitchen and the sound is amazing. The screen is great, clear and can see it from the other side of the kitchen area while cooking if I want to catch up on a movie or read a recipe. I have had it set up for a few weeks and thus for am very happy with the upgrade.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great screen and packaging! G2 may not be better than a G1 in responses
reviews.reviewText: The whole purpose for me upgrading from a G1 Show to a G2 Show was to improve responsiveness in our great room/kitchen area. I thought the improved device with more mics would have been an improvement, but it definitely responds slower and has a harder time hearing us even at close range. There are no tunable settings and the only support advice I’ve received was a reboot then a factory reset. No change. I still have the G1 and it is in the master bath and responds faster and hardly misses our requests even from the bedroom.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa is the best for a beginner smarter home.
reviews.reviewText: I got it so family can check drop in using the Alexa app on their phones... also I like controlling my smart tv’s being able to turn it on and off .... I would like that someday maybe amazon would approve the Netflix app and maybe other tv or movie apps I like how u can watch vedios or movies right from the echo device without turning on the tv.. I love the 10 inch screen and I like listening to music and Alexa works very well.

reviews.reviewTitle: The larger Show is the best of the two
reviews.reviewText: I prefer the larger show over the smaller version. I own both but the larger version I can dictate what is shown on the screen. I uploaded a picture for background and have weather and time. The try comments are on the bottom and not a problem. The smaller version I was not able to dictate what I want to see and have the annoying try comments constantly showing up.

reviews.reviewTitle: Doesn't allow for us to show photos
reviews.reviewText: We really like the show, however the device does not allow to show our pictures in Amazon photos when we use the settings on the device. It stopped showing them completely. I reset the machine and worked with customer service on this. We started asking Alexa to show photo's which works but it can not repeat the slide show more than once even though the instructions on the help page in Amazon says to say Alexa repeat photos, it does not repeat them.

2nd Update:
When I talk to Alexa on the Show and ask her to play a TV show or movie from Amazon Prime, she doesn't play it on the Show half the time. No, she apparently plays it on my Fire TV stick. Without me asking. And then I can't get her to stop it. I have to unplug the Fire TV. And then if I leave it unplugged she will play the show on the Show. You hae got to be kidding, right? Also, you can't pause Hulu shows. When you try to resume, nothing happens and you have to wait for her to reload the show all over again. The more I use this device, the more it frustrates me.
Update:
With some help from Amazon, I was able to find the Firefox browser to pull up recipes on my own (I had been trying to find a Silk browser. Because Amazon). So much happier with usability as a kitchen companion. But still difficult to figure out how to get other things done (Alexa couldn't find purchased music in my library). Will keep rating at 3 for now.
---------------------------------------------
I bought this on impulse at an Amazon pop-up. Admittedly, I'd had a couple of margaritas beforehand, but I distinctly remember the associate showing us how you could bring up a browser, and I had images of using this to bring up recipes to help me cook. Well, apparently you can enable skills which allow you to find recipes, but you can't use recipes you've already found. So it's a bust.

I already had an Echo in the kitchen for music and news, so the video aspect doesn't help there. I will try to watch a show on Hulu to keep me company while I cook (something that doesn't need a recipe) and maybe that will be useful.

I do like that it shows the upcoming events from my calendar, but it's a really expensive reminder device...

reviews.reviewTitle: Just as smart, Better sound , Bigger screen.
reviews.reviewText: No setup needed. What, does she learn from the others? interesting. Sound is much better screen is bigger and of course so is the font so I can tell what time it is without putting on my glasses. All in all much better!! haven'y found the negatives yet. Just plugged it in a little while ago and ran through lights and webcams. Now sipping glass of wine listening to Dan Folgelberg radio on Pandora. The screen resolution seems better but I could be wrong.

reviews.reviewTitle: Big Screen, Big Sound, Shotty Understanding
reviews.reviewText:
Pros:
+Great sound
+Large, clear video display
+Great for Alexa apps with pictures or videos

Con:
-Alexa often does not understand our commands on this device. We rarely had understanding issue with our Echo Spot w/ smaller video screen.

Due to the benefits, we overall like it when we can get Alexa to respond flawlessly.

I have two first gen. Echo Shows and now this second gen. Show. All are five-star IMHO. The only problem I have is, it is definitely NOT worth the upgrade. During the course of a routine day, I use all three equally and don't really care which one it is. The software on the 1st gens seems to have been updated too.

reviews.reviewTitle: What a great addition to my already smart home
reviews.reviewText:
Stunned by the quality of the audio.

Visually appealing in most dialogue windows, really well-developed.

Setup was scary easy almost too easy, I wonder what safeguards it has when determining who I am and auto connecting to my amazon account and wep encrypted network. I did not have to enter a thing... I'm sure it somehow back doored my existing echo devices.

Sound and picture are very good. We were looking for something to allow us to watch HGTV in the kitchen and assumed we could use use any of the apps (such as HGTV app) like the fire TV. That was an incorrect assumption, it does allow access to all the streaming services such as the FireTV does (at this point only what Amazon wants) we can stream HGTV through HULU for an added cost. I don’t believe you can add the FireTV either. Otherwise we are happy with the purchase.

Love the screen size and clarity. Love that it can get on the internet, YouTube and other sites. The sound quality is much better than the Dot but is a but has a bit too much bass even when you EQ the bass lower. Yet the sound is not distorted. I guess the only thing I can complain about is when music or a video is playing even at a moderate level Alexa can not hear you call her name for commands. All in all a good product. Now what they need to work on is making Alexa more like a search engine because I find myself asking her things that she should know but she doesn't or you have to be so specific in HOW you ask her the question. Often times it's much faster, easier and less frustrating to ask Google the question from my phone. But buy the Echo Show you'll like it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Speakers are MUCH MUCH better in the 2nd Gen Show
reviews.reviewText: My biggest complaint about the 1st gen was the sound... it was horrible... better sound and larger screen are nice.

The pics are twice as good as Gen1. The sound....oy-vay!!......10 times better than Gen1. Can get a good thump thump.Pretty darn cool if you ask me. Has a tad more weight to it but guessing from the added speaker magnets. Jaw jacking with others is totally worth it.

reviews.reviewTitle: No need to upgrade from Dots
reviews.reviewText: I guess I had higher expectations for the echo show. I don’t feel I got a major upgrade from just using the dots. Everything is meant to be done by voice control but honestly that isn’t always convenient. For example, we really wanted to use this for recipes. So I setup the push buttons for Firefox, then click on Pinterest, then find recipe, click on it to open full recipe. So far these are all pretty standard items. But the screen goes back to the home screen after so much time, haven’t found the setting to change this yet, and then you have to start ALL over. The webpage you were on is gone! The show also doesn’t really act as a hub anymore than the app on my phone does for the Dots. I really don’t see the point of the show over an app and the dots.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does not work with ring doorbell
reviews.reviewText: I do enjoy the Echo show, screen size is great, and the sound is very good. But I did buy it to pair with my ring doorbell and no matter what I do it will not pair. Very disappointed as I was hoping to be able to see my front door using the show.

reviews.reviewTitle: A most useful addition to my home
reviews.reviewText: I have found many uses for my new echo show as have my grandkids. They now have the ability to call me anytime using it of course they love the technology too. I love the sound of the music played on it, it fills the room with great sound as well as helps greatly when trying to make a shopping list. the drop in feature lets me keep tabs on what is going on in other parts of the house too and is most useful to let the grandkids know when it is time to come upstairs for lunch.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great device, but is lacking a tad
reviews.reviewText: Mostly love the product. You can personalize by taking off alexa “ads” and adding calendar dates and such. Love the walk thru it gives on recipes. My one main complaint is the netflix and internet issue. Internet it laggy and couldn’t even log into netfix since it wanted me to turn the device sideways - not an option. Still working on it and will try a different way soon and see if it works. Until then, it lost a star for it.

My whole family has one and uses it, I saw them but didn't think I needed it. Now that I have one (as an xmas gift from family), I don't know why I didn't get one before. The ability to torn on and off lights, ask questions, shopping lists, and even order from Amazon- well pretty darn cool.

reviews.reviewTitle: My Favorite Echo Devise so far
reviews.reviewText:
I have amazon photos rotate wallpaper pictures of photos taken from my and my wife's phones.
It often provided the words to songs it is playing so the kids can sing along.
It rotates suggestions of what you can ask it to do.

Overall, just a fun devise,
Will likely purchase for my parents so my kids can video conference them with just a verbal command.

reviews.reviewTitle: Loose sound when the machine is moved.
reviews.reviewText: The sound keeps shutting off when the devise is moved! Terrible!!! Very disappointed and tech support was useless. So I have a costly machine that doesn’t work as advertised. In addition, the instructions are HORRIBLE

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice addition to the other Echo Devices I use
reviews.reviewText:
I have standardized on the Echo products because of the numerous Apps and how I can apply them in our household.
I have an Echo show 5 which is nice for things and in areas I have limited room. I use the Echo Show 2nd Gen as my main controller next to my desk. I use it for music and streaming video mostly. Sounds good and the screen is sharp.

So I am very pleased with it.

We love everything about the echo show. We listen to our favorite music all the time now. I can make a shopping list with ease. My weather and calendar is right there. Who could have imagined. I can help my granddaughter with her homework just like I traveled 1000 miles to be beside her.

reviews.reviewTitle: A Step Up from Other Echo Devices
reviews.reviewText: Definitely improved sound when compared to other Echo devices. Only wish there was some way to adjust the treble and more importantly the bass (can be a bit boomy). A few more onscreen controls (like, for example, volume) would also be helpful. Integration with Alexa and “works with Alexa” devices is very good. Bought it to work with a Blink camera and am very impressed by the picture quality and response.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great design and quality sound...response time is slow
reviews.reviewText: The screen size is excellent as well as the speaker. The overall quality is super nice as well. The biggest issue I’m seeing is the response time to voice command. Seems to lag a bit after you say “Alexa”. That forces me to say it again and then it screws up the sequence. The first generation definitely has a faster response time so that’s what I’m comparing it to.

First of all I must admit I love Alexa devices, we have three Echos, and one dot, thus we are very acquainted with the system. I bought this device for the Kitchen thinking it would be great for videos, Netflix and of course music. Let me tell you that there is no Netflix, YouTube integration is subpar at best, integration with CNN is sad. There is very little you can do interactively with the screen, I mean almost nothing. Unless you need this for video calling (I have not tried that so that me be great) it is almost worthless. I give it two starts for what appears to be good build quality, and the sound from such a small device is commendable.

reviews.reviewTitle: I like amazon, but I don’t want amazon listening to us.
reviews.reviewText: The echo works well as described. But after reading that amazon employees listen to us via the show, we decided to return it. I don’t want Amazon listening to us. Clearly an invasion of privacy. Sorry.

I don't know what the problem is exactly but the performance of the Echo Show is noticeably slower then that of my Dot or Echo. It has trouble responding to concurrent commands and the screen is not utilized any near as much as I thought it would be. Some skills, like the TiVo and Roku skills work very inconsistently to the point of being almost useless. Overall just very disappointed in this product and not worth the upgrade. The speakers work very well though and I'm happy with the sound quality. But that is really the most I can say about it.

This device will not support Google Photo Galleries and requires you to have a Prime account to view photos on the Amazon system as if many folks were using it in the first place. I am pretty sick of deliberately hobbled devices. There are many things this device could if not for corporate greedy fingers trying to squeeze every last penny of revenue out of their products.

reviews.reviewTitle: Use it several times a day...
reviews.reviewText: I am loving my new Echo Show! I can view my outdoor security camera with quick, voice activated command, turn on "smart" lights in my house, and when nieces and nephews visit and want to watch TV, they love finding something to watch on it while the grown-ups visit. I like the visual calendar reminders and quick view weather screen. Great!

reviews.reviewTitle: I do not like the skill set
reviews.reviewText: I am finding it hard to ask Alexa to open verse using terms like 'launch'. And I want to use TuneIn radio Alexa keeps taking me to Tunein Sports Live - I do not want that - having a hard time but overall I like it. I have tried downloading the app, but that is not an easy fix/option. Hoping things will get better - Help! Note for this I will give a 4-star rating....

I love the suggestions that scroll across the bottom, it has helped me to use it more than I used the echoes, I also love the lyrics with the music, who knew I was singing so many songs wrong?!? I would love to see the date on the home screen but that’s minor and will hopefully be added later! I highly recommend

I don’t know who enjoys Alexa most, me or my 4yr old son. I love getting news and weather updates daily. My son loves to ask Alexa to tell him jokes and he repeat these corny jokes to me....hilarious! Alexa is also teaching us Spanish. We ask her to tell us words and phrases in Spanish, it’s so cool. The set up was simple especially for someone who’s not tech savvy. We watch movies, listen to music, turn light on and off, make calls, set alarms, and so much more! I don’t know what took me so long to get one. I’m still learning what all my echo show is capable of but so far I’m more than pleased with this purchase.

We are still learning about it. But it can do almost everything we have asked. Even finds classical music that I listened to back in the '70s. Took our first video phone call from our daughter on Christmas, and it was easy and so 21st Century! This rocks!!!!!

The sound is great the graphics as well, however there is a very limited availability of streaming apps(Hulu and amazon prime video). The processor speed from the moment you say a command until it actions is quite slow( 1 sec or so for playing music to several seconds or more for opening a video streaming service). Also the skills catalog is somewhat limited, and some of them do not work(tend secure WiFi camera transition).

I do not need this product, but I really like having this product. I love the calendar feature. I am just starting a business in the near future and this is really keeping my head on straight with all the activities I need to attend to. I love asking Alexa to play music for me In the morning. The suggestions that Amazon has sent me in how to use Alexa more are really helpful. Having dinner recipes at my fingertips a shopping list that when I think of it I tell Alexa and then go to the store and there it is on the app. Love! Etc. Etc. Etc.

reviews.reviewTitle: Make sure it is the interface you want
reviews.reviewText:
I was expecting so much! Was struggling between google and amazon, but after getting an Alexa unit as a gift, I went all the way in with the amazon system and I'm very dissapointed.

Too many things to write. Just buyer beware

I like the sound and picture quality but its a real hassle to connect to u-tube or internet feel like I bought a nice raido I have 3 dots 2 fire tv and 1 echo plus and have no problems but this is hard to learn and I don't like the fact that I have to buy a book to learn how to use your product, SHAME ON YOU AMAZON I guess I will go on u tube to try in learn the echo show or but a goggle it comes with direction

reviews.reviewTitle: Premium sound and a vibrant 10.1” HD screen
reviews.reviewText: Premium sound and a vibrant 10.1” HD screen, This is a perfect statement. The capabilities are simply FANTASTIC! The screens are clear and bright and the sound is incredibly bright and strong with great bass and if you want to customize the screen and sound you have brightness and equalizer controls. So Go and get the future right now! I LOVE IT and the Gen 3 Echo Dot is a great compliment if you are on a budget, I have it also.

I have fought with customer service for this product for over 5 hours now. finally somebody today is going to have a new one sent to me. The speaker went out and their customer service had me doing all kinds of silly ridiculous things including even unpluging my router for my wifi to see if the sound in my show would come back (please). Anyway my next one will hopefully work.

I absolutely love my echo!!! From calling the grandkids, to music ( sound is awesome), to even watching movies. Games love jeopardy and who wants to be a millionaire. Weather just ask and news updates when wanted. There’s nothing I don’t like about the echo.

10' display is too small, would prefer a 20" display
Voice recognition is about 50/50
Alexa Integration is very limited. Skills are very limited. No apps or android. No built-in Fire tv.
Sounds ok for a base or hub
For $229 I could have spent that money on so many more practical items. Complete waste of money.

No amazon smart home is complete without this and it's basically the center of the smart home, Google's is better and has all of Google at its disposal including play store, android, gmail, everything. I will be switching my smart home to Google in the future.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent, except for Try Alexa text scroll
reviews.reviewText:
Big improvements in display and sound quality over the Echo Show 1st generation.
Only wished customers were given the option to turn off the "Try Alexa..." from scrolling on the bottom of the screen. I had a picture of a family member that passed away during a family gathering and the screen showed "Try Alexa, tell me a pirate joke".
Amazon, PLEASE let the customers turn off "Try Alexa" on the Echo Show 1 and 2.

I had the Echo Show 1 and decided to upgrade actually bought an additional one for a friend. The sound is outstanding and picture too. I enjoy searching for all of the things that can be done on this device. I just found out that the screen can be turned off.

We had the first Show and used it all the time for our son to watch videos. We gave that one to my wifes parents to show a slideshow of pictures of our son and to call on.

The second Show is much better, better sound, and better bigger screen. The first Show had descent sound but this one has a lot more range, a lot more bass. The screen is much bigger, the entire front instead of just the top half.

reviews.reviewTitle: A great way to have video with family and friends
reviews.reviewText: My wife and I received this Echo Show as a Christmas gift. We had use Skype before for video chats but Echo is way above that as far as the video goes. The screen is about the size of a small laptop and the screen quality is amazing and in color too. Amazon's Alexa comes programmed in and she can do all kinds of things like keeping schedules, showing photos, playing music and answering questions, etc, etc.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great unit, but get it on sale, not for retail price.
reviews.reviewText: These are expensive. Compared to the Google version, it loses on price and features. I am an Echo fan and got two of these but only got them on sale and wish I could play YouTube without going to the browser. Great unit but think that $120 to $140 is a fair price. Anything more and I either would wait until it dropped or not get at all.

This is a really nice unit. The main reason I bought it was to monitor and answer the front door. The only thing I don't like about the unit is the screen is constantly showing tips, etc. that I could care less about. I don't know how long the screen will last but I'm sure it has a life span just like everything else. I would prefer to preserve that lifespan and only use it for the things "I" want, not what Amazon wants to show. I've told Alexa to turn the screen off several times but that only lasts temporarily.

reviews.reviewTitle: Win and lose with second gen
reviews.reviewText: I find the delay when asking Alexa anything with the second gen echo show to be very frustrating. Also, although the sound quality is better overall with richer bass, the speakers project toward the back of the unit as opposed to out of the front like in the older echo show. I was hoping to love this way more than the first gen, but I cannot say I do.

Overall very nice but definitely needs some improvements. Voice recognition worse then standard Echo. Settings are occasionally problem. Setting pictures to run as home screen creates slide show of maybe 5-6 pictures. Somehow unable to use entire file. Occasionally comes to life without provocation. Resolution on Skype and Skype integration relatively poor. I use it as a kitchen TV/radio/timer and for these purposes works pretty well

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Show is great. It does everything I need
reviews.reviewText: This is the Second Echo Show I bought. I bought a second one to replace the Echo Dot. I use the Echo Show for many home things to include “Ring doorbell”. “Alexa show me the front door”. Quicker than Ring. It’s great for many things. My lights, etc. I like to be able to read words on a screen. Not just listen. I don’t use for movies, at least not yet. I really like the Echo Show.

I have had my Alexa Show for 1 week. So far I have been very happy with my Alexa Show - however, after unplugging it recently there was no sound. I restarted it several times by unplugging and resetting. It would respond to my voice and appeared to doing what I asked but there was no sound. After several attempts of resetting my device I unplugged it from the back of the show rather then the plug at the wall. This worked but buyer beware; there seems to be a "known" issue with this device. I am not feeling as confident with this product after reading about all the customers who also purchased this on Prime Day and are having this same issue. Amazon - what is the fix?

Good size screen, nice speaker. I wish it came with a stand, although I did buy my own (not Amazon's though because theirs doesn't rotate). My kids enjoy the music, stories, jokes. I enjoy the weather, news, calendar, and voice control of other smart devices in my home. The voice recognition has even been able to learn to decipher what my 2 year old is saying, which is impressive.

PROS: Echo show 2 sounds AWESOME, it works great and feels like a very sturdy/solid build with good components. The screen is pretty nice as well and seems to have good resolution.
CONS: I just want the clock and weather and don’t really care about the rest of the options. The problem is I can’t seem to find the ability to even enlarge the clock which SHOULD be unlikely that they wouldn’t have the option to change for elderly or vision impaired. I also haven’t seen it work with my nest door bell yet so I hope there’s a way to fix that.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don’t try to use it for a photo frame
reviews.reviewText:
Purchased for my 93 y/o mom to
1.FaceTime”
2. Photo frame
3. Remotely allow her to unlock her lower level door.
FaceTime/ drop in works ok, mostly a problem due to bandwidth on her end. Picture is grainy and takes a while to come in.
Photo frame is the most disappointing. Initially while at her house I set up the background for 30 pictures. It was working good until she wanted to change the pictures. Now I’m 1000 miles away and use the app on my iPad, use the remove link thinking I was just removing one picture! Nope all pictures gone! Now I can only upload one pictures at a time and that only one picture is in the background. Tech support was no help at all.
She can use her voice to unlock the door. Although I had to change the command prompts to something other than Alexa!

The sound quality on the new echo show is unbelievable! It really fills the room when you ask it to play music for you. The voice recognition works really well also, and it integrates well with my smart plugs for turning lights on and off. So far I have been extremely pleased with this new product from Amazon. I highly recommend it.

reviews.reviewTitle: There is no end to what this item can do
reviews.reviewText: Purchased this item mainly to keep in touch with my grandson but, as I discover all its “skills” (apps); I’m working towards making Echo a command center to control everything in my house. Air conditioning, lamps, security cameras, garage door, weather reports , I mean ... really? The only thing I would’ve liked is for the “extra”’stand to be included with the purchase .

I have the 7" screen on the 1st Gen show and the picture is much nicer on the 2nd Gen. I has its speakers in the rear so that is not a nice as the first Gen. I know the mics are in the front on both but people can hear me much better on the first Gen Show. I sound "tinny" on the 2nd Gen. Still I am an avid user of this device and ready to buy the new 12".

reviews.reviewTitle: Disappointed it doesn't understand what I'm asking a lot and no Netflix
reviews.reviewText: This would be pretty decent if Alexa didn't confuse what I'm trying to ask it to do. Instead of turning off a show I'm watching on TV, when I'm asking it to open silk browser (which i don't have enabled on my Firestick! Also Hulu is ok, but i prefer my Netflix and prime video, and I'd just ask that you PLEASE PLEASE make it Netflix supported! However the sound quality and volume capability is excellent, at is the screen size!

The wife loves it. We had the first edition of the Echo Show in the kitchen. We replaced it with the second edition. She loves it. Most people are not taking advantage of everything this thing can do. Our whole house is Alexa enabled.

reviews.reviewTitle: Especially great if you live alone
reviews.reviewText: I bought this because I now live alone, having been very recently widowed and being kind of nervous about being alone, especially at night since I live in a very rural area. My daughter helped me add cameras to the system and she put the app on her phone as well so she can check in whenever she wants. It makes me feel much more safe and secure. I added the alert my buddy app and that too gives some peace of mind. I am very pleased with the product and I would highly recommend it.

. Goes off line daily. Stuck off line now for two days. No sound AGAIN. Reboot and factory reset have not resolved the problem. Expensive alarm clock, timer, and slide show. That is all it does consistently.

I havent had a chance to really explore all that Alexa can do but what I see so far is amazing. I love
Alexa, I have different models in almost every room of my house.

I just can’t say enough wonderful things about my Echo Show. I just love it. Chrystal clear, much bigger screen than my old one. Moved my one one into the kitchen but had to name them different names so they don’t get confused with one another. So many skills available. I love being able to see my front doof and yard using the integrated Ring skill. Music sounds great. I just love this and would highly recommend it.

I purchased this product several months ago, have called twice with problems I have has of pulling up information I want. I also have problems getting to Prime Movies, pausing and restarting the show again. Can only say, this is the most disappointing Amazon product I have bought in my (at least) four years as an Amazon customer.

I put the Alexa echo show in my kitchen. I already have Alexa devices throughout my home but first Alexa show. Extremely easy set up and the graphics are crisp. Also the speakers are great. We connected it to Hulu, Prime and it even plays YouTube on demand. I have to agree with another reviewer that I wish it had a search capability or a home screen to navigate (like an iPad). All commands are verbal or through touchscreen once you land on a page. Bottom line - love it! I bought it on Black Friday so got a good deal - if they were cheaper, I’d buy more!

Echo Show (2nd Gen) is great but could be greater! It's missing direct connections to popular items such as YouTube and Prime Time Channels along with a few others. Sort of disappointing I still have to use an iPad to view these items next to the Echo Show (2nd Gen). If anyone knows a work around PLEASE let me know! So Sad that all the large companies can't seem to get along..... But they don't mind taking our money!

Amazon makes a big deal about how the Echo system recognizes your voice even from across the room and even when loud music is on. This is the newest top of the line. It does not hear me when loud music is on except when I get very close and/or very loud. I’m not docking it a star as this new unit has a built in subwoofer and the sound is incredible.

I will start with... I haven't fully learned all of the capabilities. I received the show as a Christmas gift.
There are quite a few questions that Alexa can't help with. On the positive, the voice recognition is really good (although others are improving Alexa beats them by a mile... i.e. my vehicle and siri). I also love the shopping list feature. I downloaded the Alexa app on my phone and now my list is with me when I go (saves me from forgetting to take the paper list and then forgetting what I needed).

We purchased the Echo Show 1st generation and loved it but when the 2d generation came along we waited before purchasing to see how the new product was received in the market place. Finally ordered the 2d generation and moved the first one into another location. The sound quality is amazing with the 2d generation Echo and we love the larger screen size.

I didn't own the 1st gen show but traded my 1st gen Alexa speaker for the 2nd gen show and its definitely nice from an informational standpoint as far as how Alexa relays info. The 10" screen is nice and my kids actually interact with Alexa more due to the visuals. I really like that I can view my Ring camera feeds without having to grab my phone. Overall glad I upgraded to a show. No regrets and recommend.

We got this as a Christmas gift and use Alexa daily. She plays most music but not all without an additional subscription. Not too many old movies but lots of Amazon originals. I love that I can move her from room to room easily.. A nice device to have and I am sure she does so much more than I know about - I learn a few things each day that she will do and I get a lot of support from amazon via my email.

I use this for my shopping list, music, turn lights on and off, recipes. I am having a little trouble with one light out of 6 I have set up and it is bulbs in a ceiling light. I haven't put the call into support yet to fix this issue. The support is outstanding when you need help. I do wish you had a way to bookmark recipes that you like. I search recipes all the time and choose one for dinner. I drop in other rooms to talk to my husband and let him know dinner is ready. Next is the ring doorbell to add to it.

This 2nd generation is awesome. Large viewing screen. The speakers are in the back and deliver full, rich sound. It’s amazing how full the sound is on this Echo Show. The larger display makes watching movies so much more enjoyable. Truly an awesome product well worth the price.

Likes: great speaker with plenty of base and quality sound. It sounds best if backed up to a wall or other structure. Uses: listen to music with iHeart radio- allows you to select stations, control volume, stop and start music. Use to view Wyze cameras, video call friend who has a show. I already had a dot and this does all the same functions as the dot: controlling smart plugs and Ecobee thermostat. Dislikes: none yet. Have had it for two weeks.

Very happy with the Echo Show. It was very easy to set up and it’s easy to use. I wanted it for viewing cooking videos, adding items to the shopping list as I used them. I especially like seeing the timers displayed rather than asking Alexa how much time is left. Nice substitute for not having a TV in the kitchen. Looks and sounds great!

Love the audio and video. Only problem is that if you have a power outage it loses audio and you need to reboot by unplugging at back of unit. In Florida we lose power a lot because of all the lightning storms in Summer, have ordered a small UPS to solve that problem.

reviews.reviewTitle: A must have for every home
reviews.reviewText:
I love this. It really helps me with my reminders everyday I struggle with my memory so this is very important to me.
I do best with visual learning and lastly I love my music and this is on point

reviews.reviewTitle: Worst product ever bought on Amazon with degrading service quality
reviews.reviewText:
Couldn't give less than 1 for sound quality but there was no sound coming out of it.

Not sure what was they thinking but talking to customer service agent I got the idea that the product in this series was probably defective. Anyhow mine was defective and they asked me to send it back for service and suddenly the decided to precess refund.

I bought it at the time of promotion, with trade in option and I lost both products and the refund was less than I paid due to some restocking talk they gave me as if it was my issue that product didn't work and I should bear the loss.

I am surprised they didn't charge me saying you need to pay for sending back product.

This all happened with a Amazon prime customer. I am surprised how they handle non prime issues.

Alexa is super stupid. As an AI AND GIVEN THE AMOUNT OF YEARS ALEXA HAS BEEN AROUND it just baffles me how stupid alexa still is even after all these years. It makes me feel like were going backward in time when I talk to this machine. I wouldn't waste your money on this. What you want to do is just get alexa stereo echo or whatever just for music. The show cant really do much more than what the stereos do. Alexa cant hold a conversation alexa doesnt know anything I'm talking about. Alexa can only recognize my voice 85 percent. And not to mention the security issues downloading these skills ie apps.... allowing information to be sent even video across the world oh whatever it's the world we live in today. But seriously do not waste your money

reviews.reviewTitle: Great to travel distances when you cant
reviews.reviewText: This product is wonderful for anyone in advanced years or mobility limited. You can "visit" with loved ones (assuming they have one which is why I bought one for everyone in family). The best part is taking away the worry of not seeing the one you love. Now, we all visit in real time and home health wellness checks can wait alittle longer. Highly recommend this product for those who cant travel but want to stay in touch.

The picture is very clear and the sound is very good. My only complaint is that the IMDb freedive station which I can access on amazon prime app on my Apple TV does not work on the echo. It’s bad enough that you can’t access Netflix and I was ok with that but I’m very surprised that IMDb freedive can not be viewed on echo. It’s very frustrating!

We have this in our kitchen and purchased it because it connects to the Ring doorbells and cameras. Then my wife loves it for recipes and trivia games etc. I love it for playing our Sirius XM music. So relaxing on a Sunday morning. I only wish you could download apps to it. Everything has to be done via the phone to create skills. Small issue, but love the Echo Show.

What an absolute improvement from the first generation. Purchases mine in black and a Metal Stand for it, VMEI Metal Holder for Echo Show 2nd Generation Can 360 Degree Rotatable, Tilt The Viewing Angle of Echo Show Screen Up and Down. SO HAPPY. Thanks Amazon. Hopefully they'll come up with a complete wireless Echo Show that does all these features with a voice command.

reviews.reviewTitle: A very useful and fun Smart Device!
reviews.reviewText: Nothing to dislike. The sound is very good, with rich bass sound and balanced middle and high ranges. Alexa displays music lyrics where available, and the videos are pretty sharp on the 10 inch screen. Alexa is very helpful with questions answered, reminders, and timer/alarm functions. The show plays my Amazon Music choices quite responsively. I haven’t tried my Amazon Prime on this device yet, as I always use my big screen television, but Based on the videos that I have seen on the Show, I am sure that Prime video works will also. I’m very pleased with my purchase, and recommend the Show as a fun and useful smart device.

The Echo Show is everything I had hoped for. I use it in my kitchen. It’s great for recipes and cooking videos. I can see my shopping list when I ask for it. The sound quality is great for playing music and I love seeing the lyrics as the song plays. It also quickly connects with my Ring doorbell and I can see on the screen who is at my door. Great device!!

I had the 1st gen for many months before I started using it. It wasn't long after I started using it daily that the 2nd gen came out and I purchased right away. HUGE improvement with screen real estate and sound. Big improvement and I now use the device everyday.

I'm a bit impatient though with some much needed updates. Besides the normal voice enhancements we desperately need across all Alexa enabled devices (e.g. understanding user intent based on previous commands), I found the screen to lag a bit when browsing Amazon Prime Watchlist and it bugs out once in a while when playing movies. I've had to manually reboot (unplug) a few times.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great screen, awesome sound, very responsive
reviews.reviewText: I'm so glad I waited for Gen 2. The screen now fills up the whole front in comparison to version 1. The sound is amazing, and Alexa can pick up your instructions very easily even when talking at a normal tone and being 5 feet away from me. Video chats on the Echo Show with family members are very cool and so much better than using Facetime, Duo, and Skype. This is a great purchase and you won't be disappointed.

This is a nice improvement over gen 1. Sound seems to be quite a bit better, screen is great although populates with same as gen 1, nothing more. I bought the Amazon branded tilt stand with it and I like the stand. Gives it that extra “oomph” so to speak. Setup was very easy.

I used the trade in program and traded my gen 1. In hindsight, however, for the $30 they offered for it, along with a 25% discount towards this model, I would’ve like to maybe see Amazon recommending to go it to a friend, which would have more people on the bandwagon if they aren’t already. Just a thought.

reviews.reviewTitle: Want a great addition to your Echo Dots?
reviews.reviewText: The Echo Show is perfect for any home. I tried the "other" assistants, but the Echo Show beats them all, hands down. Voice recognition, applications, ease of use - it's all there. The only problem you'll have is deciding which room you want to put it in. When it comes to home assistants, the Echo Show wins, hands down!

It started out promising. Set up and connectivity went pretty well, step by step and turn key. The Echo stopped playing voice/sound withing 24 hours and I can't get it back. Spending way to much time having to screw around with it. I see on-line that this is not all that uncommon for this product. I find this ridiculous for this product and very inconvenient. Had to put my older echo device back in service. Not sure what I will do with the Echo Show but I have lost all confidence in the product.

reviews.reviewTitle: GREAT ITEM FOR YOUR FAMILY AND HOME
reviews.reviewText: This is totally awesome. I'm just starting to use smart items in my home and this is so great. You can all kinds of different things with it, ask weather, recipes, and the one thing I really thought was great you can tell it to play your favorite radio station (example Alexa play 97.1 the river which is a station out of Atlanta Ga.) and it will play it without any static. And it sounds as good or better than your regular home stereo. You can set alarm to wake you. I could go on & on but I'm sure you get my point. It is TOTALLY worth it, and very easy to use. My 60 year old cousin can even use it and he doesn't even know how to use a smartphone. He lives with me and I catch him all the time asking it questions thought that's cool. Hope this review helps anyone who is one the fence wheather they want to buy it or not.

What's not to like with the Gen 2 Echo Show? I think it really is a BIG improvement over Gen 1!!! The bigger screen is very nice but the sound is a huge improvement. It's the difference between Dot audio (which is.... OK, I guess) and Echo Plus audio which is excellent. I decided to hold on to my Show gen 1 because I tried it out in the smallest room in the house and the audio sounded better there.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Show only works with a Smart phone with Alex Communications ap
reviews.reviewText: This product has great potential if you have a smart phone. We don't! The Alexa Communications Ap for calling contacts has to be installed on a smart phone. Without it you can not make visual calls. They down load your phone contacts through Alex Communications for Echo Show. We still have our two flipflops phone because it is only $50 a month for unlimited texting through Verizon designed for retirees on a fixed income. I hope Amazon doesn't ignore the grandparent market who would enjoy the visual phone calls of their grandchildren as advertised on the commercial and develops a software ap, so Alex Communications can be compatible with Office "People contacts." Presently I use a Verizon text application on my computer so I can type texts on a real keyboard - my laptop when texting. Amazon Echo show team should talk to Verizon. Now it does the same as a the tower which is 1/3 the price. "Alex, what's the weather?" A frustrated grandparent

I like that I can Sync my Ring devices through it. After waking it up, I can ask to see my front door bell, or my backyard camera, and it says :Okay" and does it. I like that it announces motion at either camera. I like that you can teach it to do all kinds of stuff. So far, I have no dislikes. I'm relatively new to the device. I wish it cost a little less, I'd buy a couple more.

Although the 2nd Generation doesn't provide any significant improvements in functionality from the 1st generation, the larger, higher-definition screen and improved sound are an asset for the things we use it for the most (listening to music and audio books, finding food recipes, answering the phone - using an Echo Connect). We even are doing a bit more streaming on the device.

I can’t stand how the screen is always on. I’m always having to tell it to turn off. The screen does need to be on all night or when I’m not at home. I’m not sure why but I have an Echo 3rd gen in my den. Somehow, from the kitchen the Show is delayed at responding to my summon whereas the Echo responds first. Other then that, I’m ok with the Show. I would rather buy the Echo 3rd gen over the gimic screen.

I wasn't much of an Alexa user until I bought the Echo Show (2nd Gen) to integrate with my Ring Pro Video Doorbell and other Ring products. I discover something new every day to use my Echo Show for. I was slightly disappointed that it doesn't have a battery to un-tether it from the wall, but the benefits far outweigh this shortcoming.

We were very impressed with the quality and all of the features of the Echo Show 10. It was very easy to set up - only took a couple of minutes. The sound quality is excellent and the microphones are very sensitive. You can speak in normal volume, and it recognizes your commands. My only complaint so far is that the documentation is lacking. I could not figure out how to set up a slide show on the home screen and had to call the help line for assistance. Overall it’s a great product, and we bought the new Echo Show 5 for our bedroom - very pleased with it as well.

I would purchase this again and again. We have a dot in all of our childrens rooms, and this in the kitchen. We love all of the different things you can do- such as 'drop in' on our kids and talk to them through the echo/dot. or send announcements to every alexa device. My son is even able to call me on my cell phone using this device and use the video chat with me. I love all the features and the sound is amazing!
Received as a birthday gift and the sound doesn’t work right out of the box. Very Disappointed.

I love Echo Show! I actually mostly use it to play music. The sound is wonderful! I heard it over at my son’s and decided to get one myself. It lets you know when Amazon packages have been delivered. FaceTime with the grandkids is great. There is so much more I need to explore, but I would still buy it just for the music and sound and the words to the songs I love!!

I really like the ability to call up multiple recipes for specified food items.
This is much easier to use that the myriad of cooking apps on my smart phone.
The recipe directions are very easy to follow, with the ability to jump back and forth from directions to ingredients and back.
The display is very crisp, showing the various recipes in high resolution detail.

Love my Alexa.Do not have home cable so this works just great for me.I listen to the news in am,watch a movie later in the evening ,then listen to nature sounds at night. I wish I had got one for my mom as she lived alone and this would have been a great companion for her.Has a few bugs which I am hoping to work out but a great product.Havent even begun to use its potential.Named it after my mom.

I am obsessed with this purchase of the Echo Show (2nd Gen). All my relatives purchased these products for their kitchen and I loved the aesthetic and the capabilities. I purchased one for my newly renovated kitchen and it is perfect because I can use it for movies while i cook, for music during the day, to see all my ring camera devices, etc. I highly recommend this device.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent and enjoyable, with a big caveat
reviews.reviewText:
This is a very good purchase, but the constant messages on the display screen to 'try this Alexa skill...' (which can't be shut off) is annoying and detracts from the photo slideshow I use as my display background.

The sound is very good, and the screen clear and large enough to watch videos and movies enjoyably.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa is great for learning kids.
reviews.reviewText:
Upgraded the 1st gen to the 2nd gen. Screen is much better and audio is also much better.

I don't know what I would do without Alexa. She keeps my kids busy all day asking random questions and playing game with them. Hide and seek is pretty neat. My kids always win and they have a blast playing Alexa games and learning about random facts!

Ok el producto me gusta mucho todo funciona bien Skype YouTube todo esta muy bien lo único que me gustaría que lo pudieran en español no entiendo porque en otros países lo ponen en español y aquí en estados unidos no

reviews.reviewTitle: Good , but a little slow ...here and there
reviews.reviewText: What I dislike is the unit is update, but seems slow at times. I'll open prime video click on something to play. And it will take 2 minutes to open it sometimes. I have great connection/ wifi. So I think it's just the processor. But still is frustrating when you just wanna play something in the background to pass out

We bought two, one for us and another for a gift. Love it, easy to use and it's fun to continue to learn everything it can do. The speakers are great and we are going to sign up for the music ( they offer a 6 month free trial with purchase)

Its pathetic if you ask for a orthopedic address instead it gives you ortho club. If you ask for a name ut week give you another club and will repeat previous address. The Alexa Tower works better in answering. Will see how it does for other information. I had 2 other Echo Show and were return for faulty issues. Hope this new Generation Echo works better. I just plugged it in. And not responding correctly.

reviews.reviewTitle: Microphones are not as good as the first gen
reviews.reviewText: I had a 1st gen echo show and was skeptical about it. But I loved it and the one thing that would make it better was if it had a larger screen. That is realized in the echo show 2 but with one major trade-off. It seems that the microphones had been reduced or are not placed well in the new version I have to repeat myself a few times and shout just to wake the device from across the room. I never had an issue with the first gen. In fact the 1geb echo show is placed in another room and it will hear me over the echo show 2 even though it is in a room much farther away. I am very disappointed with this functionality and may put the new echo show in a different room because in my very long galley kitchen the old echo show is much easier to use.

I don't use it that much. I have heard bad things about Alexa spying. I like the iPad better and since I upgraded that everything has changed and it is very frustrating. I guess the gift of the Amazon Echo was supposed to shut me up till Christmas. I haven't heard from my daughter since I got it.

reviews.reviewTitle: So Easy to Setup and Use -- And fun too!
reviews.reviewText: I love our Echo Show (a Christmas gift from my daughter and son-in-law)! I use it every day for listening to my favorite tunes on my venues and playing my favorite family album pics. It also allows me to call and physically see anyone who has an Echo Show. I use it for information, reminders, time clocks, traffic, and any other info I need. It was so easy to set up. We love Alexa!

I wish this came with anything saying what all it does. I love it and use it a lot, almost every day. But I know it can do more, just haven't figured it out or looked up online. Love the sound quality, nice bass and volume. I am hopeful that once I look up more about the echo functionality, I will use it daily.

The echo show is a great product. We purchased two, one for us and one for our daughter in Hawaii. It is great to drop in and visit. She drops in over her breakfast coffee which is our lunch time. The music sound is much improved over our old echo. I particularly like the recipes feature where Alexa talks through the recipe step by step.
Well worth the investment.

I don't like the fact that when you ask for recipes from a specific group it gives you only ones from a.r. also she needs a lot more schooling, she seems to say hhmm I'm not sure about that or don't know how to answer, we also have a Google home mini which seems to know a lot more, as far as sound from songs. It is very good

reviews.reviewTitle: The Echo Show 2 has problem with the Righ Video Doorbell dislay
reviews.reviewText: When I recently purchased the Echo Show 2, I was told it works well with the Ring Video Doorbell. I found out that there is an issue displaying the image on the Echo when the doorbell rings. The video image is not automatically displayed or seen immediately unless you ask Echo to see front door. If I'm not near the Echo and someone rings the doorbell I want Echo to show me who's at the front door without physically going to the kitchen and asking Echo to display/view the person at the front door. Is there an upgrade to the Echo that can fix this problem

The Amazon show is easy to set up and has great picture quality! The sound quality is incredible. Clear, vibrant rich sound quality. I keep mine in my kitchen so that I can watch Amazon Prime or listen to music while cooking. I am still exploring all of the features but the one feature I love is telling Alexa what to put on my shopping list. When it's time to shop I simply open the app and retrieve the list. Each item is removed as you check the items off of your list. The Show is very user friendly no matter your technology level. Looking forward to exploring more of the features that the show offers.

reviews.reviewTitle: Glad to have my Echo Show
reviews.reviewText: It took me a while to bite the bullet and get onto the Alexa bandwagon, but I am loving it. I love the Echo Show. I haven't figured out how to make video calls to other Echo Show owners yet, but I will. There is SO MUCH that Alexa can do and I've only scratched the surface/ I'm very happy to be on this bandwagon.

I love this Echo show! My son got one and sent me one so we can call and see each other. He lives in Utah, I don't get to see him that often so it's great to see and talk to him. I also love asking questions, finding out the weather in my area, playing music from my playlist etc. It's wonderful! I didn't even know this existed until Rick sent it to me, and now I don't know how I lived without it.

I love this for the kitchen. I’m able to check my cameras, see recipes, and watch videos. This style specifically is so great because of the screen. I can keep an eye on the dogs and kid while I cook dinner. I can watch something on amazon prime without having a TV in my kitchen. The design is really nice as well. I like the look of it on my counter.
