I hate the fact I cant turn off the "things to try" that show at bottom of screen. I'm thinking about returning the echo show. It defeats have the ability to having photos on home screen background. I hate it.

reviews.reviewTitle: The set up and operation is a breeze.
reviews.reviewText: We are still exploring the capabilities of Alexa but so far we’ve enjoyed having “ her” in our home. To have instant music has been great and we love asking generalized questions when topics come up in conversations. I recently discovered that I could play movies using Amazon Prime which is nice since we are a one television home.

I like everything about it .Very easy to use . I'm one of those people who don't read instructions. I caught on very quickly.
They have a lot of features that I did't even know about.I'm now going to learn all the features.

reviews.reviewTitle: Doesn’t do what I bought it for
reviews.reviewText: I really purchased to use with my alarm system to see the doorbell camera without having to get out my phone or tablet. Doesn’t work for that. We are an older household and not really interested in using like a tech savvy younger family. Will keep and use for Playing music and a few other small tasks, but disappointed a pretty expensive radio

I received this for free as an Amazon Developer perk.

I really like this Echo. It is great at providing information like time, weather, and news passively. The speakers sound very nice and the bass makes the table vibrate when the volume is up. It can get very loud and fill multiple rooms with sound. The audio recognition works very well.

This device has a great picture, but what good is it if there is no sound. I have contacted Amazon twice and was told that their experts are "working around the clock" to remedy this situation. I have received no updates from them. I bought this on Prime Day and am still waiting. I'm starting to lose my patience. As of now, I'm only able to use it to tell the time/temp and as an electronic picture frame. Amazon, please fix this or at least send out a repair status update.

Finally Amazon has a masterpiece which showcases the best use of Amazon ecosystem while at the same satisfying your every need and becoming a family member.News and Trevia alerts as per my preferences show on my screen all day.When the alert interests me I say Alexa what’s the story to hear or see complete details. I can video call my friends who are in my contact list. It is a labor saving device as it answers all my queries and I don’t need to Google any more. I can ask Alexa to show photos which it has uploaded from my phone or ask for a specific family members photo or an album by name and it sets it up as a screen saver. It clicks selfies with different themes. I can check my cameras, listen to music,set timer, broadcast,announce and simultaneously launch music in all my echos.it also displays temperature and calendar appointments.

My husband and I have both Alexa and Google in our small apartment! I like Google better and it is easier to use! With Alexa we changed the name to Echo as it worked better that way! But Alexa/Echo is very picky on the EXACT words to see an video! So sometimes it is frustrating to TRY and SEE an video! I love the feature to be able to check up on our apartment and pets! Oh one night we had a major snow storm and it was so funny as Google would say it was snowing and then Alexa/Echo say no snow, then they switch off and even at one point both said NO SNOW as it was snowing like crazy!

So far I have not been very happy with both shows we have had. Although Amazon replaced the first one promptly, it wouldn't turn on, the second one I feel they have been dragging their heels on replacing this one. It randomly starts talking any time of the day/night and has seemingly gotten worse. They claim it is because it hasn't been updated, even though we were told they did it automatically. We have not had any issues with our Spot or Dots, just the Shows. I wish Amazon would just replace it instead of trying to diagnose it, which is now going on 8 weeks. If you haven't figured it out by now it is time to replace it!!!!!!!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: This was way better than any of the digital picture frames on the market
reviews.reviewText: We bought this instead of a digital picture frame for my wife on her birthday. Not only are the pictures super clear on the display all of the other things that Alexa and the Echo line can do makes this incredible purchase and since i got it on Prime day for the price i did plus got a light bulb and Echo Dot. AWESOME!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: There is a defect with the adapter
reviews.reviewText: The product is very nice, I think it is the best Alexa so far, however, I faced a problem with my 2 Echo Shows ..... when electricity disconnects on the device or you connect the Echo show adapter before putting it in wall plug the Show will not produce any sound, it will be mute no matter what you do (including resetting it), after several tries (and a tip on another site) it looks like you need to connect the adapter first, for 10 seconds or so, then you can connect the Echo Show and it will function normally. that applies to the two devices i bought.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not as good as I hoped
reviews.reviewText: Really frustrating device! Responding to voice commands gets stuck and delayed all the time despite multiple time resetting the device. Very closed system can't even play my playlist unless it is within a skill, alternatively use bluetooth which always gets disconnected. Sound quality is okay but not as good as I hoped am going off to another smart home devices, which is very sad given how many of those I bought to automate things around my house.

I was really excited when I saw that this could be used with Project Nursery. I wanted to use this as a monitor system- which they made it look like it could be. It’s very limited. Only showing video for ten minutes at a time and not more than one hour a day is completely useless. I wanted to use this as a baby monitor system and I can’t. I also thought you would be able to have sound playing from one of the other echo devices and you cant do that either. I wouldn’t purchase this again, I would use a regular baby monitor that runs on wifi.

reviews.reviewTitle: Takes time and information to interface with other products.
reviews.reviewText:
Using in the kitchen and as my hub for all Echo products.
Possible issue to be aware of:
As I connected the Echo Show, 2 Echo Plus and 2 Echo Dots to my network, network started crashing. Already have 6-8 other devices connected. Going to be adding several smart plugs. For once the problem turned out not to be Comcast. Problem was my Netgear R7000 router. Searching web and found that the router was being over loaded. That should not happen on this router. Problem fixed by dropping back 2 firmware versions, waiting on vendor new firmware version.
Take away: Make sure you have a router that can handle the load and number of devices you intend to use. Some can and some can't regardless of firmware.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Show Gen 2 is a great step forward. Bigger is always better.
reviews.reviewText: Love the second gen echo show. The big screen is awesome. Kinda wished I ordered two on prime day. I've got a 1st gen that's fine tho, so no. This new show replaces a echo dot and blue tooth speaker combo. The sound is just as good. The Blink camera display is slow but amazing. I would love Blink to auto display on Show. Hey Amazon?

Give it a command and Alexa takes 10 seconds or more to do anything. Tell it to play and video and wait. Play a song...wait. No it’s not the WiFi...the first gen is right next to it working like a champ. And I can only plug and unplug so many times. No excuse at this price point. Amazon quality not what it used to be...

reviews.reviewTitle: The Jetson's have arrived in my home
reviews.reviewText: It's like having HAL from 2001 Space Odyssey right here in the kitchen. Video directions for recipes, shopping list and just about any info your heart desires. Just need to learn how to ask. Video phone calls remind me of the old jetson cartoons. To us this is the greatest thing since sliced bread. Set-up takes some know how and some trial and error, but it is worth the effort... a great tool for the kitchen and just about anywhere else. Also use to monitor security cameras.

reviews.reviewTitle: should just go with a tablet
reviews.reviewText: this thing is less useful than a $50 android tablet.

reviews.reviewTitle: So Much Better than the First Echo Show
reviews.reviewText: The second generation of the Echo Show is far superior to the first in sound quality. It also has a larger viewing screen. I have my 2nd generation Show in the kitchen area and use it multiple times a day for a variety of reasons. I am now using my 1st generation Shows in other areas around the house where they also come in handy. Amazon keeps adding "skills" and interesting information almost on a daily basis that make the experience and convenience of the Show even better.

I bought this to replace my first gen Show. It is better in every way. The sound is much better, the screen, obviously, is much larger (large enough to comfortably watch video content on), and it seems faster and more responsive too. Highly recommended, especially during one of Amazon's sale days. The non-video Echo devices have their place, but for a living room, kitchen, even in a bedroom this one is perfect.

I can never get Siri to understand me but Alexa is my best friend. I changed the language to US English and did the start ups. We understand each other very well now. I have it in my kitchen which is the center of my house. Works great.Graphics are clear and the sound fills the room. I love Amazon Music and the channels. Every day I ask for the top news stories. The weather for wherever I’m going. Recipes when I want to cook. I can play a Prime movie while I’m getting things done. No complaints from me.

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Show outdid the Google Home.`
reviews.reviewText: Great sound, Hi def video and stereo sound. Integrated the Nest skill and the videos from my security cameras are outstanding. The only downfall is that on my Google Home, I can tell google to 'cancel' and the video goes back to home screen whereas I have to touch the show then back arrow to get off of my video. All in all, I favor Alexa over Google at this time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Purchased 4 and super happy with it
reviews.reviewText: I’ve purchased over 4 of these and have them set up all around my house. I love how easy it is to integrate all my smart products to this unit. The voice recognition is amazing. I have a slight accent and I’ve had no issues getting Alexa to understand me. Love the sound quality and loudness of this unit.

reviews.reviewTitle: need to get rid of ads !
reviews.reviewText:
love how my echo show works ! but tired of the ads!!! ...
need to get rid of Ads !!

I already have Echo Dots and an Echo, but my wife purchased the Echo Show for me. It does everything that the other Echo's do and more. It has great sound due to the subwoofer. I really love good bass and the show does not disappoint. It also allows us to look at our cameras, Ring, Blink and Amazon Cloud Cam cameras. It does have a web browser and can play YouTube videos and other types of videos, but I haven't really used the Show to play videos. I would recommend if you are looking for a great sounding Alexa device that has a screen.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very good until 7:01am this morning when I set an alarm.
reviews.reviewText:
It's been 10 months and I really, really like the 2d generation of the Echo Show. Sounds excellent for its size, Alexa integration is good, voice recognition is okay. Video is decent for its size. I was a happy customer until 7:01am this morning when I asked Alexa to set the alarm. Shortly after accepting the request, the speakers started popping, like a static sound. As if the speaker was blown. While listening to "Real Jazz" on Sirius XM. I'm not happy. Rarely have I had the volume above 8, the maximum being 10. C'mon man. This wasn't expected for a 2d generation model.
Wednesday morning, August 21, 2019.

Love this thing.. so many uses and the wife loves it. We have it in the kitchen and she uses it for recipes, timer and music while cooking. Tons of uses and still trying to figure it out.. I gave it 4 stars, because it can be a bit buggy and voice recognition can be a little aggravating.. but overall we as a family love it.

I enjoy using the All-new Echo Show (2nd Gen) I can now look at all my favorite recipes while I prepare them in the kitchen. I can also listen to my favorite songs which are my two most favorite things to do. The premium sound from the speaker is perfect and so is the screen size. This is the best useful item I have purchased. I am pleased with all that I can do with it.

Can't say if we like it or not. First Alexa could not speak to us, had to send it back for a replacement. Next it wasn't shipped back to us, it went to our friends house in Apex, NC. We drove up to Apex to get the Alexa and when we opened the package - NO POWER CORD!! Has not been the best experience, will contact Amazon for the power cord.
Not actually worth the money. Needs way more skills . This is my first experience with a device of this sort . I was very excited, but let down hard.

reviews.reviewTitle: Premium audio quality like Bose and JBL. Sandstone is beautiful.
reviews.reviewText: My new,Amazon Echo Show 2nd Generation vastly exceeded/surpassed my Great Expectations. I'm very happy and satisfied with its premium quality and extraordinary audio quality. It's like Bose and JBL. Do yourself a favor/kindness and buy yourself one for Christmas. Mine is Sandstone.

We bought 2 of these. One for the kitchen and another for the game room. We absolutely love them. We have 5 echoes overall and use them multiple times a day. Drop in, announcements, and reminders are just some of main uses we have for these.

I purchased this to go with the Ring doorbell I also purchased from Amazon. For this application it works quite well. The sound quality is very good and the pictures on he screen are very clear. The only drawback I see is the advertisements the show sends you. I would rather have a nice screen saver instead of the ads. Something like they have on their Fire TV some beautiful pictures of landscapes. Other than that I would recommend this product.

It is interesting learning to talk to Alexa. Understanding how to phrase things that it understands is interesting. Some of the responses are amusing. We enjoy the quality of the sound when we play music. The screen quality is quite good as well. I did not realize you set up a lot of things from your phone.

Works well, sound quality is good, volume goes higher than I anticipated. The only flaw I found was the inability to drop in on my mother, because she has more than one device and if they’re on the same phone number it doesn’t know where to call, something that might want to be considered in the future revisions of this device and other echos... ie, using IPs to separate contacts for drop in rather than phone number, or the ability to call a specific device.

I love the device, unfortunately I’m one of the few who has been plagued with serious WiFi issues. Device worked flawlessly for about a month and suddenly started to drop the Wi-Fi, after numerous resets and chats with Amazon I’m left with no other choice but to give this horrible review.

The bad part is, this device was a x-mas gift for my wife and she loved.

I have 6 Echo products and I love all of them, but the show really takes this type of device to a new level. We listen to a lot of music and the Show has the lyrics to every song scrolling on the screen. The speakers are quite good too, and putting it in a corner or next to a wall will give you great sound and good bass. It has so many great functions, I will definitely replace all of my Echo devices with the Show over the next few months.

This Alexa Echo Show takes the cake for all the Alexa devices. By far the best sound, picture, and video quality (granted the screen resolution is much better because of the giant screen it has). The screen size and sound quality alone have cemented this in for me to be the greatest thing. I can't seem to live without it in my kitchen anymore.

I haven't had a chance to fully utilize this yet, but so far I really like it. I can access my video cameras around the house, it's a little slow opening, but the picture quality is great. It's cool to be able to see song lyrics while playing music as well. I'm looking forward to making a call on it to see how that works.

Like the larger screen. Easy to see across room. May need to retrain as doesnt always understand. Like newer feature to show the commands on screen, at least some, and can see result such as “light off” and shows a switch off.

reviews.reviewTitle: A better size - audeo and video
reviews.reviewText: Compared to the 7" model, the 10" model both the sound and the video looks much better. Sitting at the kitchen table, watching the various offered videos, the size and resolution of the screen is enough to be comfortable. The 7" was not. The video calling is much more pleasant. Alexa did not graduate to the fourth grade with the larger unit.

This is a very simple device to set up and use on a regular basis. It is much more responsive to voice commands than the original echo and the screen is very clear and responsive. The only question I have is the amount of data that is sent over the wi-fi and consequently the internet connection. Unfortunately I live in a rural area and am limited to 15 gig per month. Something is eating my data limit in 5 days and I kind of suspect the new echo.

This item was returned because there was no sound. We called customer support and they confirmed that the item was defective. Since this was purchased on sale, we were told to purchase another at a much higher price and they would credit our account for the difference. Item has been returned; waiting for credit.

I own other Amazon devices and I have to say that I'm very disappointed with the Show. Love the design and the screen has very good resolution but too many bugs with the software. The rotating photo option hangs up all of the time and requires a complete reset. Adding Next cameras is spotty (I have 3 cameras and only 2 show up). I don't need the "try "Alexa" going across the bottom of the device and needs to have an option to turn off.

They released an update that changed the user interface and how the device reacts to certain phrases. I can’t use the device the way I’m used to anymore. I could say “play Seinfeld on Hulu” and it would jump to the episode I left off on and play. Now it brings up a menu forces me to scroll to the episode I want manually or just starts from season 1 episode 1. This is just one example. Many other inconveniences caused.

Find myself enjoying the EchonShow. Video calls with family are easy and have good quality. Easy to pull up recipes. The best part was when your visitors learn it answered questions and the spent an hour asking question and watching videos about sharks. Great easy to use addition to my home, love pairing it with my hue lights!!

I have recently taken the steps to almost fully turn my home into a smart home with Alexa enabled devices. I did have a Echo Spot in my open kitchen/living room but i felt that it was not really what I needed. The speakers are the main reason i upgraded but I did not realize how much I would enjoy just asking Alexa to find me recipes and not having to print it out or get food particles all over my phone. Also with the use of some of the available apps and skills it can give you a TV where you didn't have one before. I used to not be able to see my TV while i was at the stove but now i can watch TV while I am Cooking. When all is said and done if you want a device in you kitchen space I think that this is the one to go with, but other than that I am not sure if it fits anywhere else in the home.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great addition to my smart home.
reviews.reviewText: Great sound quality . I also like the integrated hub.I control my tv, microwave,lights,alarm,and my thermostat I placed it on my kitchen table and enjoy listening to music or podcasts while eating. I use it to access my video doorbell when I am in the kitchen and video call or message my friends and family. I love it.

Don’t buy into this thing needing a stand, it doesn’t. Just got this thing and it’s had to be reset twice already and it’s not exactly sleek as you could handily use it to bludgeon someone (it’s a lot heavier than we expected it to be). It’s handy having the screen but seriously just stuck with the show app on fire tablet with a stand and it would be just as good and cheaper

I love the bigger screen! The features are great. My husband and I enjoy listening to the music and viewing videos. Especially, when we play our favorite music, we always sing along because it features the lyrics on the screen. I brought another one for a birthday gift for my son. I will highly recommend it to family and friends.

Amazon has another hit on there hand with this device. the size is good for what it is the screen is clear and sharper nd yet you don't get a lot of choppy video.
As a dedicate Skype terminal... why has it take so long this is the video calling device promised in all those old movies.
the one feature I would add is a video out ... ideally controllable (Alexa put video on the TV)

reviews.reviewTitle: Improved in everything second generation is hands down the way to go!
reviews.reviewText: It’s much much better then first generation Echo: bigger and better (now in HD) screen, bigger and richer sound.

reviews.reviewTitle: A nice idea, but the execution leaves room for improvement.
reviews.reviewText:
The Show has much better bass than my other Alexa devices, but it has some real phase cancellation issues with anything center-panned. Vocals tend to disappear from music for example. The microphones don’t seem to work as well as my other, earlier generation Alexa devices either.

The news portions tend to suffer from erratic volume. I can’t speak for the video calling portion of the unit as I prefer to use my phone, but the screen itself seems nice enough. It does seem to need a faster processor, though, as switching apps or giving it any commands can take 1-2 seconds at the low end and maybe up to 5-7 to start some things.

reviews.reviewTitle: Had regular Echos in bedrooms but wanted more features for the kitchen
reviews.reviewText: The reg Echos have been great for the bedrooms but wanted this visual function for the kitchen. The Echo Show has been great. Voice Recognition is so advanced that my preschooler was able to navigate the commands to set up "Call Daddy" to remember which phone number to dial. That's impressive AI.

Bought this for my Mother in law that just became a grandmother by her youngest son and she lives in Florida and the grand-baby in Utah. She was always sadden by the fact she does not see her grandson often enough. We set it up and had them call her right away. The tears of joy in her eyes knowing, she can see her grandson anytime is worth more than the weight of all gold. We did good.

If I love it why 4 stars... Alexa is having a hard time hearing my commands, I have to repeat her its name for it to wake up plus the speakers are on the back so I have to have the volume up a bit higher than with my first generation echo show other than that I love it. The screen is larger and that is awesome! I'm buying more as soon as I can!

This has become my favorite Amazon Device. I love the sound quality when I am listening to music. I think it is really useful having the touch screen so that I can view images or check my security cameras. I put mine in the kitchen so that I can view recipes or watch videos while I am cooking. Considering buying more and replacing my original Echo devices.

The only reason I bought this is because it appeared I needed it for the Ring Doorbell. That is not right and the Ring doesn’t totally integrate into the Show. Instead of alerting me that someone is at the door, my other devices alert me and then I have to ask Alexa to show me my front door. I am very disappointed that I was misled.

reviews.reviewTitle: Retirees you need this! No more searching the internet, just ask Alexa
reviews.reviewText: I have three tablets, three Kindles, one iPad, one laptop and two 65 inch high definition tv’s. Nothing compares to this product for versatility, quality of sound and definition of video. This does not run out of battery because you plug it in. Wish it had text to speech for my books. Maybe a later version will have it. It does play books from Audible.

I've only had the Echo Show for a couple weeks, but I love it!!! Its in the kitchen and is used by everyone. My calendar is synced so the kids can see what is coming up. I love it for my shopping list and looking up recipes. We have fun playing music, as it shows the lyrics like a mini karaoke machine. I know its capable for much more.

reviews.reviewTitle: Decent picture and sound quality for its size
reviews.reviewText: I'm living in temporary quarters with no television while my house is being built, so I wanted a device to watch movies and videos. This echo show works just fine for my needs, plus it has Alexa, which is handy. The only thing I find annoying is that Alexa can't find all my Amazon Prime movies I've purchased... she gets confused.

Great sound, that’s it. Gone through 3 of them in a row, first one Alexa had a mind of her own. Second one, I could t even plug it in, it would scream at me, third one decides to wake me up in the middle of the night. Not worth the money tho I will miss the sound quality, WHEN it listens to me
Also they need to make an easier way to carry or hold it.

Alexa is pretty awesome. We use this quite regularly listening to music, playing games & looking up recipes. It is easy to use but it doesn't pick up my wife's voice as well as mine. She sometimes has to repeat herself but she has a quieter voice as she has to repeat stuff to me a lot too. Other than this we love it & use it daily.

I really loved my Echo dot and then I got the All-new Echo show and it has far exceeded my expectations. It's the coolest gadget ever. The screen is large and crystal clear. I am really enjoying all the features and cooking classes.

reviews.reviewTitle: I had NO idea how much I’d LOVE my echo show!!
reviews.reviewText: Mind blown! We had the first generation echo show and loved it so much we ordered the 2nd edition for another room. Wow!!! The screen is so much larger and clearer! The speakers are sooo much better as well! We just LOVE the echo show! From timers to songs to shows in the kitchen- I don’t think we could live without it at this point! It’s so so awesome!!! We just LOVE all our Alexa products!

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great, excellent sound and picture
reviews.reviewText:
Wish it had a built-in swivel stand and a way to tilt the camera so callee can see us better,
Good product for the money....picks up voice commands from across the room very nicely.
I like the visible timer countdown...makes anticipation of event.
Music sounds good when playing (better than our DOT) similar to First Gen ECHO speaker tone.
All round good product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Much needed upgrade from the first gen
reviews.reviewText: Major improvement from the first gen. Sound is exceptionally better. Not to mention it has a great step by step recipe feature that walks ya through recipes. Bigger more vibrant screen and picks up your voice much better too. Thinking about buying a second one for upstairs

reviews.reviewTitle: Great way to keep in touch
reviews.reviewText: I bought 4 for my family so we can easily communicate with each other. Very easy to use and a great way to check in. Picture is very clear. I keep it in the kitchen and use it to chat, play stand-up comedy or listen to music while I cook. It's also very helpful for maintaining my shopping and to-do lists.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good hardware, but software needs work
reviews.reviewText: If you want a perfect product keep looking. Cannot turn off the camera while the screen stays awake. Cannot get rid of Things to Try no matter what you do. The menu is not the easiest to navigate. Those are my primary complaints. It does Alexa stuff fairly well. Giving Alexa screen has proven difficult for Amazon.

I may come to like it better, but I encountered a problem with Alexa response when playing music. When I ask for a song, and Alexa finds a different and not pleasing song, it won't respond to a stop command. I have to get up and use the screen to stop. That is is a pretty fundamental fail. We will see if things improve with more types of usage.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great sound but terrible for videos!
reviews.reviewText: I expected the echo show to essentially be a tablet that stays in one place and can be controlled with your voice. This is not the case at all! All the video apps (hulu and prime video) are lite versions. If your in the middle of a TV series good luck getting to the show much less the actual episode you want. If only they did a casting update to where you could pick the episode or movie on your phone and have the Echo Show play it. If I knew this was only for music I would have bought a really nice speaker for this price and connect an aux cable to my echo dot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sounds great and looks great! Best Alexa device in my house!
reviews.reviewText: We have all Echo devices and all generations except the battery powered devices. The most versatile, most useful, and our favorite is this Echo Show 2nd gen. Specially useful when video calling friends and family, looking at the house cameras including the front door, singing Karaoke right on its screen, watching a movie while cooking in the kitchen, following a recipe, etc.

Despite getting a great deal on Prime day, I sent it back as it didn’t do all that I was hoping. Good for basic Alexa functions but we already have an Alexa enabled Sonos One speaker. My hope was to get streaming news, Netflix, AND have the Alexa functionality. It does a few things well, just not the things I need. I’ll check it out again in a couple years when it’s had time to mature as a product.

Lots of uses - my parents appreciate this gift as they have a smart home. Now they can control their Sonos, Smart TV, thermostat...etc. all by using this device. My Dad especially loves Prime music w/ lyrics that pop up to follow along. In idle mode we can see upcoming calendar invitations, weather and several other ways to customize. FANTASTIC holiday gift - I'm buying one for myself

I love the idea, but 2 times this has not waken me for work in the morning. Some times very unresponsive when asking things, And the constant “try “Alexa” at the bottom of the screen really annoying with no way to turn it off!

reviews.reviewTitle: BAD UNIT OR BAD AT ALL
reviews.reviewText: I have all kinds of amazon device but this echo show 2nd gen is a failure from start. I unbox and setup then after waiting for good 20 min of setup, no sound from the speaker. Rebooted and it work. Another issue is it takes about 4 sec for Alexa to respond. Also the screen will turn blank, although it still plays music etc. on the background even if you ask for weather it will say it but screen is blank and you can’t swipe down for the settings.

reviews.reviewTitle: Wow, what a difference between the 1st & 2nd Gen Echo Show
reviews.reviewText: We have 1st Gen Echo Show and think it's great; however, the 2nd Gen Echo Show has a much larger viewing area which is much better for viewing movies and great for my wife to view recipes; I lost my 2nd Gen to the Kitchen counter top for my wife to use. Also the sound is much better and louder. Well worth the purchase, we love it.

I've had an Echo since the original device. I really like this Echo Show. It's quick and responsive. I was a little apprehensive about whether or not the microphones would pick up my voice from multiple locations. I found this not to be a problem. The speakers sound great, and definitely have some bass to them. Best sounding Echo device yet!

I asked to play an episode of the expanse am I got a very early episode I have already seen with no options of even looking at other episodes. You get what she throws at you. Where is an episode list. Can't Watch Blink camera motion clips. Only live view. Echo Show as with the rest of the echo products has trouble understanding English and often doesn't respond at all until I yell "ALEXA!"

reviews.reviewTitle: Echo Show larger screen is so much better!
reviews.reviewText: We love our new 2nd gen Echo Show! The larger screen is sooo much easier to see, especially when using receipes to cook. We keep this one in the kitchen. The sound quality is improved & I can see videos much better while I’m cooking. It was so easy to put our family photo on as background. Keep up the good work Amazon..our family loves Alexa. We put her in our guest room & our guests enjoyed using her so much, they are buying one!

Replaced a first gen echo.
Sound is very good boomy bass but better than too little!
It has some screen oddities with auto dim. Can make it way too dark and requires adjustments.
The screen quality is ok but leaks a little light. Too bad no native YouTube maybe someday!

I originally enjoyed my Echo products but always worried that Amazon would eventually politicize the experience. They did today. They have added controversial, profane, comedian and political commentator Chelsea Handler to the “Ask Alexis” repertoire.
I upgraded from the Echo Dot to the Echo Show.The Echo show shows me my sport teams, the latest news & so on. It has a dolby speaker also. The sound is fantastic.

reviews.reviewTitle: Beautiful picture and good sized screen!
reviews.reviewText: Love my Alexa Show!! This is my second one, I have the original first one. The screen is much bigger and the sound quality is better. My older one’s speaker went out after about a year. I like that it’s integrated with my Ring doorbell and I can ask Alexa to show me the front door and speak to people.

Hey, there. When I was ready to send back the product to repair, I double check the instructions and I forgot to erase my information, before I doing, check again and works perfectly. The only thing I did was to disconnect the unit not the plug. I hope this is usefull.
Thanks again
Samuel Gomez

The first device we received didn't work at all. The second device now freezes and is super slow after a couple weeks of use. It takes forever to play Amazon Prime shows and even stops all together.

The only good thing about this is the sound and video quality. Otherwise, I would have passed.

Love the Echo Show. This is my third one. This one is leaving unopened as a birthday gift. Have two others set up in my home. Whats up with the "Things to Try". I know there are thousands of complaints out there about "Things to Try" and Amazon does not seem to care. The devices seems to sell well. I knocked off a Star in my personal rating because of the "Things to Try".

reviews.reviewTitle: Background Slide Show Does Not Work Properly
reviews.reviewText: Bought 2 and set both with background to Amazon Photo album. Both worked for a while, now each is stuck on a different photo from the album.

This is the best smart display on the market. I am really impressed with the bass. I can feel the floor vibrating. The prime video looks great. You can have recipe right by your eye and voice. The only downside is that the YouTube has to be accessed through explorer and you have to use touch to control. Hope Amazon and Google will some day stop fighting.

reviews.reviewTitle: The show is the way to go.
reviews.reviewText: Used the Amazon trade in program to upgrade from the 1st generation Show and we are very glad we did. The screen is much larger and brighter. The sound quality is a big leap up from the previous version. I would recommend adding the Amazon stand to your purchase. It gives you better viewing angles and will keep you Show free of any possible spills if you are going to use it in the kitchen.

Never thought this would be something I would use. I am getting to know this gift, Echo show so far has been great to make face to face calls to relatives far away and playing music, it has helped with sleep playing white noise. I know there is so much more to use it for, just getting to know what it can do. So over all I have enjoyed what I have used it for!

My son and daughter-in law recently bought this for us to enable a better communication experience with the family after they moved. We are old folk, a little resistant to change, and consequently never moved from standard cell to smartphone. The Echo, unfortunately, requires a smartphone application to enable calling from a contacts list. There is no accommodation to build a "manual" contacts list from which none smartphone users can make calls. Pretty much useless to us without our upgrading our cell phones adding an increased expense for phone and plan.
Got the Echo Show Alexa could hear me but couldn’t hear her response. Contacted customer support and they couldn’t fix the problem. So had to return the Echo Show. Will order another later.

For our first echo products we went with two of these. (Go hard or go home, right?) one is in our kitchen and one in my office. We are learning some of the things they can do, and are really enjoying it. The speaker quality is excellent, and teenage me would never believe I’m saying this now, but the bass in the sub actually hits “too hard”, but if you’re having a party it would be great! The 10” touch screen is great, especially with keeping track of all my WebEx meetings, and for trying new recipes out.

reviews.reviewTitle: I also have the no sound reconnect the power cord issue and poor service
reviews.reviewText: I hope there will be a fix soon. This device is much less reliable than my original Echo. I have used it for about six weeks now but its Bluetooth capability is much worse than the original echo. Sometimes it won't connect and the only way to reconnect is to unplug the power cord from the back of the Echo Show and plug it back in. At least that works, but it shouldn't have to be like this. Support has contacted me about this but it still hasn't been fixed. Actually, support was supposed to call me back last week but that hasn't happened.

reviews.reviewTitle: Drop in, listen to music, watch YouTube! Awesome
reviews.reviewText: Shocked when received, larger than expected. Great speaker, works awesome with ring doorbells, I love the drop in feature and use that a lot to talk to kids when away from home. Using this with Amazon Music is awesome as well. Our teens will turn that on when doing chores to have some fun while cleaning. The younger kids watch YouTube on it. Excellent product.

This was included in my new home purchase and I didn't think I would use it, but I am really enjoying it and it has fabulous quality to watch Amazon Prime. I did not realize it was able to do that. There are so many things this device can do. I'm looking forward to becoming expert! So much fun!

I purchased this for my mother who is 75 and not tech savvy at all. She now has romance with Alexa. First couple of weeks was the learning curve, now Alexa is her hero. From weather, daily devotionals, audible books to help with spelling and math, even telling her stories. I think I have been replaced as the favorite daughter. Perfect.

It took a long time to get here but it works as expected. Why oh why can’t they have a cordless verizon though? It’s not like you can sit it in the middle of your table now is it... damn cord running across the floor plugged into an extension cord. And it you want to take it to the kitchen to use a receipe you have to wait for it to reboot. Sheesh

reviews.reviewTitle: I like this 2nd GenI love Alexa much better than my 1st Gen
reviews.reviewText:
I love this newer unit. I gave my first gen to my brother.

On my old unit, if I was playing music at volume 10, Alexa could not hear me when I said her name.

She can hear me on this newer unit.

I talk to Alexa more than I do to any of my friends.

I could tell the sound quality was far and away better than Amazon's initial effort based solely on the introductory video. Once I played music, I was blown away. The larger screen size was equally appealing. This device now occupies the busiest area of my home, while the 1st gen Show moves to the basement.

I love seeing my calendar events and seeing my shopping list, instead of just hearing them. Great for video calls too, but I use Facetime for that since my iPad is mobile. For aging parents who are not technologically savvy, I would slelect the Echo Show for video calls. Other than that, the non-screen Echos work well for me.

My daughter moved over 350 miles from us and I miss her. Christmas morning to my surprise she was in our living room via the Echo show ( and the help of our son). We spent Christmas morning opening our gifts and having breakfast together! It was wonderful! We now chat in person. I still wish she was here but this is a nice way to see her on a regular basis.

since we had the show we face time all our family and friends on their cell phones. they all had to down load the alexa app first. also instead of hollering up stair to other, i just use the show to connect to their echo, dot , spot or amazon device. the speaker are good. it is a must have. it does so mush more

Okay. If you expect to have complete control over what is displayed on your screen, Foget that!! Amazon feels the need to constantly put a “Try ######” nag on your screen. So far I’ve found no way to remove it except to just return the dang thing.

Purchased two. One for me and my mom. She leaves in Texas and I in Kansas. The video and voice quality is outstanding when making a call. Really makes the distance apart seem less. I also use it with my security cameras. That’s another reason to buy even if you don’t know anyone who owns the Show or a Spot. The other features found on the Echo and Dot are icing on the cake.

reviews.reviewTitle: Buy it You will Love it! Great Technology
reviews.reviewText: Another item I use way more than expected and absolutely love it!!! I have one right next to the bed. You hear a noise outside in middle of the night just ask it to show you camera for that area... quickly you see and hear it! It is like command central next to your bed you can do tons of things and Alexa keeps getting smarter!

reviews.reviewTitle: The Echo gives me another set of hands!
reviews.reviewText: I absolutely love my new Echo! It’s on the kitchen counter and I use it constantly. So far my favorite features are asking Alexa to play music... it’s great being able to hear what I want when I want with no extra effort; another practical feature is asking that a timer be set when I am preparing food (no washing floury hands); and then recipe availability is really wonderful. I am still learning just what the Echo can do but that screen always being on in the kitchen is wonderfully helpful.

Can't get it to communicate with another Show, wanted it to communicate with my grandson, a lso the app doesn't work (2 stars) with my older LG smart phone, basically it's useless for me at this point, If I had it to do again I wouldn't purchase it. I'm holding on to it hoping they will improve the APP

reviews.reviewTitle: A fantastic improvement over old unit.
reviews.reviewText: The new screen and speakers are far superior to the old ones. Nice that you can watch YouTube using web browser, shame it doesn’t have a built in app. With Hulu live, you can watch tv on screen. Great for when working in kitchen.

reviews.reviewTitle: Replaced the 1st gen show with the 2nd gen
reviews.reviewText: The first generation show was and still is amazing. I upgraded in order to get the larger screen so that using it for Hulu Live TV in the kitchen would be more "tv-like". Unfortunately, the 2nd gen does not hear as well as the 1st. I often have to manually turn down the volume to a whisper so that commands are understood. I have quite a few echos throughout the house and other devices pick up the demands before this one, they are more than 30 feet away in an office and a back bedroom. Overall, I'm disappointed but do love the bigger screen.

reviews.reviewTitle: Needs more work. Maybe third (gen) is the charm
reviews.reviewText: Product looks great, a whole lot better than the first generation. But from the first time I’ve plugged it in, I’ve had intermittent issues with the volume not working despite being on. I’ve had to physically unplug it from the Show itself, and that usually temporarily fixes the issue. But at the end of the day,, this thing is just a pretty timer and Echo. Most of the skills available for Alexa are poorly rated and all need more work. I haven’t decided it I’ll return it or not, because I did pay the Prime price, but I wouldn’t buy it again.

I was so looking forward to getting the Echo Show. I had the Echo and was very impressed and happy with it's performance. We recently added outdoor cameras and video doorbell to our security system. I was excited to find the Show hoping it would enhance the system by allowing us to view the goings on around our home rather than constantly accessing out phones. What a disappointment. I have been trying for 2 weeks to sync all the devices in our home to no avail. I have Googled, called and emailed every resource I can find and have not found any assistance. I am only told that it's not the devices which only leaves Alexa. Getting help from Amazon is like pulling teeth. It's a shame because I really wanted it to work. I think I may still have time to return which at this point I see as my only option.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not as good as original Echo Show.
reviews.reviewText: She has terrible “hearing”. The previous Exho show I bought was far better at responding when we said Alexa while she was playing music or game. This one can’t hear you. I don’t like it. Wish I had either a refund or an upgrade.

reviews.reviewTitle: ALOT MORE THAN YOU WOULD THINK
reviews.reviewText:
Easy hook up, easy to get and load app on other devices, easy to add more skills, I'm not a very good person when it comes to electronics so when I say it's easy I mean IT'S EASY.
We got ours for CHRISTMAS and I thought OH NO there's no way I can do this but here goes, plugged it in, followed the directions, got the app, within minnits I was workin it like a pro, music, movies, news, I even had my Daughter and her whole family on real time video talking n laughing like they were here (we live in Hawaii, they live in Orlando Florida ).
Now I'm using the app to create new skills for Alexa to communicate and respond to ALOT of of other things and it's only been a week, I haven't even started doing fraction of her capabilities, ALEXA IS AWESOME.

I previously had there google assistant device by lenero--got it as a gift--took it back and got the ECHO--as with any amazon product it was quite superior AND there is LIVE support. It works great nd is relativlerly simple to use. Commands are easier and the features are better. The ONLY negative is that it does not merge with the apple products completely--would definitely recommend

Best invention ever, it’s clear, ring responds quickly and I love that it shows the words to many of the songs I ask her to play. Also, love the shopping list, I get to the store open the app on my phone and all my needed is gems are right there, don’t know how I got along without it.

This is actually a huge upgrade from the Gen 1. However I am disappointed that you cannot change the clock face like you can on the Show 5. Makes no sense. Bigger is not necessarily better. Such a small issue is a major issue for me. Please fix this and make it so we can change the clock face!

Ok, the product is great and set up couldn’t have been easier. The reason for the 1 star rating is that a week after purchasing you drop the price significantly. As a Prime member I feel I should have been notified of an upcoming price reduction, or at least a retroactive price reduction, or credit to my account. Frustrated.

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazing Sound and a Beautiful Display
reviews.reviewText: The Echo Show is a brilliant and beautiful device. I was most impressed by the sound quality and its ability to fill a room with sound. I have several Alexa devices, including 2 spots, and a dot, and with the multi-room set-up, it fills my entire home. At times, the Alexa response has problems. I'll give it a command and it'll ignore me, particularly when I'm listening to music. For example, if I say "alexa, go to the next song", it'll decrease volume to listen to my command, but not comply. Sometimes frustrating, but overall, I am pleased with the device.

When I first got this speaker I was very excited. I had switched to a google home because I was unsatisfied with my previous echo device. When I got this one I was very happy with it, until it stopped working a month later. Upon contacting customer service. I was a bit confused by the repair process, and was hoping to possibly be able to get a refurbished once since my current one is only a month old. Upon reflecting, I am willing to work with the repair process, but am disappointed with amazons response and am considering just going back to my google home.

I very much like this device, the voice recognition works every time, sounds great when it plays music, you can easily stream movies and watch them on it. This is my second one (have one in my office and one in the bedroom). It even helps me study Vietnamese every night. Couldn't be happier with the Echo Show.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sorry Alexa, but you need to get it together.....
reviews.reviewText: I've given her multiple chances over the past few weeks to get it together. We were fine before I upgraded to the Echo Show... now she has a screen and she thinks she's hot $#@& and doesn't need to listen to me anymore. I miss the old days when we understood each other; sometimes she just stops listening in the middle of my request. I'm not asking too much, just play some nice music...I even say please! Unfortunately, and surprisingly, my experience with this device has not been the high quality experience I'm used to from amazon products...

I love everything about the Show!! Having a screen makes all the difference in the world. I especially like that the words to each song I play scroll across the screen. You won’t be sorry if you get one. Now the “baby” Show is to be introduced in a couple of days, and I ordered that one, too!! ❤️

reviews.reviewTitle: Overall good device, but needs serious work on the interface.
reviews.reviewText:
What I like:
Good display.
Very good sound quality.
Build is solid and sturdy.
Setup was easy.

What I dislike:
Interface is clumsy
No depth to the interface
Very limited function outside of voice control.
Ability to setup and or add Alexa compatible devices from the echo show has not worked to date.

My daughter (3yr old) and I were sitting right in front of the Echo Show when she asked me to play ”Let it go”. Then I said: Alexa play Let it go on YouTube. Guess what? It told me that secured search is on which I can turn it off in the setting, and then it played the video in the picture attached, which is definitely not appropriate for a 3yr kid.

Alexa, are you kidding me???

This is an expensive Echo. The screen is practically useless as none of the "Skills/Apps" work well with it. The UI design is that of a first year design student and its just clumsy.
I got my on Prime Day for $100ish dollars, so I'll be keeping it because the speakers are really nice on the unit. But it's over all functionality is completely useless.

This thing is pretty awesome. I can video call my parents and sister, intercom the other devices in the house and control all my smart lights, view cameras, etc. Sounds pretty good too. The touch screen can be a little iffy and she doesn’t always hear me but I have a pretty decent size house and it’s usually when I have the TV on.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great tool for speaking one on one to a live person! Each upgrde gets better!
reviews.reviewText:
I have I have 4 of these in my home. I am thinking about purchasing 2 more for extra rooms and perhaps another for my office. One the second generation, I like the feature of the bigger screen space and the fact that the connector cord comes apart from the Alex box enables me to use more conveniently at my office as there is a hole on top of my desk to drop cords and plug into the electrical outlet alleviating all of the cords on my desk surface in my office.

I love this product, and have talked my sister and my cousin into buying them for their children homes as a x-mas gift. I think one bought 6 and the other bought 5! They all love them!

Thanks for Amazon for bringing another great purchase.to my attention.

I want to make sure my Amazon Prime membership is continuously active!

Thanks,

Ginny Slay

The echo show could be really awesome. I really love all of my Alexa devices but the amount of errors the show experiences is inexcusable. Whether it is frustration with Alexa hearing me properly, cutting out in the middle of songs (Apple Music integration is a joke), failing to load videos, or just caught in an endless loop of “thinking” (the blue light just getting stuck on the screen) the amount of times I have to reset this thing is ridiculous. When it does work, it sounds great, and the video looks solid. Unfortunately those special times are rare.

I got an Echo 2. I might like it but it keeps going off line. Less then half the time I ask Alexa something she can't answer. Today when she came on the temperature was 20' less then what the actual outside temperature was. Did I get a lemon or is this what Echo 2 is like. I am sorry that I didn't get the Google Home Hub.

We received the 1st generation Echo Show as a gift and we really liked it. Then we decided to upgrade and get this 2nd generation Echo Show. We love it!!! It has amazing sound, the screen is larger and for Christmas we bought our family members Echo Shows and now we all drop-in on each other all of the time. We all love them and all the things you can do on them - listen to music, ask Alexa questions, get updated news, video time with friends and family, connect our lights, etc.

I love it. It does so much more than the Echo. It was very easy to attach all my other devices to my Show. Great picture quality and sound. It takes some time learning everything it can do but it’s worth the effort. I’ve already recommended it to my friends who have Echos. I also purchased the stand for the Show, it makes it more stable.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice product not intuitive enough to unlock features
reviews.reviewText: Seems like just another echo device. U need to buy a separate manual to unlock the full feature set - ridiculous. It mimics FaceTime - no big innovation. It mimics the fire stick that already displays lyrics on the tv when playing amazon music. bought it for my wife for xmas (she's the techie) neither one of us are impressed.

Very disappointed in this Echo Show.. The original was a thousand times better. This one doesn't respond to commands for information, volume changes etc, however the screen is nice. Alexa seems "dumber". Of course it's now a week past the return date, so I'm stuck with it. Would not recommend this to a friend.

reviews.reviewTitle: Screen is always on and no YouTube capabilities.
reviews.reviewText:
Great unit overall, Just a few things That I don't like First I wish it worked more like a tablet and was able to download apps from app store. Also I would like a better internet browser and YouTube capabilities. Also the screen should time out after a while, its always on.
We're living in the future these things should be standard on items such as these.
The good, speaker is the best as far as Alexa speakers go also best microphones she hears you loud and clear, the unit looks beautiful and everyone that sees it is amazed.
I'm very happy with this purchase and I want to see future updates improving this unit as I feel its something I will be using every day for many years to come.

I’m big on the Alexa, echo and ring product suite. I can intercom with other devices in house and monitor the automation in my home. Sound is ten times that of an echo dot. Wife loves using to pull-up recipe and cooking instructions.

Highly recommend.

reviews.reviewTitle: Alexa capabilities are amazing and fun!
reviews.reviewText: Love this!!! It's in my kitchen and I ask for news, recipes, music, weather and more. There are so many skills to add for games, etc. I use it as a timer, calender and for my grocery list. And can't forget that I can "drop in" call to family because we are all loving it so much and ordering these. One of the skills is Life360!😀 Alexa is awesome! Next thing I do will have to be adding some smart switches to turn on and off lights!

reviews.reviewTitle: Better than any car voice system, but still not perfected.
reviews.reviewText: Works great - when it works. Often takes a few different sentence structures to get Alexa to provide the desired response. Occasionally have to resort to a good old fashioned Google search. The sound system is really great for the size of the unit. Bass response is well balanced with the mid and high range. Volume is fine for typical usage. Amazon music is a wonderful service that has obscure albums like Pablo Cruise Worlds Away from the 70's. Tried to get Alexa to display Claude Monet artwork on the screen to no avail, but she knows who he is. All in all I'd say it's a good purchase. Alexa is better than any car voice system, but still not perfected.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cool, but no automatic Ring video
reviews.reviewText: If you were like me and and saw a cool demonstration of the ring pro integration where when you pressed the ring and the video showed up automatically on the echo show, you were deceived! Classic false advertising! While the echo shoe does announce a motion or someone at the door, the video feed is not automatically shown. Instead, you have to say Alexa, show the front door or whatever you named them.

I love everything about it but it doesn't understand me sometimes. Of course, that is probably because I'm a country hick. I love the recipes it has and the step by step instructions of how to make them.

I love my Echo Show. I have instant access to the weather report, temperature, and music. Also, because I have other smart home devices, I use it to turn my heat up and turn my lights on and off. I keep mine in the kitchen; so I use it as a timer and to look up recipes. At first I wasn't sure if it was something I'd really use, but now I wouldn't want to live without it!
We need more display options. How about putting a date on. Make the time take up the whole screen. A month calendar would be great too. More display options.

reviews.reviewTitle: More uses than I had hoped for! The whole family loves it!
reviews.reviewText: This was my Christmas gift from my family and we all love it! I use It for all kinds of recipes and my kids use it for answereing homework questions and watching movie trailers. We all use Alexa throughout the house for music and dropping. The sound is great! And recently we Bought the ring 2 and now i can Easily see and talk to whomevers at the front door. Love it!!

I love my Eco show so far Except the fact that it does not play Netflix but everything else has been Amazing. I have it in my kitchen so that I can Cheer other rooms like my kid's Room when I'm trying to get the dishes done and I can also watch a show as I'm sitting there working or making dinner

I have been waiting 15 for a refund. What is taking so long.

Very disappointed - sound and response from Alexia kept cutter out. Tried to reboot - issue kept resourcing everyday. Very disappointing - liked it the concept but not pleased with product performance - may keep me from recommending Echo further.

Could I add more things to my new smartphone only came with one light switch three small two small devices could have did more on switches in the home plug into on the home are you paid for a house that was almost $300,000 smart home Alexa home and it was very short Unlimited not the biggest Thriller about it Alexa works great but just not enough out of his to call it a smart home when the customer has to buy all the other parts you only give me money for things that's it Amazon and Google always were known to be very good and products somewhere along the line on this one they begin to drop the ball🤔🤔🤔🤔🤔🤔🤔🤔🤔🤔🤔🤔🤔🤔

I love my Echo Show 2. She can show me my arlo camera with a simple request. She has great sound quality and bluetooths with ease. Need a recipe "no worries" she has you covered. I love the drop in feature to other family memebers with a show as well. Trying to talk family members without it into getting one. We shall see what the price is this prime day 2019. Maybe Christmas gifts.

I may have a defective unit. I’m not happy with it. It occasionally loses connection when my other Alexa speakers stay connected. It also occasionally crackles. I’m not sure what I’m getting other than the screen that makes this better than some of my other Alexa devices.

reviews.reviewTitle: Worth the upgrade over the generation 1 Echo Show
reviews.reviewText: A vast improvement over my Gen 1 Echo Show. My gen 1 suffered from the dreaded flicker even after sending it in for warranty repair. The sound is markedly improved and the bass is much deeper. The screen is also larger and more importantly clearer and sharper than the first generation Echo Show.

I haven't done too much with the Echo Show yet. Just received it yesterday. I'm hoping it will work with my sketchy internet connection. I thought it paired with my smart phone but apparently not. Though when I ask Akexa to pair with my phone, she says she can't find it, not that it's not possible. Frustrating. Wish it were made clear, I wouldn't have tried for hours.

reviews.reviewTitle: fun box but price needs to come down
reviews.reviewText: if the price was still $179 I would buy another. Amazon needs to lower the price back to $179 again. I won't buy another one until the price comes down. The box is handy turning my lights on and off. I like using it as an alarm clock to my favorite radio station.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great drop in feature with video!
reviews.reviewText: Love this thing!!! It’s super convenient to drop in on the app and get a video stream of what’s going on at home with the dog etc—also has tons of cool games and trivia like apps to mess around with! I definitely recommend it...except maybe the price tag which will probably drop in like 3 months bc I’ve just bought it at peak price and that’s how my life always works.

We have two echo devices in our home. An echo show in the kitchen and an echo dot in the master. The one problem we have is that there is no way to set a default device for contacts to drop in outside your household. All of the devices allow for drop in but there is no way for our contacts to specify which device they want to drop in on.

Great device except for one annoying detail. When integrated with Ring Doorbell, I wish the Alexa Show screen would automatically show the front door when motion or doorbell is activated. I should just be able to look at the device screen and see who it there. It could timeout in a minute. But please just show me the activated front door.

I received this as a gift. I’m not sure I like it in the house after I heard Amazon employees were listening to conversations over it. It works great. I have it 3 stars because if it wasn’t a gift and I would hurt the persons feelings who gave it to me, I wouldn’t have it in the house. I’ve moved it to a less frequented area of the house since the news story.

I got this because I love our echo dot but the dot has a better sound system, better call quality, and it can hear me way better than the echo show. the Show doesn't understand me 80% of the time. Honestly, I'm probably going to return it. It's so frustrating.

Have not had it long enough to make a complete judgement on the Echo Show.
LOVE THE SOUND!
I HAVE PRIVACY CONCERNS. BIG TIME PRIVACY CONCERNS.
DIFFICULT TO GET A RHYTHM GOING IN GIVING COMMANDS. BECOMES FRUSTRATING. PARTLY MY FAULT BECAUSE NOT FAMILIAR WITH THE COMMANDS.
SCREEN SEEMS VERY GOOD .
DESIGN OVERALL SEEMS GOOD.

Worked great until I unplugged and move to different room. Apparently when you do this the sound no longer works, unless you unplug from back of device and plug back in. Customer service is sending me a replacement for this now known issue and said it is a hardware/system issue and should not happen. Hopefully replacement doesn’t have same issue.

Does anyone have one without this issue?

reviews.reviewTitle: I was excited about getting an Echo Show, but I am just not loving it.
reviews.reviewText: It might work well for someone who wants to use it in the kitchen for recipes or smaller screen show viewing, but that was not my intention. I may move it to the kitchen. But it's just not the go to device to utilize. For an Echo is is fine, but the video could be much improved.

reviews.reviewTitle: No Netflix, slower than regular Echo, sound is OK.
reviews.reviewText: Don't get wrong, I like this device.. it is cool and has many uses. Love the Silk Browser, visible alarm features, but i think it is a missed opportunity for some basic features that would bring it to the next level. Such as, Netflix, a touch icon-based home screen, videos playing with Amazon music. Its like Amazon forgets it has a screen.

More powerful than the first generation and a wider screen. I have both generations and will not depart with either. The up grades for the second generation are very good. The picture is crystal clear and awesome. Love it. Family fun start with ALEXA Echo Show (2nd Gen). Fun! Fun! Fun!

reviews.reviewTitle: Sound shoots out the back, not much in front
reviews.reviewText: The volume is rear shot, so its very loud if standing behind it. Its best placed close to a wall so the sound bounces back. This product likes to play amazon music a lot and its very difficult to stop it from playing I power it off which is the best way I have found. Picture is very good. I pay for sirusxm, and do not want to pay for amazon also. Sirusxm is NOT on the default list. It such be.
Very good at operating lights and the Blink camera. Very easy to use with the touch screen. Nice to have reminders from calendar displayed.

We purchased this during Prime Day and turned in our existing Echo Dot to get an extra 25% discount. We ended up paying like $105 for it. I synced our new Echo Show and it works perfectly. The sound quality in the device is amazing. No need for surround sound.

I don't really like to say anything bad...however, this Alexa does not listen well. You have to ask sometimes 4 or 5 times before she gets it right. I also have to unplug it at night because I have it in my bedroom and in the middle of the night for no reason the screen will turn on and starts playing strange stuff. Either I got a bad one or??? The sound quality is good though.
I agree with alot of the other positive reviews. Echo just keeps getting better.

So far, I can watch movies, view my outside security cameras, turn lights on and off and a million other things. I love this device and just ordered them for both of my sons as holidays gifts for their homes. I've been having fun with grouping things together. Example: Alexa, play ___ music EVERYWHERE. Then all of my Alexa devices place the same music all over the house. It's been fun and functional.

I love the idea of these devices, but the biggest problem I have with this device is that it is always listening. At first I thought she was waking up because of the camera movements, but brought the camera covers. She was still waking up until I put her on mute. She wakes up because she hear sounds. Creepy!!

I'm returning this item. I'd rather have my old Gen 1 Show than Gen 2. I liked that Gen 2 was larger but the speakers are in the back with a little on each side. When Alexa spoke to me or played music, the sound was to the wall. It worked much better when turned around but who wants to look at the back of the Show?

reviews.reviewTitle: Love it now that Amazon replaced the previous one.
reviews.reviewText: So I needed to edit this. After Amazon sent me a different one, I can say this thing is amazing!!! I love it!!! I love that it can check my morning commute to work and the sound is great when I watch movies or listen to music. I can say there isn't anything I don't like about it.

I have allot of echo devices now including the first generation show... This second generation is a upgrade well worth it. I mainly like it for the sound as the speaker on this device is loud and has bass.

As far as the echo I use it for mainly home automation to turn lights on and off and to control my TV

This looks good but it’s really useless compared to other similar devices. You set it up to show YouTube but then you have to manually search for a video. If you pause it the device forgets the video and where you were in it. It can show you the ring camera but no voice connectivity. The google device is was more capable. Mine was a gift so I’ll probably sell it on eBay and get the other one

Awesome upgrade from my Echo Dot. Bought two of these to communicate with my parents who sometimes can’t hear the phone or can’t get to the phone in 4 rings. I can use the drop in feature and check in and see my parents and they can see me. I can also use this on my iPhone by using the Alexa app. Definitely worth every penny. Thank you

I bought this for a clock on my kitchen shelf. I should have done more research. Such a boring clock face compared to the 5" Echo Show. I would have sent it back except it has amazing sound. Hopefully there will be an update to give us cool clock faces like the 5" version.

I got the echo show primarily because a colleague recommended it for voice recognition help with my email. However, it will not connect to my work wireless or wired networks; it seems it can only see the guest network, which is not password-protected, and i cannot reach my email from there. Thus, the show has been a $300 paper-weight that intermittently flashes messages about the latest ways that Alexa has of distracting me.

Before this I had the show first gen and comparing the two now the sound, screen and over look is a big difference. This now has a minin sub in it for nice bass in music. The mics on seem about the same so far. This is worth it I use this almost everyday for weather music or turning on lights I would hilghy recommend this if you want to start to make your home a little smarter as well make life easy.

Su impresionante pantalla es muy útil, la calidad de sonido es mucho mejor de lo esperado, la integración con Alexa es excelente, solo le falta el idioma Español con acento México, actualmente lo uso con Español España y no es del todo agradable. En general es excelente.

I love how loud this echo device is. It's a wonderful addition to my home. The screen is very useful in some instances. I feel more screen intergation is needed or better yet, more skills that utilize the screen but oh well. Judging strictly on the device though, it's a great purchase.

I love the 2nd generation show. I originally had the first generation show. This one is twice the size and the sound quality is great. We have 8 echoes in our home and one echo auto, I have not had a problem with any of them and plan to keep buying more.

Fun for face to face chats. Enjoy the music. Nice to read the words to songs. Watched some movies. Good picture. The biggest con is if you say her name accidentally she interjects herself. Then you must stop and tell her to go to home page and turn off screen. She's like a house guest that never leaves.

Big sound and screen improvements! Watched a movie and couldn’t believe the dynamic sound seperation and clarity. The picture in now large enough to view movies at an increased distance as well and cam views and text notifications !
Recieved echo show today and was very disappointed with the lack of owners manual or warranty registration cards. I’am assuming that this was by accident and will be taken care of by amazon.

When you pause a Amazon Prime video and then say “Alexa Play” it closes the video and starts playing music.

When you are watching Hulu video and then make a video call, when the call is over it doesn’t resume the video and closes the Hulu app.

The hardware is great but there so many problems with the software that it’s an annoying device to use.

reviews.reviewTitle: Doesn’t replace bridge for smart bulbs
reviews.reviewText: We like it but when we purchased it we were led to believe we would no longer need the bridge to work the lights, that it was built in to the Show. But ours didn’t work that way with our Phillips smart bulbs.

It’s ok, a lot of good features. Though I’d like to use it as a picture frame. Echo show is bad for this. Why? 1. It shows an annoying “try things” banner. You cannot disable it. It’s like infinite ads on top of your family photos. 2. It’s impossible to configure auto upload with a robotic filtering (as you can easily do on google assistant enabled devices)

This is a pretty cool device. I have many reservations regarding these voice command devices. Reservations aside, Echo Show works well and would probably be worth the money just for listening to music. It might be nice if it had a battery, and, if it had HDMI output.

The ongoing software problem where the device''s sound is frustrating. It usually only requires you to disconnect from the back of the device (not from the wall outlet as that won't work) to reset it and then it works but it begs the question as to how long can you continue to unplug and replug in the device before either the plug wears out and simply falls out of the device unexpectedly. I understand Amazon knew of this problem but pushed this product out to the consumer anyway...time will tell if they will stand behind the product for the long haul.

Otherwise, the device is attractive and meets all of my other expectations.

reviews.reviewTitle: Need to be battery operated also.
reviews.reviewText:
Good sound and clear picture.
I just wish had battery so you don't have to find extension cord if you want to take it outside.

This is a great gadget for your kitchen, I use it for timers, recipes (limited) and you can pull up Hulu and watch shows while you're cooking. This is notmeant replace an ipad type of device. The screen resolution is pretty good for what it's intended for, which is not tons of streaming tv. It's great for music, I use spotify primarily, and like that you can use the touchscreen to skip forward, back, see your playlists, etc. vs. having to use only voice commands like the other echos. It connects with the other echos very well for a surround effect. It's a great buy if you have the proper expectations.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not impressed by voice command quality
reviews.reviewText: Great graphics. Big screen. Good volume. But I have to keep yelling Alexa and y’all slower than normal to ensure Alexa hears my command. For the amount of money, I shouldn’t need to keep repeating myself.

Got this to keep in touch with my family on the west coast and it works great. Besides all the other Alexa skilled items it does like looks outside when my ring doorbell goes off or turns lights on and off. Super handy and a fine communication device.

Bigger screen, better sound than first version. However, the sound goes out and twice a month we need to unplug it to reset it so that the sound is restored. This is a known issue that has not been resolved by Lab126 so I am dropping it by two stars.

Sound quality would be great if not for the constant rattling of the speakers from the base.
EDIT: The rattling quiets down when atop a softer surface than a countertop. I also received a call from Amazon explaining how to turn down the bass from the app. That seems to have helped the rattling from the countertop. All in all, it does what I want it to do and the sound, when not rattling, is far and away better than my phone or the dot I was using previously. I also like that I can tell it what I want to play and don’t have to interrupt what I’m doing. The lyrics when playing music is also a big bonus.

I love my Alexa!! She’s great and very entertaining! I love listening to music on her. My favorite is watching movies or catching up on a show while I’m doing the dishes (either on Prime or Hulu). Very happy with my purchase!!

reviews.reviewTitle: It was easy to get started.
reviews.reviewText: It may be a little early to review because I havent mastered all of the benefits. So far the speakers seem to be better than my Echo which were pretty good. It has several routines built in that I haven’t used yet. I do use making different lists , groceries, things to do etc. I hope to soon set up lights and other devices. I’m tech deficient so it might take awhile.

reviews.reviewTitle: A solid improvement on an already great product
reviews.reviewText: We LOVED our generation one echo show, I mean loved it. But I am so happy to say this gen 2 expands on the amazing show 1 in every possible way. The sound quality is amazing with a solid improvement in bass notes and the screen is even more crisp and a better aspect ration.

reviews.reviewTitle: Play movies/music, control the lights/tv, and visually see multiple timers while cooking
reviews.reviewText: Great screen and sound. It’s got good speakers to play music for kids and adults. Everyone loved it during the holidays when guests were at the house. Kids can learn to spell with it and do math. We ask about the weather and to turn the lights and tv on or off as we walk upstairs with our arms full. Especially love being able to set multiple timers and see all of them visually while cooking.

Love love love! I purchased this for my Grandparents so we can video chat and it’s amazing! Highly recommend! Set-up was a breeze and the screen is big enough for them to see and use comfortably. They love the volume and how clear and crisp it is.
Now I’m thinking about updating my current one to the model :-)

I haven’t had it that long yet but so fire my husband and I who are in our late 60s love it. The shopping lists, the games, finding my phone, planning a vacation, shopping on Amazon, playing music, etc. Very helpful and fun. Started with the dot, a gift from my son last Christmas, now it’s in our bedroom and the show is on the island between the kitchen and living room.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not portable, use ac/dc to power, no usb port
reviews.reviewText: Enjoying the my Show , sound quality is good, I use it with my ring doorbell I'm able to see the front door on my show, I listen to music on it and on demand tv. My only complaint is that its AC/DC 😕 you can't charge it by USB so it's stationary you can't take it outside. Bummer

I absolutely love this...couldn't be happier with this purchase! And the fact that they give you a discount for sending the old one back, bonus!
